Mission.Title: What are you doing?
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Jennifer와 함께 오늘 저녁 계획을 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to your colleague, Jennifer, about what you are doing tonight.

Task.Q1: Are you doing anything tonight?
Task.Q2: What are you going to do tonight?
Task.Q3: Do you have any plans for tonight?
Task.Guide: Jennifer에게 영화를 보러 갈 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm going to] [the movies.]}
I'm going to go to the cinema.
I'm going to see a movie.
To a movie.
I'll be watching a movie.
I'm going to watch a movie.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are going to the movies?

Task.Q0: The movies sounds fun!
Task.Guide: 같이 갈 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[come along?] {Do you want to}
Do you want to come with me?
Why don't you come with me?
Let's go together.
Come with me.
Shall we go together?
You can come along, if you want.
Do you want to come too?
You can tag along.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying do I want to come along?

Task.Guide: 지금 막 티켓을 예매하는 중이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm just booking] [the tickets right now]}.
I'm just buying the tickets online.
I'm buying the tickets now.
I was about to buy the tickets just now.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you are just buying the tickets right now?
Task.Key: I {am} just book{ing} the tickets right now.
Use_Key: I'm just getting ready to eat.
Tom is just getting ready for a meeting.
I'm just leaving my office.
Use_Guide: 막 먹을 준비를 하는 중이라고 말해 보세요.
Tom은 막 회의 준비를 하는 중이라고 말해 보세요.
막 사무실을 떠나는 중이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: When are you going?
Task.Q2: What time are you going?
Task.Q3: What time is the movie?
Task.Guide: 오후 7시에 나갈 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm leaving] [at 7]}.
At 7.
Around 7 p.m.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are leaving at 7?

Task.Q0: I'm a little busy with work now.
Task.Q1: But I think I will finish soon.
Task.Q2: But I think I can go with you.
Task.Q3: But I think I'll be ready before 7.
Task.Guide: 올 수 있으면 전화해 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Give me a call] [if you can come]}.
Just let me know if you can come.
Please call me if you can come.
If you can come, text me.
Let me know if you can join me.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying give you a call if I can come?

Complete.Reaction: Okay. I'll let you know soon.

Mission.Title: Check in Counter.
Mission.Description_Ko: 공항 체크인 카운터에서 체크인을 진행해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are checking in at the check-in counter.
Mission.Guide_En: Hi, I'd like to check in.

Task.Reaction: Hi, I'd like to check in.
Task.Q1: Hi, Can I have your passport?
Task.Q2: Hi, May I have your passport?
Task.Q3: Hi, passport please.
Task.Guide: "여기 있습니다"라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Here] [it is].
[Here] you are.
[Here].

Task.Q1: Do you want a window seat or an aisle seat?
Task.Q2: Would you prefer a window seat or an aisle seat?
Task.Q3: Do you have a seating preference?
Task.Guide: "통로자리로 주세요"라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[An aisle], please.
I'd like to get [an aisle] seat. 
Please give me [an aisle] seat.
I prefer to [an aisle] seat. 
I would prefer [an aisle] seat.

Task.Reaction: Okay. Just give me a second.
Task.Q1: Do you have any luggage to check in?
Task.Q2: Will you be checking in any luggage?
Task.Guide: "네, 수하물로 부칠 가방이 2개 있어요."라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, I'm [checking in] two [suitcases]. 
Yes, I have two [suitcases] to check in.
Yes, two [suicases] to check in.
Yes, Two [Suitcases].
Yes, Two.

Task.Reaction: Please put the bags on the scale. Here is your boarding pass. Your plane will be leaving from Gate 7 at 2:15 pm.
Task.Q1: Is there anything else I can help you with?
Task.Q2: Is that all for today?
Task.Q3: Anything else?
Task.Guide: "네, 탑승시간은 언제인가요?"라고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, [What time] do we board? 
Yes. What’s the boarding time?
Yes, When do we board? 
Yes, When is boarding time? 
Yes, When is the [boarding time]? 
Yes, What time will we start boarding?

Complete.Reaction: The flight will start boarding at 1:45. Please be on time.

Mission.Title: A New Smartphone
Mission.Description_Ko: 스마트폰을 새로 사고 싶은 당신, 가게에 가서 당신이 원하는 모델에 대해 점원과 이야기하고 한 대를 주문해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are at a shop to get a new smartphone. Talk to the staff about what you want and order one that you like.

Task.Q1: Is there anything I can help you with?
Task.Q2: What can I help you with?
Task.Q3: Can I help you?
Task.Guide: 직원에게 새 스마트폰을 사려 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {I'm looking for} [a new smartphone].
Yes, I'm here to buy a new smartphone.
I hope you could show me some new smartphones.
I'm interested in getting a new smartphone.
I want to buy a new smartphone.
Can I buy a new smartphone?
I need a new smartphone.
Would you help me find a new smartphone?
Yes, please. I need a new smartphone.
I'd like to buy a new smartphone.
I'm thinking about getting a new smartphone.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you are looking for a new smartphone?

Task.Q1: What kinds of features are you looking for?
Task.Q2: Are you looking for any specific features?
Task.Q3: Any features you want?
Task.Guide: 스마트폰에 대해 잘 알지 못한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I don't really know much about} [smartphones].
I know only little about smartphones.
I don't really know about smartphones.
I don't know about smartphones well.
I only have little knowledge on smartphones.
I'm not familiar with new smartphones.
I need your help as I know only little.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you don't really know much about smartphones?
Task.Key: I {don't reallly know much about} smartphones.
Use_Key: I don't really know much about laptops.
I don't really know much about technology.
I don't really know much about music.
Use_Guide: 노트북에 대해 잘 알지 못한다고 말해 보세요.
기술에 대해 잘 알지 못한다고 말해 보세요.
음악에 대해 잘 알지 못한다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Would you be interested in this new model?
Task.Q2: Why don't I show you this new model?
Task.Q3: How about this new model?
Task.Guide: 좋아 보이는데 가격은 얼마냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[It looks] [nice], {how much is this?}
It looks good, what is the price?
It looks fancy, how much should I expect?
It looks very good, how much is it?
It seems nice, how much is it?
How much is it? It seems perfect.
Nice, what's the price?
It looks great. How much is it?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how much this is?

Task.Q1: Here is the price tag.
Task.Q2: Here is the price tag.
Task.Q3: Here is the price tag.
Task.Guide: 비싸서 살 수 있을지 모르겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
It is [expensive] so {I don't know if I can} [afford it].
It's pricy and I am not sure if I can buy it.
It's too expensive. I don't know if I can buy it.
I don't think I can afford it. It is way out of my budget.
It is expensive. I'm not sure if I can afford it.
It is really pricy. I don't think I can afford this.
I'm afraid I might not be able to afford it.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you don't know if you can afford it?
Task.Key: {I don't know if I can} afford it.
Use_Key: I don't know if I can attend the meeting.
I don't know if I can finish the report by today.
I don't know if I can go to the party tonight.
Use_Guide: 그 회의에 참석할 수 있을지 모르겠다고 말해 보세요.
오늘까지 보고서를 끝낼 수 있을지 모르겠다고 말해 보세요.
오늘 밤에 그 파티에 갈 수 있을지 모르겠다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: We do have some older models, if you are interested.
Task.Q2: Would you be interested in some older models, then?
Task.Q3: How about some older models, then?
Task.Guide: 스크린이 큰 모델도 있냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you have} [any models] [with a large screen?]
Could you show me any models with a big screen?
I want a model with a large screen.
Do you have any other models with a larger screen?
I want a larger screen, any recommendations?
I was wondering if you could show me other models with a larger screen.
Do you also have any other models with a bigger screen?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have any models with a large screen?

Complete.Reaction: Sure, we do. There you go. This one has a 5.8-inch display.

content_name: Excuse me. I think I am lost.

Mission.Title: Excuse me. I think I am lost.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 Star Mall에 가고 있었는데 길을 잃었습니다. 지나가는 사람에게 도움을 요청해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You were going to the Star Mall but you think you are lost now. Ask a passerby for help.

Task.Q1: May I help you?
Task.Q2: Can I help you?
Task.Q3: Do you need a help?
Task.Guide: 길을 잃은 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [I am lost].
I guess I am lost.
I am lost, I think.
I'm sure I am lost.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think you are lost?

Task.Q1: Where are you headed?
Task.Q2: Where do you want to go?
Task.Q3: Where are you going?
Task.Guide: Star Mall에 가려고 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm trying to} [get to] [the Star Mall].
I'm headed to the Star Mall.
I was going to the Star Mall.
I was on my way to the Star Mall.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you are trying to get to the Star Mall?

Task.Guide: 길을 알려줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [give me directions] [to the Star Mall?]
Can you tell me how to get to the Star Mall?
Please give me directions to the Star Mall.
Do you know how to get there?
How should I get there?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying could I give you directions to the Star Mall?
Task.Key: {Could you} give me directions {to} the Star Mall?
Use_Key: Could you give me directions to City Hall?
Could you give me directions to the department store?
Could you give me directions to the subway station?
Use_Guide: 시청 가는 길을 알려 달라고 말해 보세요.
백화점 가는 길을 알려 달라고 말해 보세요.
지하철 역 가는 길을 알려 달라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: Go straight ahead for three blocks.
Task.Q1: Then make a right and walk up one block.
Task.Q2: Then turn right and walk up another block.
Task.Q3: Then turn right and go up a block.
Task.Guide: 우회전 후 한 블록 더 올라가는 게 맞는지 확인해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Turn right] and [walk up one more block]}, [right?]
You said I should turn right and walk up one block, didn't you?
So, turn right and go up one block, am I right?
Did you say turn right and go up another block?

Task.Q0: That's right. It's on the left.
Task.Guide: 감사 인사 후 큰 도움이 되었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thank you]. {You have been} [great help].
Thanks. It has been really helpful.
I appreciate you for the help. It helped me a lot.
Thank you for your help.
Task.Are_you_saying: You are saying I have been great help?

Complete.Reaction: My pleasure. You won't miss it!

Mission.Title: Congratulations
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Angie와 Paul이 아들을 낳았습니다. Angie의 집을 방문해서 도와주며, 아이의 미소는 Angie를, 눈은 Paul을 닮았다고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friends Angie and Paul now have a son. Help Angie while making a conversation that he has her smile and Paul's eyes.

Task.Q1: Would you mind helping me feed him?
Task.Q2: Can you help me feed him?
Task.Q3: Do you mind helping me?
Task.Guide: Angie에게 당연히 도와주겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Not at all]}.
No problem.
Sure.
Of course.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean not at all?

Task.Q0: He seems to like you.
Task.Q1: I think he likes you.
Task.Q2: He looks happy with you.
Task.Q3: He likes you.
Task.Guide: 아들이 너를 정말 빼닮았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[He looks] [just like you]}.
You two share many features.
He looks like you.
He is so cute.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he looks just like me?
Task.Key: {He looks just like} you.
Use_Key: She looks just like her mother.
You look just like your older brother.
They look just like their grandfather.
Use_Guide: 그녀는 어머니를 빼닮았다고 말해 보세요.
네가 너의 오빠/형을 빼닮았다고 말해 보세요.
그들은 그들의 할아버지를 빼닮았다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 웃는 모습이 너와 똑같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[He has] [your smile]}.
You two share a smile.
His smile is precious.
His smile is the same as yours.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he has my smile?

Task.Q0: I think so too.
Task.Q1: I agree.
Task.Q2: You're right.
Task.Q3: He does.
Task.Guide: 그런데 눈은 Paul을 닮았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{But [he has] [Paul's eyes]}.
He looks a lot like his dad too.
But he has Paul’s eyes.
He has Paul’s eyes.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he has Paul's eyes, though?

Complete.Reaction: I agree. Look at him. He's smiling at you.

Mission.Title: That's not terribly PC(politically correct)
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Molly와 함께 메가 남성복 매장의 주인을 주제로 이야기를 나누게 된 당신. Molly가 그의 매장을 탐탁치 않아 하는 이유에 대해 알아 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are having a conversation with your friend Molly about the owner of the mega men's clothing store around the corner. Find out why Molly has something against his store.

Task.Q0: What 's the story about that you're reading?
Task.Q1: That guy wearing the do-rag looks kind of familiar.
Task.Q2: That guy looks kind of familiar.
Task.Q3: That guy is familiar.
Task.Guide: 왜냐하면 그가 모퉁이를 돌아서 있는 저 메가 남성복 매장의 주인이기 때문이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That's because} [he's the owner of] [that mega men's clothing store] [around the corner].
He’s the owner of that mega men’s clothing store around the corner.
That’s because he’s the owner of the store around the corner.
He’s the owner of the store around the corner.
The clothing store around the corner is his.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say that's because he's the owner of that mega men's clothing store around the corner?

Task.Guide: 최근에 이 주변에서 그의 얼굴이 광고판 전체에 도배된 것을 본 적이 없냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Haven't you seen} [his face plastered] [all over the billboards] [around here lately?]
You haven’t seen his face plastered all over the billboards around here?
His face is on all the billboards around here lately; haven’t you seen them?
Haven’t you seen him in the billboards around here lately?
Did you not see the billboards with his face on them?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I haven't seen his face plastered all over the billboards around here lately?

Task.Q0: You mean the ones that stick out like a sore thumb with their tacky slogans?
Task.Q1: I also heard he's making a pretty penny.
Task.Q2: I heard he's making a ton of money.
Task.Q3: He’s making a lot of money.
Task.Guide: 그렇다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Sure is]}.
Yep.
You’re right.
He is.
That’s right.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean it sure is?

Task.Guide: 그가 빈민촌 출신이고, 그 지역 사람들도 거의 2류 시민으로 여겨진다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He's from} [the wrong side of the tracks], and [people from that part of town] are [pretty much treated like second-class citizens].
He’s from a poor neighborhood, and people from over there are treated like second-class citizens.
He is from a poor vililage, and people from his village are treated badly.
People don’t treat him well because of where he came from.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean he's from the wrong side of the tracks, and people from that part of town are pretty much treated like second-class citizens?
Task.Key: People from that part of town are {pretty much treated like} second-class citizens.
Use_Key: In India, cows are pretty much treated like God.
Our oldest brother is pretty much treated like our father.
I feel like I was pretty much treated like a slave in my former workplace.
Use_Guide: 인도에서는 소들이 거의 신처럼 여겨진다고 말해 보세요.
우리의 가장 큰 형은 거의 아버지처럼 여겨진다고 말해 보세요.
내가 느끼기에 전 직장에서 나는 거의 노예처럼 여겨졌다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I know it's not terribly politically correct, but I wish he'd invaded another neighborhood.
Task.Q1: That store's an eyesore compared to the upscale shops.
Task.Q2: His store’s appearance clashes with the upscale shops in the area.
Task.Q3: The store looks like it doesn’t belong here.
Task.Guide: 어쨌든 이 남자를 싫어하는 이유가 뭐냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{So [what exactly have you got against this guy], anyway?}
What did this guy ever do to you?
Why do you have it out for this guy?
What exactly is your problem with this guy?
Why do you dislike him?
What’s wrong with him?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what exactly I have got against this guy, anyway?

Complete.Reaction: I just don't want to see this area start to go downhill.

content_name: Flattery could get you in trouble

Mission.Title: Flattery could get you in trouble
Mission.Description_Ko: 딸 Paula가 당신에게 자신의 행동을 따라하는 동생과 친구들에 대해 불평합니다. 딸의 이야기를 듣고, 아첨에 반응하는 방법을 조언해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your daughter Paula complains about her sister and friends copying herself. Listen to her story and give her an advice on how to respond to flattery.

Task.Q1: Susie's doing everything I do. Make her stop.
Task.Q2: Susie’s copying me. Make her stop.
Task.Q3: Susie is copying me, please stop her.
Task.Guide: 동생에게 짓궂게 굴지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Don't [be cross with] her}.
Don't be harsh with her.
Don't be mean to her.
Stop teasing her.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying not to be cross with her?

Task.Guide: 동생이 버릇을 곧 고치게 될 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{She'll soon} [grow out of it].
She will grow out of it soon.
She’ll grow out of her habit soon.
She’ll grow out of it eventually.
She will eventually grow out of it.
She will stop when she grows up.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean she'll soon grow out of it?

Task.Q0: I hope it doesn't take too long.
Task.Q1: She's driving me crazy.
Task.Q2: She is annoying me a lot.
Task.Q3: She is making me angry.
Task.Guide: 모방은 가장 진실된 아첨의 형태라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery]}.
It’s a form of flattery.
She likes you so she does what you do.
It means she likes you.
She just wants to be like you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say imitation is the sincerest form of flattery?

Task.Q0: You remember Mary, that girl in my class, don't you?
Task.Q1: She's always trying to copy me, too!
Task.Q2: She is always copying me, too!
Task.Q3: She does everything that I do, too!
Task.Guide: 너의 반 다른 아이들도 너를 따라하기 시작한다니 네가 매우 인기 있는 아이임에 틀림없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[You must be a very popular girl] [if others in your class] [are beginning to copy you]}.
If she is doing everything that you are doing, then you must be popular in class.
Well, you must be a popular girl if she is copying you.
If girls are copying you then you must be very popular.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I must be a very popular girl if others in my class are beginning to copy me?

Task.Guide: 네가 으쓱해졌겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You must} [feel flattered].
You must be pleased.
You must feel great.
That must be great.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I must feel flattered?

Task.Q0: Imitation may be the sincerest form of flattery,
Task.Q1: but I don't feel very flattered when Mary copies my answers to the homework.
Task.Q2: but it feels like cheating when Mary copies my homework.
Task.Q3: but I am upset when Mary copies my homework.
Task.Guide: 그런 아첨은 학교에서 너를 곤경에 빠트릴 수 있겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} [that kind of flattery] [could get you in trouble] at school.
Well, that could get you in trouble at school.
I guess that could be troublesome.
That could get you in trouble.
That’s not good.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you guess that kind of flattery could get me in trouble at school?
Task.Key: I guess that kind of flattery {could get you in trouble} at school.

Mission.Title: Making Arrangements

Task.Guide: 아니 우리가 좋았다고 말하고, 언제든 우리를 다시 보러 와 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, [it was our pleasure]. {Feel free to} [come back and see us any time].

No, don't mention it. It was our pleasure as well. Feel free to come see us any time.
It was our pleasure as well. Please come back and visit us anytime.

It was our pleasure. Please visit us when you return.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying feel free to go back and see you any time?
Task.Key: {Feel free to} come back and see us any time.
Use_Key: Feel free to call me whenever you need.
Feel free to go and see him.
Feel free to cancel our dinner if you have to.
Use_Guide: 필요할 때마다 나한테 편하게 전화하라고 말해 보세요.
편하게 그를 보러 가라고 말해 보세요.
어쩔 수 없으면 우리 저녁 약속을 편하게 취소하라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 우리 회사는 당신 회사와 거래를 해서 기쁘고, 계속 그렇게 할 계획이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Our company is pleased to do business with your company] and [plans to keep it that way]}.
Our company is satisfied doing business with your company and want to keep it that way.
Our company would be delighted to do business with your company and wish to keep it that way.
Our company would like to continue to do business with your company.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your company is pleased to do business with my company and plans to keep it that way?

Task.Q1: We are always pleased to work with you too. Also, I will send the follow up report for my business trip by end of this week, and please let me know if you need any assistance with our products.
Task.Q2: We are honored to work with you as well. I will also send the follow up report for my business trip by the end of this week. Please let me know if you need any assistance.
Task.Q3: So honored to work with you as well. Will send the follow up business trip report by this week. Let me know if you need any assistance.
Task.Guide: 감사합니다. 도움이 필요하면 꼭 전화하겠다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thank you]. {I will be sure to} [call you if we need any help].
Thank you. I will be certain to call you if we need assistance.
Thank you. I'll call you for sure if we need the help.
Thank you. I'll call you certainly if we need the assistance.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you will be sure to call me if you need any help?

Task.Q1: Okay. Have a nice day. I’ll talk to you soon.
Task.Q2: Have a nice day. Talk to you soon.
Task.Q3: Good day. Talk soon.
Task.Guide: 전화해 주셔서 감사합니다. 만나서 반가웠다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thank you for calling]. {[It was nice talking with you]}.
Thank you for the call. It was a pleasure talking to you.
Thanks for the call. So nice talking to you.
Thanks for the call. Such a pleasure to talk to you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it was nice talking with me?

Complete.Reaction: You're welcome. Nice talking to you as well.

content_name: I've been playing for a while.

Mission.Title: I've been playing for a while.
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Bob의 기타 연주에 감탄한 당신. Bob에게 언제부터 배웠는지 묻고, 한 곡 더 부탁해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are impressed by your friend Bob's guitar. Ask him when he started and ask for another song.

Task.Guide: 이렇게 잘 하다니 믿을 수 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I can't believe] [how well you play]}.
I didn't know you would play this well.
I wouldn't expect you to play this well.
I think you are really talented.
You are really great.
You're so good.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't believe how well I play?

Task.Q1: I’m glad you liked the song.
Task.Q2: I'm glad you liked it.
Task.Q3: I’m happy to hear that.
Task.Guide: 배운지 얼마나 됐냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[How long] [have you been learning?]}
How long have you been playing?
When did you start playing?
How many years have you been playing?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean how long have I been learning?

Task.Q1: I’ve been playing the guitar since I was 12 years old.
Task.Q2: I started playing when I was 12 years old.
Task.Q3: Since I was 12 years old.
Task.Guide: 정말 오래 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[You've been playing] [for a long time]}.
It's been really long.
Task.Key: {I've been} play{ing} since I was 12 years old.
Use_Key: I've been surfing since 2017.
I've been working here since last year.
I've been studying English since October.
Use_Guide: 2017년부터 서핑을 했다고 말해 보세요.
작년부터 이곳에서 일해왔다고 말해보세요.
10월부터 영어공부를 했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: It doesn't feel like it's been that long, though.
Task.Q1: Do you play any instrument?
Task.Q2: Do you know how to play an instrument?
Task.Guide: 피아노를 칠 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can} [play] [the piano].
I play the piano.
I know how to play the piano.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can play the piano?

Task.Q1: How long have you been playing?
Task.Q2: How long have you played the piano?
Task.Q3: How long have you played it?
Task.Guide: 10살 때부터 피아노를 쳤다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have been playing the piano since you were 10 years old?

Task.Guide: 한 곡 더 연주해 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[play me] [another song?] {Could you}
Can you play me one more?
Can I listen to another song?
Would you play me another song for me?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying could I play you another song?

Complete.Reaction: Of course. I'd love to.

Mission.Title: Long time no see!
Mission.Description_Ko: 지난 달 졸업한 당신. 대학 친구 Matthew를 졸업 후 처음 만났습니다. 대학원에 진학한 Matthew의 안부를 듣고, 일 때문에 조만간 유럽으로 떠난다고 안부를 전해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You graduated last month and today you ran into Matthew, your old friend from college. Listen to how things are with him and pass him the news that you are moving to Europe for work.

Task.Guide: Matthew에게 졸업하고 못 봤다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I haven't seen you} [since graduation].
I never saw you after graduation.
This is our first time to see each other since graduation.

Task.Q0: I've been busy with graduate school.
Task.Q1: How is work going?
Task.Q2: How's your work?
Task.Q3: How are you doing?
Task.Guide: 새 직장이 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I like] [my new job]}.
I love my new job.
I like it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you like your new job?

Task.Q1: I'm happy for you.
Task.Q2: Happy for you.
Task.Q3: Good for you.
Task.Guide: 하지만 곧 다른 오피스로 보내질 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{But [they are transferring me] [to another office soon]}.
I think I will be transferred to another office soon.
But people say that I might be transferred to another office soon.
I think they will be transferring me to another office soon.
They are sending me to another office soon.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying they are transferring you to another office soon?

Task.Q1: Where are they transferring you to?
Task.Q2: Where will you be transferred to?
Task.Q3: Where are you going?
Task.Guide: 일년동안 유럽에 가게 됐다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm moving to Europe] [for a year]}.
They are sending me to Europe for a year.
I'll work in Europe for a year.
I will be transferred to Europe for a year.
To Europe for a year.
I have to live in Europe for a year.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you are moving to Europe for a year?

Task.Q1: It's so far away.
Task.Q2: It is quite far.
Task.Q3: It's far.
Task.Guide: 떠나기 전에 너를 못 볼까봐 걱정했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I was worried that I wouldn't} [see you] [before I left].
I was worried that I might be able to see you before I leave.
It's so good to get to see you before I leave.
I really wanted to see you before I left.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you were worried that you wouldn't see me before you left?
Task.Key: {I was worried that I wouldn't} see you before I left.
Use_Key: I was worried that I wouldn't finish this by today.
I was worried that I wouldn't attend the meeting this morning.
I was worried that I wouldn't make it to his party last weekend.
Use_Guide: 오늘까지 이 일을 못 끝낼까봐 걱정했다고 말해 보세요.
오늘 아침에 미팅에 참석하지 못할까봐 걱정했다고 말해 보세요.
그의 파티에 가지 못할까봐 걱정했다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: It is good to see you before you leave. Let's catch up for some coffee.

content_name: What do you want for dinner?

Mission.Title: What do you want for dinner?
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 룸메이트 Bell과 오늘 저녁을 어떻게 할 것인지 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to your roommate Bell about what you are going to have for dinner tonight.

Task.Q1: I'm starving.
Task.Q2: I'm really hungry.
Task.Q3: I'm hungry.
Task.Guide: 저녁에 무엇을 먹고 싶은지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do you want} [for dinner] [tonight?]
What should we have for dinner?
Anything you want for dinner?
What should we eat for dinner?
What do you want to have for dinner?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what do I want for dinner tonight?
Task.Key: {What do you want} for dinner?
Use_Key: What do you want for Chirstmas?
What do you want for your birthday?
What do you want for your wedding anniversary?
Use_Guide: 크리스마스에 뭘 원하는지 물어보세요.
당신의 생일에 뭘 원하는지 물어보세요.
당신의 결혼 기념일에 뭘 원하는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: We eat out all the time.
Task.Q1: I want to have something at home.
Task.Q2: Let's have something at home.
Task.Q3: Let's eat at home.
Task.Guide: 냉장고에 무엇이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do we} [have] [in the refrigerator?]
Do we have something to eat in the refrigerator?
Do we have some food in the refrigerator?
What's in the refrigerator?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what do we have in the refrigerator?

Task.Q1: We have some carrots but there aren’t any apples.
Task.Q2: Some carrots but there are no apples.
Task.Q3: Carrots only.
Task.Guide: 계란이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are there} [any eggs?]
Please tell me there are some eggs.
Do we have any eggs?
Any eggs?
How about eggs?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean are there any eggs?

Task.Q1: There aren't any eggs.
Task.Q2: No eggs.
Task.Q3: None.
Task.Guide: 오늘은 나가서 먹자고 제안해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Why don't we} [just go out] [for dinner?]
Don't you want to eat out?
How about going out for tonight?
We can go out for tonight.
Let's just eat out tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying why don't we just go out for dinner?

Complete.Reaction: Alright. I guess we don't have choice.

Mission.Title: Breaking The Ice
Mission.Description_Ko: 회사 업무에 지쳐 휴식을 취하고자 합니다. 다른 직원에게 본인을 소개하고, 언제부터 일을 했는지 말해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You have just had a tiring day at work and are trying to rest. Introduce yourself to another colleague, and talk about when you started working.

Task.Q1: Looks like I’m not the only one who needs a 3:00 boost.
Task.Q2: I see that I'm not the only one needing a 3:00 boost.
Task.Q3: You seem to need a 3:00 boost.
Task.Guide: 커피를 마시거나 강력한 낮잠을 자거나 둘 중 하나 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I either} [drink coffee] or [take a power nap].
I can either drink it or take a power nap.
I will either drink it or take a power nap.
Drinking coffee or taking a power nap will do the job.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you either drink coffee or take a power nap?

Task.Q0: I’m Zoe
Task.Q1: I started in Acquisitions on Monday.
Task.Q2: I have started working in Acquisitions since Monday.
Task.Q3: Starting Monday, I was in Acquisitions.
Task.Guide: 만나서 반갑다고 말하면서 커피 브레이크가 생겨나기 전에 경리부에서 일하기 시작했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Nice to meet you. {I started in} [Accounting] before [coffee breaks were invented].
So nice to meet you. I worked in Accounting before coffee breaks were available.
It's a pleasure meeting you. I am from Accounting. I worked there before coffee breaks were created.
It's a pleasure to meet you. I have worked in Accounting before coffee breaks were introduced.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you started in Accounting before coffee breaks were invented?

Task.Q1: I can't even imagine.
Task.Q2: Wow, I really can't imagine.
Task.Q3: Unbelievable.
Task.Guide: 커피만 없었던 것이 아니라 계산기라고 불리는 장비도 사용해야 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Not only} [did we not have coffee], but we [had to use these gadgets] [called calculators].
Not only did we not have coffee, we were also forced to use calculators.
Back then, we didn't have any coffee; we also used these gadgets called calculators.
Back then, we had no coffee and had to use calculators.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you also had to used the gadgets called calculators?
Task.Key: {Not only} did we not have coffee, but we had to use these gadgets called calculators.
Use_Key: Not only did we have vacation time, but we also had bonuses at the end of the year.
Not only is she friendly, but also she is hard working.
Not only are they skilled, but also they are professional.
Use_Guide: 우리는 휴가 뿐만 아니라, 연말 보너스도 있었다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 친절한 것 뿐만 아니라, 열심히 하기도 한다고 말해 보세요.
그들은 숙련된 것 뿐만 아니라, 전문적이기도 하다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: It was nice meeting you. Thanks for making the coffee.
Task.Q2: It was nice to meet you nonetheless. Thanks for the coffee.
Task.Q3: Nice meeting you and thanks for the coffee.
Task.Guide: 또 필요한 것이 있다면 알려달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let me know} [if you need anything else].
If you need anything, just let me know.
Kindly let me know if you need any help.
If you need help, kindly let me know.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I should let you know if I need anything else?

Complete.Reaction: Sure thing.

Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.

description: 23.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급_비지니스영어_비즈니스 : 일상편 1

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I work as a ~"}는 '저는 ~로 일하고 있습니다.'를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I work as a ~" is an expression to tell your role at work.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I really appreciate ~"}은 '~에 정말 감사를 전합니다.'를 의미하는 표현입니다.

Mission.Title: Getting over the hump
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 회사는 제품에 대한 불평신고를 받은 상황입니다. 어려운 상황에 대해 동료 Jaclyn과 이야기 해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: There are many reports questioning about the quality of your company's products. Talk to your colleague Jaclyn about this difficult time your company is facing.
Mission.Guide_En: Jaclyn, have you heard about the news report?

Task.Q1: Why is the quality of our product beign called into questions?
Task.Q2: Why are people complainig about the quality of our products?
Task.Q3: What's the matter with our products?
Task.Guide: 구매하고 얼마 안 됐는데 스크린이 깨지는 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I hear [some screens are breaking soon] {after} [being purchased].
Some screens are breaking  soon after they are bought.
Screens are breaking soon after being purchased.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you hear some screens are breaking soon after being purchased?

Task.Q1: This is Jon's area of specialty.
Task.Q2: Jon has valuable experience in this field.
Task.Q3: Jon has a lot of experience in this area.
Task.Guide: 이게 Jon을 컨퍼런스에 데려가는 이유 중에 하나라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
That is one of the reasons we are bringing Jon to the conference.
That is one of the reasons Jon is coming to the conference with us.
That is why we are bringing Jon to the conference.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying this is one of the reasons we are bringing Jon to the conference?

Task.Q0: I think he will help.
Task.Q1: What is your schedule like after the conference?
Task.Q2: What are you doing after the conference?
Task.Q3: Any plans after the conference?
Task.Guide: 바이어들을 만나러 베를린에 간다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm heading to Berlin] {to} [meet with some perspective buyers].
I'm heading to Berlin to meet with some buyers.
I'm going to Berlin to meet with some perspective buyers.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're heading to Berlin to meet with some perspective buyers?
Task.Key: {I'm heading to} Berlin {to} meet with some perspective buyers.
Use_Key: I'm heading to Han River to waterski with my friends.
I'm heading to my office to finish the project.
I'm heading to a café to get a coffee.
Use_Guide: 나는 한강에 수상스키를 타러 간다고 말해 보세요.
나는 그 프로젝트를 끝내러 사무실에 간다고 말해 보세요.
나는 커피를 마시러 카페에 간다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I hope you can convince them.
Task.Q1: Our company is facing a rough road ahead.
Task.Q2: Our company is expecting some hard times in the future.
Task.Q3: Our company will experience some difficulties in the future.
Task.Guide: 이 고비만 넘기면 괜찮아질 거라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[We just need to get over the hump] [and then things will get better]}.
we just need to get over the hump and it will get better.
We need to get  over the hump and it will be okay.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we just need to get over the hump and then things will get better?

Complete.Reaction: You are right. I hope so.

Mission.Title: Can you? Can't you?
Mission.Description_Ko: 룸메이트 Grace와 영화를 보러 가기로 했습니다. 출발해야 하는데 Grace가 시간이 더 필요하다고 말합니다. 이야기를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are about to leave for a movie with your roommate, Grace. You have to go but now she says she needs a few more minutes. Talk to her about it.
Mission.Guide_En: Grace, are you ready to leave?

Task.Q1: Just a few more minutes.
Task.Q2: I need a few more minutes.
Task.Q3: Give me a few more minutes.
Task.Guide: Grace에게 지금 뭐 하고 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What] [are you doing now?]}
What do you have to do now?
Why can't you leave now?
What's keeping you?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what am I doing now?

Task.Q1: I have to reply to a few e-mails for work.
Task.Q2: I have to reply to some business e-mails.
Task.Q3: I'm writing a few e-mails for work.
Task.Guide: 언제쯤 끝낼 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[When will you be able to] [finish?]}
What time will you finish?
How many minutes do you need to finish?
Will it take long?
When can you finish?
When will you be done?
What time will you be ready to leave?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying when will I be able to finish?
Task.Key: When {will you be able to} finish?
Use_Key: When will you be able to meet me?
When will you be able to have dinner?
When will you be able to start the project?
Use_Guide: 나를 언제 만날 수 있는지 물어보세요.
언제 저녁식사를 할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
언제 그 프로젝트 시작할 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: In a few minutes.
Task.Q2: I'll be done in a few minutes.
Task.Q3: I can finish in a couple of minutes.
Task.Guide: 영화에 늦겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[late for] [the movie.] {We’ll be}
We might be late for the movie.
We would not make it to the movie.
We won't be on time for the movie.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we will be late for the movie?

Task.Q1: Can we change the time of the movie?
Task.Q2: Can we watch the movie at a later time?
Task.Q3: Can we watch the movie at a later screening session?
Task.Guide: 아니, 시간 변경이 안 된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, [we] {can't} [change the time].
No, we can't.
I'm afraid not.
No, we cannot change the time of the movie.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying no, we can't change the time?

Task.Q1: I shouldn’t take long.
Task.Q2: I won't take long.
Task.Q3: I'll be quick.
Task.Guide: 차 안에서 기다리겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Okay. [wait] [in the car.] {I’ll}
Okay. I'll wait for you in the car.
Alright. Then see you in the car.
OK. I'll be in the car.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you'll wait in the car?

Complete.Reaction: Okay. I'll be ready soon.

Mission.Title: Where is the menu?
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Sandra와 햄버거 집에서 메뉴를 고르고 있습니다. 콜라도 마실 거라고 말하고, 음료 리필이 되는지 물어보자고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are choosing what you are going to have at a burger place with your friend, Sandra. Tell her that you'd like a coke as well and suggest to ask if you can get a refill later.

Task.Q1: What do you feel like eating today?
Task.Q2: What would you like to have?
Task.Q3: Are you ready to order?
Task.Guide: Sandra에게 치즈버거가 먹고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[eat] [a cheeseburger.] {I want to}
I'd like to have a cheeseburger.
I'll have a cheeseburger.
I want a cheeseburger.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you want to eat a cheeseburger?

Task.Q0: That sounds good.
Task.Q1: I might copy you.
Task.Q2: I might order the same.
Task.Q3: I want one for me, too.
Task.Guide: 그리고 콜라를 마시겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[have] [a coke too.] {I'll}
And a coke.
I'd like to have a coke.
I need a coke, too.
I want a coke as well.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll have a coke?

Task.Q0: Good idea. I'll have the same.
Task.Guide: 목이 너무 마르다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[really thirsty.] {I am}
I'm so thirsty, right now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are really thirsty?

She {[started working at our company]} [just a week ago].

Task.Answer_Set:
I {will} [present about] [the research our team is conducting on expansion opportunities in Southeast Asia] today.

Task.Q0: We are all excited to learn about it.

{Could everyone please} [refer to] [the graph on page 2 of our report?]
Could everyone refer to the graph on page 2 of our report?
Let's look at the graph on page 2 of the report.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking to refer to the graph on page 2 of your report?

Task.Guide: 지난 6개월동아 해당 지역의 판매량이 크게 늘어난 것을 볼 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{As you can see}, [our sales in the region] [have grown considerably over the last six months].
It shows that our sales in the region grew considerably over the last six months.
It shows that our sales in the region grew a lot in the last six months.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying as we can see, your sales in the region have grown considerably over the last six months?

Task.Q0: That is very impressive.
Task.Guide: 우리는 주어진 데이터에 기반해, 지역 내 성장 잠재력이 풍부하다고 느낀다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We feel that given the data} [that there is a lot of potential] [for further growth in the region.]

We feel that with the data we have, there is much potential for further growth in the region.

With our current data, there is potential for much more growth in the region.

With our current data, there is potential for a lot of growth in the region.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you feel that given the data that there is a lot of potential for further growth in the region?

Task.Guide: 다음 페이지를 보면, 우리가 실행할 전략의 개요를 볼 수 있다고 말해 보세요.

{If} [you look at the next page, [we have outlined the strategy that we would like to follow].
If you look at the next page, there is a strategy outlined that we would like to follow.
Look at the next page. There is a strategy we would like to follow.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you have outlined the strategy that you would like to follow on on the next page?

Task.Guide: 우리 보고서를 검토해 달라고 말하고, 다음 주 회의에서는 더 정확한 데이터를 공유할 수 있게 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Please look over our report]. {We hope to} [be able to share more exact data by next week’s meeting].

Please review our report. Hopefully we can share more exact data by next week's meeting.

Please take a look at our report. We hope to share more exact data by our meeting next week.

Please examine our report. Hopefully we are able to share more data by our meeting next week.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you hope to be able to share more exact data by next week's meeting?
Task.Key: We {hope to be able to} share more exact data.

We hope to be able to tell you that our sales in the region grow considerably next year.
We hope to be able to support your department as much as you need.
Use_Guide: 우리는 더 상세한 계획을 제공할 수 있게 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
내년에는 해당 지역의 판매량이 급증했다는 소식을 전할 수 있기를 바란다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 당신의 부서가 필요한만큼 지원할 수 있기를 바란다고 말해 보세요.

[support your department], [as much as you need]

Complete.Reaction: I'm looking forward to our meeting next week. Thank you for your presentation.

Mission.Title: Let me check my schedule

[take a walk here] [during my lunch break.] {I often}

Use_Key: I often go to the gym after work.

[pretty busy] [with work.] {I’ve been}

Task.Q2: What project are you doing?
Task.Q3: What is your project?

{I'm scheduling} [the company's workshop].

Mission.Title: Asking directions
Mission.Description_Ko: 바쁜 일정 때문에 약속 시간을 놓친 당신. 동료 Oliver에게 미팅 장소까지 가는 가장 빠른 길을 물어보세요.

Task.Q2: What's wrong?
Task.Q3: What's the problem?

Mission.Title: Can I leave a message?
Mission.Description_Ko: Prime Tech의 당신 계정에 문제가 생겨 전화를 걸었습니다. 담당자 Bill Smith를 찾지만 자리에 없습니다. 그의 동료 Arianna에게 메시지를 남겨 보세요.

Task.Q3: He's in a meeting.
