Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have a plan through your company?

Task.Q0: 70% of the cost will be covered.
Task.Q1: So these meds should only cost you $17 after deductions.
Task.Q2: With your insurance the total comes to $17.
Task.Q3: It will be $17 with your deductions.
Task.Guide: 1시쯤 약 받으러 다시 오겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
OK, {I'll be back around} [1:00] [to pick them up].
I’ll come back around 1:00 to pick them up, thank you.
Thanks! I’ll come back around 1:00 to get them.
I’ll come back at 1:00 to pick it up.
I’ll be back at 1:00 for the prescription.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll be back around 1 to pick them up?

Complete.Reaction: Alright. Your prescription should be ready by then.

Mission.Title: Where Should We Go?
Mission.Description_Ko: 길에서 우연히 오랜 친구 Ginny를 만났습니다. 저녁을 먹으면서 얘기하자고 제안하고, 무슨 음식을 먹을지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You happen to meet your old friend Ginny after a while. Ask her to catch up over dinner and talk about which food you would like to have.
Mission.Guide_En: Hi, Ginny. How are you doing?

Task.Q0: it's been ages.
Task.Q1: What have you been up to?
Task.Q2: What have you been doing?
Task.Q3: What were you up to?
Task.Guide: 어디 가서 저녁을 먹으며 이야기 하는 게 어떨지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Why don't we} [go somewhere] [and catch up over dinner?]
Why don't we go somewhere to eat dinner and catch up?
Let's go somewhere for dinner and catch up.
Let's go for dinner somewhere and catch up.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying why don't we go somewhere and catch up over dinner?

Task.Q0: That's a wonderful idea.
Task.Q1: What do you feel like having?
Task.Q2: What are you in the mood for?
Task.Q3: What do you want to eat?
Task.Guide: 멕시칸 음식은 어떤지 제안해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do you say to} [Mexican?]
How about Mexican?
What do you think about Mexican?
Are you okay with Mexican?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what do I say to Mexican?
Task.Key: {What do you say to} Mexican?
Use_Key: What do you say to Italian?
What do you say to Chinese?
What do you say to Japanese?
Use_Guide: 이탈리안 음식은 어떤지 물어보세요.
중국 음식은 어떤지 물어보세요.
일본 음식은 어떤지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: There's a really nice place down the street, but it's too early.
Task.Q2: I know a nice place down the street, but it's early.
Task.Q3: I know a great place, but it's too early.
Task.Guide: 기다리는 동안 술 한 잔은 어떤지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How about} [grabbing a drink] [while we're waiting?]
How about having drinks while we're waiting?
What do you think about having drinks while waiting?
Do you want to grab a drink while we wait?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean how about grabbing a drink while we're waiting?

Task.Q1: What would you like for drink?
Task.Q2: What drink would you like?
Task.Q3: So, what would you like to drink?
Task.Guide: 레드 와인 한 잔 주문하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'll have} [a glass of] [red wine].
A glass of red wine.
Red wine would be great.
Let me have a glass of red wine.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean a glass of read wine?

Complete.Reaction: Okay. I'll have the same.

Mission.Title: Healthy eating
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Aiden이 피곤해 보입니다. 야채를  많이 먹으라고 권하고, 무엇이든지 너무 많이 먹는 것은 좋지 않다고 이야기 해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Aiden looks tired. Recommend vegetables for his problem and tell him too much of anything is always not good.

Task.Q1:
I feel so tired lately.
I'm so tired recently.
I'm so much tired nowadays.
I feel like tired recently.
Task.Q2: I am tired these days.
Task.Q3: I am, actually.
Task.Guide: 더 건강하게 먹어야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You should} [try] [eating healthier].
You have to eat heathier.
You need to eat heathier.
You should eat some healthy food.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should try eating healthier?

Task.Guide: 피로에는 야채가 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Vegetables] {are good for} [fatigue].
You know vegetables are really good for fatigue.
You have to have a lot of vegetables.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying vegetables are good for fatigue?

Task.Q1: Would that really help?
Task.Q2: Are they really helpful?
Task.Q3: Are you sure?
Task.Guide: 하루에 적어도 3인분 양의 야채를 먹어야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You should} [eat] [at least three servings of vegetables a day].
At least three servings of vegetables a day are required.
At least three servings of vegetables a day are recommended.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should eat at least three servings of vegetables a day?

Task.Q1: I'm going to try to eat a lot more than that.
Task.Q2: I'm going to eat a lot more than that.
Task.Q3: I will eat a lot more than that.
Task.Guide: 무엇이든지 과한 건 좋지 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Too much of anything] {isn't good for} [you].
Too much is always a bad idea.
Eating too much doesn't sound like a good idea.
Too much isn't good for you.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean too much of anything isn't good for me?
Task.Key: {Too much} of anything {isn't good for} you.
Use_Key: Too much sugar isn't good for you.
Too much sugar isn't good for you.
Too much sugar isn't good for you.
Use_Guide: 단 걸 너무 많이 먹으면 안 좋다고 말해 보세요.
커피를 너무 많이 먹으면 안 좋다고 말해 보세요.
초콜렛을 너무 많이 먹으면 안 좋다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: You are right. I'll eat only about three servings of vegetables.

content_name: Could you tell him to call me later?

Mission.Title: Could you tell him to call me later?
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Louis Park에게 전화를 걸었는데 다른 동료 Emma가 전화를 받았습니다. Louis에게 메모를 남겨 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You wanted to talk to Louis Park, your colleague, but Emma, another colleague, answered. Leave a message to her.

Task.Q1: May I help you?
Task.Q2: Can I help you?
Task.Q3: Do you need a help?
Task.Guide: Emma에게 Louis Park과 통화할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {can I} [speak to] [Louis Park] please?
May I speak to Louis Park please?
I'd like to talk with Louis park.
Can I talk to Louis park?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying can you speak to Louis Park?

Task.Q1: Can I ask you what it is about?
Task.Q2: May I ask what it is for?
Task.Q3: Can you tell me what it is about?
Task.Guide: 컨퍼런스에 관한 것이라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It is about} [the conference].
About the conference.
I want to talk about the conference.
We need to talk about the conference.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you should talk about the conference?

Task.Q0: But he isn’t here at this moment.
Task.Q1: May I take a message for you?
Task.Q2: I can take a message, if you want.
Task.Q3: Do you want to leave a message?
Task.Guide: Louise에게 전화해 달라고 말해 줄 수 있는지 부탁해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {could you} [tell him] [to call me back?]
Yes, Please tell him to call me back.
Yes, Just tell him to call me back when he is free.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say could I tell him to call you back?
Task.Key: {Could you} tell him to call me back?
Use_Key: Could you tell her to come back later?
Could you tell them to bring some food?
Could you tell him to read through this report?
Use_Guide: 그녀에게 나중에 다시 와 달라고 말해 줄 수 있는지 부탁해 보세요.
그들에게 음식을 가져오라고 말해 줄 수 있는지 부탁해 보세요.
그에게 이 보고서를 읽어봐 달라고 말해 줄 수 있는지 부탁해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I will hand this message to him.
Task.Q2: I will give him the message.
Task.Q3: I will let him know you called.
Task.Guide: 감사 인사 후, 좋은 하루 보내라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thanks]. {Hope you} [have a good day].
Thank you. Have a great day.
Thanks a lot. Good day.

Complete.Reaction: You, too! Bye.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_시간 말하기 2

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 시간을 말할 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you tell the time.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"minutes past (hour)"}은 "몇 시에서 몇 분이 지난"을 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "minutes past (hour)" is an expression telling the time.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"minutes past (hour)"}와 같이 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "minutes past (hour)." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"minutes past (hour)"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "minutes past (hour)."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 다른 표현을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"minutes to (hour)"}은 "몇 시 몇 분 전"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "minutes to (hour)" is an expression telling the time.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"minutes to (hour)"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "minutes to (hour)."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"minutes to (hour)"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "minutes to (hour)."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 마지막 표현을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"half/quarter to (hour)"}은 각각 "30분/15분 전"을 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "half/quarter to (hour)" is an expression telling the time.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"half/quarter to (hour)"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "half/quarter to (hour)."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"half/quarter to (hour)"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "half/quarter to (hour)."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 시간을 읽을 때 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used to tell the time.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 시간 읽는 연습을 해보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning how to tell the time with your tutor!

Mission.Title: A Tough Week
Mission.Description_Ko: 수요일입니다. 상사 때문에 힘든 하루를 보내고 있는 당신. 동료 Sherman에게 힘든 하루를 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: It's Wednesday. Tell your colleague, Sherman, about a hard day you are having today beause of your boss.
Mission.Guide_En: Hi Sherman, how's your day going?

Task.Q1: Well, considering it's hump day, it's not going too badly.
Task.Q2: Well, it's the middle of the week. It's been alright, I guess.
Task.Q3: For a Wednesday, it's been alright.
Task.Guide: Sherman에게 당신의 하루는 별로 좋지 못하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, {[mine] is [not as good as yours]}.
Mine is not going so well.
I'm having a bad day.
It's been so stressful for me.
Mine hasn't been going smoothly.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying yours is not as good as mine?
Task.Key: Mine is not {as} good {as} yours.
Use_Key: Mine is not as heavy as yours.
Mine is not as light as yours.
Mine is not as speedy as yours.
Use_Guide: 내 것은 네 것만큼 무겁지 않다고 말해 보세요.
내 것은 네 것만큼 가볍지 않다고 말해 보세요.
내 것은 네 것만큼 빠르지 않다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I'm sorry to hear that.
Task.Q2: Sorry to hear that.
Task.Q3: Sorry.
Task.Guide: 하루가 너무 길다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Is this day ever going to end?]}
I can't wait for this day to end.
When is this day going to be finished?
I just want this day to end.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say is this day ever going to end?

Task.Q1: What happened?
Task.Q2: What's wrong?
Task.Q3: Something's wrong?
Task.Guide: 상사가 계속 일을 시킨다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[My boss] is {making me do} [one thing after another].
My boss is getting me to do one thing after another.
My boss keeps getting me to do one thing after another.
My boss has given me an endless list of things to do.
My boss keeps me busy with a lot of work.
My boss has made me finish so many tasks.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your boss is making you do one thing after another?

Task.Q0: we all have those days.
Task.Q1: Keep your head up.
Task.Q2: Keep a clear head.
Task.Q3: Cheer up.
Task.Guide: 알지만 그냥 오늘은 일찍 들어가고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, [I know]. {I just wish I could} [knock off early today].
I know but I really wish I could just knock off all this work.
I know but I just wish I could finish early and go home.
I know but I just wish I could knock off for today early.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you just wish you could knock off early today?

Task.Q1: Hump day is almost finished and it's all downhill from here.
Task.Q2: Wednesday is almost over and it's all downhill from here..
Task.Q3: The rest of the week will be better and easier.
Task.Guide: 빨리 주말이 왔으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can't} [wait for] [the weekend].
I hope the weekend to come soon.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't wait for the weekend?

Complete.Reaction: Neither can I.

Mission.Title: Describing characteristics
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 친구 Jack과 Diane를 주선해 주었습니다. Jack에게 Diane과의 소개팅이 어땠는지 물어보고 Diane의 성격도 말해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: You set up a blind date for your friend Jack with Diane, another good friend of yours. Ask him about the date and tell him more about her personality.

Task.Guide: 어젯밤에 Diane을 잘 만났냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Did you} [enjoy meeting Diane] [last night?]
Did you enjoy your time with Diane last night?
How was it with Diane last night?
Did you and Diane have fun last night?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying did I enjoy meeting Diane last night?

Task.Q1: She seems like a very nice woman.
Task.Q2: She’s a very nice woman.
Task.Q3: She’s very nice.
Task.Guide: Diane의 성격은 어떤 것 같냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What did you} [think of] [her personality?]
How did you find her personality?
What was it like her personality?
Do you want to tell me about her personality?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what did I think of her personality?

Task.Q1: I’d describe her as a very friendly person.
Task.Q2: I would say she is very friendly.
Task.Q3: I think she's very kind.
Task.Guide: 수긍하며 Diane은 밝은 성격이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {[she has] [a bright personality]}.
Right, she's a happy person with a bright personality.
Yes, she has bright energy.
Yes, she has a bight personality.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she is a very outgoing woman with a bright personality?
Task.Key: She {has a bright personality}.
Use_Key: My friend has an energetic personality.
My colleague has an humorous personality.
My fiance has a generous personality.
Use_Guide: 내 친구는 에너지가 넘친다고 말해 보세요.
내 동료는 유머러스하다고 말해 보세요.
내 약혼자는 관대하다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I hope that I can meet her again soon.
Task.Q2: I hope that I will meet her again.
Task.Q3: I hope I can see her again.
Task.Guide: Diane도 다음주 Harry의 파티에 올 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [she’ll be also at Harry’s party] [next week].
I guess she will at Harry’s party next week, too.
I think she's going to Harry’s party next week as well .
I heard she's going to Harry’s party next week.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think she will be also at Harry's party next week?

Complete.Reaction: I shouldn't miss the party, then.

Mission.Title: The Great Outdoors
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 정원을 가꾸는 친구 Beth를 도와주고 있습니다. 내일 등산을 가자고 제안하며 장소와 날씨에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are helping your friend Beth with her gardening. Ask her to go for a hike tomorrow and talk about the place and the weather.
Mission.Guide_En: Beth, it's good to be in the garden.

Task.Q1: There is nothing like being in the great outdoors.
Task.Q2: There's nothing better than being outdoors.
Task.Q3: Being outdoors is the best.
Task.Guide: 내일 등산을 가자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you want to} [go for a hike] [tomorrow?]
Would you like to go hiking tomorrow?
Do you want to go hiking tomorrow?
Would you want to go for a hike tomorrow?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying do I want to go for a hike tomorrow?

Task.Q1: Where did you have in mind?
Task.Q2: Where were you thinking of?
Task.Q3: Where do you want to go?
Task.Guide: 속초가 이맘때쯤 좋다고들 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I hear that} [Seokcho is great] [this time of year].
I hear that Seokcho is the best these days.
I was told Seokcho is great right now.
I hear that Seokcho is great now.
Task.Are_you_saying: You hear that Seokcho is great his time of year?
Task.Key: {I hear that} Seokcho is great this time of year.
Use_Key: I hear that Canada is great this time of year.
I hear that France is great this time of year.
I hear that Australia is great this time of year.
Use_Guide: 캐나다가 이맘때쯤 좋다고들 한다고 말해 보세요.
프랑스가 이맘때쯤 좋다고들 한다고 말해 보세요.
호주가 이맘때쯤 좋다고들 한다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Do you think the weather is going to hold out?
Task.Q2: Will the weather continue to be okay?
Task.Q3: Do you think the weather will be okay?
Task.Guide: 기상 정보(Weather Channel)에 따르면 이번주 내내 맑고 따뜻할거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[According to the Weather Channel], {it's supposed to} [be sunny and warm] [all week].
According to the Weather Channel, it's going to be sunny and warm all week.
The Weather Channel says that it'll be sunny and warm all week.
I heard on the Weather Channel that it will be sunny and warm all week.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean it's supposed to be sunny and warm all week according to the Weather Channel?

Task.Q1: That's great news.
Task.Q2: Good to hear.
Task.Q3: That's great.
Task.Guide: 그래서 가고 싶은지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{So, [you want to go?]}
Now, do you want to go?
Would you want to go now?
And so, want to go?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I want to go?

Task.Q1: Provided you help me finish with the garden today.
Task.Q2: Given that you help me finish the garden today.
Task.Q3: Only if you help me finish gardening today.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 하자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It's a deal]}.
I promise.
I will do so.
I agree.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say it's a deal?

Complete.Reaction: Yes, it is!

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_상황별 표현 : 공항편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 공항에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 예습해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions to use at the airport. Read after the AI tutor!

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I have two bags to check.
I would like to have a window seat.
I would like to have an aisle seat.
Can I pay by credit card?

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 제 소지품의 일부를 기내용 짐으로 옮길 수 있나요?
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Can I move some of my belongings into my carry-on?

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"창가 좌석을 원합니다."}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I would like to have a window seat.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~할 수 있나요?"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"카드로 결제할 수 있나요?"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Can I pay by credit card?

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

Mission.Title: Cross-cultural Business Etiquette
Mission.Description_Ko: Ms.Ho는 대만에서 비즈니스 협상을 할 때 관계를 형성하는 것이 중요하다고 조언해 줍니다. 어떻게 관계를 성공적으로 형성할 수 있는지, 또 주의해야 할 점이 있는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Ms.Ho is advising you that it's important to form relationships when doing business negotiations in Taiwan. Ask her how you can build good relationships in Taiwan and what other things to be careful about.

Task.Q0: I wanted to talk to you about something.
Task.Q1: I consider relationships as the most important part of the negotiation process in Taiwan.
Task.Q2: I think relationships are the most important part of negotiations in Taiwan.
Task.Q3: Relationships are the most important to negotiations in Taiwan.
Task.Guide: 죄송한데, 여기가 좀 시끄러워서 잘 못 들었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I’m sorry. {[I didn’t catch what you said]}. [It’s a little loud in here].
I'm sorry. I didn't understand. It's a bit loud here.
So sorry. It's hard to understand. It's noisy in here.
Apologies. It's quite hard to understand. It's noisy here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you didn't catch what I said?

Task.Q1: Relationships…it’s critical that we establish relationships with our partners as soon as possible in order to carry out a successful negotiation.
Task.Q2: Relationships, huh? We should establish relationships with partners ASAP in order to carry out successful negotiations.
Task.Q3: We should always establish relationships with partners quickly, so as to carry out successful negotiations.
Task.Guide: 내 생각에 그것은 서양과 꽤 비슷한 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} [that’s pretty similar] [to the West].
I guess the trend is similar to the West.
I suppose it's pretty similar to what's going on in the West.
I suppose the West is pretty similar.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's pretty similar to the West?

Task.Guide: 대만에서는 어떻게 그것을 성취할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[How can we accomplish that in Taiwan?]}
How are we to accomplish that in Taiwan?
How can we achieve that in Taiwan?
How are we to achieve that in Taiwan?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how we can accomplish that in Taiwan?

Task.Q1: In the beginning, we need to prepare gifts for our partners and be sure to always show respect for everyone in the room.
Task.Q2: We should prepare gifts for partners and be certain of showing respect for everyone in the room.
Task.Q3: Prepare gifts for partners and be sure to show respect for people in the room.
Task.Guide: 또 조심해야 할 게 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Is there anything else] [I should be careful about?]}
Is there anything I should be careful of?
What could I be careful about?
What is it that I could be careful of?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying if there is anything else you should be careful about?

Task.Q1: Giving business cards with one hand is considered rude.
Task.Q2: Giving business cards by one hand.
Task.Q3: Using one hand to give business cards.
Task.Guide: 카드를 어떻게 제시해야 하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[How should I hand out my card?]}
How am I supposed to hand out my card?
How must I present my card?
How should I present my card?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how you should hand out your card?
Task.Key: {How should I} hand out my card?
Use_Key: How should I greet in Korea?
How should I use this screen?
How should I give this to her?
Use_Guide: 한국에서는 어떻게 인사해야 하냐고 물어보세요.
이 스크린을 어떻게 사용해야 하냐고 물어보세요.
이것을 그녀에게 어떻게 줘야 하냐고 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: You should present it with two hands and make sure to pay respect to another person’s card.

Mission.Title: Proper Conduct 1
Mission.Description_Ko: CEO와의 저녁 도중 어떻게 행동을 해야할지에 대하 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on how to conduct onself during a dinner with the CEO.

Task.Q1: I've got to say, dinner with the CEO is a little scary. I don't even know what fork to use.
Task.Q2: I have to admit, dinner with the CEO is a bit scary. I don't know which fork I should use.
Task.Q3: I must admit that the CEO dinner scares me and that I don't know which fork to use.
Task.Guide: 식기구를 바깥쪽에서 사용하기 시작하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Just use your cutlery from the outside]}.
Use your cutlery from the outside.
Begin using your cutlery from the outside.
Begin the cutlery on the outer edges.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say I should use your cutlery from the outside?

Task.Q1: I can do that. Let's keep the advice rolling.
Task.Q2: I'll do that. Keep the advice coming.
Task.Q3: Keep giving me advice.
Task.Guide: 핸드폰을 받지 말고, 문자 또는 그와 같은 무엇이든 하지 말라고 하면서 그냥 꺼두라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Avoid} [answering] your phone, [texting], or anything like that. [Just turn it off].
Try not to answer your phone, text, or do anything similar. Just turn it off.
Do not answer your phone, text, or do anything of the type. Just turn it off.
Do not respond to phone calls, text, or do anything else. Just turn the phone off.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should just turn my phone off?

Task.Q1: I'll be sure to do that. What about alcohol?
Task.Q2: I'll certainly do that. And alcohol?
Task.Q3: I'll do that. And alcohol?
Task.Guide: Mr.Thompson이 음료를 시키면, 똑같이 하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{If Mr. Thompson orders a drink}, [do the same].
If Mr. Thompson orders a drink, you should too.
If Mr. Thompson drinks alcohol, do the same.
You should order alcohol when Mr. Thompson does.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should do the same if Mr. Thompson orders a drink?

Task.Q1: But what do I even talk about with him?
Task.Q2: But what can I talk about with him?
Task.Q3: So what should I talk about with him?
Task.Guide: 그 웹사이트에서 무언가 찾을 수 있을 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You could} probably [dig something up] [on the website].
You could probably find something on the website.
It's likely that you may find something on the website.
You could presumably find  something on the website.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say I could dig something up on the website?
Task.Key: {You could} probably dig something up there.
Use_Key: You could find something if you look into it carefully.
It could snow this afternoon, so we should prepare for that.
We could try to find it again, if you want.
Use_Guide: 그것을 자세히 드려다 보면 무언가를 찾을 수 있을 것이라고 말해보세요.
오늘 오후에 눈이 올 수 있을 것 같으니, 우리는 그것에 대비해야 한다고 말해보세요.
네가 원하면, 우리는 그것을 다시 찾으러고 노력해도 된다고 말해보세요.
Use_Hint: [snow this afternoon], [so we should], [prepare for that]

Complete.Reaction: I'll look into that, thanks.

Mission.Title: What Happened 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 소프트웨어 업데이트 시 작동하는 오류에 대해 알리고 문제를 사전에 방지하는 것에 대한 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a discussion on informing people about the software bug which operates upon updating and preventing this problem before it gets worse.

Task.Q1: I was fixing Paige’s computer when I found a bug in the new software.
Task.Q2: I was repairing Paige's computer when a bug was found in the software.
Task.Q3: While fixing Paige's computer, I found a bug.
Task.Guide: 너에게 그것은 좋지 않은 뉴스라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That’s bad news for you]}.
That's horrible for you.
That's terrible for you.
That's awful for you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say that's bad news for me?

Task.Q1: Four other people had the same issue.
Task.Q2: Four people also had this issue.
Task.Q3: Four people had the same.
Task.Guide: 나는 다른 사람들에게 그들의 시스템을 업데이트하지 말라고 알릴 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’ll let others know} [not to update] [their system].
I'll let others know that they shouldn't update their system.
I'll tell others that they must update their system.
I'll advise others to update their system.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll let otheres know not to update their system?

Task.Q1: I was already writing an e-mail about it when you came in.
Task.Q2: I was about to email people about it when you arrived.
Task.Q3: I will email people and tell them.
Task.Guide: 더 많은 문제가 생기기 전에 이것을 미연에 방지하자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let’s nip this in the bud} before we have [more problems].
Let's prevent this before we incur more problems.
Let's try to avoid the possibility of this problem worsening.
Why don't we nip this in the bud before encountering more problems?
Why don't we avoid this problem before it gets worse?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say we should nip this in the bud before we have more problems?

Task.Q1: I’ll be working on Paige’s laptop the rest of the day.
Task.Q2: I'll be using Paige's laptop to work the rest of the day.
Task.Q3: I'll work on Paige's laptop the rest of the day.
Task.Guide: 이번주에 다른 지점에 갈 수 있을 것인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Will you} [be able to] go to [the other branch] this week?
Can you go to the other branch this week?
Are you going to the other branch this week?
Will you be going to the other branch this week?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I'll be able to go to the other branch this week?
Task.Key: {Will you} be able to go to the other branch this week?
Use_Key: Will you visit the other stores by the end of the week?
Will you come back home right after the business trip?
Will you fix the computers yourself?
Use_Guide: 이번주 끝날때까지 다른 상점을 방문할 것인지 물어보세요.
출장 직후에 집으로 올 것인지 물어보세요.
네가 직접 컴퓨터를 고칠 것인지 물어보세요.
Use_Hint: [visit the other stores], [by the end of the week]

Complete.Reaction: Hopefully we won’t have any more problems, and I can make it there tomorrow.

Mission.Title: Expatriate Employees
Mission.Description_Ko: 볼리비아 전근을 가게 된 당신. 이미 다녀온 동료 Bill에게 필요한 정보를 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You happened to be transfer to the office in Bolivia. Ask your colleague Bill, who has already lived there, about information you might need to know.

Task.Q1: What’s up? When do you leave for Bolivia?
Task.Q2: How is it going? When are you leaving for Bolivia?
Task.Q3: Doing well? When is Bolivia?
Task.Guide: 다음주 토요일. 이제 좀 불안해진다는 말을 해야겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Next Saturday]. {I have to} [tell you that I’m getting a little nervous now].
Next Saturday. I must inform you that I'm getting a bit nervous these days.
The following Saturday. I'm afraid that I'm getting nervous recently.
The following Saturday. I'm afraid that I'm becoming nervous nowadays.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have to tell me that you're getting a little nervous now?

Task.Guide: 나는 전근 사실을 너무 갑작스럽게 알게 되어 알아볼 시간이 없었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I found out about the transfer so suddenly] {that} [I haven’t had time to research].

I discovered the transfer so suddenly that I haven't had time to research.

I recently found out about the transfer, so I haven't had sufficient time to research.

I most recently gained information about the transfer, so I did not have enough time to research.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you found out about the transfer so suddenly that you haven't had time to research?

Task.Q0: I'm sure you'll like it there.
Task.Q1: For me, the most challenging thing about living there was being away from my family, but you’ll be okay. Your family is going, too, right?
Task.Q2: For me, the greatest challenge is to separate from my family. You will be okay though. Your family is going with you, right?
Task.Q3: The challenge for me is to be away from the family. I'm sure you'll be okay. Your family is going with you.
Task.Guide: 당신 말이 맞다고 말하고, 더 안 좋을 수도 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I guess you’re right]}. [It could be worse].
I guess you're not wrong.
You know, it could always be worse.
I suppose you're correct. It could be even worse.
I don't suppose you're wrong. You should know it could be worse.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it could be worse?

Task.Guide: 떠나기 전에 알았으면 했던 것이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is there} [anything that you wish you knew before you left?]
Is there something you want to know before leaving? You know, it could always be worse.
Is there anything you wish to know before leaving?
Anything you want to know before leaving? You should know it could be worse.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if there is anything that I wish I knew before I left?
Task.Key: {Is there anything that you wish} you knew before you left?
Use_Key: Is there anything that you wish you didn't do when your were young?
Is there anything that you wish you didn't say to him?
Is there anything that you wish you didn't buy?
Use_Guide: 어렷을 때 하지 말았어야 했던 것이 있는지 물어보세요.
그에게 말하지 말았어야 했던 것이 있는지 물어보세요.
사지 말았어야 했던 것이 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I suggest you bring some good books if you read a lot. English books are really expensive there.
Task.Q2: I suggest that you bring good books if you are a reader. English books are expensive there.
Task.Q3: Bring books if you read. English books are expensive there.
Task.Guide: 좋은 조언이라고 말하고, 그곳 근무환경은 어땠는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That’s good advice]. {[How was the working environment there?]}
It's such a good advice. How are the working conditions there?
That's so good to hear. How is the workplace there, anyway?
It's so nice to hear that. How are the workplaces there, at any rate?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how the working environment was there?

Task.Q1: It’s fairly relaxed. I think you’ll enjoy it there.
Task.Q2: Fairly relaxed. You'll enjoy it there.
Task.Q3: Relaxed. You can enjoy it.
Task.Guide: 고맙다고 말하고, 마음이 안정됐다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thanks for that]. {[You’ve really reassured me]}.
Thanks for saying. You've reassured me so much.
Thank you. The assurance was helpful.
Thank you. The assurance was quite helpful.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I've really reassured you?

Complete.Reaction: No problem.

Mission.Title: Special occasions
Mission.Description_Ko: 내년에 결혼하는 친구 Samantha와 함께 결혼식 예산이 충분했다면 무엇을 했을지 이야기를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: With your friend Samantha, who is getting married next year, talk about what you would do if you had the money.

Task.Guide: 내년에 결혼하지 않냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You're getting married} [next year], [right?]
You will get married next year, right?
You're going to get married next year, aren't you?
You will get married next year, won't you?
Aren't you getting married next year?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying ain't I getting married next year?

Task.Q1: In April.
Task.Q2: In April.
Task.Q3: In April.
Task.Guide: 결혼식장은 결정했는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Have you} [picked a place] [to have your wedding yet?]
Have you chosen a place to have your wedding?
Haven't you decided where to have your wedding yet?
Did you make up your mind on where to get married?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean have I picked a place to have my wedding?

Task.Q0: I wish I had a plan.
Task.Q1: But I don’t have the time to look at anywhere.
Task.Q2: But I haven't had a chance yet.
Task.Q3: But I haven't.
Task.Guide: 예산이 충분했다면 나는 시내 호텔에서 하고 싶었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{If I had enough money}, [I’d have it] [in a hotel downtown].
If I had enough money, I’d have it in a hotel downtown.
Had I have enough money, I would have mine at a hotel downtown.
I wish I had enough money, so that I could have it at a hotel downtown.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd have it in a hotel downtown if you had the money?
Task.Key: {If I had} enough money, {I would} have it in a hotel downtown.
Use_Key: If I had the money, I would quit my job.
If I had enough time, I would travel more often.
If I had a new camera, I would take better pictures.
Use_Guide: 돈이 있었다면 일을 그만뒀을 거라고 말해 보세요.
시간이 충분했다면 나는 더 자주 여행 했을 거라고 말해 보세요.
새 카메라가 있었다면 나는 더 좋은 사진을 찍었을 거라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I would do the same if I had the money as well.
Task.Q2: I would want the same if I had enough money.
Task.Q3: I would do the same.
Task.Guide: 예산이 충분했다면 뭘 하고 싶냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What would you do} [if you had enough money] [for your wedding?]
What would you do if you had tons of money for your wedding?
What would you do if you had a lot of money for your wedding?
What would you do if you had good enough money for your wedding?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what would I do if I had unlimited money for my wedding?

Complete.Reaction: Well I'd have to think about that...

Mission.Title: Hitting the Gym
Mission.Description_Ko: 퇴근 직전에 친구 Frank에게 전화가 왔습니다. 운동을 가긴 가야 하는데 힘이 없다고 말하고, Frank의 조언을 들어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You've got a phone call from your friend Frank. You think you need to go to the gym to work out after work but you don't have the energy to do so. Listen to Frank's opinion.

Task.Q0: You are calling late.
Task.Q1: Are you still at work?
Task.Q2: You still at work?
Task.Q3: You still working?
Task.Guide: 지금 퇴근한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Yes, but [I'm just leaving]}.
Yes, but I’m leaving now.
Yeah, but I'm heading out now.
Yeah, but I was just about to leave.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I'm just leaving?

Task.Q1: So, what are you doing tonight?
Task.Q2: So, what will you do tonight?
Task.Q3: So, your plans tonight?
Task.Guide: 운동하러 갈까 생각했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I was thinking of} [hitting the gym].
I was thinking about going to the gym.
I may be going to the gym.
I might want to go to the gym.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you were thinking of hitting the gym?

Task.Guide: 근데 운동할 힘이 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{but [I don't have the energy] [to work out]}.
But I feel too tired to work out.
But I'm too exhausted to work out.
But I don't want to work out.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you don't have the energy to work out?

Task.Q1: maybe you should skip going to the gym today.
Task.Q2: perhaps you shouldn't go to the gym today.
Task.Q3: maybe you should skip the gym today.
Task.Guide: 그러고 싶지만 이미 2주동안 안 갔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'd love to, but I haven't} [been to the gym] [in the two weeks].
I would love to, but I already missed going to the gym for two weeks.
I'd love that, but I haven't been to the gym in two weeks.
That would be great, but I already skipped going to the gym for two weeks.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd love to but you haven't been to the gym in the two weeks?
Task.Key: {I haven't been} to the gym in the two weeks.
Use_Key: I haven't talked to him in the three weeks.
I haven't studied English in the two weeks.
I haven't seen her in the four months.
Use_Guide: 그와 3주동안 말하지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
2주동안 영어를 공부하지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
그녀를 4개월동안 보지 않았다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Why don't you just have a quick workout and go home?
Task.Q2: Why don't you work out quickly and go home?
Task.Q3: Then work out briefly and go home.
Task.Guide: 좋은 생각이라고 말하고, 짧게 유산소 운동만 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Good idea], {I'll just} [hit the treadmill] [for a quick run].
Good idea, I'll just go on the treadmill for a run.
Perfect, I'll just go for a quick run on the treadmill.
Great, I'll just run for a bit on the treadmill.
Task.Are_you_saying: You are saying you'll just hit the treadmill for a quick run?

Complete.Reaction: Sounds great. Have a good workout!

Mission.Title: Body Language Across Culture
Mission.Description_Ko: 터키에 간 당신. Mr.Lawson에게 그곳 문화가 어떻고, 조심해야 하는 제스처가 있는지 듣고, 이와 관련하여 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You recently arrived in Turkey. Listen to how the culture is like there, and what is considered offensive. Respond as you see necessary.

Task.Q0: Actually I wanted to talk to you about your gestures.
Task.Q1: You’re new to Turkey, so you might not know this. I don't think it's such a great idea to use that gesture around the office. It’s considered offensive here.
Task.Q2: You're new to Turkey, so you may not know this, but it's not a great idea to use that gesture around the office. It's considered offensive.
Task.Q3: You're new, so you may not know. It's not a great idea to use the gesture in the office. It's offensive.
Task.Guide: 사과하고, 그 누구의 기분도 상하게 할 생각은 없었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m sorry]. {[I didn't intend to offend anyone]}.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend people.
So sorry. Didn't have the intention of offending people.
So sorry. Didn't mean to offend people like this.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you didn't intend to offend anyone?
Task.Key: {I didn't intend to} offend anyone.
Use_Key: I didn't intend to scare you.
I didn't intend to upset you.
I didn't intend to annoy you.
Use_Guide: 너를 놀라게 할 생각은 없었다고 말해 보세요.
너를 화나게 할 생각은 없었다고 말해 보세요.
너를 짜증나게 할 생각은 없었다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: It's just the cultural difference.
Task.Q1: That’s why I’m telling you now.
Task.Q2: It's the reason I'm telling you.
Task.Q3: I'm telling you now because you don't.
Task.Guide: 알려줘서 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Thanks for letting me know]}.
Thanks for telling me.
Thank you for informing me.
Thank you for the notice.

Task.Guide: 내가 주의해야 할 다른 제스쳐가 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Are there any other gestures]} [that I should be aware of?]
Are there any other gestures to be aware of?
What other gestures are there?
What other gestures can you suggest?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if there are any other gestures that you should be aware of?

Task.Q1: There are a few others, but most aren’t things you would do by accident. For example, you should avoid making a fist with your thumb between your index finger and middle finger.
Task.Q2: A few others, but most aren't things you would do by accident. For instance, avoid making a fist with your thumb between your index finger and middle finger.
Task.Q3: Yes, but you wouldn't do them by accident. Try to avoid making a fist with your thumb between your index finger and middle finger.
Task.Guide: 알게 되어 좋다고 말하고, 내가 지금 실수로 얼마나 많은 사람들을 불쾌하게 만들었는지 걱정된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Good to know]. {I’m worried about} [how many people I might have accidentally offended now].
Nice to know. I'm worried how many people I might have offended accidentally just now.
So good to know. I worry how many people could have been offended by accident recently.
So nice to know. I worry about the people that could have been offended on accident at this moment.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are worried about how many people you might have accidentally offended now?

Complete.Reaction: Don’t worry. Everyone knows you are new to Turkey.

Mission.Title: Moving Up in the World
Mission.Description_Ko: 상사 Ms.Daniels가 부장으로 승진했다는 소식을 들었습니다. Daniels에게 축하인사를 건네 보세요.

Task.Q1: How are you?
Task.Q2: Are you good?

Task.Answer_Set:
{I heard} [you have been promoted] [to Division Head].

I heard that you were promoted to Division Head.

Task.Q1: I just heard about it myself, too.
Task.Q2: I just found out myself, too.
Task.Q3: I just heard about it, too.
Task.Guide: 승진 축하 인사를 건네 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Congratulations on} [your new promotion].
Congratulations on being promoted.
Congratulations on the new title.
Congrats for being promoted.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say congratulations on my new promotion?
Task.Key: {Congratulations on} your new promotion.
Use_Key: Congratulations on your graduation.
Congratulations on your marriage.
Congratulations on your new job.
Use_Guide: 졸업을 축하한다고 말해 보세요.
결혼을 축하한다고 말해 보세요.
취업을 축하한다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 승진하실 자격이 충분하다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Nobody deserves it] [more than you]}.
Your promotion is well deserved.
You certainly earned your promotion.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying nobody deserves it more than me?

Task.Q1: Without all of you, it would have never happened.
Task.Q2: I have you and the team to thank for it.
Task.Q3: I thank you and the team.
Task.Guide: 다 함께 오늘 저녁에 승진 축하 자리를 갖자고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We all need to} [go out tonight] [to celebrate your promotion].
We should all go out tonight to celebrate your promotion.

Let's all go out and celebrate your promotion tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we all need to go out tonight to celebrate my promotion?

Complete.Reaction: Thanks. Let's do it! I'm leaving this in your capable hands.

Mission.Title: Holiday plans
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Sebastian과 설날 휴일의 계획을 이야기하고, Sebastian을 사촌이 여는 파티에 초대해 보세요.

Task.Q3: What's your plan for New Year’s Eve?

{[My cousin is having] [a big party]}.
I'm going to go to my cousin's party.

Task.Q3: Sounds fun.

You can join us.
Let's go together.

Why don't you come?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should come?

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions to use at the hotel. Read after the AI tutor!

Could we get some extra towels, please?
Could you call me a taxi to take me to the airport?

Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

content_name: Do you mind if I use your car tonight?

Mission.Title: Do you mind if I use your car tonight?
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 오늘 밤 댄스 파티에 가야합니다. 친구 Paul에게 필요한 것 두 가지를 부탁해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You need to be at a dance party tonight. Ask your friend Paul two favors.

Task.Q1: What's up?
Task.Q2: What's up?
Task.Q3: What's up?
Task.Guide: Paul에게 부탁이 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{May I} [ask you a favor?]
Can I ask you a favor?
Could you do me a favor?
I want you to do me a favor.

Task.Q1: How can I help you?
Task.Q2: What can I help you?
Task.Q3: What is it?
Task.Guide: 오늘 밤에 정장을 빌려줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Can I} [borrow your suit] [tonight?]
Could you lend me your suit tonight?
May I borrow your suit tonight?
I'd like to borrow your suit tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying can you borrow my suit tonight?

Task.Q1: What happened to yours?
Task.Q2: What happened to yours?
Task.Q3: What happened to yours?
Task.Guide: 내 건 세탁해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Oh, {[mine] is [too dirty]}.
Mine needs to be washed.
Oh, My suits needed to be washed.
Oh, mine is too dirty to wear tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying yours is too dirty?

Task.Q1: Is that all?
Task.Q2: That's it?
Task.Q3: Anything else?
Task.Guide: 차도 써도 되는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you mind if} [I also use your car] [tonight?]
Can I also use your car tonight?
Could you also lend me your car tonight?
Can I also borrow your car tonight?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying do I mind if you also use my car tonight?
Task.Key: {Do you mind if} I use your car?
Use_Key: Do you mind if I open the window?
Do you mind if I turn off the light?
Do you mind if I close the door?
Use_Guide: 창문을 열어도 괜찮을지 물어보세요.
불을 꺼도 괜찮을지 물어보세요.
문을 열어도 괜찮을지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Where are you going tonight?
Task.Q2: Going where?
Task.Q3: To where?
Task.Guide: Ann과 함께 댄스 파티에 갈 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I am going} [to a dance party] [with Ann].
I promised to go to a dance party with Ann.
I will go to a dance party with Ann.
Ann and I are going to a dance party tonight.
I'm taking Ann to a dance party tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are going to a dance party with Ann?

Complete.Reaction: Alright. Drive safe, okay?

Mission.Title: Business Small Talk
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 Springfield라는 곳에 있는 회사에 회의를 하러 갔습니다. 회의 전에 Monica Craig라는 사람을 만나 짧게 인사를 나눠 보세요. 그리고 처음 가 본 Springfield에서 가 볼 장소도 추천받아 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are at a company in Springfield for a meeting. You got a chance to exchange greetings and have a smalltalk with a person named Monica Craig. Ask for her recommendations about the places to see.

Task.Reaction: Hello, my name is Monica Craig.
Task.Q1: I’m a vice president in the marketing department.
Task.Q2: I'm vice president of the marketing department.
Task.Q3: Vice president from marketing.
Task.Guide: 이름을 말하고, 만나서 반갑다고 인사해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I'm <user's name>]. {[Nice to meet you]}.
I'm <user's name>. I'm from Ace Corp. So nice to meet you.
I'm <user's name>.I belong to Ace Corp. It's nice meeting you.
I'm <user's name>. It's a pleasure to meet you.

Task.Q1: Nice to meet you, too. Is this your first time in Springfield?
Task.Q2: Nice to meet you as well. Are you visiting Springfield for the first time?
Task.Q3: So nice meeting you. Your first time in Springfield?
Task.Guide: 그렇다고 말하고. 아직 이곳을 많이 둘러보지 못했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Yes, it is]. {I haven’t got to} [see much of it yet].

Yes, it is. I haven't gotten to see much of it yet.

Yes. I haven't had the chance to see it thoroughly.

Yes. I haven't seen it thoroughly yet.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you haven't got to see much of it yet?

Task.Guide: 이곳에서 볼 것을 추천해 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do you} [recommend] [I see here?]

What would you  recommend I see here?

Would you recommend seeing something here?
Would you like to tell me what I should see here?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I recommend you see here?
Task.Key: {What do you} recommend I see here?
Use_Key: What do you recommend I drink here?
What do you recommend I do here?
What do you recommend I buy here?
Use_Guide: 여기서 무엇을 마셔야 하는지 추천 받아 보세요.
여기서 무엇을 해야 하는지 추천 받아 보세요.
여기서 무엇을 사야 하는지 추천 받아 보세요.

Task.Q1: Do you like plays? Springfield is known for its theater district. If you have time, you should try to watch one.
Task.Q2: How about plays? Springfield is known for its theater. If you have time, you should watch one.
Task.Q3: Watch plays, because Springfield is famous for theater.
Task.Guide: 극장을 좋아한다고 말하고, 연극을 자주 보는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I love the theater]. {Do you} [watch plays often?]
I love the theater. How about you? Do you watch plays frequently?
I love watching theater. And you? How often would you watch plays?
I adore the theater. What about you? How often do you watch plays?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I watch plays often?

Task.Q1: I used to, but not very much lately.
Task.Q2: I did in the past, but not so much now.
Task.Q3: Yes, in the past, but not now.
Task.Guide: 이제 회의에 들어가봐야 한다고 말하고, 만나서 정말 반가웠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Oh…{I think it’s time to} [go in for the meeting]. [It was very nice to meet you], Mr. Craig.

Oh… I think it's time to begin the meeting. It was so nice meeting you,  Mr.Craig.

I think we should enter the meeting room now. Mr.Craig, it was a pleasure to meet you.

I think we ought to enter the meeting room now. Mr.Craig, it was pleasant meeting you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's time to go in for the meeting?

Complete.Reaction: I enjoyed talking to you. I’ll see you inside the meeting.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_해외에서 살아남기 : 병원 편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 병원 방문 시 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use in the hospital.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"schedule an appointment"}는 "약속을 잡다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "schedule an appointment" is an expression making appointments.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"schedule an appointment"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "schedule an appointment." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"schedule an appointment"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "schedule an appointment."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: schedule an appointment with Dr. Chang

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I have ~"}은 "저는 ~이/가 있어요"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I have ~" is an expression telling what symptom you have.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I have ~"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "I have ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"I have ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "I have ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How often ~?"}은 "얼마나 자주 ~하나요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "How often ~?" is an expression asking the frequency of actions.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How often ~?"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "How often ~?."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"How often ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "How often ~?."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: How often should I take the medicine?
How often should I visit a doctor?

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"얼마나 자주 약을 먹어야 하나요?"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: How often should I take the medicine?

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 병원 방문 시 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used when you are visiting a hospital.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

Mission.Title: Formal Informal Communication
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 부서는 최근 용지 적하물을 받았는데, 문제가 있었습니다. 그래서 적하물에 대한 환불을 받고자 합니다. 담당자 Mr.Tate를 찾아가 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your team received a shipment of paper lately but there was a problem. So you want to get a refund for the damage. Have a conversation with Mr.Tate on refunding the delivered paper.

Task.Q1: How are you doing today?
Task.Q2: How are you today?
Task.Q3: Doing well?
Task.Guide: 나는 괜찮은데, 어떠시냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I’m fine. And you?]}
I'm fine, what about you?
Swell. And you?
Quite good, thank you. How are you?

Task.Q1: I’m doing well. What can I do for you today?
Task.Q2: I'm well. How can I help you today?
Task.Q3: Fine, actually. What is up?
Task.Guide: 우리에게 최근 배달된 용지 적하물에 문제가 있었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{There was} [a problem] [with our latest shipment of paper].
There was a problem with our latest paper shipment.
Our latest paper shipment had a problem.
Our latest paper shipment has had a problem.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying there was a problem with your latest shipment of paper?

Task.Q1: I’m doing well. What can I do for you today?
Task.Q2: I'm well. How can I help you today?
Task.Q3: Fine, actually. What is up?
Task.Guide: 배달된 대부분의 상자들이 물에 젖었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Most of} [the boxes] [had water damage].
Most of the units  have had water damage.
Most boxes had water damage.
Most boxes have water damage.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying most of the boxes had water damage?

Task.Q1: I’m sorry to hear that. That’s a very unusual situation. Would you like to exchange the damaged units?
Task.Q2: I'm sorry for that. That's quite an unusual situation. Do you like to exchange the damaged units?
Task.Q3: Sorry for that. That's very unusual. How would you exchange the damaged units?
Task.Guide: 아니 나는 네가 환불을 해주기를 바란다고 말하고, 상황이 매우 곤란했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, {I was hoping that} [you could give me a refund]. [The situation was really inconvenient].
No, I was hoping for a refund instead. The situation was truly inconvenient.
Actually, I would like a refund. The situation has been quite inconvenient.
Actually, I would like to get a refund. The situation has been inconvenient so far.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you were hoping that I could give you a refund?
Task.Key: {I was hoping that} you {could} give me a refund.
Use_Key: I was hoping that you could take the job.
I was hoping that I could get some more details.
I was hoping that they would not come back.
Use_Guide: 나는 네가 그 일을 맡아줬으면 했다고 말해 보세요.
나는 내가 자세한 정보를 더 얻을 수 있기를 바란다고 말해 보세요.
나는 그들이 돌아오지 않았으면 했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: That is a very difficult situation, but I'm not sure if I can refund your  purchase. Do you mind if I call my supervisor and check?
Task.Q2: It's a difficult situation, but I'm not sure I can give a refund. Do you mind  that I call my supervisor and check?
Task.Q3: It's a difficult situation indeed, but I cannot give refunds. Okay that I call my supervisor and check?
Task.Guide: 괜찮으니 그렇게 하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Not at all]. {[Go right ahead]}.
No, not at all. Please go ahead.
No I don't. Feel free to go ahead and check.
No it's fine. Go ahead and check.

Complete.Reaction: His line is busy now. Please give me a few more minutes.

Mission.Title: Online Communication
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 본사의 Ms.Black과 컨퍼런스 콜을 하고 있습니다. 당신의 시간에 맞춰 일찍 출근해서 전화해 준 Ms.Black에게 감사인사를 하고, 판매량이 증가했다고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are having a conference call with Ms.Black from the head office. Thank her for coming in early to have this call with you and tell her that the sales volume has increased.

Task.Q1: How are you doing today?
Task.Q2: How is it going today?
Task.Q3: Doing well today?
Task.Guide: 잘 지내고 있다고 말하고, 전화 줘서 감사하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m doing fine]. {Thank you so much for} [calling me].
I'm fine. Thank you so much for the call.
Fine, thank you. I appreciate your calling.
Yes, I'm fine. Really appreciate your calling.

Task.Guide: 네가 이 통화를 위해 오늘 일찍 왔어야 해서 미안하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’m sorry that} [you had to come in so early] [to make the call].
I'm sorry that you had to come in early to call.
Sorry that you had to come in early for it.
I apologize that you had to arrive early for it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're sorry that I had to come in so early to make the call?

Task.Q1: It was no problem. I like taking the bus early. It’s so much more peaceful.  Now, why don’t we get down to business. Let’s start with discussing the  quarterly sales data.
Task.Q2: It was not a problem. I like taking the bus early, because it's so peaceful.  Now, why don't we do business. Start by discussing quarterly sales data.
Task.Q3: No problem. Early buses are so much more peaceful. Let's start discussing quarterly sales data.
Task.Guide: 모든 것은 좋아 보인다고 말하고, 분기 초부터 우리 회사의 판매량은 거의 8% 증가했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Everything is looking good]. {From the start of the quarter}, [our sales volume has increased almost 8%].

Everything seems good. From the beginning of the quarter, our sales volume increased by nearly 8%.

Everything is seeming to go well. Our sales volume increased to nearly 8%, since the beginning of the quarter.

Everything appears to be going well. Our sales volume increased to almost 8%, since the start of the quarter.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying from the start of the quarter our sales volume has increased almost 8%?

Task.Q1: That’s quite an impressive change. Would you mind sending me a copy of your data?
Task.Q2: That's impressive. Can you send me a copy of your data?
Task.Q3: Impressive. Send me a copy of your data?
Task.Guide: 내 컨퍼런스 콜 시스템이 문제가 있는지 소리가 잘 안 들린다고 말하고, 내 말을 들리는지 확인해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’m sorry, but} [there’s something wrong with my conference call system]. [It’s hard for me to hear you]. [Can you hear me?]

I apologize, but something is wrong with my conference call system. It's not easy for me to hear you. Can you hear me?

So sorry, but something seems to be wrong with my conference call system. It's dfficult for me to hear you. Can you hear me?

So sorry, but the conference call system seems to be malfunctioning. I cannot hear you easily. Can you hear me?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I can hear you?

Task.Q1: Yes, I hear you fine.
Task.Q2: Yes, I can hear you fine.
Task.Q3: Yes, I hear you.
Task.Guide: 연결이 자꾸 끊긴다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The connection keeps getting lost]}.
The connection keeps breaking.
The connection breaks regularly.
The connection breaks constantly.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the connection keeps getting lost?

Task.Guide: 데이터 복사본을 그쪽 시간 내일 아침까지 이메일로 보내줘도 되는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Would it be okay if} [I e-mail you the copy of the data] [by tomorrow morning your time?]

Would it be all right if I emailed you the data copy by tomorrow morning? In your time?

Can I email you data copy by tomorrow morning, your time?

May I email you the copy of the data soon? Perhaps by tomorrow morning, your time?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if you can e-mail the copy of the data by tomorrow morning my time?
Task.Key: {Would it be okay if} I e-mail you the copy of the data tomorrow?
Use_Key: Would it be okay if I leave early today?
Would it be okay if I call you back this afternoon?
Would it be okay if I skip the meeting for a conference call?
Use_Guide: 오늘 일찍 들어가봐도 되는지 물어보세요.
이따 오후에 내가 다시 전화 줘도 되는지 물어보세요.
컨퍼런스 콜 때문에 회의 참석을 못 해도 괜찮을지 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: That will be fine. Thank you for that.

Mission.Title: Making Dinner Reservations
Mission.Description_Ko: 전화로 저녁식사를 할 식당에 예약하려고 합니다. 예약이 가능한 날짜와 시간을 묻고, 일행 정보에 맞게 필요한 사항을 요청해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are making a dinner reservation at a restaurant on the phone. Ask the clerk to get you a table when you'd like and make a request telling him whom you are going with.

Task.Reaction: Thank you for calling Bon Appetit.
Task.Q1: How may I help you?
Task.Q2: How can I help you?
Task.Q3: Can I help you?
Task.Guide: 금요일로 예약할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could I} [make a reservation for Friday], please?
Could you please help me make a reservation for Friday?
Would I be able to make a reservation for Friday, please?
Would you please help me make an reservation for Friday?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying could you make a reservation for Friday, please?

Task.Q0: I'm sorry, we are all booked up.
Task.Q1: How about Saturday?
Task.Q2: Is Saturday okay?
Task.Q3: What about Saturday?
Task.Guide: 오후 7시에 예약이 가능한지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [have any tables] [available for 7 p.m.?]
Do you have any free tables at 7pm?
Would there be tables available at 7pm?
Could I get a table at 7pm?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean do we have any tables available for 7pm?
Task.Key: Do you have any tables {available for} 7 p.m.?
Use_Key: Do you have any tables available for Sunday night?
Do you have any seats available for tomorrow morning?
Do you have any rooms available for next Monday?
Use_Guide: 일요일 밤에 예약이 가능한지 물어보세요.
내일 아침에 좌석 예약이 가능한지 물어보세요.
다음주 월요일에 방 예약이 가능한지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: How many people is the reservation for?
Task.Q2: How many is the reservation for?
Task.Q3: How many people?
Task.Guide: 성인 2명에 아이 3명이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Two adults and three kids]}.
There are two adults and three kids.
We have two aduluts and three kids.
Three kids and two adults.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying two adults and three kids?

Task.Guide: 아이용 높은 의자가 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [have] [any high chairs?]
Could you set up high chairs for the kids?
I need some high chairs for the kids.
Could you get us high chairs for the kids?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean do we have any high chairs?

Task.Q0: I'll set one aside for you.
Task.Q1: Could I get your name, please?
Task.Q2: May I have your name?
Task.Q3: Your name please?
Task.Guide: 이름을 말해 주세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Sure. It's <user's name>}.
Yes, it's <user's name>.
Sure. My name is <user's name>.
Yup, it's <user's name>.

Complete.Reaction: Great. I've penciled you in for 7 p.m. on Saturday. See you then!

Mission.Title: Banking
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 입금과 지난달 입출금 내역서의 사본이 필요해서 은행에 갔습니다. 은행 직원에게 이를 요청해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are at a bank to deposit some money into your account and get a copy of your bank statement from last month. Ask the banker for them.

Task.Q1: How may I help you today?
Task.Q2: How can I help you?
Task.Q3: Can I help you?
Task.Guide: 직원에게 이 돈을 계좌에 입금하고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'd like to} [deposit this money] [into my savings account], please.
I'd like to put this money into my savings account, please.
Could you please add this money into my savings account?
Please deposit this money into my savings account.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd like to deposit this money into your savings account?
Task.Key: {I'd like to} deposit this money into my savings account, please.
Use_Key: I'd like to withdraw some cash.
I'd like to transfer some money.
I'd like to open a new account.
Use_Guide: 현금을 인출하고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
돈을 조금 이체 하고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
새로운 구좌를 열고 싶다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Do you have your ATM card with you?
Task.Q2: Would you have your ATM card on you?
Task.Q3: Can I get your ATM card?
Task.Guide: 집에 놓고 온 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, {I must have forgotten it} [at home].
No, I must have left it at home.
No, I forgot to bring it from home.
No, I forgot. It must be at home.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you must have forgotten it at home?

Task.Q1: Could I get your ID card?
Task.Q2: May I have your ID?
Task.Q3: Can I get your ID?
Task.Guide: 신분증을 건네며 여기 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Sure], {[here it is]}.
Sure, here you go.
Okay, here it is.
Yes, there you go.

Task.Q0: The money is in the account.
Task.Q1: Is there anything else I can do for you today?
Task.Q2: Can I help you with anything else today?
Task.Q3: Is there anything else?
Task.Guide: 지난달 입출금내역서 사본을 요청해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you give me} [a copy of my bank statement] [from last month?]
Could I get a copy of my bank statement from last month?
Could you help me with a copy of my bank statement from last month?
I need a copy of my bank statement from last month.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean could I give you a copy of your bank statement from last month?

Task.Q0: Here you go.
Task.Q1: Will there be anything else?
Task.Q2: Is there anything else?
Task.Q3: Anything else?
Task.Guide: 없다고 말하고, 감사 인사를 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[No], [thank you]}.
No, that's all.
No, nothing else.
No, that's great.

Complete.Reaction: Alright, have yourself a good day then.

Mission.Title: What are you doing now?
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Jack에게 전화가 왔습니다. 어디에서 전화를 거는 건지, 그곳에 왜 갔는지, 그곳에서 무엇을 하고 있는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You've got a phone call from your friend, Jack. Ask him where he is calling from, why he is where he is, and what he is doing now over there.

Task.Q1: This is Jack.
Task.Q2: It's me, Jack.
Task.Q3: It's Jack.
Task.Guide: Jack에게 인사하고, 집에서 전화하는 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Hi, Jack]. {Are you calling} [from home?]
Hi, Jack. Are you at home and calling me now?
Hello, Jack. Are you at home right now?
Hi, Jack. Is it your home that you are calling from?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean am I calling from home?

Task.Guide: 그럼 어디냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Where are you} [then]?
Where are you right now?
Then, where are you?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean where am I then?

Task.Q1: I'm in Miami with my parents.
Task.Q2: My parents and I are in Miami.
Task.Q3: My family is in Miami.
Task.Guide: 왜 Miami에 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
In Miami? {Why are you} [there?]
Miami? What made you go there?
Miami? Why did you go there?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking why am I here?
Task.Key: {Why are you} there?
Use_Key: Why are you busy?
Why are you tired?
Why are you upset?
Use_Guide: 왜 바쁜지 물어보세요.
왜 피곤한 지 물어보세요.
왜 기분이 안 좋은지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I am on vacation.
Task.Q2: I am taking a vacation.
Task.Q3: I am on holiday.
Task.Guide: 그래서 지금 뭐하고 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What are you doing} [now]?
What are you dong there?
Doing what?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what am I doing now?

Complete.Reaction: Actually, I am just staying at the hotel. It's raining outside.

Mission.Title: I should have ..
Mission.Description_Ko: 마지막 버스를 놓친 줄 모르고 한참을 기다리다가 친구 Natalie에게 전화한 당신. 당신을 데리러 와 준 Natalie와 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You have waited so long, not knowing that you missed the last bus. You called your friend Natalie and she is driving you home now. Talk to her about what happened.
Mission.Guide_En: Natalie, thank you so much for the ride .

Task.Q1: What would you have done if I hadn't been there to help?
Task.Q2: I'm happy that I was there to help you.
Task.Q3: I'm glad that I could help you.
Task.Guide: 버스 시간을 미리 확인했으면 좋았을 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I wish} [I had checked] [the bus timetable].
I should have checked the bus timetable.
I can't believe I didn't check the bus timetable.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you wish you hadn't forgotten your wallet?

Task.Q1: Missing the last bus was unfortunate.
Task.Q2: Missing the last bus was bad.
Task.Q3: Missing the last bus was a bad start.
Task.Guide: 오래 기다리지 말았어야 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I know. {I shouldn’t have} [waited] [so long].
I wish I hadn't waitied that long.

Mission.Title: Tackling Problems
