Complete.Reaction: Of course. She's the best. Come with me!

Mission.Title: I'm walking my pet.
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Corey와 저녁식사를 하기로 한 당신. 나가기 전에 강아지 산책을 시켜야 한다고 말하고, 다음 주에 강아지 산책을 부탁해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are supposed to have dinner with your friend Corey. Tell her that you have to walk your dog before you leave and ask her to walk him next week for you.

Task.Q1: Are you ready to go to dinner now?
Task.Q2: Are you ready to leave now?
Task.Q3: Can you go to dinner now?
Task.Guide: 나가기 전에 강아지를 산책시켜야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I need to} [walk my dog] [before we go out].
I have to walk my puppy before we go out.
I want to walk my dog before we leave.
I think I should walk my dog first.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you need to walk your dog before we go out?

Task.Q1: How often do you walk your dog?
Task.Q2: How many times do you walk your dog?
Task.Q3: Do you walk your dog often?
Task.Guide: 하루에 두 번 공원에서 산책을 시킨다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I usually} [walk him twice a day] [at the park].
I walk it twice a day at the park.
Twice a day at the part, usually.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you usually walk him twice a day at the park?

Task.Q1: I bet walking him is fun.
Task.Q2: I guess walking him would be fun.
Task.Q3: Walking him sounds fun.
Task.Guide: 너도 언제 한번 산책시켜 보라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
It is. {You should} [try it] [sometime].
You're right. You can try it sometime.
Maybe you could try it later.
Why don't you try it later sometime?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I should try it sometime?

Task.Q1: Let me know if you ever need help.
Task.Q2: Let me know when you need me.
Task.Q3: Anytime!
Task.Guide: 다음 주에 부모님을 뵈러 갈 때, 산책시켜 줄  수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Would you} [walk my dog for me] [when I visit my parents next week?]
Could you walk my dog when I visit my parents?
Can you do this when I visit my parents?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean would I walk your dog for you when you visit your parents next week?
Task.Key: {Would you} walk my dog {for} me?
Use_Key: Would you feed my dog for me?
Would you receive my packages for me?
Would you return this book for me?
Use_Guide: 강아지 먹이를 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
택배를 받아줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
이 책을 반납해 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Sure, just let me know the date!

Mission.Title: Paying the Bill
Mission.Description_Ko: 레스토랑에서 식사를 마친 당신. 음료를 권하는 웨이터에게 계산서와 카드 결제를 요청해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You just had a meal at a restaurant. Ask the waiter to bring the check and tell him you will pay with your credit card.

Task.Q1: How was everything tonight?
Task.Q2: Was the meal okay tonight?
Task.Q3: Was everything okay?
Task.Guide: 웨이터에게 모두 다 좋았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Everything was just great], [thanks]}.
Everything was perfect!
It was great, thanks.
It was wonderful.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying everything was just great?

Task.Q1: Can I bring you anything else?
Task.Q2: Would you like anything else?
Task.Q3: Will there be anything else?
Task.Guide: 배가 부르다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[No], [I'm stuffed]}.
No, I can't eat another bite.
I couldn't eat another bite.
I'm full.
No, thank you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you are stuffed?

Task.Reaction: Well, I'm glad to hear that.
Task.Q1: Would you like tea or coffee?
Task.Q2: Would you like an after dinner drink?
Task.Q3: Would you like something hot to drink?
Task.Guide: 거절하고, 계산서를 요청해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, thanks. {Could I} [get the check], [please?]
Thanks, but the check will be fine.
Just the check please.
The check please.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean could you get the check?

Task.Q0: Here you are.
Task.Q1: I can take care of that for you whenever you're ready.
Task.Q2: I'll be back around momentarily.
Task.Q3: Whenever you're ready.
Task.Guide: 신용카드로 결제하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I'm ready, {[I'll put it] [on my credit card]}.
Thank you, here is my credit card.
We’re ready, here you are.
Thank you, here you are.
I'll pay by credit card.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll put it on your credit card?
Task.Key: {I'll put it on} my credit card.
Use_Key: I'll put it on my debit card.
I'll put it on my paypal account.
I'll put it on my tab.
Use_Guide: 직불 카드로 내겠다고 말해 보세요.
페이팔로 내겠다고 말해 보세요.
장부에 달아놓겠다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Sure. And I'll get back to you with the receipt.

Mission.Title: Shall we have some dessert?
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Stan과 식사를 마친 당신, 어떤 디저트를 먹을지 그리고 어디에서 먹을지 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You just had a meal with your friend Stan. Talk to him about what you want for dessert and whether you should have it now or later.

Task.Q1: I really enjoyed the food here.
Task.Q2: It was delicious.
Task.Q3: I had a lot.
Task.Guide: 디저트를 먹자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[have] [some dessert?] {Shall we}
Would you like some dessert?
Let's have some dessert, too.
I'd like some dessert, too.
How about we have some dessert?
Why don't we have some dessert, too?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean shall we have some dessert?

Task.Q1: What do you feel like?
Task.Q2: What do you want for dessert?
Task.Q3: What do you want?
Task.Guide: 초콜릿 케이크가 맛있어 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The chocolate cake] [looks so delicious]}.
The chocolate cake looks so good.
I think the chocolate cake looks nice.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the chocolate cake looks so delicious?

Task.Q1: But I think I'm too full to have it now.
Task.Q2: But I'm too full right now.
Task.Q3: But I'm full right now.
Task.Guide: 테이크아웃을 하고 싶냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you want to} [get it] [to go]?
Do you want to take it away?
We can get it to go, if you want.
Would you like to get it to go?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying do I want to get it to go?

Task.Q1: We could eat it later with our coffee.
Task.Q2: We can have it later with some coffee.
Task.Q3: Let's have it later with coffee.
Task.Guide: 좋은 생각이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That's a good idea]}.
Great idea.
I think it's a great idea.
Great. Let's do that.

Task.Guide: 그럼 케이크 한 조각 테이크아웃 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'll} [order a piece of cake] [to go], then.
Let me order a piece of cake to go.
Let's order a piece of cake to go.
I'll order a cake as takeout.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you'll order a piece of cake to go?
Task.Key: I'll order a piece of cake {to go}.
Use_Key: I'll order a sandwich to go.
I'll order a cup of coffee to go.
I'll order pizza to go.
Use_Guide: 샌드위치를 테이크아웃 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
커피를 테이크아웃 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
피자를 테이크아웃 하겠다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: That would be great. Thanks.

Mission.Title: Thanks, but No Thanks.
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Dylan과 파티에 같이 가기로 한 약속을 잊어버렸습니다. 약속을 못 지키게 된 당신. Dylan에게 사과하고, 기분을 풀어주기 위해 다른 것들을 제안해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You forgot about your plan to go with Dylan to a party. Make a sincere apology to Dylan for not being able to keep your words and make suggestions to make it up to him.

Task.Q1: I just wanted to get back to you about Julie's party this Friday.
Task.Q2: I wanted to update you on Julie's party this Friday.
Task.Q3: I wanted to talk to you about Julie's party.
Task.Guide: 이런, 까맣게 잊어버렸다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I totally forgot]}.
I wasn't thinking about that at all.
That totally slipped my mind.
I forgot about that.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you totally forgot?

Task.Guide: 같이 못 갈 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I won't be able to} [come with you].
I don't think I can go with you.
I won't be able to make it with you.
I'm not sure I can come with you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you won't be able to come with me?

Task.Q1: We talked about this weeks ago.
Task.Q2: We promised a long time ago.
Task.Q3: We made plans already.
Task.Guide: 내 실수라고 말하고 사과해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[My mistake]. [I'm so sorry]}.
My bad. I'm terribly sorry.
My fault. I don't know what to say.
I messed up. I'm so sorry.
Task.Are_you_saying: Your mistake?

Task.Guide: 사과의 의미로 내일 저녁을 사겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[To make it up to you], {why don't I} [take you to dinner] [tomorrow night?]
As a way of saying sorry, I'd like to take you to dinner tomorrow night.
Can I take you to dinner tomorrow night?
Let me take you to dinner tomorrow night, please.
Task.Are_you_saying: To make it up to me, you want to make me to dinner tomorrow night?
Task.Key: To make it up to you, {why don't I} take you to dinner tomorrow night?
Use_Key: To make it up to you, why don't I buy you a drink?
To make it up to you, why don't I clean the house for you?
To make it up to you, why don't I buy you coffee?
Use_Guide: 사과의 의미로 술 한 잔 사겠다고 말해보세요.
사과의 의미로 대신 집청소를 하겠다고 말해보세요.
사과의 의미로 커피를 사겠다고 말해보세요.

Task.Q0: I think I'll be getting home pretty late.
Task.Q1: How about another time?
Task.Q2: Perhaps another time?
Task.Q3: Maybe next time?
Task.Guide: 약속을 못 지켜서 미안하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sorry about} [backing out] [on our plans].
I apologize for cancelling on our plans.
I'm sorry about not sticking to our plans.
I apologize for not going as planned.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you are sorry that you are backing out on our plans?

Complete.Reaction: That's okay. Let's catch up later.

description: 20.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 유학 코스_오늘의 표현 시즌 1-3

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 수업에서 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 핵심 표현을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some key expressions in the topic card first. Read after the AI tutor.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: make one's bed and lie in it
You've made your bed and now lie in it.
I think it's time to face the music.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 돌이킬 수 없이 관계를 안 좋게 끝내다
관계를 안 좋게 끝내는 건 현명한 생각이 아니야.
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: It's never smart to burn bridges.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 내 생각엔 다시 원점으로 돌아온 것 같아.
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I guess it's back to square one.

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: make one's bed and lie in it

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"회피하지 않고 직시하다"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"돌이킬 수 없이 관계를 안 좋게 끝내다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 많은 표현을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions through the class with your tutor.

Mission.Title: The Post Office
Mission.Description_Ko: 영국으로 수하물을 부쳐야 하는 당신. 우체국에 가서 직원에게 보내는 방법을 묻고, 수하물을 어떻게 보낼 건지 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You have a package to send to the UK. Ask a clerk at the postoffice about the options you have and tell him how you'd like to send it.

Task.Q1: How can I help you today?
Task.Q2: What can I do for you today?
Task.Q3: Can I help you?
Task.Guide: 직원에게 이 수하물을 해외로 보내야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I need to} [send this package] [overseas].
I need to deliver this package to a foreign country.
I would like to send this package overseas.
I want to send this package out of the country.
I need to deliver this package abroad.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you need to send this package overseas?

Task.Q1: Where are you sending it to?
Task.Q2: What country is it going to?
Task.Q3: Where is it going?
Task.Guide: 영국으로 보낸다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The UK]}.
I want to send it to the UK.
It’s going to the UK.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean the UK?

Task.Guide: 보낼 수 있는 방법에 대해서 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What are my options for} [sending this package?]
Are there any options for that?
How can I send it there?
What options do you have for sending it to the UK?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what are your options for sending this package?
Task.Key: {What are my options for} send{ing} this package?
Task.Use_Key: What are my options for mailing this letter?
Task.Use_Guide: 이 편지를 부칠 수 있는 방법들이 뭐가 있냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: You can send it standard mail, airmail, or priority mail.
Task.Q1: How fast does it need to get there?
Task.Q2: How quickly do you need it to reach its destination?
Task.Q3: When do you want to arrive?
Task.Guide: 가능한 빨리 도착해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[As soon as possible]}.
It needs to get there ASAP.
As fast as it can.
The quicker the better.
The fastest option you have please.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying as soon as possible?

Task.Q1: This package will cost $65 for one-day delivery.
Task.Q2: It’s $65 for one-day delivery.
Task.Q3: $65 for one-day.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 해 주면 좋겠다고 말하고, 감사인사를 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That'll be great]. {Thank you for} [your help].
That sounds perfect, thank you.
Thank you! That will work.
Thank you for all the help.
Thank you very much.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that'll be great?

Complete.Reaction: My pleasure. Have a wonderful afternoon.

content_name: Campus English : At the admin office
description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 행정실편

Title.Title_En: Campus English : At the admin office

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 행정실에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression which can be used at the admin office before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"get a copy of ~"}는 '~의 사본을 발급받다'를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "get a copy of ~" is an expression asking for a copy of the original thing.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {“get a copy of ~”} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let’s practice some words that can come after “get a copy of.” Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"get a copy of ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now, let’s use these words with the pattern “get a copy of.”

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: get a copy of my transcript
get a copy of that article

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 행정실에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that can be used with at the admin office.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"have a question about ~"}은 '~에 대해 질문이 있다'를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "have a question about ~" is an expression that you can use when you are curious about something.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"have a question about ~"}의 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let’s practice some words that can come after “have a question about~.”

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"have a question about ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "have a question about ~".

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: have a question about class schedule
have a question about my paper

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 행정실에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used at the admin office.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"fill out"}은 '~를 작성하다'를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "fill out" is an expression that you can use when you need to write down some information on a form.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"fill out"}의 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "fill out".

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"fill out"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "fill out".

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 당신의 학생증 번호와 함께 이 양식을 작성하다
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: fill out this form with your student ID

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"내 성적 증명서의 사본을 발급받다"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: get a copy of my transcript

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"수업 시간표에 관해 질문이 있다"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: have a question about class schedule

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 유학 생활 중 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used during studying abroad.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

Mission.Title: Planning a Potluck
Mission.Description_Ko:
당신은 매년 친구들과 음식을 준비해 와서 모이는 파티가 있습니다.
올해는 어떤 음식을 할지 친구 Caraol과 함께 계획을 세워보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are having an annual potluck with your friends. Make a plan for this year's potluck with your friend Carol.
Mission.Guide_En: Carol, let's talk about our annual potluck.

Task.Q1: How many people are coming this year?
Task.Q2: What is the guest count this year?
Task.Q3: Do you know how many people will be coming?
Task.Guide: Caraol에게 30명 정도가 올 거라고 말해 보세요.

{[We have about 30 people] [coming to the annual potluck]}.
There are about 30 people coming to the potluck this year.
About 30 people will be coming this year.
There should be around 30 people this year.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we have about 30 people coming to the annual potluck?

Task.Q1: Then, we need to organize the food.
Task.Q2: We need to prepare for the food.
Task.Q3: We should decide how to do the food.
Task.Guide: 집에서 담근 고추장을 가지고 올 수 있는지 물어보세요.

{Would you mind} [bringing] [your homemade chili paste?]

Task.Key: {Would you mind} bring{ing} your homemade chili paste?
Use_Key: Would you mind picking me up after work?
Would you mind having my shirt dry-cleaned?
Would you mind wiping down the table?
Use_Guide: 퇴근하고 데리러 올 수 있냐고 물어보세요.
셔츠를 드라이클리닝 해줄 수 있냐고 물어보세요.
테이블을 닦아줄 수 있냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I'll make up a double batch.
Task.Q2: I'll prepare extra this time.
Task.Q3: I'll make a lot this year.

{Why don't we} [ask Mary to bring] [her fried chicken?]
Do you think Mary can bring her fried checken?

Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we should ask Mary to bring her fried chicken?

Task.Q2: We can ask Wendy to bring her Caesar salad.
Task.Q3: Wendy can bring her Ceasar salad.

{I wonder if} [Karen could bring] [her chocolate cream pie].
Karen could bring her amazing chocolate cream pie.

Karen can bring her chocolate cream pie.
Task.Are_you_saying: You wonder if Karren could bring her chocolate cream pie?

Task.Q1: I think we'll have enough food to feed an army.
Task.Q2: We should have more than enough food.
Task.Q3: There will be plenty of food.

Task.Answer_Set:
{[I can't wait] [until Saturday]}.

Saturday is going to be great.

Mission.Title: Weekend plans
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Eric에게 주말 계획을 물어보세요. Eric의 제안에 일정을 확인하고 다시 연락하겠다고 말해 보세요.

Mission.Title: Getting in Touch
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 너무 바빠서 친구 Tiffany가 보낸 메시지에 회신을 못했습니다. Tiffany에게 전화를 걸어 사과하고, 안부 인사를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You didn't reply to Your friend Tiffany's message as you have been too busy. Make an apology on the phone and ask her how she has been.

Task.Q0: Long time no hear!
Task.Q1: How's it going?
Task.Q2: How have you been?
Task.Q3: How are you?

Great! [Sorry] {[I didn't reply to your message]}.

Task.Q2: I'm happy we get to talk.
Task.Q3: I'm glad we can talk.

Task.Guide: Jessica에게 어제 데이트는 어땠는지 물어보세요.

나의 친구는 활발하고 말을 잘하는 사람을 좋아한다고 말해 보세요.

What time can we enter?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what time the doors open?

Complete.Reaction: The lobby opens at 6 and the show starts at 7. Enjoy the show!

Mission.Title: TGIF
Mission.Description_Ko: 즐거운 금요일! 동료인 Larry와 함께 주말 계획을 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: It's Friday! With Larry, talk about your plans for the weekend.

Task.Q1: How are things?
Task.Q2: How's it going?
Task.Q3: How are you?
Task.Guide: Larry에게 드디어 금요일이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It's finally Friday]}.
The work week’s over.
Time for the weekend!
It’s Friday!
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's finally Friday?

Task.Q1: This week has seemed endless.
Task.Q2: I thought this week would never end.
Task.Q3: This week was really long.
Task.Guide: 오늘이 빨리 지나갔으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I can't wait for this day] [to be over]}.
I’ll be glad when this day if finished.
I’m ready for this day to be over.
I wish this day would finish sooner.
I want this day to end.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't wait for this day to be over?
Task.Key: I can't wait {for} this day {to} be over.
Use_Key: I can't wait for him to come.
I can't wait for my birthday to come.
I can't wait for spring to start.
Use_Guide: 그가 빨리 왔으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
생일이 빨리 왔으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
봄이 빨리 시작됐으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 오늘밤 계획을 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What is your plan] [for tonight?]}
What are you up to tonight?
What’s the plan tonight?
What are you doing tonight?
Doing anything tonight?
Any plans tonight?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what is my plan for tonight?

Task.Q0: My boyfriend is picking me up after work.
Task.Q1: And we're going out for dinner and a movie. How about you?
Task.Q2: I’m going to dinner and a movie with him. What are you up to?
Task.Q3: Dinner and a movie together. You?
Task.Guide: 빨리 끝내고 기차 타러 가고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can't wait to} [knock off early] and [hop on a train].
I hope to duck out early so I can grab a train.
I’m getting ready to bail early. Then I’m going to catch a train.
I want to leave early and jump on a train.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you can't wait to knock off early and hop on a train?

Task.Q1: Where are you headed?
Task.Q2: Where are you going?
Task.Q3: Where to?
Task.Guide: 부산에 간다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm heading to} [Busan].
I’m riding down to Busan.
Headed to Busan.
Going to Busan.
Busan.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are heading to Busan?

Complete.Reaction: That sounds fun. Tell me when you get back.

content_name: What do you do after work?

Mission.Title: What do you do after work?
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Grace와 퇴근 후 하는 일에 대해 이야기해 보세요. 친구와 저녁 먹으러 가끔 가는 식당에 대해서도 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a chat with your colleague, Grace, about what you do after work. Talk about a restaurant you sometimes go with your friend for dinner.

Task.Q1: Today is almost over.
Task.Q2: It's almost over.
Task.Q3: It's almost 6 p.m.
Task.Guide: Grace에게 일 끝나고 뭐 하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do you} [do] [after work?]
What do you usually do after work?
What do you do when you finish?
What do you do when you leave the office?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what do I do after work?
Task.Key: {What do you do} after work?
Use_Key: What do you do before work?
What do you do in your free time?
What do you do on the weekends?
Use_Guide: 출근 전에 뭐 하는지 물어보세요.
여가 시간에 뭐 하는지 물어보세요.
주말에 뭐 하는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: I usually go straight home.
Task.Q1: Do you also usually go straight home?
Task.Q2: Do you also usually go back home?
Task.Q3: Do you also usally go home?
Task.Guide: 아니라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set: [No], {I don't}.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you don't?

Task.Guide: 자주 친구를 만나서 저녁을 먹는다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I often} [meet a friend] [for dinner].
Well, often I have dinner with a friend.
Well, I meet a friend and have dinner very often.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you often meet a friend for dinner?

Task.Q1: Where do you usually go?
Task.Q2: Where do you eat?
Task.Q3: Where?
Task.Guide: Fabio's Restaurant을 아는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you know} [Fabio's Restaurant?]
Have you heard about Fabio's Restaurant?
Do you know Fabio's?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean do I know Fabio's Restaurant?

Task.Q1: Do you like the place?
Task.Q2: Is it a nice place?
Task.Q3: Good place?
Task.Guide: 음식은 싸고 맛있는데 서비스가 안 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[The food is good and cheap], {but} [the service is terrible].
The food is nice and cheap, but the service is bad.
The food is great and affordable, but the service is terrible.
The food is delicious and reasonable, but the service is bad.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the food is good and cheap but the service is terrible?

Complete.Reaction: Really? Then, I don't want to try there.

Mission.Title: He sings rock.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 미국의 락스타 Bon Jovi의 영상을 보고 있습니다. Bon Jovi를 모르는 친구 Andrew에게 가수를 설명하고,  재즈를 좋아하는 Andrew에게 당신이 자주 가는 재즈바에 같이 가보자고 제안해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are watching a video of Bon Jovi, your favorite singer. Tell your friend Andrew who Bon Jovi is and invite him to the jazz bar that you often go.

Task.Q1: What are you watching?
Task.Q2: Are you watching something?
Task.Q3: Are you watching a video?
Task.Guide: Andrew에게 이 사람이 누구인지 아냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [know] [him?]
Have you seen him before?
Do you know who he is?
You know him, don't you?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying do I know him?

Task.Q1: Who is he?
Task.Q2: Who is that?
Task.Q3: Who?
Task.Guide: 그의 이름은 Bon Jovi이고, 미국의 유명한 가수라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
His name is Bon Jovi. {He is} [a famous singer] [in the USA].
He is Bon Jovi. He is a famous one in the U.S.
He is Bon Jovi who is famous singer in the U.S.
Bon Jovi. He is one of the greatest singer in the U.S.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying his name is Bon Jovi, a famous singer in the U.S.?

Task.Q1: What kind of songs does he sing?
Task.Q2: What is his sector of music?
Task.Q3: What genre does he sing?
Task.Guide: 락(rock) 음악을 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He sings} [rock].
He does rock.
He is a rock star.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he sings rock?

Task.Guide: 락은 내가 제일 좋아하는 음악 스타일이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Rock is} [my favorite style of] [music].
That is my favorite style of music.
Rock is my all time favorite.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying rock is your favorite style of music?
Task.Key: Rock is {my favorite style of} music.
Use_Key: Italian is my favorite style of food.
Hip Hop is my favorite style of dance.
Abstract art is my favorite style of painting.
Use_Guide: 이탈리안이 내가 제일 좋아하는 음식 스타일이라고 말해 보세요.
힙합댄스가 내가 제일 좋아하는 춤 스타일이라고 말해 보세요.
추상화가 내가 제일 좋아하는 그림이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I like Jazz.
Task.Q1: I never listen to rock.
Task.Q2: I don't listen to rock.
Task.Q3: Rock is not my thing.
Task.Guide: 나도 가끔 재즈바에 간다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I sometimes} [go to] [a jazz bar], [too].
I often go to a jazz bar.
I like to go to a jazz bar at times.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you sometimes go to a jazz bar?

Complete.Reaction: You do? Let's go together later.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 기숙사편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 기숙사에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you are living at the dormitory.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"live in ~"}은 "~에 살다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "live in ~" is an expression answering where you are living.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"live in ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "live in ~." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"live in ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "live in ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I live in a share house.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"get along with ~"}은 "~와 잘 지내다"를 의미하는 표현입니다. with 뒤에 관계의 대상 인물을 넣어 말하면 돼요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "get along with ~" is an expression telling your relationship. You can put the name of other people after 'with'.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"get along with ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 표현들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "get along with ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"get along with ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "get along with ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: get along with his younger sister

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"catch up on ~"}은 "~을 따라잡다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "catch up on ~" is an expression telling what you will do.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"catch up on ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "catch up on ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"catch up on ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "catch up on ~."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 유학 생활 중 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used during studying abroad.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "register for ~" is an expression talking whether you sign up the class.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"register for ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"make up for"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"make up for"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "make up for."

make it up for this situation

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"depend on ~"}은 "~에 달려있다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "depend on ~" is an expression you can use telling some results and reasons.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"depend on ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"depend on ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 유학 생활 중 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used during studying abroad.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!

Mission.Title: Where Can I Put This?
Mission.Description_Ko: 이사한 친구 May를 도와 짐을 옮겨주고 있습니다. 가구를 어디에 놓으면 좋을지 이야기 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are helping your friend May with arranging furniture at her new house. Talk to her about where to put it.

Task.Q1: Thank you so much for helping me move.
Task.Q2: Thank you so much for today.
Task.Q3: Thank you for today.
Task.Guide: 언제든지 도울 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm} [always happy] [to help].
I'm always happy to be of help.
I can help out anytime.
No worries.
My pleasure.
You're welcome.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are always happy to help?

Task.Q1: Can you help me move these boxes?
Task.Q2: Can you help me move the boxes?
Task.Q3: Can you help me move this box?
Task.Guide: 이 박스를 어디에 둘 지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Where] [does this box go]}?
Where should I put this box?
Where do you want me to put this box?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean where does this box go?

Task.Q1: It goes to the bedroom.
Task.Q2: Could you put it in the bedroom?
Task.Q3: Please put it in the bedroom.
Task.Guide: 이 테이블도 옮겨주길 원하냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[move] [this table], too? {Do you want me to}
Would you like me to move this table, too?
Do you need me to move this table as well?
I can move this table, if you want.
Should I move this table, too?
I will move this table, if you want me to.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying do I want you to move this table, too?
Task.Key: {Do you want me to} move this table, too?
Use_Key: Do you want me to go with you?
Do you want me to talk to Sam?
Do you want me to come over now?
Use_Guide: 같이 가주길 원하냐고 물어보세요.
샘에게 내가 이야기하길 원하냐고 물어보세요.
내가 지금 그쪽으로 가길 원하냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: That would be really great.
Task.Guide: 어디에 둘 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Sure. {[Where should I] [put it?]}
Where do you want me to put it?
Where does this table go?
Where do you want this table?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying where should you put it?

Task.Q1: I'm not sure.
Task.Q2: I have no idea.
Task.Q3: I don't know.
Task.Guide: 저 의자 사이에 놓는 게 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [it would look good] [between those chairs].
I think between those chairs would be good.
How about between those two chairs?
How about I put it between those two chairs.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you think it would look good between those chairs?

Task.Q1: They would look nice in front of the window.
Task.Q2: Maybe we should put them in front of the window.
Task.Q3: I think they should go by the window.
Task.Guide: 나도 그렇게 생각한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I think so] [too]}.
I agree.
You are right.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you think so too?

Complete.Reaction: Excellent. Let's move it together on three.

Mission.Title: To Do Lists
Mission.Description_Ko: 봄맞이 청소하기 좋은 날입니다. 남편에게 오늘 해야 할 집안 일들을 말해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: It's perfect time for spring cleaning. Please tell your spouse what needs to be done for today.
Mission.Guide_En: The weather seems nice and warm, doesn't it?

Task.Q1: Things are finally starting to warm up.
Task.Q2: It is getting warmer and warmer.
Task.Q3: It is warm now.
Task.Guide: 남편에게 봄맞이 청소하기 딱 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, {perfect time for} [some spring cleaning].
Yeah, and it seems a perfect day for some spring cleaning.
Task.Are_you_saying: Perfect time for some spring cleaning?

Task.Q1: So, what needs to be done again?
Task.Q2: So, what do you need me to do again?
Task.Q3: So, what do I need to do again?

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_당신은 누구인가요? : 가족편

Description.Description_Ko: {당신은 누구인가요? : 가족편} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Who are you : Family"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 당신의 가족 구성원에 대해 이야기해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about your family members.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Who is he?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 나의 아버지입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is my father.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, who is she?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 나의 여자 형제입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is my sister.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그러면 그가 누구인지 말해줄 수 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, can you tell me who he is?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 나의 남자 형제입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is my brother.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Ok. Then who is she?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 나의 할머니입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is my grandmother.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Who is she?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 나의 고모입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is my aunt.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 이 사진 속에 그는 누구인지 말해줄 수 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Can you tell me who is he in this picture?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 나의 사촌입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is my cousin.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 마지막 질문이에요. 저쪽에 있는 연세가 있으신 분은 누구신가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Last question. Who is the old man over there?
Quiz.Guide: {"That old man is"}를 이용해 {"그 연세가 있으신 분은 저희 할아버지이십니다."}라고 말해볼게요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: That old man is my grandfather.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?

작년부터 독일어를 공부했다고 말해 보세요.
