Task.Guide: 연주하는 악기가 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [play] [any instruments?]
Do you play an instrument?
Do you play an instrument too?
How about you? Which instrument do you play?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean do I play any instruments?

Task.Q1: I play the cello.
Task.Q2: I only play the cello.
Task.Q3: The cello.
Task.Guide: 첼로는 정말 어렵다고 들었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I hear} [that’s] [really difficult.]
I hear that's quite hard to play.
I heard the cello is really difficult.
I heard the cello is quite hard to learn.
I heard playing the cello is hard.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you hear that's really difficult?

Task.Q0: I like it, though.
Task.Q1: I’ve been playing since I was in high school.
Task.Q2: I've played it since I was in high school.
Task.Q3: I started in high school.
Task.Guide: 너의 연주를 꼭 한번 듣고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’d love to} [hear you play] [sometime].
I'd love to hear your performance sometime.
I'd love to see you perform sometime.
I would like to see you play from time to time.
I would like to see your performance one day.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd love to hear me play sometime?

Task.Q0: Well
Task.Q1: I have a concert next week.
Task.Q2: I am holding a concert next week.
Task.Q3: My concert is next week.
Task.Guide: 더 자세하게 말해 달라고 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You’ll have to} [tell me] [the details].
You'll have to tell me more in detail.
Please tell me about it.
Give me more information.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I'll have to tell you the details?

Complete.Reaction: Let me send you a brochure.

Mission.Title: My New Wardrobe
Mission.Description_Ko: 새 옷을 사러 간 당신. 점원에게 신상품이 어디에 있는지 묻고, 필요한 청바지를 구매해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are shopping for some new jeans. Ask the clerk where the new arrivals are and ask for help to buy a pair of jeans.

Task.Q1: How may I help you?
Task.Q2: How can I help?
Task.Q3: Can I help?
Task.Guide: 신상품들이 어디에 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Where] [are the new arrivals?]}
Can you point me to the new arrivals?
Can you show me where the new arrivals are?
Can you direct me to the new arrivals?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying where are the new arrivals?
Task.Key: {Where are the new arrivals?}
Use_Key: What are the new arrivals?
What are the best sellers?
What are on sale?
Use_Guide: 어떤 게 신상품인지 물어보세요.
어떤 게 베스트 셀러인지 물어보세요.
어떤 게 할인 중인지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: We have a lot of items on sale today for our seasonal clearance.
Task.Q2: We have many items for seasonal clearance sale today.
Task.Q3: We have many things on sale today.
Task.Guide: 사실 오늘은 청바지를 사러 왔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Actually, {I'm just looking for} [some jeans] [today].
Actually, I'm only looking for jeans today.
Actually, I only need to get some jeans today.
I'm only shopping for some jeans today, actually.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're just looking for some jeans today?

Task.Q1: We have a large selection over here.
Task.Q2: We have a great selection.
Task.Q3: We have many goods.
Task.Guide: 이 청바지가 마음에 든다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I really like] [these]}.
I like these a lot.
I really love these.
I adore these a lot.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you really like these?

Task.Guide: 근데 한 사이즈가 커야 할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
But {I think} [I need] [a size up].
But I think I need a bigger pair.
They seem too small for me.
I'm afraid I might not fit in.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think you need a size up?

Task.Q0: I'll see what we have in the back.
Task.Q1: Would you like me to open a fitting room for you?
Task.Q2: Do you need me to open a fitting room?
Task.Q3: Do you want a fitting room?
Task.Guide: 감사 인사 후 (많이 들어서) 팔이 이미 아프다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Yes, thanks]. {[My arms are getting tired already!]}
Yes, thank you. My arms were hurting.
Great, thank you. My arms were killing me.
Perfect, thanks. I don't think my arms can take more now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your arms are getting tired already?

Complete.Reaction: Sure. It's room 6 when you're ready.

content_name: Is there an Internet café near here?

Mission.Title: Is there an Internet café near here?
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 급하게 컴퓨터와 현금이 필요합니다. 길 가는 사람에게 근처에 PC방과 현금인출기가 있는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You urgently need a computer and some cash at the moment. Ask a stranger on the street for help.

Task.Q1: May I help you?
Task.Q2: Can I help you?
Task.Q3: Do you need a help?
Task.Guide: 이 근처에 pc방이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is there} [an Internet cafe] [near here?]
I'm looking for an Internet cafe near here.
I need to go to an Internet cafe near here.
Could you let me know where an internet cafe is near here?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying is there an Internet cafe near here?
Task.Key: {Is there} an Internet cafe near here?
Use_Key: Is there a convenient store near here?
Is there a pharmacy near here?
Is there a shoe store near here?
Use_Guide: 근처에 편의점이 있는지 물어보세요.
근처에 약국이 있는지 물어보세요.
근처에 신발가게가 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: There is one on Main Street across from the big department store.
Task.Q1: It's right up this street.
Task.Q2: You can find it right up this street.
Task.Q3: Go right up this street.
Task.Guide: 감사 인사를 하고 근처에 현금 인출기가 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Thanks, and {are there} [any ATM] [around here?]
Thank you. Is there a cash machine near here, too?
Thanks. Also, any cash machines around here?
Thanks. Any ATMs around here?
Thanks you. Also, I was wondering if there is any ATM around here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying are there any cash machines around here?

Task.Q1: Yeah, there are some ATMs over there outside the bank.
Task.Q2: Yeah, there are some outside the bank over there.
Task.Q3: Yeah, over there. Outside the bank.
Task.Guide: ATM이 몇 시에 닫냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What time} [does it] [close?]
Do you know what time it closes?
What time do they close?
Until what time is it open?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what time it closes?

Task.Reaction: It closes at five in the evening.
Task.Q1: I think you should get going.
Task.Q2: Why don't you go to the ATM first?
Task.Q3: Maybe you'd better get going.
Task.Guide: 감사 인사를 하세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Thank you}.
Thank you very much.
Thanks a lot.
I appreciate you for your help.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you appreciate for my help?

Complete.Reaction: Sure thing. Bye for now.

Mission.Title: I like to go camping
Mission.Description_Ko: Angela에게 주말 계획과 캠핑 활동에 대해 말해 보세요. 캠핑할 때 하는 낚시에 대해서도 이야기해 보세요. 어떤 종류의 물고기를 주로 잡는지 말하고, 다음에 잡아다 주겠다고도 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Discuss with Angela your weekend plans and camping activities. Talk about what kind of fish you catch when camping, and offer to bring fish back next time you return.

Task.Q1: What do you usually do on the weekend?
Task.Q2: What do you normally do on weekends?
Task.Q3: How do you spend weekends?
Task.Guide: 쉴 때 캠핑 가는 것을 좋아한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I like to} [go camping] [in my free time].
I like to go camping when I have time.
I like to camp when I am free.
I go camping in my spare time.
I camp when I can.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you like to go camping in your free time?
Task.Key: I {like to go} camping in my free time.
Use_Key: I like to go water-skiing in Summer.
He likes to be in the center of attention.
Would you like to drink coffee?
Use_Guide: 나는 여름에 수상스키 타는 것을 좋아한다고 말해 보세요.
그는 주목 받는 것을 좋아한다고 말해보세요.
커피를 마시고 싶은지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: Sounds fun!
Task.Q1: What do you do when you camp?
Task.Q2: What do you do when camping?
Task.Q3: What do you do?
Task.Guide: 보통 낚시나 수영하러 간다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I {usually} [go fishing or swimming].
I usually fish and swim.
I normally go fishing or swimming or both.
I normally fish and swim as well.
I often fish or swim or do both.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you usually go fishing or swimming?

Task.Q0: I've never done it before.
Task.Q1: What kind of fish do you catch?
Task.Q2: What are some fish that you catch?
Task.Q3: Catch any fish?
Task.Guide: 무지개 송어(rainbow trout)를 먹어봤는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Have you ever} [tried] [rainbow trout?]
Have you eaten rainbow trout?
Have you had rainbow trout before?
Usually rainbow trout. Have you had it before?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have tried rainbow trout?

Task.Q1: I tried it on vacation once. It was delicious.
Task.Q2: I tried it once on vacation. It was tasty.
Task.Q3: Yes. It was good.
Task.Guide: 다음에 무지개 송어를 잡아 가져다 주겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’ll} [bring you some] [the next time I go].
I'll bring some back to you next time I go.
Next time, I will bring some back to you.
Next time I return, I will bring some back for you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll bring me some the next time you go?

Complete.Reaction: Thanks! I'll look forward to it.

Mission.Title: 跟朋友聊天
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구가 노동절에 어디 갈 계획이 있냐고 물어봅니다. 친구와 함께 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: 朋友问你在劳动节打算去哪儿，请和你的朋友一起聊聊吧。

Task.Q1:
劳动节你打算去哪儿？
 Láodòngjié nǐdǎsuàn qù nǎr?
Task.Q2:
劳动节你要去哪儿？
 Láodòngjié nǐyào qù nǎr?
Task.Q3:
劳动节你去哪儿？
 Láodòngjié nǐqù nǎr?
Task.Guide: 한국에 갈 거라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
我要回国。
我要回韩国。
我打算回国。
我打算回韩国。

Task.Q1:
那太好了，不过机票不是很贵吗？
 Nà tài hǎo le, búguò jīpiào búshì hěn guì ma?
Task.Q2:
太好了，不过现在机票应该很贵呀。
 Tài hǎo le, búguò xiànzài jīpiào yīnggāi hěn guì ya.
Task.Q3:
是吗？不过现在买票的话不贵吗？
 Shì ma? búguò xiànzài mǎi piào dehuà bú guì ma?
Task.Guide: 당연히 비싸지만 이미 사놓았다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
当然很贵，但我已经买票了。
当然很贵，但我已经买好票了。
当然贵呀，不过我已经买好票了。

Task.Q1: 你要坐多长时间的飞机？Nǐyào zuòduōchángshíjiān de fēijī?
Task.Q2:
到韩国要坐多长时间的飞机？
 Dào Hánguó yào zuò duōchángshíjiān de fēijī?
Task.Q3: 坐多长时间的飞机？Zuòduōcháng shíjiān de fēijī?
Task.Guide: 대략 두 시간 반 정도면 도착한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
大概两个半小时就能到。
大概需要两个半小时。
大概两个半小时。
 大概要坐两个半小时。
 大概两个小时三十分钟就能到。

Task.Reaction:
还挺近的嘛。
Hái tǐng jìn de ma.
Task.Q1:
你晕飞机吗？
Nǐ yūn fēijī ma?
Task.Q2:
晕机吗？
Yūnjīma?
Task.Q3:
你会晕机吗？
Nǐhuì yūnjī ma?
Task.Guide: 멀미를 한다고, 하지만 미리 약을 먹으면 괜찮다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
我晕机，不过提前吃个药就没事。
我晕机，不过登机前吃个药就没事。
我晕机，但是吃个药就没事了。

Complete.Reaction: 那你不要忘吃药了

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_해외에서 살아남기 : 은행편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 은행에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use in the bank.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"open/close an account"}은 "계좌를 개설하다/해지하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "open/close an account" is an expression for opening a new account in the bank.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"open/close an account"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "open/close an account." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"open/close an account"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "open/close an account."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"withdraw A from B"}는 "B에서 A를 인출하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "withdraw A from B" is an expression to withdraw money from your account.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"withdraw A from B"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "withdraw A from B."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"withdraw A from B"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "withdraw A from B."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: withdraw $250 in check from my account

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"issue"}는 "발급하다, 발행하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다. 발급하려는 대상을 뒤에 넣어 말하면 돼요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "issue" is an expression you can use when you make a new card. Put the name of the card you want to make after 'issue'.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"issue"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "issue."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"issue"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the "issue."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: withdraw $250 in check from my account

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 은행에서 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used at the bank.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_해외에서 살아남기 : 집구하기편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 집을 구할 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you find the house.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: "I'm interested in ~"은 "저는 ~에 관심이 있습니다."를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I'm interested in ~" is an expression telling what you are interested in.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I'm interested in ~"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "I'm interested in ~."  Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"I'm interested in ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "I'm interested in ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I'm interested in buying a studio.
I'm interested in listening to classical music.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How long does it take ~?"}은 "~하는 데 얼마나 걸리나요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "How long does it take ~?" is an expression asking the required time to do something.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How long does it take ~?"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "How long does it take ~?"

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"How long does it take ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "How long does it take ~?"

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 가장 가까운 대중교통 정류장까지 얼마나 걸리나요?
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: How long does it take to the nearest public transportation?
How long does it take to get downtown?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Is it possible to ~?"}은 "~하는 것이 가능한가요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "Is it possible to ~?" is an expression asking possibility.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Is it possible to ~?"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "Is it possible to ~?."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: share a studio with my friend
get to the subway station by walk

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"Is it possible to ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "Is it possible to ~?."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 원룸을 친구와 함께 사용하는 것도 가능한가요?
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Is it possible to share a studio with my friend?
Is it possible to get to the subway station on foot?

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"원룸을 사는 것"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"원룸을 사는 것에 관심이 있습니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I'm interested in buying a studio.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"가장 가까운 대중교통 정류장"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"가장 가까운 대중교통 정류장까지 얼마나 걸리나요?"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: How long does it take to the nearest public transportation?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: get to the subway station by walk

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"지하철역까지 걸어서 갈 수 있나요?"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Is it possible to get to the subway station by walk?

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 집을 구할 때 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used when you are finding a studio.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

Mission.Title: What's your name?
Mission.Description_Ko: 외국인들과 함께 하는 영어 스터디 모임에 갔습니다. 새 친구의 이름과 국적을 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You went to a English study club. Ask a new friend's name and nationality.

Task.Guide: 이름을 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What is} [your name?]
Can I ask your name?
May I have your name?
I didn't catch your name.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what is my name?

Task.Q1: It's James.
Task.Q2: My name is James.
Task.Q3: James.
Task.Guide: 만나서 반갑다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It is} [nice to meet you].
It's good to meet you.
I'm glad to meet you.

Task.Q1: Are you from Korea?
Task.Q2: Are you Korean?
Task.Q3: Korean?
Task.Guide: 맞다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Yes], {I am}.
I am from Korea.
I am a Korean.
Yes.

Task.Guide: 어느 나라 사람이냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Where] {are you} [from?]
Which country are you from?
Where were you born?
Where did you grow up?
What's your nationality?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying where am I from?

Task.Q1: Are you from Seoul?
Task.Q2: Did you grow up in Seoul?
Task.Q3: Is Seoul your hometown?
Task.Guide: 지금은 서울에 살지만 부산에서 태어났다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I live in Seoul now] {but} [I was born in Busan].
I'm originally from Busan. I moved to Seoul.
I was born in Busan but now I live in Seoul.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you live in Seoul now but you were born in Busan?
Task.Key: I live in Seoul now {but} I was born in Busan.
Use_Key: I live in Seoul now but I was born in New York.
I studied Literature but I work in marketing now.
I moved to Jeju last month but I am moving back to Seoul next month.
Use_Guide: 지금은 서울에 살지만 뉴욕에서 태어났다고 말해 보세요.
문학을 공부했지만 지금은 마케팅 일을 한다고 말해 보세요.
지난달에 제주도로 이사왔지만 다음달에 다시 서울로 이사간다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [moved to Seoul last month], [moving back to Busan next month]

Complete.Reaction: Oh, I've heard that Busan is such a beautiful place.

content_name: Would you like to watch a movie?

Mission.Title: Would you like to watch a movie?
Mission.Description_Ko: 저녁을 먹고 영화를 보자 동료 Patrick의 제안에, 영화는 볼 수 있는데 바빠서 저녁은 먹지 못한다고 답해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Listen as Patrick asks you to watch a movie and have dinner with him. Respond by saying that you cannot have dinner because you are too busy with work.

Task.Q1: If you have time, would you like to watch a movie tonight?
Task.Q2: If you are free tonight, would you like to watch a movie?
Task.Q3: Want to watch a movie tonight?
Task.Guide: 재미있겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That sounds like fun]}.
Sounds fun.

Task.Guide: 언제 출발할 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{When} [are you going?]
When do you plan on going?
When do you want to go?
When are you leaving?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking when I'm going?

Task.Q0: The movie starts at 8 but,
Task.Q1: I’m meeting Sam for dinner first. Do you want to join us?
Task.Q2: I will meet Sam for dinner beforehand. Do you want to join?
Task.Q3: I'm having dinner with Sam first. Want to join?
Task.Guide: 끝내야 할 일이 너무 많다고 말해 보세요. 내야 할 일이 너무 많다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I [have a lot of work] {to} [finish].
I'm sorry, but I have so much work to get done.
I apologize, but I am too busy.
I apologize, but I cannot due to too much work.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have a lot of work to finish?

Task.Guide: 영화는 볼 수 있을 거 같은데 저녁은 먹을 수 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I {might} [be able to make the movie], [but not dinner].
I may be able to do the movie, but not dinner.
I can make the movie, but not dinner.
I can watch the movie, but not have dinner together.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you might be able to make the movie, but not dinner?
Task.Key: I {might be able to} make the movie, but not dinner.
Use_Key: I might be able to finish the project by tomorrow, but not today
I might be able to have lunch with you, if you don't hurry.
She might be able to recommend you for the position.
Use_Guide: 이 프로젝트를 내일까지는 끝낼 수 있겠지만 오늘까지는 안 된다고 말해 보세요.
네가 바쁘지 않으면, 너와 점심을 먹을 수 있을 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
그녀가 그 포지션에 너를 추천해 줄 수 있을지도 모른다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [have lunch with you], [if you don't hurry]

Task.Q1: Just let me know later.
Task.Q2: Let me know more later.
Task.Q3: Tell me later.
Task.Guide: 알겠다고, 점심 맛있게 먹으라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Okay. {[Have a nice lunch]}.
Okay. Have a good meal.
I will. You go have lunch now.
I will. You should have lunch now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying have a nice lunch?

Complete.Reaction: Yeah have a nice lunch too.

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_당신은 어디에서 왔나요?

Description.Description_Ko: {"당신은 어디에서 왔나요?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Where are you from?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 출신지에 대해 이야기해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about where people came from.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you from?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am from"}을 이용해 {"저는 브라질에서 왔어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am from Brazil.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is your nationality?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am"}을 이용해 {"저는 한국인입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am Korean.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you from?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am from"}을 이용해 {"저는 중국에서 왔어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am from China.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is your nationality?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am"}을 이용해 {"저는 포르투갈인입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am Portuguese.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you from?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am from"}을 이용해 {"저는 태국에서 왔어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am from Thailand.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is your nationality?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am"}을 이용해 {"저는 그리스인입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am Greek.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그는 어디 출신이신가요? (그는 어느 나라에서 왔나요?)
Quiz.Quiz_En: What is his nationality?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용하여 {"그는 미국인입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is an American.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_이건 뭘까요? : 우리집편

Description.Description_Ko: {"이건 뭘까요? : 우리집편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"What is this? : Home"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우리 집에 있는 물건들에 대해 이야기해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about things in your home.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"fireplace"}를 이용해 {"이것은 벽난로야."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a fireplace.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, what is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"video game console"}를 이용해 {"이것은 내 게임기야."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is my video game console.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 제가 책상에서 무엇을 할 수 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: What can I do on the desk?
Quiz.Guide: {"do your homework"}를 이용해 {"네가 원하면 책상에서 숙제를 할 수 있어."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
You can do your homework on the desk if you'd like.
You can do your homework on the desk if you want.

Quiz.Quiz_En: There are so many books on the bookshelf!
Quiz.Guide: {"read you a short story"}를 이용해 {"너에게 짧은 이야기(책)를 읽어줄까?"}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Do you want me to read you a short story?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 옷장에 옷이 가득 찼네요! 그것들 중 몇몇은 편해보여요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: The wardrobe is full of clothes! Some of them look comfortable.
Quiz.Guide: {"slip into something"}을 이용해 {"더 편한 옷으로 갈아입고 싶어?"}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Would you like to slip into something more comfortable?

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this place?
Quiz.Guide: {"bathroom"}을 이용해 {"여기는 화장실이야."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is the bathroom.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Is that a swimming pool? It looks so nice!
Quiz.Guide: {"go for a swim"}을 이용해 {"수영하러 가고 싶어?"}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Would you like to go for a swim?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Is this a garage? It's very huge.
Quiz.Guide: {"stay clear"}를 이용해 {"조심해, 차 근처에 있지 마."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Be careful, stay clear of the car.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_이 신체부위는 무엇인가요?

Description.Description_Ko: {"What Is This Body Part?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"What is this body part?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 여러 신체 부위 표현들을 말해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's name some body parts.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 팔입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is an arm.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 무릎입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is a knee.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, what is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"These are"}를 이용해 {"이것은 발가락입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: These are toes.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 팔꿈치입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is an elbow.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"These are"}를 이용해 {"이것은 손가락입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: These are fingers.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 어깨입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is a shoulder.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this body part?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 배입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is the stomach.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

content_name: I'm ready for the dessert menu

Mission.Title: I'm ready for the dessert menu
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 스테이크를 다 먹고, 디저트를 주문하려고 합니다. 원하는 디저트를 주문해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You just finished your steak and now want to order a dessert. Order what you want for dessert.
Mission.Guide_En: Hi, the steak was really delicious.

Task.Q0: I'm glad that you liked it.
Task.Q1: Is there anything else I can get for you?
Task.Q2: Is there anything I can serve you?
Task.Q3: Can I get you anything?
Task.Guide: 디저트를 먹을 준비가 됐다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {I’m ready for} [the dessert menu].
Yes, I'm ready for desserts now.
Yes, I can eat deserts now.
Yes. Can I have desets?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are ready for the dessert menu?

Task.Q0: Here you are.
Task.Guide: 커피와 케이크 한 조각을 주문해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Please} [bring me] [some coffee and a piece of cake].
Could you bring me some coffee and a piece of cake?
Would you bring me a cup of coffee and a piece of cake?
I'd like to have a cup of coffee and a piece of cake.
Can I have some coffee and a piece of cake?
Please bring me some coffee and a piece of cake.
Could you get me some coffee and a piece of cake?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I could bring you some coffee and a piece of cake?
Task.Key: {Please bring me} some coffee and a piece of cake.
Use_Key: Please bring me the things I will need.
Please let him or her know about it.
Please do not bother them now.
Use_Guide: 내가 필요한 것을 가져다 주라고 말해보세요.
그/그녀에게 그것에 대해 알려주라고 말해보세요.
지금 그들을 방해하지 말라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: Here you are.
Task.Q2: As you asked, here is one of each
Task.Q3: Help yourself.
Task.Guide: 케이크가 완전 맛있었다고 극찬해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That cake is amazing!]}
The cake is delicious!
The cake is so good!
Oh my goodness, the cake is great!
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying this cake is amazing?

Task.Q1: Here you are.
Task.Q2: As you asked, here is one of each
Task.Q3: Help yourself.
Task.Guide: 한 조각을 더 포장하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’d like to} [order another piece] [to go].
I'd like another piece to go.
I'd like another one to go please.
Please get me another one to go.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you'd like to order another piece to go?

Task.Q1: I’ll get that ready for you.
Task.Q2: I'll get it ready now.
Task.Q3: Sure thing.
Task.Guide: 계산서도 요청해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Also, {please} [bring me] [the bill].
Oh and don't forget to bring the bill.
Please don't forget the bill.
Please bring the bill too.

Complete.Reaction: Sure wait just a minute.

Mission.Title: Could I get a sandwich?
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 식당에서 식사 주문을 하고 있습니다. 치킨 샐러드 샌드위치와 버섯 스프를 주문해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are ordering a meal at a restaurant now. Order a chicken salad sandwich and a mushroom soup for yourself.

Task.Q1: Are you ready to order?
Task.Q2: Do you want to order?
Task.Q3: Order now?
Task.Guide: 치킨 샐러드 샌드위치를 주문해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could I get} [a chicken salad sandwich?]
Could I have a chicken salad sandwich please?
Can I order a chicken salad sandwich?
Yes, I would like to order one chicken salad sandwich.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if you could get a chicken salad sandwich?
Task.Key: {Could I} get a chicken salad sandwich?
Use_Key: Could I borrow a pen?
Could I leave early today?
Could I ask you the time?
Use_Guide: 펜을 하나 빌릴 수 있는지 물어보세요.
오늘 일찍 갈 수 있는지 물어보세요.
몇 시인지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Would you like any sides?
Task.Q2: Would you like any side dishes to go with that?
Task.Q3: Anything else?
Task.Guide: 가볍게 먹고 싶다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I {want to} [eat something light].
I want something light.
I want to eat light.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you want to eat something light?

Task.Guide: 버섯 스프(mushroom soup)가 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [have] [mushroom soup?]
Can I have a mushroom soup?
Maybe a mushroom soup. Do you have one?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean do I have mushroom soup?

Task.Q1: I will bring you one.
Task.Q2: Let me bring you one.
Task.Q3: Please wait.
Task.Guide: 물도 더 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} also [refill] [my water?]
Would you refill my water, too?
Could you please you refill my water?
Could I I have more water?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying if I can refill your water, too?

Task.Q1: I’ll bring it right to you.
Task.Q2: I will bring it right now.
Task.Q3: Give me a second.
Task.Guide: 감사 인사를 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Thank you.
Thank you so much.
Thanks a lot.
{[Thanks I really appreciate it]}.

Complete.Reaction: No problem. It's my pleasure.

content_name: You have to know life is not easy.

Mission.Title: You have to know life is not easy.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 친구 Tony가 새로 시작한 일이 힘들다고 이야기합니다. 이야기를 잘 들어주고 위로와 응원을 해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Tony is saying he has found his new job difficult. Listen to his story and cheer him up.

Task.Q1: You look great today.
Task.Q2: You look good today.
Task.Q3: You look good.
Task.Guide: Tony에게 새 직장은 어떤지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How is} [your new job?]
How are things going at work?
Are your new colleagues treating you well?
Do you like your new job?
Are you happy with your new job?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean how is my new job?

Task.Q1: It is hard work. I'm so tired.
Task.Q2: It is hard and I'm tired.
Task.Q3: Hard.
Task.Guide: 정말 쉬운 게 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[You know], {life is [not easy]}.
Now you see that life is not easy.
I guess that's why people say life is not easy.
Life is really not easy, isn't it?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying life is not easy?

Task.Q1: How about yours?
Task.Q2: What about your job?
Task.Q3: How is your job?
Task.Guide: 힘들지만 내 일이 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[It's also hard] {but} [I like my job a lot].
Not easy but I think I love my job.
Hard but I'm happy with my job.
I can't complain because I like what I do.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's also hard but you like your job a lot?

Task.Q0: Good for you.
Task.Q1: My job is not very interesting.
Task.Q2: I don't think my job is fun.
Task.Q3: I don't like my job.
Task.Guide: 시간을 두고 지켜보라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Take your time]}.
Let's see.
Don't say it yet.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I have to take my time?

Task.Guide: 좋아하게 될 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You will} [become] [interested].
You will feel interested soon.
It takes time to become interested.
As time goes by, you will love it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I will become interested?
Task.Key: {You will become} interested.
Use_Key: You will become worried.
You will become relieved.
You will become annoyed.
Use_Guide: 걱정하게 될 거라고 말해 보세요.
안심하게 될 거라고 말해 보세요.
짜증나게 될 거라고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: I hope so. Anyway, thanks for cheering me up.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_길 물어보기

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 길을 물어볼 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression asking way to your destinations.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Where is ~?}"은 "~는 어디에 있나요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "Where is ~?" is an expression asking way to your destinations.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Where is ~?"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can be used with "Where is ~?" Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"Where is ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "Where is ~?"

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Where is The Statue of Liberty?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn some other expressions that you can use in a dialogue.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How can I get to ~?"}은 "~로 어떻게 가나요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "How can I get to ~?" is an expression asking way to your destinations.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How can I get to ~?"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can be used with "How can I get to ~?"

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"How can I get to ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "How can I get to ~?"

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: How can I get to Niagara Falls?
How can I get to the convenience store?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 길을 물어보는 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used for asking direction.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Is this the right way to ~?"}은 "여기가 ~로 가는 길이 맞나요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "Is this the right way to ~? " is an expression asking way to your destinations.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Is this the right way to ~?"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can come after "Is this the right way to ~?"

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"Is this the right way to ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "Is this the right way to ~?"

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 이 길이 멀라이언 파크로 가는 길이 맞나요?
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Is this the right way to Merlion Park?

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 이 길이 센트럴 파크로 가는 길인가요?
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Is this the right way to Central Park?

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you can remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Where is The Statue of Liberty?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: How can I get to the convenience store?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"여기가 ~로 가는 길이 맞나요?"}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Is this the right way to ~?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"이 길이 센트럴 파크로 가는 길이 맞나요?"}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Is this the right way to Central Park?

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 길을 물어보는 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that you can use to ask direction.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_길 안내하기

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 길을 안내할 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression telling the way to the destination.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"next to"}는 "~옆에"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "next to" is an expression telling the way to the destination.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"next to"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can be used with "next to." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"next to"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "next to."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn other expressions that you can use in dialogues.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"opposite"}은 "~맞은 편에"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "opposite" is an expression telling the way to the destination.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"opposite"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can be used with "opposite."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"opposite"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "opposite."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 길을 안내하는 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used for giving direction.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"between"}은 "사이에"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.Preview_BG_Description_En: "between" is an expression telling the way to the destination.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"between"}과 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can be used with "between."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"between"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "between."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: between the public library and the pharmacy

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you can remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"공립 도서관과 약국 사이에"}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: between the public library and the pharmacy

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 길을 안내하는 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that you can use to give direction.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

content_name: Could you help me move my desk?

Mission.Title: Could you help me move my desk?
Mission.Description_Ko: 오늘 당신은 집의 가구를 다시 배치하고 있습니다. 당신을 도와주는 친구 Sam에게 책상을 옮겨 달라고 부탁해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are rearranging your furniture today and your friend Sam is helping you. Ask Sam to move your desk to where you want it to be.
Mission.Guide_En: Sam, thank you for helping me today.

Task.Q0: I'm happy to be a help.
Task.Q1: Where should this desk be placed?
Task.Q2: Where should I put this desk?
Task.Q3: Where to put this desk?
Task.Guide: 방 안에 놓아야 한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It goes in] [the bedroom]}.
It can go in the bedroom.
It can be put in the bedroom.
It can be placed in the bedroom.
You can put it in the bedroom.
You can place it in the bedroom.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it goes in the bedroom?

Task.Q0: Let me see.
Task.Q1: Should I put it right between your bed and the window?
Task.Q2: Should I put it between the bed and the window?
Task.Q3: Move it next to the bed and the window?
Task.Guide: 문 옆에 놓는 게 좋겠다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [by the door] is [better].
I think it's better to put it by the door.
I think putting it by the door is better.
it should go near the door.
You should place it somewhere by the door.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you think by the door is better?

Task.Q0: I'll put it over there.
Task.Guide: 근데 놓고 보니 공간이 부족해 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It looks} [a little crowded].
It looks a bit crowded.
It's too crowded now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it looks a little crowded?

Task.Q0: I agree.
Task.Guide: 다른곳에 다시 놓아줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [help me move it] [again?]
Can you move it again?
Move it again please.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I could help you move it again?

Task.Q0: No problem.
Task.Q1: Where would you like it?
Task.Q2: Where would you like to put it?
Task.Q3: Where do you want it?
Task.Guide: 침대와 창문 사이에 놓고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'd like to} [put it] [between the bed and the window].
How about between the bed and the window?
I want to put it between the bed and the window.
I think between the bed and the window would be nice.
Could you place it between the bed and the window.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd like to put it between the bed and the window?
Task.Key: {Where would you like} it?
Use_Key: Where would you like to place this vase?
Where would you like to go?
Would you like to eat out tonight?
Use_Guide: 이 꽃병을 어디에 놓고 싶은지 물어보세요.
어디로 가고 싶은지 물어보세요.
오늘밤 외식하고 싶은지 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Sure. Let me move it there.

content_name: Introducing yourself to a new neighbor

Mission.Title: Introducing yourself to a new neighbor
Mission.Description_Ko: 최근에 이사한 당신. 이사 간 새 동네의 이웃 Mary와 이야기해 보세요. 워싱턴에서 이사왔다고 말하고, 이 동네에서 오래 살았는지에 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You just moved into a new neighborhood. Talk to your new neighbor, Mary, about where you are from and how long she has lived here.

Task.Q0: I'm Mary.
Task.Guide: 나는 당신의 새로운 이웃 John 이라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Hi, I am John, your neighbor.
Hi there. I am John, your new neighbor.
Hello. My name is John, your new neighbor.
Hello. My name is John, and I am your new neighbor.

Task.Q0: Nice to meet you.
Task.Q1: Are you new to this area?
Task.Q2: Are you a new neighbor?
Task.Q3: You moved here?
Task.Guide: 워싱턴에서 가족과 함께 이사왔다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {[my family moved here] [from Washington]}.
Yes, my family and I came from Washington.
Yes, our family moved here from Washington.
Yes, I came with my family. We are from Washington.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your family moved here from Washington?

Task.Q1: {I'm from} [Washington] [too!]
Task.Q2: I'm also from Washington!
Task.Q3: Me too!
Task.Guide: Mary에게 여기서 오래 살았는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Have you} [lived here] [a long time?]
Have you been here for long?
How long have you lived here?
How long has it been since you first arrived?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have lived here a long time?
Task.Key: {Have you lived} here a long time?
Use_Key: Have you resided there for long?
Have you been around the neighborhood?
Have you visited that place?
Use_Guide: 거기에 오래 있었는지 물어보세요.
동네를 둘러봤는지 물어보세요.
그곳을 방문해 봤는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Only for a year, but feel free to ask for my help!
Task.Q2: Just a year, but you can ask me for help anytime!
Task.Q3: Only a year, but I can always help.
Task.Guide: 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Thanks,] [I appreciate it]}.
Thank you. I appreciate it very much.
That's very kind of you, thanks.
I will. Thank you for your kind gesture.
I will. Thank you in advance for your offer.

Complete.Reaction: You're welcome. I'm glad that I have a neighbor like you now.

Mission.Title: Thank you for the invitation
Mission.Description_Ko: 어젯밤 초대된 파티에 대해 칭찬을 하는 당신. Claire에게 파티가 즐거웠고, 음식도 맛있었으며, 완벽했다고 말해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are praising a party that you were invited to last night. Tell Claire that the party was fun, the food was great, and it was perfect overall.

Task.Q0: It was nice seeing you last night.
Task.Guide: Claire에게 나도 봐서 좋았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Nice seeing you too]}.
Nice seeing you as well.
It was nice seeing you too.
It was nice seeing you as well. Thanks for inviting me.

Task.Guide: 초대해줘서 고맙다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Thank you for} [the invitation].
Thanks for inviting me.
Thank you for the invitation.
Thanks for inviting me.

Task.Q0: I was very happy that you came.
Task.Q1: What did you think of the party?
Task.Q2: How did you like the party?
Task.Q3: How was the party?
Task.Guide: 원래 큰 파티는 싫어하지만 당신의 파티는 즐거웠다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Normally, I dislike big parties], {but} [yours was very fun].
Usually, I don't like big parties, but yours was very enjoyable.
I normally do not like big parties, but yours was very fun.
I usually do not like big parties, but yours was very enjoyable.
I dislike big parties, but last night was very entertaining.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you normally dislike big parties but mine was very fun?

Task.Q0: That's good to hear.
Task.Q1: I also made the food myself.
Task.Q2: The food was my work too.
Task.Q3: I made the food too.
Task.Guide: 치킨도 직접 만들었는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Did you} [make the chicken] [too?]
Did you cook the chicken as well?
Did you also prepare the chicken?
Who made the chicken?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I made the chicken too?
Task.Key: {Did you make} the chicken too?
Use_Key: Did you make this yourself?
Did she know about this too?
Did they come to the party?
Use_Guide: 이것을 혼자 만들었는지 물어보세요.
그녀도 이것에 대해 알았는지 물어보세요.
그들이 파티에 왔는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Did you enjoy it?
Task.Q2: Did you find it enjoyable?
Task.Q3: Enjoy it?
Task.Guide: 치킨이 완벽했다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It was perfect!]}
It was so delicious!
It was the best chicken ever.
It could not have been better.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it was perfect?

Complete.Reaction: That is a relief. I was a bit worried about it, actually.

Mission.Title: What a nice apartment!
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Hillary의 집에 초대 받은 당신, 가서 집에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are invited to your friend, Hillary's apartment. Talk to your friend about it.
Mission.Guide_En: Hillary, thank you for inviting me.

Task.Q1: Make yourself comfortable.
Task.Q2: Make yourself at home.
Task.Q3: Feel at home.
Task.Guide: Hillary에게 아파트가 좋다고 말해 보세요.
