Use_Guide: 그것은 오후까지 완료될 것이다라고 말해보세요.
네 소포는 크리스마스 전에 도착할 거라고 말해 보세요.
톰은 다음해에 열살이 될 거라고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Great! Thank you for washing it for me again.

Mission.Title: How was your weekend?
Mission.Description_Ko: 월요일 아침! 친구 Harry와 주말에 한 일에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: It's Moday! Talk to your friend, Harry, about what you guys did over the weekend.

Task.Q1: It's Monday, again.
Task.Q2: How's your Monday going?
Task.Q3: It's Monday!
Task.Guide: Harry에게 주말 잘 보냈는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How was} [your weekend?]
How did you spend your weekend?
What did you do on weekend?
Could you tell me how your weekend was?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you ask how was my weekend?

Task.Q1: Gina and I went biking in the park.
Task.Q2: Gina and I rode a bike in the park.
Task.Q3: Gina and I went to the park to ride a bike.
Task.Guide: 재미있었겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That must have been} [fun] [for you guys].
You guys must have had so much fun.
It sounds you guys had fun.
I know you guys had fun.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that must have been fun for us?
Task.Key: That {must have been} fun for you.
Use_Key: That must have been surprising for you.
That must have been sad for your friend.
That must have been surprising for you.
Use_Guide: 너에게 놀라운 일이었겠다고 말해 보세요.
당신의 친구에게 슬픈 일이었겠다고 말해 보세요.
당신에게 흥미로운 일이었겠다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: It was really fun.
Task.Q1: But there were lots of hills.
Task.Q2: But there were a lot of hills.
Task.Q3: But there were many hills.
Task.Guide: 오늘 피곤하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You must be} [tired] [today].
You are tired today, aren't you?
I think you must be tired today.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think I must be tired today?

Task.Q1: How did you spend your weekend?
Task.Q2: How was your weekend?
Task.Q3: How was yours?
Task.Guide: 친구 생일 파티에 다녀왔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I went} [to my friend's birthday party].
I was at my friend's birthday party.
There was my friend's birthday party.
It was my friend's birthday.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you went to your friend's birthday party?

Task.Q1: How was the party?
Task.Q2: How was it?
Task.Q3: Was it good?
Task.Guide: 오래된 친구들이 많이 왔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
There were many old friends at the party.
{Many of} [my old friends] [came].
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean many of your old friends came?

Complete.Reaction: That sounds fun! Glad that you had a good weekend.

content_name: What did you do last night?

Mission.Title: What did you do last night?
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Emma를 만났는데, 많이 피곤해 보입니다. 어젯밤에 뭐 했는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You met your friend, Emma. But she looks tired. Ask her what she did last night.

Task.Q1: I feel really tired.
Task.Q2: I am tired.
Task.Q3: So tired.
Task.Guide: 어젯밤에 뭐 했냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What did you} [do] [last night?]
What were you doing last night?
Did you do something last night?
Tell me what did you do last night.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what did I do last night?

Task.Q0: I had a test this morning.
Task.Q1: So I studied math.
Task.Q2: So I was studying math.
Task.Q3: I studied math.
Task.Guide: 얼마나 오래 공부했는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[How long] {did you} [study?]
How much time did you spend?
How many hours did you study?
For how long?
How long?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how long did I study?
Task.Key: {How long did you} study?
Use_Key: How long did you work?
How long did you sleep?
How long did you read this book?
Use_Guide: 얼마나 오래 일했는지 물어보세요.
얼마나 오래 잤는지 물어보세요.
얼마나 오래 이 책을 읽었는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: I studied for about three hours.
Task.Q1: Did you leave the office late yesterday?
Task.Q2: Did you finish late yesterday?
Task.Q3: Did you work until late?
Task.Guide: 아니라고 말하고, 집에 일찍 갔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[No, I didn't]. {I went} [home early].
Not really. I went back home early.
No actually, I finished early.
Task.Are_you_saying: You are saying you went home early?

Task.Q0: I'm glad you could relax yesterday.
Task.Q1: What did you have for dinner?
Task.Q2: What was your dinner yesterday?
Task.Q3: What did you eat for dinner?
Task.Guide: 저녁으로 피자를 먹었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I ate] [pizza].
I had pizza with my friends.
My dinner was pizza.
Task.Are_you_saying: You are saying you had pizza yesterday?

Complete.Reaction: Sounds yummy. let's grab some pizza with me sometime.

content_name: What do you want to do?

Mission.Title: What do you want to do?
Mission.Description_Ko: 졸업 후 오랜만에 친구 Marcus를 만났습니다. 직업에 대해 이야기 나누고, 직종을 바꿔 아버지 회사에서 근무하고 싶다는 Marcus의 이야기도 들어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation with Marcus on occupations. Tell him the job you held after graduation and listen to Marcus when he says that he wants to change jobs and work at his father's company.

Task.Q1: What have you been doing since graduation?
Task.Q2: What have you done since graduation?
Task.Q3: How have you been since graduation?
Task.Guide: 지금은 병원에서 간호사로 일하고 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I work as} [a nurse] [at a clinic] now.
I have been working as a nurse at a clinic.
I have worked as a nurse at a clinic.
I worked as a nurse at a clinic.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you work as a nurse at a clinic now?

Task.Q1: I’m working in an office, but I’d like to change jobs.
Task.Q2: I work in an office, but I wish to change jobs.
Task.Q3: Office work, but I want to change.
Task.Guide: 무슨 일을 하고 싶은지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do you} [want to] [do?]
What do you wish to do then?
What is it that you want to do?
What would you like to do?
Which job would you change to?
Which job do you want?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I want to do?

Task.Q1: In the future, I’d like to work for my father’s company.
Task.Q2: In the future, I want to work at my father's company.
Task.Q3: Work at my father's company.
Task.Guide: 아버지가 무슨 일을 하시는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What does your father do?]}
What was your father's job?
What did your father do again?
What did you say he did?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what my father does?

Task.Q1: He runs a chain of restaurants. He wants to expand it abroad.
Task.Q2: He runs a restaurant franchise. He wants to expand abroad.
Task.Q3: He is a restaurant owner. He wants branches worldwide.
Task.Guide: 네게 좋은 기회일 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That sounds like} [a good opportunity].
That sounds like the chance of a lifetime.
That sounds great.
That sounds like a great job.
That seems like a good opportunity.
That seems like a great chance.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that sounds like a good opportunity?
Task.Key: {That sounds like} a good opportunity.
Use_Key: That sounds like the perfect job.
That sounds too complicated.
The town sounds like the one I know.
Use_Guide: 완벽한 직업 같다고 말해 보세요.
너무 복잡한 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
그 마을은 내가 아는 곳 같다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: You can bet it is.

content_name: How was your trip to Florida?

Mission.Title: How was your trip to Florida?
Mission.Description_Ko: 플로리다로 여행을 다녀온 친구 Joe에게 여행이 어땠는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Joe went to Florida for a holiday. Ask him about his trip to Florida.

Task.Q1: It's so good to catch up with you.
Task.Q2: It's so good to be back.
Task.Q3: How have you been?
Task.Guide: Joe에게 플로리다 여행은 어땠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How was} [your trip] [to Florida]?
Did you have good time on the trip to Florida?
How did you spend your last trip to Florida?
Did you enjoy your trip to Florida?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how was my trip to Florida?
Task.Key: {How was} your trip {to} Florida?
Use_Key: How was your business trip to Australia?
How was your family trip to France?
How was your honeymoon to the Maldives?
Use_Guide: 호주 출장은 어땠는지 물어보세요.
프랑스로의 가족여행은 어땠는지 물어보세요.
몰디브로의 신혼여행은 어땠는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: It was fantastic.
Task.Q2: It was terrific.
Task.Q3: It was amazing.
Task.Guide: 플로리다 날씨는 어땠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How was} [the weather] [in Florida]?
What about the weather in Florida?
Was the weather great in Florida?
What was the weather like in Florida?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean how was the weather in Florida?

Task.Q1: It was not perfect, but it was ok.
Task.Q2: It was not excellent, but it was not bad.
Task.Q3: It was not the best, but it was good.
Task.Guide: 좋은 식당이 있었는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Were there} [any good restaurants?]
Did you get to go to any great restaurants?
How were the restaurants there?
Did you enjoy the food over there?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying were there any good restaurants?

Task.Q1: There were many good restaurants near the hotel.
Task.Q2: There were many good restaurants near the hotel.
Task.Q3: Many good restaurants near the hotel.
Task.Guide: 호텔은 어땠는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What was the hotel like?]}
How about the hotel?
Was the hotel great?
Did you like the hotel?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean what was the hotel like?

Task.Q1: There were a swimming pool and a tennis court.
Task.Q2: A swimming pool and a tennis court were there.
Task.Q3: I enjoyed a swimming pool and a tennis court.
Task.Guide: 나도 플로리다에 가보고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I want to} [go to Florida], [too].
I hope I can go there, too, soon.
I'd like to travel there, too.
I would love to go there, too.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you want to go to Floria, too?

Complete.Reaction: Yes, you should go there. I did enjoy my time there.

content_name: Would you like to come with me?

Mission.Title: Would you like to come with me?
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Susan에게 전화를 걸어 토요일 저녁 계획을 물어보고, 같이 영화보러 가자고 제안해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Make a phone call to your friend Susan. Ask her about her plans for Saturday night and invite her to go to a movie with you.

Task.Q1: Who is this?
Task.Q2: Who is this?
Task.Q3: Who is this?
Task.Guide: Susan에게 이름을 말해 주세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[This is]} <user's name>.
It's <user's name>

Task.Q1: Hey, how are you doing?
Task.Q2: Hey, how's it going?
Task.Q3: Hey, how are you?
Task.Guide: 나쁘지 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Not bad]}.
Not too bad.
I can't complain.
Alright.
Doing okay.
Task.Are_you_saying: Not bad?

Task.Guide: 토요일 밤에 일정이 있냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are you doing} [anything] [Saturday night?]
Do you have plans for Saturday night?
Are you free on Saturday night?
What are you going to do on Saturday night?
Are you busy on Saturday night?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean am I doing anything on Saturday night?

Task.Q1: Nothing special. Why?
Task.Q2: No plan for now. What's up?
Task.Q3: Nothing. Why?
Task.Guide: 영화를 볼 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I am going to} [see] [a movie].
I will see a movie.
I am going to go see a movie. .
I will go to the cinema.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are going to see a movie?

Task.Guide: 같이 가지 않겠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Would you like to} [come] [with me?]
Why don't you come with me?
Do you want to come with me?
Come with me.
Let's go together.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking would I like to go with you?
Task.Key: {Would you like to} come with me?
Use_Key: Would you like to go out for dinner tonight?
Would you like to go to the museum tomorrow?
Would you like to have some coffee next Friday?
Use_Guide: 오늘 저녁 먹으러 나가지 않겠냐고 말해 보세요.
내일 박물관에 가지 않겠냐고 말해 보세요.
다음 금요일에 커피를 좀 마시지 않겠냐고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: I'd love to.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_상황별 표현 : 쇼핑편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 쇼핑할 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression which can be used at the shopping mall.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I'm looking for ~"}은 "~을 찾고 있다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I'm looking for ~" is an expression asking what you want to buy.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I'm looking for ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can come after "I'm looking for ~." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"I'm looking for ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these vocabularies with the pattern "I'm looking for ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I'm looking for a white blouse.
I'm looking for a denim skirt.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 쇼핑몰에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that can be used at the shopping mall.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Can I try on ~?"}은 "입어봐도 되나요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "Can I try on ~?" is an expression to ask if you can try things on.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"Can I try on ~?"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some vocabularies that can come after "Can I try on ~?"

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"Can I try on ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these vocabularies with the pattern "Can I try on ~?"

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Can I try on these straight pants?
Can I try on these flip-flops?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 쇼핑몰에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used at the shopping mall.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I'll pay with ~"}는 "~로 결제할게요"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I'll pay with ~" is an expression answering how you will pay. You can put what you will pay by after 'with'.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I'll pay with ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can come after "I'll pay with ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"I'll pay with ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these vocabularies with the pattern "I'll pay with ~."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you can remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"하얀색 블라우스를 찾고 있어요."}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I'm looking for a white blouse.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"이 쪼리를 신어봐도 되나요?"}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Can I try on these flip-flops?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 쇼핑할 때 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that you can use while shopping.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_상황별 표현 : 여행 리허설편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 단어들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 질문들의 핵심 표현을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some key expressions in the question first. Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 이번에는 질문에 대답할 때 유용하게 활용할 수 있는 패턴들을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: From now on, let's practice some key patterns that you can use to answer the questions.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I am heading to the Metropolitan Museum.
Is this bus going to Central Park?
If you don't mind, could you take a photo of me?
Could you tell me how to get to ~?
Could you tell me how to get to Times Square?

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can use for today's lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you can remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"잘못된 음식을 가져다주다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"이 버스가 센트럴 파크로 가나요?"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Is this bus going to Central Park?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"괜찮으시다면 사진 한 장만 찍어주시겠어요?"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: If you don't mind, could you take a photo of me?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"타임스퀘어로 가려면 어떻게 해야 하나요?"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Could you tell me how to get to Times Square?

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the expressions perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 당신의 튜터와 학습을 시작할 준비가 되셨습니다.
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start the lesson with your tutor.

Mission.Title: Getting a Haircut
Mission.Description_Ko: 단발머리를 하고 싶어 자주 가던 헤어샵 Miranda 선생님을 찾아 간 당신, 다시 생각해 보니 용기가 안 납니다. 오늘은 다듬어만 달라고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You wanted a short bob and went to your hairstylist, Miranda. But now you have a second thought. Ask for a trim for today instead of a big chop.

Task.Q1: What will it be today?
Task.Q2: How would you like your hair?
Task.Q3: Do you want a haircut?
Task.Guide: Miranda에게 변화를 위해 과감하게 잘라 볼까한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm thinking of} [doing a big chop] [for a change].
I'm thinking of getting a big chop for a change.
I feel like going for a whole new look for a change.
I want a whole new look for a change.
I want to cut my hair really short.
I'd like to try a short hair cut.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are thinking of doing a big chop for a change?
Task.Key: {I'm thinking of} do{ing} a big chop for a change.
Use_Key: I'm thinking of getting a pet.
I'm thinking of decorating my room.
I'm thinking of baking a cake.
Use_Guide: 애완동물을 키워 볼까한다고 말해 보세요.
방을 꾸며볼까 한다고 말해 보세요.
케이크를 구워볼까 한다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: sounds good to me.
Task.Q1: You could definitely pull off a short, chin-length bob.
Task.Q2: You will certainly look good with a short bob.
Task.Q3: You will like a new short hair style.
Task.Guide: 머리가 볼륨이 없어서 얼굴이 길어보일 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[My hair is so flat], though. {It might} [make my face look too long].
But my hair is so flat, you know. Don't you think my face will look too long?
As my hair is so flat, I'm kind of worried that my face might look too long.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think it might make your face look too long as your hair is flat?

Task.Q1: I'll add some layers to create some body and soften up your look.
Task.Q2: I'll add some layers so that it has more body.
Task.Q3: I'll add some layers.
Task.Guide: 다시 생각해 봤는데 오늘은 그냥 다듬어만 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Hmm.. [on second thought], {I think I'll just} [get a trim for today].
Well.. on second thought, I just want a trim for today.
Sorry but on second thought, I'd like the dead ends chopped off, please.
Sorry, I'm having a second thought and I'd just go for a trim for today.
I'm sorry but I think I should just get a trim for today.
I guess I'm not brave enough. Can I just get a trim for today?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you just want to get a trim for today?

Task.Q1: Well, what about letting me add some highlights?
Task.Q2: Well, how about adding some highlights?
Task.Q3: How about some highlights?
Task.Guide: 제안에 동의하며 흰머리를 가리기는 해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, I {need something to} [cover] [this stupid gray].
Yeah, I need to do something about this stupid gray.
Yeah, highlights will cover this gray, I believe.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you need something to cover the gray?

Complete.Reaction: It's not too bad! But the highlights will really freshen up your look.

Mission.Title: Describing appearance
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Nick에게 당신의 동생 Roger의 마중을 부탁했습니다. 복잡한 역에서 Roger를 못 찾고 있는 Nick에게 Roger의 외모를 설명해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Nick is at a station to pick Roger, your brother, for you. Nick is having a trouble finding Roger as it is crowded. Describe Roger to Nick.

Task.Q0: It's so crowded.
Task.Q1: How would you describe him?
Task.Q2: How could you describe him?
Task.Q3: How can you describe him?
Task.Guide: Roger는 키가 큰 편이고 마르고 갈색 머리라고 설명해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He's} [a little tall and skinny] [with brown hair].
He is tall and skinny with brown hair.
He is tall and skinny and has brown hair.
He is tall and skinny. And he has a brown hair.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he is a little tall and skinny with brown hair?
Task.Key: He's {a little} tall and skinny {with} brown hair.
Use_Key: She is a little short and thin with long hair.
Chris is a little handsome and muscular with black hair.
My little brother is a little small and chubby with curly hair.
Use_Guide: 그녀는 좀 키가 작고 말랐으며 긴 머리를 가지고 있다고 말해 보세요.
크리스는 좀 잘생겼고 근육질이며 검은 머리를 가지고 있다고 말해 보세요.
나의 남동생은 좀 작고 통통하며 곱슬 머리를 가지고 있다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Does he have a beard?
Task.Q2: He has a beard?
Task.Q3: What about a beard?
Task.Guide: 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[No], {he doesn’t}.
Not really.
I don't think so.
No beard.

Task.Q1: I can’t see anyone who fits the description.
Task.Q2: I can’t see anyone who looks like Roger.
Task.Q3: I still don't see Roger.
Task.Guide: 매표 기계 근처에 있겠다고 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He said} [he would be] [near the ticket machine].
He might be standing by the ticket machine.
Can you see the ticket machine? He might be next to it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he said he would be near the ticket machine?

Task.Q1: I saw him now.
Task.Q2: I found him.
Task.Q3: He's there.
Task.Guide: Roger을 빨리 만나고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can't wait to} [meet him].
I'm dying to see him.
I'm so excited to see him.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you can't wait to meet him?

Reaction: We will get there in 30 minutes.
We will get there in 30 minutes.

content_name: I have to use it at work

Mission.Title: I have to use it at work
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Christy가 당신이 회사에서 쓰는 컴퓨터 프로그램을 가르켜 달라고 합니다.요청을 수락하고, Christy의 저녁 식사 초대도 수락해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Christy is asking you to teach her the computer program you use at work. Accept her request and welcome her dinner invitation as well.

Task.Q0: I didn't know you use this program.
Task.Q1: How did you learn this computer program?
Task.Q2: How did you learn to program computers this way?
Task.Q3: How do you know this computer program?
Task.Guide: 회사에서 데이터 입력 작업을 위해 이 컴퓨터 프로그램을 써야 한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I have to} [use it for data entry] [at work].
I have to use it at work for entering data.
I must use it for data entry at the workplace.
I must use it for entering data at work.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have to use it for data entry at work?
Task.Key: I {have to} use it {for} data entry at work.
Use_Key: I have to eat less food for medical checkup.
I have to lock my door for safety.
He has to work all day for his boss at work.
Use_Guide: 나는 건강검진을 위해 음식을 덜 먹어야 한다고 말해 보세요.
나는 안전을 위해 문을 잠가야 한다고 말해 보세요.
그는 상사를 위해  회사에서 하루종일 일해야 한다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: You're so fast.
Task.Q1: When will you be able to help me learn?
Task.Q2: When can you help me learn?
Task.Q3: Can you help me learn?
Task.Guide: 오늘은 회사 프로젝트를 끝내야 해서 바쁘다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m busy today because] I {have to} [finish a project for work].
Today is not good for me as I have to complete this project for work today.
I'm busy now, because I must finish a work project today.
I'm busy right now, because I must complete a work project today.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you have to finish a project for work today?

Task.Q0: No rush.
Task.Q1: How about next weekend?
Task.Q2: How about teaching me next weekend?
Task.Q3: Next weekend then?
Task.Guide: 좋다고 말하고 또 필요한 것이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That sounds good]}. [Anything else?]
That's totally fine. Anything else?
It sounds good. Do you need anything else?
Sounds good. Anything else you need?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean do I need anything else?

Task.Reaction: Well, it's not something I need but
Task.Q1: Would you like to come over for dinner?
Task.Q2: Do you want to have dinner at my place?
Task.Q3: How about dinner at my place?
Task.Guide: 좋다고 말하고 초대해 줘서 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’d like that]. {Thank you for} [the invitation!]
I'd like that a lot. Thank you for inviting me.
I'd love to. Thank you in advance for the invitation!
I'd love to come over. Thank you for inviting me. I will look forward to it.

Complete.Reaction: I'm glad to know. You are welcome!

Mission.Title: Taking public transport
Mission.Description_Ko: 낯선 도시로 출장을 떠난 당신. 공항으로 돌아오는 교통편을 알아보고 있습니다. 호텔 컨시어지에서 도움을 받아 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are on your business trip to an unfamiliar city. Ask for a help from the hotel concierge to get to the airport.

Task.Q1: How may I help you?
Task.Q2: Can I help you?
Task.Q3: May I help you?
Task.Guide: 공항까지 가는 택시 잡는 걸 도와달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [help me] [get a taxi to the airport?]
Can you help me to get a taxi to airport?
I want to get a taxi to airport.
I need a help to get a taxi to airport.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean could I help me get a taxi to the airport?

Task.Q0: There's a lot of traffic now.
Task.Q1: So I think taking a bus from here is more convenient.
Task.Q2: So you'd better take a bus from here.
Task.Q3: So taking the bus would be more convenient.
Task.Guide: 다음 버스는 언제 출발하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [tell me] [when the next bus leaves?]
What time the next bus leaves?
When does the next bus leave?
Do you know when the next bus leaves?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying could I tell you when the next bus leaves?
Task.Key: {Could you} tell me when the next bus leaves?
Use_Key: Could you tell me when the next shuttle leaves?
Could you tell me when the next train arrives?
Could you tell me when the flight ABC leaves for New York?
Use_Guide: 다음 셔틀은 언제 출발하는지 물어보세요.
다음 기차는 언제 도착하는지 물어보세요.
비행기 ABC는 언제 뉴욕으로 출발하는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: It leaves every 30 minutes in front of the hotel.
Task.Q1: The next one is at 1 p.m.
Task.Q2: So it leave at 1 p.m.
Task.Q3: So, at 1 p.m.
Task.Guide: 티켓은 버스에서 살 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Can I} [buy tickets] [on the bus?]
Am I able to buy tickets on the bus?
Am I allowed to buy tickets on the bus?
Could I buy tickets on the bus?
Should I buy tickets on the bus?
Do I buy tickets on the bus?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean can you buy tickets on the bus?

Task.Q1: It will be $3 for one person.
Task.Q2: It’s $3.
Task.Q3: It’s $3.
Task.Guide: 도움에 감사 인사를 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Thank you so much for} [your help].
It helped me a lot, Thank you.

Complete.Reaction: My pleasure. Let me know if you need anything else.

Mission.Title: Trending technology
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Gavin이 당신과 같은 모델로 핸드폰을 바꿨습니다. 시스템 업그레이드를 했는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Gavin just got the same phone as you. Ask him if he has upgraded the operating system.

Task.Guide: 핸드폰 바꿨냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Did you} [change phones?]
Did you get a new phone?
Have you bought a new cell phone?
Have you got a new phone?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying did I change phones?

Task.Q1: I got a new one last month.
Task.Q2: I had a new one last month.
Task.Q3: I bought a new one last month.
Task.Guide: 나하고 같은 모델을 가지고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Ah ... {[you have the same one] [as me]}.
Oh... you had the same one as me.
Ah... you bought the same one as me.
Ah ... you got the same one as me.
We have the same model.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I have the same one as you?

Task.Q1: It’s much more compact than the old one.
Task.Q2: It’s much smaller than my old one.
Task.Q3: It’s so small.
Task.Guide: 시스템 업그레이드도 했는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Have you upgraded} [the operating system] [yet?]
Didn't you upgrade the operating system yet?
Haven't you upgraded the operating system yet?
Don't tell me you didn't upgrade the operating system.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean have I upgraded the operating system yet?
Task.Key: {Have} you upgrad{ed} the operating system yet?
Use_Key: Have you upgraded the software yet?
Have you checked your emails yet?
Have you finished the report yet?
Use_Guide: 소프트웨어를 업그레이드 했는지 물어보세요.
이메일을 확인했는지 물어보세요.
보고서를 끝냈는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: It is much more difficult than the old one.
Task.Q2: It's more difficult than my old one.
Task.Q3: I don't know how to upgrade it.
Task.Guide: 새로운 버전이 훨씬 빠르다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The new version] [is much quicker]}.
The new version is faster.
I think the new version is much faster.
The new version is much quicker I think.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the new version is much quicker?

Task.Q1: Could you help me update it?
Task.Q2: Can you help me update it?
Task.Q3: Please help me with it.
Task.Guide: 알겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[No problem]}.
Alright.
Okay.

Complete.Reaction: Thank you. You are the best.

Mission.Title: Too tired to sleep
Mission.Description_Ko: 최근 프로젝트 때문에 오랫동안 잠을 많이 못 잔 당신. 동료 George에게 당신의 불면증에 대해 이야기하고, 조언을 들어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You haven't slept enough and well due to a project. Talk about your insomnia to your colleague George and get some advice.

Task.Q0: You look tired.
Task.Guide: George에게 컨디션이 너무 안 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I feel} [absolutely] [horrible]!
I feel so bad!
I don't feel too great!
I'm feeling terrible!
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you feel absolutely horrible?

Task.Guide: 어제 한숨도 못 잤다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I didn't get a wink of sleep] [last night]}.
I didn't get any sleep last night.
I wasn't able to sleep last night.
I had trouble sleeping last night.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you didn't get a wink of sleep last night?

Task.Q1: I thought that project you were so worried about was finished.
Task.Q2: Didn't that project you worried about finish?
Task.Q3: I thought that project was done.
Task.Guide: 프로젝트는 끝났는데 그동안 잠을 너무 못잤다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
The project is finished, {but} I have been [staying up all night] for so long that [my sleep has really suffered].
The project is done, but I had been burning the candle at both ends for so long that my sleep has really suffered.
I finished the project, but I've been pulling all nighters for a long time, getting very little sleep.
I'm done with the project, but I haven't been getting enought sleep, pulling all nighters for so long.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you've been staying up all night for so long that your sleep has really suffered?

Task.Guide: 너무 피곤해서 잠을 못 자는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} I'm [actually] [too tired to sleep].
I guess I'm too tired to sleep.
I'm actually so tired I'm having trouble sleeping.
I think I must be so tired I cannot sleep.
I think I'm having trouble sleeping because I'm too tired.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think you're actually too tired to sleep?

Task.Q1: You have to get some shuteye sometime, or you'll get sick.
Task.Q2: You have to get some sleep, or you will get sick.
Task.Q3: You need to sleep or you will get sick.
Task.Guide: 아는데, 요즘 수면 패턴이 정말 일정하지 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I know, but} [my sleep patterns] are really [out of whack] [these days].
I know, but my sleep patterns are out of order these days.
I'm aware, but my sleeping patterns are not normal these days.
I realize, but my sleeping patterns are out of control these days.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your sleep patterns are really out of whack these days?
Task.Key: My sleep patterns are really {out of whack} these days.
Use_Key: The system is clearly out of whack.
All the traveling has thrown my body out of whack.
The spending priorities were out of whack.
Use_Guide: 시스템이 제대로 작동하지 않는다고 말해 보세요.
지난 여행들로 몸 상태가 안 좋다고 말해 보세요.
지출을 위한 우선순위들이 제대로 지켜지지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [all the traveling has thrown my body]

Task.Guide: 잠들기는 하는데, 깊게 잠들기 전에 깨서 다시 못 잔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I manage to} [fall asleep], but before I can [get into a really deep sleep], I wake up and can't [get back to sleep again].
I managed to fall asleep, but before I got into a really deep sleep, I woke up and now I can't get back to sleep again.
I fell asleep but before I got into deep sleep I woke up and am having trouble falling asleep again.
I am having trouble falling asleep again after I woke up before getting into deep sleep.
Since I woke up before getting into deep sleep, I am having trouble falling asleep again.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean before you can get into a really deep sleep, you wake up and can't get back to sleep again?

Task.Q0: That sounds like a really bad case of insomnia.
Task.Q1: Have you tried a glass of warm milk?
Task.Q2: Did you try drinking warm milk?
Task.Q3: Did you try warm milk?
Task.Guide: 도움이 안 된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {[it doesn't work]}.
Yes, it doesn't do the trick.
Yes, it's not helpful.
Yes, it's not effective.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it doesn’t' work?

Task.Q1: Maybe you should see a doctor.
Task.Q2: You should see a doctor.
Task.Q3: Go see a doctor.
Task.Guide: 오늘 일끝나고 가보도록 하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I guess so]. {I'll see about} [going today] [after work].
Maybe. I'll look into going today after work.
Perhaps. I'll think about visiting today once I'm done with work.
Yeah I think so. I'll consider going today after work.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you'll see about going today after work?

Complete.Reaction: Sounds good. Hope you get better soon!

Mission.Title: Suitable Activities 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 스포츠 데이 행사에 포함할 활동에 대한 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on the activities to include on sports day.

Task.Q1: To me, a sports day should have activities everyone can do.
Task.Q2: To me, there should be activities for everyone on sports day.
Task.Q3: Everyone should participate in sports day activities.
Task.Guide: 동의하면서 모든 사람들이 좋아하는 활동도 있어야 한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think so too}. [There should also be] [activities] [everyone likes].
I think so as well. There should also be activities most people like.
I agree. Everyone should also like the activities they participate in.
I agree. Everyone should also like the activities that are offered.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying there should also be activities everyone likes?

Task.Q1: Ideally. So let's get rid of soccer.
Task.Q2: So why don't we get rid of soccer?
Task.Q3: Let's not do soccer then.
Task.Guide: 하지만 모든 사람들이 축구하는 것을 좋아할 것이라고 생각한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{But I think} [everyone might like] [playing it].
But people still might like playing it.
But everyone might enjoy soccer.
But people may like playing soccer.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean everyone might like playing it?

Task.Q1: I beg to differ. Definitely not my cup of tea.
Task.Q2: I don't think so. I definitely don't like playing soccer.
Task.Q3: No, that's not true for me.
Task.Guide: 그럼 암벽등반을 없애자고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Let's cut rock climbing]}.
How about cutting rock climbing?
Why don't we cut rock climbing?
What about cutting rock climbing?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we should cut rock climbing?

Task.Q1: I think it might be a nice change of pace to go rock climbing.
Task.Q2: It might be a nice change to go rock climbing.
Task.Q3: I don't know. I think rock climbing is fine.
Task.Guide: 최소한 요가는 없애야 한다는 것에 동의할 수 있는지 물어보세요.

{Can we at least agree to} [cut yoga?]
Can we agree on cutting yoga, at the least?
Can we skip yoga, first off?
Would you agree on cutting yoga at least?

Use_Key: Can we at least agree to eat out tonight?
Can we at least agree to go to the movies?
Can we at least agree to hang out this weekend?
Use_Guide: 최소한 오늘 밤에 외식 한다는 것에 동의할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
최소한 영화관에 간다는 것에 동의할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
최소한 이번 주말에 놀러나가는 것에 동의할 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Hmm I don't know. Let's think this over more.

Mission.Title: Welcome to the team
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 회사와 다른 회사와 파트너십을 맺었습니다. 캄보디아 지사에서 온 대표 Mr.Chan을 당신의 팀에게 소개하고 환영해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your company has a partnership with another company. Introduce Mr.Chan from your new office in Cambodia to your team and welcome him.

Task.Guide: Mr.Chan을 환영해 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I would like you to} [welcome Mr. Chan].
Please welcome Mr. Chan.
I would like you to greet Mr. Chan.
Please say hello to Mr. Chan.
It would be nice if you could welcome Mr. Chan.

Task.Guide: 우리 회사의 캄보디아 지사에서 온 파견 대표라고 소개해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
He is [the visiting representative] [from our new office in Cambodia].
He represents our new office in Cambodia.
He is from our new office in Cambodia.
He has come to visit from our new factory in Cambodia.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he is the visiting representative from our new factory in Cambodia?

Task.Reaction: Thank you for the warm welcoming.
Task.Q0: Because of the hostilities between our two nations in the past,
Task.Q1: it has been difficult to strike an accord or to do business with one another.
Task.Q2: it's been hard to come to an agreement or do business together.
Task.Q3: it's been tough to do business together.
Task.Guide: 최근까지도 그랬다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Yes], [that is until recently]}.
Yes, that is until now.
Yes, that's true until these days.
Sure, that's true until recently.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean that is until recently?

Task.Q0: The problem with governments is that they are just in it for themselves.
Task.Q1: Meanwhile, the common people want to do business and live their own lives.
Task.Q2: The common people want to do business and live their own lives.
Task.Q3: All the people want is to do business and live their lives.
Task.Guide: 그게 당신 회사가 우리 회사와 파트너십을 맺은 이유냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is that the reason} [your company] [sought a partnership with ours?]
Is that why your company looked to work with us?
Is that the reason your company wanted a partnership with ours?
Did your company seek a partnership with us for that reason?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if that is the reason our company sought a partnership with yours?
Task.Key: {Is that the reason} your company sought a partnership with ours?
Use_Key: Is that the reason you quit your job?
Is that the reason they couldn't attend the meeting?
Is that the reason she changed her plan?
Use_Guide: 그게 당신이 직장을 그만둔 이유냐고 물어보세요.
그게 그들이 회의에 참석하지 못한 이유냐고 물어보세요.
그게 그녀가 계획을 바꾼 이유냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: I think it's in everyone's best interests that we cooperate with one another.
Task.Q1: Each of us has resources that could benefit the other.
Task.Q2: Both sides has resources to benefit each other.
Task.Q3: We have resources to benefit one another.
Task.Guide: 이곳의 지사들을 대표하여 인터내셔널팀의 합류를 환영한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[On behalf of our offices here], [we welcome you] [to our international team].
Speaking for our offices here, we welcome you to our international team.
On behalf of our offices here, we welcome you to our global team.
We welcome you to our global team, speaking on behalf of our offices here.
Task.Are_you_saying: You welcome me to your international team on behalf of your offices here?

Complete.Reaction: Thank you. I expect that this will be a profitable relationship for everyone involved.

Mission.Title: Informed consumers 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 정장을 구입하고자 합니다. 필요한 정장에 대해 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are trying to buy a suit. Talk about the type of suit you need.

Task.Q1: How can I help you today?
Task.Q2: How may I help you?
Task.Q3: Would you like any help?
Task.Guide: 새로운 정장을 구입하고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'd like to get a new suit]}.
I would like a new suit.
I need a new suit.
I want to buy a new suit.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd like to get a new suit?

Task.Q1: What kind of styles are you looking for? We've got English style and Italian style.
Task.Q2: What kind of styles do you prefer? English or Italian?
Task.Q3: What kind of styles do you mean? English or Italian?

Task.Answer_Set:
I'm not sure. {[What's the difference?]}
I'm not certain. Can you explain the difference?
Well, not sure. What's the difference?
Not sure. Any difference?

Task.Q1: English is a more traditional style. Italian is a little more modern. Tighter fitting.
Task.Q2: English is traditional style. Italian is more modern and tighter fitting.
Task.Q3: English is more traditional, while Italian is modern and tighter.
Task.Guide: 나는 보통 출장을 많이 가는데, 어떤 것을 추천하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I usually go on business trips often]. {Which one} [do you recommend?]
Normally, I have a lot of business trips. Then, which one is better?
Which one would you recommend? I generally go on business trips often.
I normally on on business trips quite often. Which style is better?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking which one I recommend?
Task.Key: {Which one} do you recommend?
Use_Key: Which one looks better on me?
Which one does she prefer?
Which one are you talking about?
Use_Guide: 어떤 것이 나에게 더 잘 어울리는지 물어보세요.
그녀가 어떤 것을 선호하는지 물어보세요.
어떤 것에 대해 말하는 건지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I'd definitely recommend Italian travel suits.
Task.Q2: Italian travel suits would be much better.
Task.Q3: I'd recommend Italian travel suits.
Task.Guide: 이 정장이 다른 색으로 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Do you have this suit in other colors?]}
Does this suit come in other colors?
Do you have other colors for this style?
Are there any other colors for this suit?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have this suit in other colors?

Complete.Reaction: Sure, let me doublecheck the stock first.

content_name: We're like one, big, happy family

Mission.Title: We're like one, big, happy family
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Suzanne가 당신의 추천으로 같은 빌딩에 이사를 왔습니다. Suzanne에게 가족같은 이웃들에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend, Suzanne, has moved in your building. Talk to her about your good neighbors who are like your family.

Task.Guide: Suzanne에게 이사 잘 했냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Are you all settled in?]}
Are you all comfortable now?
Are all of you feeling okay now?
Are all of you adjusted now?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean am I all settled in?

Task.Guide: 새 아파트는 어떠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[How's your new apartment?]}
How do you like your new apartment?
Do you like your new apartment?
What do you think about your new apartment?
What do you have to say about your new apartment?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how's my new apartment?

Task.Q0: Thank you so much for helping me find it.
Task.Q1: I can't believe we're actually going to be neighbors in the same building.
Task.Q2: I can't believe we're going to be neighbors in the same place.
Task.Q3: I can't believe you'll be my neighbor in the building.
Task.Guide: 여기서 사는 거 만족할 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You'll} [love living] [here].
You'll really like this place.
You'll really like living here.
You'll really appreciate this place.
Are_you_saying: You mean I'll love living here?
You mean I'll love living here?

Task.Guide: 빌당에 사는 다른 사람들을 만나보면 알 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Wait till} you [meet the others] [in the building].
When you meet the others in the building, you'll understand.
Wait till you meet the neighbors.
Meet the neigbors in the building and you'll see.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying wait till I meet the others in the building?

Task.Q1: You mean you know the other people who have apartments in this building?
Task.Q2: You actually know your neighbors?
Task.Q3: You really know your neighbors?
Task.Guide: 맞다고 말하고, 너도 곧 알게 될 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Yes, and you'll too, very soon!]}
Yeah, and you will meet them too, very soon!
Yes, and you will as well!
Yeah, and you'll soon get to know them as well!
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I'll too?

Task.Guide: 이번 주말에 파티가 있을 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{There's going to be} [a party] [this weekend].
There will be a party this weekend.
This weekend, they will have a party.
We will have a party this weekend.
There will be partying this weekend.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying there's going to be a party this weekend?

Task.Q0: That sounds exciting.
Task.Guide: 우리는 지난 몇 년 동안 많이 친해지게 됐다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We've become} [quite close] [over the years].
We got quite close over the years.
We've become very close over time.
Over the years, we've become close friends.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you've become quite close over the years?

Task.Guide: 행복한 대가족 같은 사이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[We're like] [one, big, happy family]!
We resemble one, big, happy family!
We are one, great, jolly family!
One, big, happy family are we!
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are like one, big, happy family?

Use_Key: They have become quite close since the dinner.
The author has become rich and famous, thanks to her last novel.
The video has gone viral online since last night.
Use_Guide: 그 저녁식사 이후에 그들은 꽤 친해졌다고 말해 보세요.
그 작가는 그녀의 소설 덕분에 부와 명성을 얻었다고 말해 보세요.
그 비디오는 어젯밤 이후 온라인상에서 빠르게 퍼지고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [The author], [rich and famous], [thanks to her last novel]

Complete.Reaction: Now I know why you insisted I move into the neighborhood.

Mission.Title: Negi's Mother
Mission.Description_Ko: Negi의 학부모로서 새로 부임한 담임 선생님과 면담을 해 보세요. 아이의 학습을 도울 수 있는 방법에 대해 조언을 구해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a face-to-face talk with Negi's new teacher, Jane. Ask her for an advice on how to help Negi to be a better student.

Task.Guide: 선생님께 급하게 연락드렸는데도 만나 주셔서 감사하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Thank you for} [meeting with me] [on such short notice].
Thank you for meeting with me even though I asked for a meeting so abruptly.
Thank you for meeting me so suddenly.
Even though I asked so suddenly, thank you for meeting me.

Task.Q1: Please call me Jane. We don't need to use formalities here.
Task.Q2: Please call me Jane. We don't need to be formal here.
Task.Q3: Call me Jane. No need to be formal here.
Task.Guide: 새로 부임하셨는데 학교는 어떠신지 여쭤보면 좋을 것 같았다라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {I just thought that} I would [check] [how you are enjoying your new job].
Yes, I was just thinking that I would check how you were taking your new job.
Yes, I thought I should check in on how you were doing at your new job.
Yes, I just thought it would be nice to see how you were doing at your new job.
Task.Are_you_saying: You thought that you would check how I am enjoying my new job?

Task.Guide: Negi반을 맡으신지 한 달밖에 안 되지 않았냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[You've only been teaching Negi's class for a month], [right?]}
It's only been a month of teaching Negi's class, right?
Has it been a month since you taught Negi's class?
One month is how long you've been teaching Negi's class, right?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I've only been teaching Negi's class for a month?

Task.Q0: Things are great.
Task.Q1: But I don't think I'll ever get used to having to work six days a week.
Task.Q2: But I don't think I'll get used to working six days a week.
Task.Q3: But I won't be okay with work six days a week.
Task.Guide: 동의하지만, 시험을 위해 애들이 공부할 시간이 더 필요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Of course, but} the kids [need the extra time to] [study for their exams].
Of course, but the children need more time to study for their exams.
Certainly, but the students need extra time to prepare for their examinations.
Sure, but the kids need the extra time to prepare for their tests.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the kids need the extra time to study for their exams?

Task.Guide: 시험 점수에 따라 좋은 대학과 직장이 보장되기 때문에 매우 중요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It's very important because} [those scores can get them into a good university] [and later a good job].
It's super important because their scores help them  go to good universities and find good jobs later.
It's essential because the test scores allow them to get into a good university and later a good job.
It's critical because those scores determine whether or not they get into a good university and later find a good job.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean it's very important because those scores can get them into a good university and later a good job?

Task.Guide: 이곳 부모들은 아이들의 성공에 관심이 많다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Parents here care a lot about] [their children's success]}.
Here, parents think a lot about their children's success.
Parents in Korea care a lot about the success of their children.
The success of their children is very important to parents here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that parents here care a lot about their children's success?

Task.Q0: I guess that makes sense.
Task.Q1: In America, we don't worry too much about putting our children in after-school academies.
Task.Q2: In America, we don't worry about sending our children to after-school academies.
Task.Q3: In America, we don't put our children in after-school academies.
Task.Guide: 나중에 좋은 직장을 가질지에 대해 걱정되지 않냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Don't you worry if} they will be able to [get good jobs] [later?]
Don't you think about whether or not they will be able to get good jobs later?
Don't you contemplate about how they will get good jobs later?
Aren't you worried about whether they will be able to get good jobs later?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean don't we worry if they will be able to get good jobs later?

Task.Q0: We are about their futures.
Task.Q1: But we also think they should have the freedom to make their own choices, you know?
Task.Q2: But we also believe they should be allowed to make their own choices.
Task.Q3: But we believe they should make their own choices.
Task.Guide: Negi가 선생님 수업을 얼마나 좋아하는지 계속 이야기한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes. {Negi keeps telling me about} [how much he enjoys] [your classes].
Yes. Negi keeps telling me how much he enjoys your class.
Yeah. I keep hearing from Negi how much he is enjoying your classes.
Yup. I hear from Negi nonstop that he is enjoying your classes.
Task.Are_you_saying: Negi keeps telling you about how much he enjoys my classes?
Task.Key: Negi {keeps telling me about} how much he enjoys your classes.
Use_Key: She keeps telling me about how much she enjoys her new job.
I kept telling him about how much I wanted the project.
We should keep telling people about how important it is.
Use_Guide: 그녀가 얼마나 즐겁게 새 직장을 다니고 있는지 계속 이야기한다고 말해 보세요.
내가 그 프로젝트를 맡고 싶다고 그에게 계속 말했다고 이야기해 보세요.
우리는 이것이 중요한 문제인 것을 사람들에게 계속 알려야 한다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I'm so happy to hear that.
Task.Guide: 근데 숙제하는 모습을 못 봐서 걱정이 된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
But I {rarely} [see him doing any homework], so I'm [concerned about him].
But I barely see him doing homework, so I’m worried about him.
I'm worried because I rarely see him doing any homework.
I'm concerned about him since I never see him doing his homework.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you rarely see him doing any homework so you're concerned about him?

Task.Guide: 사실 그래서 제가 어떻게 Negi를 도와줄 수 있는지 물어보고 싶었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{In fact}, [I was hoping that you could tell me] [how I could help him to become a better student].
Actually, I was hoping that you would be able to tell me how to help him become a better student.
I am hopeful that you could tell me what I can do to help him become a better student.
How I could help him become a better student is what I was hoping you could explain to me.
Task.Are_you_saying: You were hoping that I could tell you how you could help him to become a better student?

Complete.Reaction: That's what I thought you wanted to know. Here, I'll show you how he's been doing.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_한국 소개하기

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 수업에서 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that you can use today before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 질문들의 핵심 표현을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some key expressions in the question first. Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 이번에는 질문에 대답할 때 유용하게 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: From now on, let's practice some useful expressions that you can use to answer the questions.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I would recommend you to visit ~

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can use for today's lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you can remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"잊어서는 안 되는"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~와 함께 시간을 보내다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~하는 것은 실례로 여겨진다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"대중교통을 자주 이용하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the expressions perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 튜터에게 한국을 소개해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, introduce Korea to your tutor through the class.

Mission.Title: Making Doctor's Appointment
Mission.Description_Ko: 오늘 진료를 받고 싶은 당신. 병원에 전화해서 오늘 진료 예약을 잡아달라고 요청하고, 시간도 정해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You want to see the doctor today. Call the hospital and ask them to squeeze you in sometime today. Make an appointment at a time that works for you, too.

Task.Q1: How may I help you?
Task.Q2: Do you need help?
Task.Q3: Can I help you?
Task.Guide: 오늘 진료를 볼 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Would it be possible to} [make an appointment] [to see the doctor today?]
Would you help me make an appointment to meet with the doctor today?
Could I possibly make an appointment to see the doctor today?
If possible, could I set a time to meet with the doctor today?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying would it be possible to make an appointment to see the doctor today?
Task.Key: {Would it be possible to} make an appointment to see the doctor today?
Use_Key: Would it be possible to take a rain check?
Would it be possible to call me back tomorrow?
Would it be possible to check the stock?
Use_Guide: 약속을 다음으로 미룰 수 있는지 물어보세요.
내일 다시 전화를 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
재고를 확인해 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: But there is a flu going around these days.
Task.Q1: And the doctor is quite busy today.
Task.Q2: The doctor is very busy today.
Task.Q3: The doctor is so busy.
Task.Guide: 오늘 어떻게든 예약을 잡아줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [squeeze me] [in sometime today], please?
Could you fit me in sometime today, please?
Could you make some time for me today, please?
Could you please find time to meet with me today?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying could I squeeze you in sometime today?

Task.Q1: Could you be here in thirty minutes?
Task.Q2: Could you come in thirty minutes?
Task.Q3: Can you make it in thirty minutes?
Task.Guide: 그렇게 빨리는 못 갈 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I don't think} [I could be there] [that fast].
I don't think I can get there that fast.
I'm not sure if I can be there so fast.
I'm uncertain that I can get there so fast.
Task.Are_you_saying: You don't think you could be here that fast?

Task.Q1: Could you come in at half past four this afternoon?
Task.Q2: Could you come by 4:30 this afternoon?
Task.Q3: Can you come by 16:30?
Task.Guide: 가능하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Yes], {[that would work just fine]}.
Yes, that works for me.
Yes, that won't be a problem.
Yes, that would be just great.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say that would work just fine?

Task.Q1: We'll see you at 4:30.
Task.Q2: Let's meet at 4:30.
Task.Q3: See you at 4:30.
Task.Guide: 예약을 잡아줘서 고맙다고 인사해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Thank you so much for} [squeezing me in].
I really appreciate you for making time for me.
Thank you so much for fitting me in.
I highly appreciate you for making time to meet me.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you thank me for squeezing you in?

Complete.Reaction: No worries, bye for now.

content_name: You can do a million things.

Mission.Title: You can do a million things.
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Daniel과 뉴욕에 놀러 간 당신. 예상치 못한 비가 옵니다. 비오는 날 뉴욕에서 무엇을 할 수 있는지를 묻고, 계획을 세워 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are traveling in New York with your friend, Daniel. But it is raining now. Ask him what you can do on a rainy day and make a plan together.

Task.Q1: I didn't know it would rain today.
Task.Q2: I can't believe it's raining today.
Task.Q3: It's raining.
Task.Guide: Daniel에게 비오는 날에 뉴욕에서 뭘 할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What can we} [do in New York] [on a rainy day]?
What can we do in New York when it's raining like this?
Is there anything we can do in New York in this rain?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what can we do in New York on a rainy day?
Task.Key: {What can we do} in New York on a rainy day?
Use_Key: What can we do in Canada on a snowy day?
What can we do in Germany on Christmas Day?
What can we do in Australia in Summer?
Use_Guide: 눈오는 날에 캐나다에서 뭘 할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
크리스마스에 독일에서 뭘 할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
여름에 호주에서 뭘 할 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: We can do a million things.
Task.Q2: We have things to do.
Task.Q3: We have many options.
Task.Guide: 어떤 걸 할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Like what]}?
What can we do?
What?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean like what?

Task.Q1: We can go to the top of the Empire State Building.
Task.Q2: We can look around the Empire State Building.
Task.Q3: The top of the Empire State Building.
Task.Guide: 이런 날씨에는 아무것도 볼 수 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We can't} [see anything] [in this weather].
We are not going to see anything in this weather.
It will be very hard to see in this weather.
We won't be able to see anything in this weather.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we can't see anything in this weather?

Task.Q0: I think you are right. Let's go back to the hotel.
Task.Q1: We can watch a free movie on TV.
Task.Q2: Watching a movie on TV would be fun.
Task.Q3: Let's watch a free movie on TV.
Task.Guide: 좋은 생각이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That is} [a good idea].
A free movie in the hotel is a great idea.
It sounds like a perfect plan.
Great idea.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that is a good idea?

Complete.Reaction: Alright, let me get a taxi for us.

Mission.Title: What's your friend like?
Mission.Description_Ko: 오늘 저녁식사를 함께 할 Alex의 친구 Bill에 대해 얘기하면서 이 친구에 대해 알아보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about Bill you are having dinner with today and ask more about him.

Task.Q1: Is it okay if my friend Bill joins us for dinner?
Task.Q2: Is it okay if Bill joins us at dinner?
Task.Q3: Can Bill join for dinner?
Task.Guide: 당연히 괜찮다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That’s no problem]}.
That's not a problem.
Sure.

Task.Guide: 친구Bill은 어떤 사람인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What’s your friend like?]}
How would you describe your friend?
What is Bill like?
How can you depict Bill?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what is my friend like?

Task.Q1: My friend has an energetic personality.
Task.Q2: Bill has an energetic personality.
Task.Q3: He is energetic.
Task.Guide: 수다스러운 편인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Is he very talkative?]}
Is he talkative often?
Does he talk a lot?
How often does he talk?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if he is very talkative?
Task.Key: {Is he} very talkative?
Use_Key: Is she very attentive to details?
Are you proud of your awards?
Am I too negative?
Use_Guide: 그녀는 디테일에 많은 주의를 기울이는지 물어보세요.
네가 받은 상에 대해 자랑스러운지 물어보세요.
내가 너무 부정적인지 자문해 보세요.

Task.Q1: He’s a very outgoing man.
Task.Q2: He's talkative and so outgoing.
Task.Q3: Very much. Outgoing too.
Task.Guide: 좋은 사람처럼 들린다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[He sounds nice]}.
He sounds agreeable.
Really? Sounds like a nice person.
Really? Sounds very pleasant.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he sounds nice?

Task.Q1: I’d also describe him as a very funny man.
Task.Q2: He is also a really funny person.
Task.Q3: He is so funny.
Task.Guide: 오늘밤 그를 만나는 게 기대된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can’t wait to} [meet him] [tonight].
Can't wait to see him tonight.
I anticipate meeting him tonight.
Really anticipate meeting with him tonight.
I'm looking forward to meeting him tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't wait to meet him tonight?

Complete.Reaction: I can't wait either.

Mission.Title: It's Time
Mission.Description_Ko: 플로리다의 장마철 날씨와 관련하여 대화를 나누고, 새로 온 동료도 소개 받아 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation regarding the rainy Florida weather, and get introduced to a new colleague.

Task.Q0: Is it raining again?
Task.Q1: That doesn’t look like any fun.
Task.Q2: That looks like no fun.
Task.Q3: How awful.
Task.Guide: 나는 우산을 가져올 정도로 똑똑했지만, 그리고 나서 내 차에 두고 왔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I was smart enough} [to bring an umbrella], and then [left it in my car].
I was smart to bring an umbrella, but left it in the car.
I actually brought an umbrella, and left it in the car.
I actually have an umbrella with me, but it is in the car.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you were smart enough to bring an umbrealla but left it in your car?

Task.Q1: It’s rained every day since I moved to Miami.
Task.Q2: Since I moved to Miami, it has rained every single day.
Task.Q3: It rained every day since moving to Miami.
Task.Guide: 남플로리다에 온 것을 환영한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Welcome to South Florida]}.
Welcome, this is South Florida.
I can hear you. Welcome to South Florida.
I know. Say welcome to South Florida.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying welcome to South Florida?

Task.Q1: There are worse places to live, trust me.
Task.Q2: Trust me, you can live in worse places.
Task.Q3: It can be worse.
Task.Guide: 여기서 최소한 자연재해는 드물다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[At least natural disasters are rare here]}.
Natural disasters, at the least, seem rare.
At least there are no natural disasters here.
It's a relief that there are no natural disasters here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say natural disasters are rare here?

Task.Q0: By the way,
Task.Q1: Did you get a chance to meet Steve? He's the one standing over there.
Task.Q2: Did you meet Steve? He's standing over there.
Task.Q3: Meet Steve? He's there.
Task.Guide: 아니라고 말하면서 그는 날씨가 화창해지기를 기다리는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No I haven't. {It looks like} [he is waiting for the weather] [to clear up].
No I haven't. It seems like he is waiting for the clear weather.
Not yet. He looks like he's waiting for the weather to get better.
Not yet. He seems like he's waiting for better weather to arrive.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean it looks like he is waiting for the weather to clear up?
Task.Key: {It looks like} he is waiting for the weather to clear up.
Use_Key: It looks like he is doing so much more work.
It looks like she is happy with her job.
It looks like the weather is going to be much coloder tomorrow.
Use_Guide: 그가 훨씬 더 많은 일을 하는 것으로 보인다고 말해 보세요.
그녀가 그녀의 직업에 만족해 하는 것으로 보인다고 말해 보세요.
내일 날씨가 훨씬 더 추워질 것으로 보인다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Yes, he is waiting for the car just like us.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_나의 나라, 너의 나라

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 수업에서 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: From now on, let's practice some useful expressions that you can use to answer the questions.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"잠들지 않는 도시"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the expressions perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 튜터와 함께 각자의 나라에 관해 말해보는 시간을 가져보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, talk about each other's country with the tutor through the class.

content_name: How is your new job going?

Mission.Title: How is your new job going?
Mission.Description_Ko: Megan을 만나 새로운 직장에 대해 물어보고, 같이 다녔던 이전 직장에도 방문하기를 원한다고 말해보세요. 헤어지면서 연락하고 지내자고 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Upon meeting Megan, ask about her new job, and ask her to visit the office sometime. Offer to keep in touch as you part ways.

Task.Q0: Is that you?
Task.Q1: I haven’t seen you since I changed jobs.
Task.Q2: I couldn't see you for a while, especially after switching my job.
Task.Q3: Hadn't seen you since starting my new job.
Task.Guide: 맞다고 말하고, 새 직장은 괜찮은지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I know]. {[How is your new job going?]}
I know. How is your new workplace?
Yes I realize. How do you like your new job?
Yes I realize. How do you find your new workplace?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how is my new job going?

Task.Q1: It’s a little busy, but I like it a lot.
Task.Q2: It's busy alright, but I like it so much.
Task.Q3: Busy, but great.
Task.Guide: 듣기 좋다고 말하고, 오랜만에 봐서 좋다고도 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That’s great to hear]}. [It’s good to see you in so long].
That's nice to hear. It's nice to see you in so long.
So nice to hear. It's welcoming to see you in such a long time.
So nice to hear. It's nice to see you in a while.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's good to see me in so long?

Task.Q0: I'm so happy to see you, too.
Task.Q1: I was worried that you wouldn’t recognize me.
Task.Q2: I worried that I wouldn't be recognized.
Task.Q3: It's a relief you recognize me.
Task.Guide: 언제 사무실에 한번 오라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
You {should} [visit the office] [sometime].
You must visit the office from time to time.
Why don't you visit the office sometime.
Why not visit the office sometime.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should visit the office sometime?

Task.Q0: I miss everyone.
Task.Guide: 모두가 보면 기뻐할 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Everyone] {would} [be happy to see you].
Everybody would be glad to see you.
Everyone will be happy to see you.
People are going to be happy to see you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying everyone would be happy to see me?
Task.Key: Everyone would be happy to see you.
Use_Key: Most people would be shocked to hear the news.
Everyone would be upset if you don't come.
They would be disappointed to find that they did not win.
Use_Guide: 대부분의 사람들은 이 뉴스에 충격을 받을 것이라고 말해 보세요.
네가 오지 않으면 모두 속상할 거라고 말해 보세요.
그들은 그들이 졌다는 것에 실망할 거라고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [be disappointed], [to find that they did not win]

Task.Q1: I might just do that.
Task.Q2: I will do that.
Task.Q3: Okay I will.
Task.Guide: 내 새 연락처를 주겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let me} [give you] [my new number].
I'll give you my new number.
This is my new number.
Here's my new number.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you going to give me your new number?

Task.Guide: 이 번호로 꼭 전화하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
You {should} [give me] [a call].
You should definitely call me.
You should call me sometime.
You must give me a call.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should give you a call?

Mission.Title: Let's look around more.
Mission.Description_Ko: 룸메이트 Royce와 함께 쇼핑을 하고 있는데, Royce가 새 TV에 관심을 보입니다. 더 좋은 가격을 찾아보자고 룸메이트를 설득해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are at a shopping mall with your roommate, Royce. She is interested in a new TV. Talk her through that you can find a better price.
Mission.Guide_En: Royce, what are you looking at?

Task.Q1: This television is a real bargain.
Task.Q2: This TV is a big bargain.
Task.Q3: The TV is so cheap.
Task.Guide: 아직도 좀 비싸다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It’s still a little expensive]}.
It's still a bit expensive.
A bit expensive, don't you think?
A little too expensive.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's still a little expensive?

Task.Guide: 더 좋은 가격이 있는지 좀 더 둘러보자고 제안해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let’s} [look around more] [for a better price].
Why don't we look for a better price?
We should look for a cheaper price.
Let's search for a cheaper price.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you want to look around more for a better price?

Task.Q1: What do you mean? It’s so cheap!
Task.Q2: Say that again? It's really cheap!
Task.Q3: Really? It's too cheap!
Task.Guide: 전자제품 시장에 가면 더 저렴할 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think it would} [be cheaper] [at an electronics market].
I think it is likely to be cheaper at a market for electronics.
Maybe it would be cheaper at the electronics market.
Perhaps it is going to be cheaper at the electronics market.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think it would be cheaper at an electronics market?
Task.Key: {I think it would} be cheaper at an electronics market.
Use_Key: I think it would be cheaper online.
I think it would be better to take the cheaper option.
I think it would be colder next week.
Use_Guide: 온라인상에서는 더 저렴할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
더 저렴한 옵션을 선택하는 것이 나을 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
다음 주에 더 추워질 것 같다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Maybe… but it might not be.
Task.Q2: Perhaps… but it may not be.
Task.Q3: You cannot be sure.
Task.Guide: 우리는 새 TV가 사실 필요하지 않다고, 지금 TV도 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
We {don’t} really [need it after all]. We [have a good TV now].
We don't need it actually. We already have a good TV.
We don't really need the TV you know. Ours is good enough.
It's not necessary to buy one now. We have a good enough TV.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we don't really need it after all?

Task.Q1: I guess you are right.
Task.Q2: You're right, I guess.
Task.Q3: You're right.
Task.Guide: 더 큰 TV를 사면 좋겠지만 우리는 돈을 저축해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It would} [be nicer to have a bigger one], but [we should save our money].
It woud be nice to have a larger one, but we really should save money.
Yes, even though it would be nice to have a bigger TV, we need to save a lot of money.
Yes, although it would be nice to have a larger TV, we should save as much money as possible.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean it would be nicer to have a bigger one but we should save our money?

Complete.Reaction: Okay, let's move on.

content_name: What do you usually do on Saturday?

Mission.Title: What do you usually do on Saturday?
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Jason에게 주말에 하는 일을 묻고, 같이 테니스를 치러 가자고 제안해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Ask your colleague Jason about what he does on the weekend. And ask him if he wants to play tennis together.

Task.Q1: I can't wait for the weekend.
Task.Q2: It's finally Friday.
Task.Q3: Friday, yay!
Task.Guide: Jason에게 토요일에 보통 뭐 하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What do you} [usaully] [do] [on Saturday?]
How do you spend your saturday?
On saturday, what is your daily routine?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what do I usually do on Saturday?

Task.Q0: I usually go for a run in the morning.
Task.Q1: What do you usually do on Saturday?
Task.Q2: What about you?
Task.Q3: You?
Task.Guide: 보통 영화를 본다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I usually} [watch] [a movie].
I usually go see a movie.
I usually see a movie.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you usually watch a movie?
Task.Key: I {usually} watch a movie.

Mission.Title: Boy things and girl things

Mission.Description_En: You are talking about gender role with your husband Steve. Tell Steve to help out around the house.

Task.Guide: 이것은 어떻냐고 물으면서 사랑스럽지 않냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: But what if it's a boy?

Task.Guide: 분홍색 입는 것이 무슨 문제냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Guide: 어떤 성별에나 잘 어울릴 것이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it will look good on any baby?

Task.Q0: But it'll be confusing for everyone who sees the baby.
Task.Q1: Also I don't want him growing up confused about the difference between boy thing and girl things.
Task.Q2: Boys should not be wearing the color pink.
Task.Q3: I don't want to confuse our son.
Task.Guide: 그 말의 의도가 정확히 무엇이냐고 물어보세요.

Mission.Title: The price of globalization
Mission.Description_Ko: 도움을 주러 온 Sandra에게 고마움을 표하면서 그녀와 함께 요즘 경제 상황에 대하여 이야기 하세요.
Mission.Description_En: Thank Sandra for coming down to help you and talk with her about the current economic situation.
Mission.Guide_En: Sandra, thanks again for coming down here today.

Task.Q0: My pleasure.

{Any help you could give us} is [definitely worth it], [especially these days].

Furthermore, many people are having trouble paying for the things they need.

많은 사람들이 외국어를 배우기 위해 고군분투 중이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I didn't think it was that bad.

Task.Q2: The richer are getting richer while the poor keep getting poorer.
Task.Q3: Wage gaps are high.

Task.Q0: I didn't realize.

Task.Q3: Many people are suffering financially.

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_제대로 발음하자! : B & V편

Description.Description_Ko: 자주 혼동되는 /B/와 /V/발음. AI 튜터와 마지막으로 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the confusing pronunciations in English of {"/B/ and /V/"} for the last time with me. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Betty beat a bit of butter to make a better batter than before.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Betty beat a bit of butter to make a better batter than before.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Vicky and violet, vowed venegeance vigorously after Victorian army invaded their country.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Vicky and violet, vowed venegeance vigorously after Victorian army invaded their country.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Betty loved Violet's velvet vest best but Betty never borrowed it from Violet.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Betty loved Violet's velvet vest best but Betty never borrowed it from Violet.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Brother Brick should visit brother Vincent's house to play basketball but big violent bugs stopped him.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Brother Brick should visit brother Vincent's house to play basketball but big violent bugs stopped him.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Queen Victoria banned beer so valley beer of Vermont village became even more valuable.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Queen Victoria banned beer so valley beer of Vermont village became even more valuable.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The victorious vocalist wore a brown braided vest and violet velvet boots to the best vocal award ceremony.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The victorious vocalist wore a brown braided vest and violet velvet boots to the best vocal award ceremony.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 혼동되는 /B/ /V/ 발음을 이제 정말 마스터하셨네요! 축하합니다. :)
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You’ve mastered some of confusing pronunciation in English. Congratulations!

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_해외에서 살아남기 : 집 구하기편

Description.Description_Ko: {"해외에서 살아남기 : 집 구하기편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Living Abroad : Finding an apt."}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 해외에서 집을 구해보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's find a house abroad.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Can I help you?

Quiz.Answer_Set: What kind of room do you have?

I like it.
I love it.
