같이 수영장에 가고 싶은지 의향을 물어보세요.
같이 커피를 마시고 싶은지 의향을 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: but I don't really feel like baseball.
Task.Q1: How about catching a movie instead?
Task.Q2: How about going to a movie instead?
Task.Q3: How about a movie instead?
Task.Guide: 그것도 좋다고 말하고, 요즘 뭐가 상영되고 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: What's playing?

Task.Q0: I really want to see The Lucky one.
Task.Q1: or there is the new X-Men movie.
Task.Q2: or the new X-Men movie is playing, too.
Task.Q3: or the new X-Men movie.
Task.Guide: 엑스맨을 보러 가자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Why don't we} [go see] [the X-Men movie?]
Let's go to the X-Men movie.
Do you want to go watch the X-Men movie?
Shall we go and see the X-Men movie?
Task.Are_you_saying: Why don't we go see the X-Men movie?

Complete.Reaction: Okay, let's go!

Mission.Title: Home Entertainment
Mission.Description_Ko: 아내가 말했던 TV를 보러 갔습니다. 구매를 원하는 아내에게 정말 필요한지, 어디에 둘 것인지 등을 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You went to see a TV that your spouse were telling you about. Ask her if you really need one and where you can put.
Mission.Guide_En: Hey, what are you looking at?

Task.Q1: Would you look at that?
Task.Q2: Could you look at that?
Task.Q3: Come and look at that.
Task.Guide: 아내에게 이게 나한테 말했던 TV냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is this} [the TV] [that you were telling me about?]
This is the TV that you told me before, right?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean is this the TV that I was telling you about?

Task.Q1: Can you imagine putting this one in our living room?
Task.Q2: It would be so awesome if you put this one in our living room.
Task.Q3: I want to put this one in our living room.
Task.Guide: 60인치 TV가 정말 필요하냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do we really} [need] [a 60-inch TV?]
Do you really think we need a 60-inch TV?
Are you sure we need a 60-inch TV?
I'm not sure why we need a 60-inch TV.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if we really need a 60-inch TV?

Task.Q1: It will be just like we were watching it in the theater.
Task.Q2: It will be just like the theater.
Task.Q3: It'll be like the theater.
Task.Guide: 어디에 둘 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Where] {are we going to} [put it?]
Where can we put that thing?
Where do you think we can put it?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean where are we going to put it?

Task.Q1: I was thinking on the wall between the bookshelves.
Task.Q2: How about the wall between the bookshelves.
Task.Q3: The wall between the bookshelves.
Task.Guide: 그럼 어머니가 주신 사진은 어디에 둘 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
But then, {what are we going to do with} [the picture] [mom gave us?]
But then where are we going to put the picture mom gave us?
Then, where should we put the picture mom gave us?
Task.Are_you_saying: Where are we going to put the picture Mom gave us?
Task.Key: {What are we going to do with} the picture?
Use_Key: What are we going to do with your old car?
What are we going to do with the wardrobe?
What are we going to do with your old smartphone?
Use_Guide: 쓰던 차는 어떻게 할 거냐고 물어보세요.
옷장은 어떻게 할 거냐고 물어보세요.
쓰던 스마트폰을 어떻게 할 거냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: We could find a place for it somewhere.
Task.Q1: This even has a setting that can display whatever picture we want on the wall.
Task.Q2: With this, we can have whatever picture we want on the wall.
Task.Q3: This will show us whatever picture we want on the wall.
Task.Guide: 이미 계획을 다 세운 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I've really thought this through?

Complete.Reaction: Actually, I have. It will be so good for us!

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_원서 읽기 : The Necklace

Description.Description_Ko: AI 튜터와 마지막으로 {"The Necklace"}에 나오는 문장들을 한번 더 읽어볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the quotes from The Necklace you've learned. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The girl was one of those pretty and charming young creatures who sometimes are born, as if by a slip of fate, into a family of clerks.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The girl was one of those pretty and charming young creatures who sometimes are born, as if by a slip of fate, into a family of clerks.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {She dressed plainly because she could not dress well, but she was unhappy as if she had really fallen from a higher station.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: She dressed plainly because she could not dress well, but she was unhappy as if she had really fallen from a higher station.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {She had no gowns, nop jewels, nothing. And she loved nothing but that. She felt made for that.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: She had no gowns, nop jewels, nothing. And she loved nothing but that. She felt made for that.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {But one evening her husband reached home with a truimphant air and holding a large envelope in his hand.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: But one evening her husband reached home with a truimphant air and holding a large envelope in his hand.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Instead of being delighted, as her husband had hoped, she threw the invitation on the table crossly, muttering.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Instead of being delighted, as her husband had hoped, she threw the invitation on the table crossly, muttering.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {By a violent effort she conquered her grief and replied in a calm voice, while she wiped her wet cheeks.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: By a violent effort she conquered her grief and replied in a calm voice, while she wiped her wet cheeks.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The day of the ball drew near and Madame Loisel seemed sad, uneasy, anxious. Her frock was ready, however.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The day of the ball drew near and Madame Loisel seemed sad, uneasy, anxious. Her frock was ready, however.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"~ is on me"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "~ is on me."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"for here / to go"}는 "먹고 가다 / 포장해가다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_like & want로 의사 표현하기

Title.Title_En: Expressing what I like and what I want

Description.Description_Ko: {"Like & Want로 의사 표현하기"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Expressing what I like and what I want"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: like와 want를 이용하여 내가 좋아하고 원하는 것을 말해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's make sentences with the verb, like and want.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you like pizza?
Quiz.Guide: {"Yes, I"}를 이용해 {"네, 저는 피자를 좋아합니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, I like pizza.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you like coffee?
Quiz.Guide: {"No, I"}를 이용해 {"아니요, 저는 커피를 좋아하지 않습니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: No, I don't like coffee.

Quiz.Reaction: Oh, you don't like coffee. I see.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you want to have this smartphone?
Quiz.Guide: {"Yes, I"}를 이용해 {"네, 저는 이 스마트폰을 갖고 싶습니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, I want to have this smartphone.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you want to study?
Quiz.Guide: {"No, I"}를 이용해 {"아니요, 저는 공부하고 싶지 않습니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: No, I don't want to study.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, do you like playing soccer?
Quiz.Guide: {"Yes, I"}를 이용해 {"네, 저는 축구하는 것을 좋아합니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, I like playing soccer.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you want that jacket?
Quiz.Guide: {"No, I"}를 이용해 {"아니요, 저는 저 재킷을 원하지 않습니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: No, I don't want that jacket.

content_name: What are you going to do tonight?

Mission.Title: What are you going to do tonight?
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Jake의 오늘밤 계획에 대해 이야기를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: With your friend, Jake, talk about his plan for tonight.

Task.Guide: 오늘밤에 무엇을 할 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What are you going to} [do] [tonight?]
What is your plan for tonight?
What will you do tonight?
What is your plan for tonight?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what am I going to do tonight?
Task.Key: {What are you going to} do tonight?
Use_Key: What are you going to do after retirement?
What are you going to buy at the mall?
What are you going to drink with your steak?
Use_Guide: 은퇴 후에 뭐 할 건지 물어보세요.
쇼핑몰에서 무엇을 살 건지 물어보세요.
당신의 스테이크와 함께 무엇을 마실 건지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I'm going to go to a dance party.
Task.Q2: I will go to a dance party.
Task.Q3: I'm going to a dance party.
Task.Guide: 파티가 어디냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying where is the party going to be?

Task.Q1: It will be at Mary’s house.
Task.Q2: At Mary’s house.
Task.Q3: Mary’s house.
Task.Guide: 누구하고 같이 가냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Who are you going to go with?]}
Who are you going to accompany?
Are you going there with someone?
Is there anybody you will go with?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean who am I going to go with?

Task.Q1: I'm going with Alice.
Task.Q2: Alice is going with me.
Task.Q3: Alice.
Task.Guide: 확실하냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Are you sure?]}
Did you talk to her?
Did she say yes?
Did you ask her?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say am I sure?

Task.Guide: Alice는 오늘 시간이 안 되는 걸로 알고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm pretty sure} [Alice is not available] [tonight].
I heard that Alice cannot come tonight.
She told me she wouldn't be able to come tonight.
I thought she is not coming tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are sure Alice is not available tonight?

Complete.Reaction: Really? Oh no, I need to talk to her.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_해외에서 살아남기 : 전자기기편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 전자기기와 관련하여 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression related to the electronic device.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"go over"}는 "넘다, 초과하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "go over" is an expression telling what you use too much or break.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"go over"}와 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "go over." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"go over"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "go over."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"connect to ~"}은 "~에 연결하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "connect to ~" is an expression telling what you want to connect to.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"connect to ~"}와 함께 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "connect to ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"connect to ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "connect to ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 대화에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that you can use in conversation.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"~ is not working"}은 "~ 가 제대로 작동하지 않다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "~ is not working" is an expression to tell about broken things.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"~ is not working"}과 함께 쓸 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "~ is not working."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"~ is not working"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "~ is not working."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"내 노트북 PC"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"내 노트북 PC가 작동하지 않는다"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 전자기기 사용에 활용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used when you are using electronic devices.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 완료되었으니, 튜터와 함께 더 많은 표현을 배워보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start. Go and start learning more useful expressions with your tutor.

Mission.Title: She just left for lunch
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 동료 Gloria가 Terry라는 또 다른 동료를 찾는데, 부재중입니다. Gloria의 메시지를 받고, Terry가 돌아오자마자 전달하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your colleague, Gloria, is looking for Terry, another colleague. As Terry is not available, take Gloria's message for Terry.

Task.Q1: Do you know if Terry is in the office?
Task.Q2: Is Terry in the office?
Task.Q3: Terry inside?
Task.Guide: 그녀는 방금 점심 먹으러 나갔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, I’m sorry. {[She just left for lunch]}.
No, I'm sorry. She left for lunch just now.
Sorry. She seems to have left for lunch
Sorry. She has left for lunch.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she just left for lunch?

Task.Q1: Could I leave a message for her?
Task.Q2: Could I leave her a message?
Task.Q3: Leave a message then?
Task.Guide: 펜을 가져올 테니 잠깐만 기다려 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Wait a minute]. {[I’ll get a pen]}.
Wait. I'll go get a pen.
Yes. I'll get me a pen.
Yes. Let me get a pen.
Task.Are_you_saying: You want me to wait a minute?

Task.Q1: Please tell her that Gloria called.
Task.Q2: Tell her that Gloria gave her a call.
Task.Q3: Tell her that Gloria called her.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 하겠다고 답변해 주세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[No problem]}.
Sure no problem.
Sure thing.
Okay I will.

Task.Q1: And could you have her call me back when she has time? It’s important.
Task.Q2: Tell her also to call me when she is free. It's important.
Task.Q3: Yes and tell her to call me it's important.
Task.Guide: 그녀가 돌아오자마자 알려주겠다고 말해 주세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’ll} [tell her] [as soon as she comes in].
I'll tell her when she comes.
I'll tell her immediately.
I'll tell her right away.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll tell her as soon as she comes in?
Task.Key: {I’ll} tell her as soon as she comes in.
Use_Key: I'll give her your contact information.
We will grant them their wish.
They will inform me of the decision when it is finalized.
Use_Guide: 그녀에게 당신의 연락처를 주겠다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 그들의 소원을 들어줄 것이라고 말해 보세요.
그들은 최종 결정이 되면 나에게 알려줄 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [inform me of], [the decision], [when it is finalized]

Complete.Reaction: Thanks a lot.

description: 09.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 서바이벌 워킹홀리데이_이 문구류는 무엇인가요?

Description.Description_Ko: {"이 문구류는 무엇인가요?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"What is this? : Stationery"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 문구류들을 나타내는 단어들을 말해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about the words of stationery.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"This is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 연필입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a pencil.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, what is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"This is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 지우개입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is an eraser.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, what is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"This is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 연필깎이입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a pencil sharpener.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are these?
Quiz.Guide: {"These are"}를 이용하여 {"이것들은 크래용(색연필)입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: These are crayons.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"This is"}를 이용하여 {"이것은 (접착용) 풀입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a glue stick.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are these then?
Quiz.Guide: {"These are"}를 이용하여 {"이것은 가위입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: These are scissors.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Next. What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"This is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 필통입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a pencil case.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"This is"}를 이용해 {"이것은 노트입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a notebook.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Finding Time 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 금요일 일정에 대해 말하면서 두바이 보내주겠다는 제안에도 답을 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about Friday plans and respond to suggestions of visiting Dubai.

Task.Q1: Good to see you. Thanks for coming in.
Task.Q2: Nice seeing you. Thanks for coming.
Task.Q3: Welcome and thanks for coming.
Task.Guide: Mr. Clark을 만나서 반갑다고 말하면서 무엇을 해 드릴 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Nice to see you too, Mr. Clark}. [What can I do for you?]
Nice to see you as well, Mr. Clark. What can I do?
No problem. Nice to meet you. Is there anything I can do?
No problem. Nice meeting you. Is there something I can do?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what you can do for me?

Task.Q1: Tom, what's your schedule like for Friday?
Task.Q2: I want to know your schedule for Friday.
Task.Q3: Tell me your schedule Friday.
Task.Guide: 정기 팀 회의가 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, {[I have my regular team meeting]}.
Well, I will have the regular team meeting.
I've got the regular team meeting.
Maybe the regular team meeting.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have your regular team meeting?

Task.Q0: Nothing important?
Task.Q1: Have you ever been to the UAE?
Task.Q2: Have you visited the UAE before?
Task.Q3: Visited the UAE yet?
Task.Guide: 아니라고 말하면서 몇 년 동안 가고 싶어하긴 했다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, but {I've been} [wanting to go for years].
No, but I wanted to go for years.
No, but I did want to go for a long time.
Not yet, but I always wanted to go.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you've been wanting to go for years?
Task.Key: No, but {I've been} wanting to go for years.
Use_Key: They've been traveling there for a long time.
You've been talking to me for an hour.
I've been preparing for an exam since last year.
Use_Guide: 그들은 오랫동안 그곳을 여행해왔다고 말해보세요.
너는 나한테 한 시간동안 이야기를 해왔다고 말해보세요.
나는 작년부터 시험을 대비해왔다고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: Let's fix that; I want you to visit our Dubai branch and review its operations. You leave first thing Friday.
Task.Q2: It's time to go then. I want you visiting our Dubai branch to review operations there.
Task.Q3: Go then. You should review operations of the Dubai branch.
Task.Guide: 어떻게 티켓을 구입할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How can I} [get my ticket?]
How can I purchase a ticket to go there?
How can I buy tickets to get there?
How may I get tickets for Dubai?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how you can get your ticket?

Complete.Reaction: I'll have my secretary give you details.

content_name: Speak Like a Native : Greetings & Introductions

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"오랜만에 보다, 한동안 보지 못했다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?

Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with your tutor.

Mission.Title: I Need A New Ride.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신 새 차를 사러 자동차 대리점에 갔습니다. 대리점 직원과 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are at a dealer shop to buy a new car. Have a conversation with a dealer.

Task.Q0: Welcome to our shop.
Task.Q1: What can I do for you?
Task.Q2: How may I help you?
Task.Q3: May I help you?
Task.Guide: 새 차를 구입하고 싶어서 왔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm in the market for a new car]}.
I'm here to look at some cars.
I'm here to buy a new car.
I want a new car.
I need a new car.
I want to buy a new car.
I need to buy a new car.
I'm interested in buying a new car.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're in the market for a new car?

Task.Q0: I certainly can help you.
Task.Q1: What car do you have in mind?
Task.Q2: Is there a car you are considering?
Task.Q3: Have you thought about any cars you're interested in?
Task.Guide: 작은 차를 찾고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm looking for} [something compact].
I'm considering something small.
I want a car not too big.
I just want a small car.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are looking for something compact?
Task.Key: {I'm looking for} something compact.
Use_Key: I'm looking for a diffeent size.
I'm looking for the restroom.
I'm looking for my son.

Mission.Title: Getting ready
Mission.Description_Ko: 허리케인이 온다는 기상예보가 있습니다. 친구 Tim에게 어떻게 대비해야 하는지 듣고 질문해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: The weather report says a hurricane is expected. Your friend Tim is explaning what to do in the event of a hurricane. Listen to him and ask questions about it.

Task.Q1: The weather report says a hurricane is brewing off the coast and is expected to touch land in 48 hours.
Task.Q2: The weather report says a hurricane is forming and is expected to touch land in 48 hours.
Task.Q3: According to the weather report, a hurricane is expected to touch land in 48 hours.
Task.Guide: 허리케인이 올 때에는 상하지 않는 음식, 휴대가능한 물, 구급상자가 있는지 확인해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[In the event of a hurricane], you {should check to see that} you [have a supply of non-perishable food, potable water and first aid kit].
In the event of a hurricane, you must check that you have non-perishable food, potable water, and first aid kit.
Just in case a hurricane strikes, you should check to see that you have a supply of long-lasting food, drinkable water, and first aid kit.
To be ready for a hurricane, check to see that you have enough food, water, and first aid kit.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I should chack to see that I have a supply of non-perishable food, potable water and first aid kit?

Task.Guide: 그리고 비상금을 챙겨두는 것을 잊지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[And don't forget] [a stash of cash]}.
And don't forget to reserve money.
And remember to store cash.
Also remember to have a supply of cash.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying don't forget a stash of cash?

Task.Q1: You really are organized.
Task.Q2: You are really neat.
Task.Q3: So organized!
Task.Guide: 너도 그럴 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set: {[You can be, too]}.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I can be, too?

Task.Guide: 이번에 내 옆에 있으면 뭐가 필요한지 알게 될 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Just stick by me during this hurricane], {you will} [learn all you need to know].
Just stay near me during this hurricane and you will learn everything you need to know.
Just stay close to me during this hurricane, I will teach you all you need to know.
Just stay with me during this hurricane and I will let you know all you need to remember.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying just stick by you during this hurricane and I will learn all I need to know?

Task.Guide: 허리케인이 왔을 때 해야 할 일과 하지 말아야 할 일을 아는 것은 생사가 걸린 문제일 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Knowing the do's and don'ts during a hurricane] {can be} [a question of life or death].
Knowing the do's and don't s during a hurricane can save your life.
Know the do's and dont's during a hurricane and stay alive.
Knowing what to do and what not to do during a hurricane may determine whether you live or die.
Knowing what to do and what not to do during a hurricane is critical to your life.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean knowing the do's and don'ts during a hurricane can be a question of life or death?

Task.Q1: What else should I know?
Task.Q2: What else to know?
Task.Q3: What else?
Task.Guide: 허리케인이 오기 전에 먼저 할 일은 가장 가까운 대피소에 가는 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{The first thing you should do} [before a hurricane hits] is to [go to the nearest hurricane shelter].
The first thing to do before a hurricane hits is to get to the nearest hurricane shelter.
First, go to the nearest hurricane shelter before a hurricane hits.
First, before a hurricane hits, get to the nearest hurricane shelter.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the first thing I should do before a hurricane hits is to go to the nearest hurricane shelter?
Task.Key: {The first thing you should do} is to go to the nearest hurricane shelter.
Use_Key: The first thing we should do is to make a plan.
The second thing he should do is to make sure everyone attends.
The last thing they should do is to inform everyone about the venue.
Use_Guide: 우리가 가장 먼저 해야 하는 것은 게획을 세우는 거라고 말해 보세요.
그가 두번째로 해야하는 것은 모두가 참석하는지 확인하는 거라고 말해 보세요.
그들이 해야 하는 마지막 일은 모두에게 장소를 알리는 거라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 그리고 담당자들이 나가도 안전하다고 할 때까지 그곳에 머물어야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[And you should stay put] {until} you're [informed by those in charge] that it's safe to leave.
And you should stay put until those who are in charge tell you it's safe to leave.
And you shouldn't move until you're told by those in charge that it's safe to go.
And you shouldn't leave until those who are responsible tell you it's okay to go out.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I should stay put until I'm informed by those in charge that it's safe to leave?

Task.Q1: So do you know where the nearest shelter is?
Task.Q2: Do you know the nearest shelter?
Task.Q3: Where is the nearest shelter?
Task.Guide: 이 건물 안에 하나가 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We [have one] [right here in the building]}.
We have on in this building actually.
There is one right here in the buliding.
The building has one right here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we have one right here in the building?

Complete.Reaction: That's convenient. You know what? I'll stick by you.

Mission.Title: How Was Your Trip?
Mission.Description_Ko: 여행을 다녀온 Kelly와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Kelly who came back from her trip.

Task.Q0: How was your week off?
Task.Q1: Did you do anything special?
Task.Q2: Did you any special plans?
Task.Q3: What fun things did you do?
Task.Guide: 결국 집에서 시간을 보냈다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I {ended up hanging out] [at home]}.
I eventually stayed home.
I happened to spend time at home.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you ended up hanging out at home?
Task.Key: I {ended up} hanging out at home.
Use_Key: I ended up fighting with my brother.
She ended up asking him for help.
We ended up staying at the same hotel.
Use_Guide: 나는 결국 남동생과 싸웠다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 결국 그에게 도움을 요청했다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 결국 같은 호텔에서 머물렀다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: My family had the time of our lives in hawaii.
Task.Q2: My family had a blast in Hawaii.
Task.Q3: My family had a great time in Hawaii.
Task.Guide: 와, 정말 좋았을 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Wow, {[it must have been real nice]}.
Wow, the trip must have been amazing.
Wow, it must have been a wonderful trip.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the trip must have been real nice?

Task.Q0: We rented a car and took a lot of day trips
Task.Q1: It's a coastal highway with some amazing views.
Task.Q2: It's a coastal highway with beatiful scenery.
Task.Q3: It's a highway along the beach with fantastic views.
Task.Guide: 꽤 바쁘게 보낸 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It sounds like} [you kept pretty busy].
I seems like your trip was non-stop.
It sounds like you had a quite a busy trip.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it sounds like I kept pretty busy?

Task.Q0: There was a lot to see.
Task.Q1: But we made sure to leave room for a few beach days.
Task.Q2: But we saved some time to spend on the beach.
Task.Q3: But we spared some days for the beach.
Task.Guide: 사무실 복귀가 힘들겠다라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It must be hard] [to go back to the office]}.
It must be difficult to come back to work.
It must be tough coming back to work.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it must be hard to go back to the office?

Task.Q1: I should start saving up for my vacation too.
Task.Q2: I should start preparing money for my next vacation too.
Task.Q3: I've decided to save money for my vacation from now on.
Task.Guide: 다음에는 같이 해외로 휴가가자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let's} [go abroad together] [on our next vacation].
How about going abroad on our next vacation?
What do you say we go abroad on our next vacation?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking me to go abroad with you on our next vacation?

Complete.Reaction: Sounds good to me.

Mission.Title: I found this great website
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 친구 Patricia는 음악을 다운받을 수 있는 새 웹사이트를 찾았습니다. 새로 나온 음악에 대해 이야기 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Patricia has found a new website where she can download music. Have a conversation with her on new music.

Task.Q0: I've been all over the place trying out new things.
Task.Q1: And I discovered  a cool place where you can download music and movies.
Task.Q2: And I found this great website for downloading music and movies.
Task.Q3: And I found a new way to get music and movies.
Task.Guide: 인터넷에서 음악을 다운받는 거에 별로 관심이 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I've got no qualms about downloading stuff off the internet.
{I don't really care much about} [downloading anything] [from the net].
I don't take it so serious downloading things from the net.
I'm not really interested in downloading things from the net.
I don't really download things from the net.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you really don't care much about downloading things from the net?

Task.Guide: 어차피 가수들이 앨범 발매를 통해 수입을 만들지 못한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
The artists will hardly see a dime from their albums anyways.
[The artists] {barely} [make any money out of their albums].
The artists make so little money from their albums anyways.
It's so hard for the artists now to make good money out of their albums.
The artists are having trouble making good money out of their albums these days.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that artists barely make any money out of their albums?

Task.Q0: But It's got all the latest tracks from everyone on the charts.

Task.Q1: I bet you will enjoy using the website, too.
Task.Q2: I think you will like the website.
Task.Q3: You will like it.
Task.Guide: 새 음악 얘기가 나와서 말인데 Bassnectar의 새 노래를 들어봤냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Speaking of new music], {did you have a chance to} [listen to the new track of Bassnectar?]
As we are talking about new music, did you happen to come across the new track of Bassnectar?
Since you talk about new music, have you had a chance to check out Bassnectar's new song?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean did I have a chance to listen to the new track of Bassnectar?
Task.Key: {Did you have a chance to} listen to the new track of Bassnectar?
Use_Key: Did you have a chance to talk to her?
Did you have a chance to go that concert?
Did you have a chance to meet him?
Use_Guide: 그녀에게 말할 기회가 있었냐고 말해 보세요
그 콘서트에 갈 기회가 있었냐고 물어보세요
그를 만날 기회가 있었냐고 물어보세요

Task.Q0: Who's that?
Task.Q1: Sorry, I'm afraid I don't know the singer.
Task.Q2: I don't think I know the singer.
Task.Q3: I don't know who that is.
Task.Guide: 그럼 네 재생목록에는 어떤 음악들이 있냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I have on my playlist?

Complete.Reaction: Would you like to see? I'll show you now.

content_name: I've Replayed it Again and Again.

Mission.Title: I've Replayed it Again and Again.
Mission.Description_Ko: 실수로 승진 기회를 놓쳤다고 생각하는 동료 Melinda와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with your colleague Melinda who thinks she has lost her chance for promotion.

Task.Q0: I completely botched things up with the boss.
Task.Q1: I'm afraid I've lost my chance for a promotion.
Task.Q2: I think I've just said farewell to my promotion opportunity.
Task.Q3: There goes my promotion.
Task.Guide: 그래서 모두가 다시 시작할 수 있는 기회(리셋 버튼)를 원하는 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Everybody wants a reset button]}.
All people wishes for a reset button.
Everyone wants to go back in time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying everyone wants a reset button?

Task.Q0: I misplaced the files for the big case I'd been researching for months.
Task.Q1: I've replayed what happened again and again.
Task.Q2: I tried to restore my memory repeatedly.
Task.Q3: I kept on thinking back over and over again.
Task.Guide: 이런 힘든 시간을 보내야 해서 안타깝다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sorry} [you're having such a hard time].
I'm sorry you're going through such trouble.
I'm sorry that you're undergoing such harsh times.
Task.Are_you_saying: You are sorry I'm having such a hard time?
Task.Key: {I'm sorry} you are having such a hard time.
Use_Key: I'm sorry you have to move for work.
I'm sorry you had to break up with your girlfriend.
I'm sorry you didn't get the promotion.
Use_Guide: 네가 일때문에 이사가는 게 안타깝다고 말해 보세요.
네가 여자친구와 헤어지게 된 게 안타깝다고 말해 보세요.
네가 이번에 승진하지 못한 게 안타깝다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I just can't understand how I screwed up so royally.
Task.Q1: This wouldn't have happened if I had back up copies.
Task.Q2: If only I'd made back up copies I wouldn't be in this mess.
Task.Q3: I should have made back up copies and I could have been saved.
Task.Guide: 사람이 실수할 수도 있지라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[People make mistakes]}.
Nobody is perfect.
We are all imperfect people.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying everybody makes mistakes?

Task.Q1: You should go ahead home.
Task.Q2: You should get off work early.
Task.Q3: You'd better go home early.
Task.Guide: 도움이 필요하면 내 번호 아니까 연락하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[You have my cell] {if} [you need someone in your corner].
You know my number, so call me if you need a hand.
You know where to call when you need help.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I can calll you when I need help?

Task.Q1: But I think I can somehow find a way myself.
Task.Q2: But I'll take care of this on my own.
Task.Q3: But I'll handle this myself.
Task.Guide: 무리하지는 말라고  말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Don't push yourself so hard]}.
Take it easy.
Don't burn yourself out.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that I shouldn't push myself so hard?

Complete.Reaction: Don't forget it next time.

Mission.Title: The Day I've Been Having.
Mission.Description_Ko: 비행기를 놓친 친구 Irene과 무슨 일이 있었는지 대화를 나눠보세요
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Irene is telling you that she has missed her flight. Have a conversation on what has happened to her today.

Task.Q0: You won't believe the day I've been having.
Task.Q1: My flight turned out to take off 90 minutes later than the scheduled time.
Task.Q2: My plane was postponed for over 90 minutes.
Task.Q3: My flight was delayed by more than and a half.
Task.Guide: 가끔 그런 일이 생기기도 한다고  말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That happens time to time]}.
It happens sometimes.
I happens once in a while.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that happens time to time?

Task.Q0: My connecting flight was already preparing to take off.
Task.Q1: Suffice to say, I missed my flight.
Task.Q2: In short, I couldn't get on my flight.
Task.Q3: Briefly, I had to say bye to my plane.
Task.Guide: 그래서 어떻게 했는지 물어보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{[So what did you do?]}
How did you handle the situation?
How did you cope with the problem?
What actions did you take?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I did?

Task.Q0: I had to check in again for a new boarding pass.
Task.Q1: All of the fights today are overbooked except for a red eye.
Task.Q2: There are no flights available today except for a night time flight.
Task.Q3: None of the flights are available today except for a late night flight.
Task.Guide: 시간 안에 도착할 수 있을 거 같냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you think} [you can get there] [on time?]
Is it possible for you to get there when you're supposed to?
Can you get there on time?
Task.Are_you_saying: Do I think I can get there on time?

Task.Q1: The flight will put me in London at 4a.m. tomorrow
Task.Q2: I'm going to land in London tomorrow at 4a.m.
Task.Q3: I'll get to London at 4a.m. tomorrow.
Task.Guide: 다행이라고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What a relief]}.
That's comforting.
How fortunate.

Task.Q1: At least they bumped me up to executive class.
Task.Q2: The good thing is that they upgraded my seat to executive class.
Task.Q3: Fortunately, they moved my class to executive.
Task.Guide: 당연히 그렇게 해줘야 한다고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That's the least they can do]}.
They better do that.
They should definitely do that.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's the least they can do?

Task.Q0: Now that I got a comfortable seat.
Task.Q1: I can get some shut eye during the flight.
Task.Q2: I'll be able to sleep in throughout the flight.
Task.Q3: I can get some rest in the plane.
Task.Guide: 정말 정신없는 하루였겠다고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{[You must have had a hectic day]}.
What a crazy day you've been through
That must have a been a rough day for you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that I've had a hectic day?
Task.Key: You {must have had} a hectic day.
Use_Key: You must have been really busy.
He must have been disappointed.
They must have prepared for a long time.
Use_Guide: 정말 바빴을 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
그가 실망했을 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
그들은 오래 준비했을 거라고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Tell me all about it.

Mission.Title: A Score to Settle
Mission.Description_Ko: 미국인 여행객을 타켓으로 하는 납치사건이 계속 일어나고 있습니다. 납치사건을 폭력으로 대응해야한다고 생각하는 친구 David와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: There have been three kidnapping incidents targetting American tourists. Talk with David who thinks violence is necessary to cope with kidnapping

Task.Reaction: Did you watch the news last night?
Task.Q0: The news about a kidnapping incident.
Task.Q1: The news startled me.
Task.Q2: It was shocking
Task.Q3: I was so surprised.
Task.Guide: 리조트에서 일어난 커플 납치 사건을 말하는 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are you talking about} [the couple that was kidnapped from a resort?]
You mean the kidnapping incident at a resort?
The couple who was kidnapped from the resort?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you talking about the couple who was kidnapped from the resort?

Task.Q0: It was kind of hard to miss.
Task.Q1: They must have had it on every channel.
Task.Q2: All the channels were talking about case.
Task.Q3: It was on every channel.
Task.Guide: 이번달에만 세번째 납치사건이라고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{This is} [the third kidnapping] [this month].
It is the third time that kidnapping happened this month.
Kidnapping has occurred three times this month.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that this is the third kidnapping this month?

Task.Guide: 특히 미국인들이 이 뉴스를 달갑지 않게 생각하는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[The Americans] {don't seem} [too pleased at this news].
The Americans seem quite upset with the news.
The Americans got angry with the news.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that Americans don't seem too pleased at this news?

Task.Q0: It's the American tourists they've been targeting.
Task.Q1: We should just go in there with an army and settle the score.
Task.Q2: We have to strike with military power to make it even.
Task.Q3: We should take revenge on them.
Task.Guide: 폭력은 아무것도 해결해주지 않을 것 같다고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{I don't think} [any of this violence] will really [solve anything].
I think violence wouldn't make this situation any better.
Violence is not going to solve any of these problems.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that violence will not really solve anything?
Task.Key: {I don't think} any of this violence will really solve anything.
Use_Key: I don't think that will work.
I don't think that's a good idea.
I don’t think that's possible.
Use_Guide: 그 방법은 안될 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
그게 좋은 생각 같지 않다고 말해 보세요.
그게 가능할 것 같지 않다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: Would you say that if it were your family that they took?
Task.Q1: The guys know they can get away with it.
Task.Q2: They are confident that they won't be seen.
Task.Q3: They know that they won't get caught.
Task.Guide: 그래도 폭력이 어떤 결과를 낳는지 알지 않냐고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Still. {You've seen} [what violence does].
You know the outcome of violence.
We know the result of violence.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I've seen what violence does?

Task.Guide: 더 낳은 방법이 있을거라고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{There has to be} [a better solution] [to the problem].
I believe there is a better way of solving this problem.
There should be a better solution to the problem.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that there has to be a better solution to the problem?

Complete.Reaction: Well, I hope so.

Mission.Title: That's very healthy.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당근주스를 만들어 먹고 있는 당신. 친구 Jonathan이 들어오며 물어봅니다. 당근주스가 눈에 좋다고 알려주세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are drinking carrot juice that you just made. Your friend Jonathan is asking about it when coming in. Tell him that carrots are good for our eyes.

Task.Q1: What are you drinking?
Task.Q2: What is that drink you have?
Task.Q3: Are you drinking something?
Task.Guide: 당근 주스인데, 방금 만들어서 신선하고 설탕이 안 들어갔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[It’s carrot juice].  [I made it just now], {so} [it is fresh and with no sugar].
This is carrot juice. I made it fresh and there's no sugar in it like the juice bought in stores.
I am drinking carrot juice. I made it just now, so it is fresh and with no sugar, unlike the juice in stores.
Carrot juice. I just made it, so it is fresh. There's also no sugar in it like the juice in stores.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you made it just now so it is fresh and with no sugar?

Task.Q1: Too much sugar isn’t good for you.
Task.Q2: Too much sugar in fact is bad for you.
Task.Q3: Sugar is bad.
Task.Guide: 당근이 눈에 좋은 것을 알고 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Did you know that} [carrots are really good for] [your eyes?]
Did you know that carrots make your eyes healthier?
Did you know that carrots preserve and protect the eyes?
Were you aware that carrots are good for the eyes?
Have you noticed that carrots are good for the eyes?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did I know that carrots are really good for our eyes?
Task.Key: {Did you know that} carrots are really good for your eyes?
Use_Key: Did you know that we need to eat vegetables?
Did you know that drinking alcohol that often is not good for you?
Did you know that some of the food is rotten?
Use_Guide: 우리가 야채를 꼭 먹어야 하는 것을 알고 있는지 물어보세요.
그렇게 잦은 음주가 네기 좋지 않은 것을 알고 있는지 물어보세요.
음식 일부가 썩은 것을 알고 있는지 물어보세요.
Use_Hint: [drinking alcohol that often], [not good for you]

Task.Q0: My vision has been getting worse.
Task.Q1: Do you think carrot juice would help?
Task.Q2: Would carrot juice help?
Task.Q3: I may need carrot juice.
Task.Guide: 하루에 여러 잔을 마셔야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes. You {should} [drink multiple glasses of carrot juice] [a day].
Yes. You should have many carrots everyday.
I think so. You should have lots of vegetables in a day as well.
I think so. You should also consume a lot more vegetables in a day.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should drink multiple glasses of carrot juice a day?

Task.Q1: Could I try some carrot juice now?
Task.Q2: Could I try some now?
Task.Q3: Carrot juice now?
Task.Guide: 믹서기를 다시 꺼내겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {I’ll} [get the blender out] [again].
Yes I'll take the blender out once again.
Sure I can make that now. I'll bring out the blender again.
Sure I can make some for you now. Let me take out the blender again.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll get the blender out again?

Complete.Reaction: Oh, thanks! I can't wait.

content_name: He taught me all I know

Mission.Title: He taught me all I know
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 아들에게 어머니 사진을 보여주고 있습니다. 그녀가 좋은 교훈을 알려주셨고, 당신의 롤모델이었다고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are showing a picture of your mom to your son. Tell him that she taught good life lessons and she was your role model.

Task.Reaction: Hey, what are you looking at?
Task.Q0: What a great picture of all of us! Grandma, you and me.
Task.Q1: Are you looking at this picture of us?
Task.Q2: This is a picture of us.
Task.Q3: Nice picture.
Task.Guide: 아들에게 몇 해 전 이 여름을 기억하냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [remember this one], [a few summers ago?]
Do you remember this one from a few summers ago?
Do you remember this photo from a few summers ago?
This one from a few summers ago, do you remember?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying if I remember this one a few summers ago?

Task.Q0: What a great memory.
Task.Q1: Who was your greatest influence on your life?
Task.Q2: Who gave you the greatest influence on you?
Task.Q3: What was your motivation?
Task.Guide: 어머니한테 내 인생에서 가장 큰 영향을 받은 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
You know, {I'd say that} [my mom was] [the greatest influence on my life], hands down.
My mom was the greatest influence on my life for sure.
Actually, I want to say that my mom had the greatest influence on my life, hands down.
My mom by far had the greatest influence on my life for sure.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean that your mom was the greatest influence on your life?
Task.Key: {I'd say that} my mom was the greatest influence on my life.
Use_Key: I'd say that my colleague was my motivation.
I'd say that it was the best dinner ever in my life.
I'd say that the movie was quite interesting.
Use_Guide: 내 동료가 나의 동기부여였던 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
그것이 내 인생에서 가장 좋은 저녁식사였던 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
그 영화가 꽤 흥미로웠던 것 같다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 그녀에게 배운 교훈이 오늘 날의 나를 만들었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[The lessons I learned from her] {shaped me into} the person that I am today].
The lessons I learned from her made me the person I am today.
The lessons she taught me shaped me into the person that I am today.
I am the way I am today because of the lessons I learned from her.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she taught you many important things?

Task.Q0: Can you tell me more about grandma?
Task.Q1: I wish I'd gotten to know her better before.
Task.Q2: I wish we would have talked more.
Task.Q3: I miss my grandma.
Task.Guide: 할머니께서 내가 아는 모든 것을 알려주셨다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Grandma taught me] [all I know]}.
Grandma taught me everything I know.
I learned everything from grandma.
Grandma taught me all I know.
Everything I know came from grandma.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that she was the good teacher?

Task.Guide: 그녀는 내가 가장 최고의 사람과 용감한 사람이 되도록 격려했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{She also encouraged me to} [be the best] and [to be brave].
Also, she encouraged me to be the best person I could be and to be brave.
She also told me I should try to be the best and to have courage.
She also motivated me to try my best and have courage.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean she taught you how to be strong?

Task.Guide: 자라면서 그녀가 나의 롤모델이었던 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} [she was my role model] [growing up].
I guess she was the one I looked up to growing up.
I think she was my role model when I was young.
She was the one I wanted to be like growing up.
I wanted to be like her growing up.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you admired and respected her?

Task.Q0: I miss grandma.
Task.Q1: And I also want to be just like you when I grow up.
Task.Q2: And when I grow up, I want to be just like you.
Task.Q3: I hope I am strong and brave like you one day.
Task.Guide: 아들에게 너답게 행동하고 너의 꿈을 펼치길 원한다는 것을 명심하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Just remember that} {I want you to} [be your own pereson] and [follow your own dreams].
Just remember that I want you to be yourself and follow your own dreams.
Remember, I only want you to be yourself and follow your dreams.
Remember, it's important that you follow your own dreams, being your own person.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I should be my own person and follow my own dreams?

Complete.Reaction: Thank you, Dad. Yes, I will!

Mission.Title: It gives me goosebumps
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 April과 함께 귀신의 집 앞에 서 있습니다. April에게 들어가보자고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You and your friend April are standing in front of a haunted house. Tell April to go inside together.

Task.Guide: 저것 좀 보라면서 몇 백년은 된 게 틀림 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Get a look at that!} It [must be] [hundreds years old].
Look at that! It must be really old.
Get a look at that! It must be from hundreds of years ago.
Take a look at that! It must be hundreds of years old.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it looks hundreds years old?

Task.Guide: 대낮에 봐도 무서워 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It looks} [scary] [even in broad daylight].
It's scary even in bright daylight.
It looks creepy even in the day.
It looks bizarre even in bright day time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean it looks scary even in broad daylight?

Task.Q0: You are looking at the oldest building in the area.
Task.Q1: It's supposed to be haunted.
Task.Q2: Rumor is that the building is haunted.
Task.Q3: It may be haunted.
Task.Guide: 전혀 들어본 적 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I've never heard about it]}.
I never heard anythig about it.
I heard nothing about it.
There is nothing I heard about it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you haven't heard anything about it?

Task.Q0: Lots of people claim to have seen and heard strange things.
Task.Q1: Their stories make my hair stand on end.
Task.Q2: The stories send chills up my spine.
Task.Q3: The stories freak me out.
Task.Guide: 그것을 듣기만 해도 소름이 돋는다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Just hearing about it} [gives me goosebumps].
Just hearing you talk about it makes my skin crawl.
Just listening to you talk about it gives me goose flesh.
I got goosebumps just listening to you talk about it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you're having goosebumps now?
Task.Key: {Just hearing about it} gives me goosebumps.
Use_Key: Just hearing about it makes me cry.
Just hearing about it makes me smile.
Just hearing about it scares me.
Use_Guide: 그것을 듣기만 해도 눈물이 난다고 말해 보세요.
그것을 듣기만 해도 미소가 지어진다고 말해 보세요.
그것을 듣기만 해도 겁이 난다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 들어가 본 적 있냐고 물어보고 가보자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Have you ever been} [inside?] [Shall we go in?]
Have you ever gone in? Do you want to go in?
Did you have a chance to go inside? Should we try going in?
Were you ever inside? Do you want to try going in?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if we should go in?

Task.Q0: No to both questions.
Task.Q1: I don't want to spend good money to visit an old, scary building.
Task.Q2: I have better ways of spending my money.
Task.Q3: I would rather spend my money elsewhere.
Task.Guide: 재밌을 것 같다고 말하며 김 빠지게 하지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Sounds like fun!} [Don't be a spoil sport].
Sounds fun! Don't ruin it for me.
That sounds fun! Don't drag me down.
That sounds like it's fun! Don't make us feel bad.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying don't be a spoil sport?

Complete.Reaction: For heaven's sake! You're as white as a ghost. Go if you really want to, but count me out!

description: 24.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중고급_비즈니스_중고급 비즈니스 : 출장편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 표현들을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some expressions from the topic card first. Read after the AI tutor.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: be away on a business trip

Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you will learn through today's lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"출장으로 자리를 비우다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: be away on a business trip

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"왕복 항공편을 예약하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"회의 일정을 확인하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~이름으로 예약이 되어있다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업 준비를 마쳤으니 수업을 통해 더 많은 표현을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with the tutor.

Mission.Title: It's all in the numbers
Mission.Description_Ko: 복권에 당첨된 당신! 친구 Paula에게 이 소식을 전하고, 당첨 소감과 가장 먼저 하고 싶은 일에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You just won the lottery. Tell your friend Paula about the news. Also talk about how you feel and what you'd like to do first with the money you won.

Task.Q1: You sure are chipper today.
Task.Q2: You're in a good mood today.
Task.Q3: You seem very happy today.
Task.Guide: Paula에게 그 말이 맞다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You can} [say that] [again].
You have no idea.
I couldn't be happier.
I'm ecstatic.
I'm very happy today.
You're totally right.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I can say that again?

Mission.Title: A star-studded evening
Mission.Description_Ko: 어젯밤 오스카 시상식을 본 당신. 친구 Layla와 여배우 Rebecca Law에 대한 가십에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You watched the Oscars last night. Gossip about a female star Rebecca Law with your friend Layla.

Task.Q1: Did you catch the Oscars last night?
Task.Q2: Did you see the Oscars last night?
Task.Q3: Did you watch the Oscars?
Task.Guide: Layla에게 봤다고 말하고, Rebecca Law의 의상을 보았냐고 물어보세요.

Use_Guide: 언론이 정부의 스캔들에 대해 신이 나서 떠들어대고 있다고 말해 보세요.

description: 24.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중고급_비즈니스_중고급 비즈니스 : 발표편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 표현들을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some expressions from the topic card first. Read after the AI tutor.

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 다루게 될 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you will learn through today's lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~에 관해 발표하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"새로운 목표를 제안하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"아시는 바와 같이"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~에 대해 상세히 말하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~와 연관되어 있다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업 준비를 마쳤으니 수업을 통해 더 많은 표현을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with the tutor.

Mission.Title: Going on a Business Trip
Mission.Description_Ko: 시애틀에 위치한 SMA Securities라는 회사에서 전화가 왔습니다. 당신은 바로 출장을 가야한다고 생각합니다. 상사 Ms.Smith에게 상황을 설명해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You have got a phone call from SMA Securities in Seattle. You think you should go on a business trip there right away. Explain what is happening and why you think you should make a trip there to your boss, Ms.Smith.
Mission.Guide_En: Ms.Smith, are you busy at the moment?

Task.Q0: A little, but not to worry.
Task.Q1: What's up?
Task.Q2: Is something wrong?
Task.Q3: Is there a problem?
Task.Guide: SMA Securities의 Richard가 방금  전화했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Richard from SMA Securities] {just} [called me].
Richard from SMA Securities just rang me.

Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying Richard from SMA Securities just called you?

Task.Guide: 그쪽 시스템에 계속 문제가 있어 왔다고 말해 보세요.

{They have been [having problems with]} [their system].

[Most definitely]. To be frank, {I think you should} let me fly out to Seattle to act right on it.

Definitely. To be frank. I think you'd better let me fly to Seattle to act on it.

금요일까지 팀에게 이 초대장을 반드시 보내겠다고 말해 보세요.

Mission.Description_En: You heard the news that your colleague Marcus has just lost his job. Express your regret while giving him a word of advice and a helping hand.

content_name: The odds, one in a million

Mission.Title: The odds, one in a million
Mission.Description_Ko: 남성 친구의 사고 소식을 듣고 병원에 온 당신. Gladstone 의사에게 친구의 상태는 어떤지 묻고, 나아질 가능성을 확인해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are in a hospital after hearing the news that your male friend got into an accident. Ask Doctor Gladstone about your friend's condition and identify the possibility of his survival.

Task.Q2: How are you?

Is he okay?

Is he going to be okay?

Will he survive?
Will he be okay?

Are you saying he might not live?

Mission.Title: Talking over the phone 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 금요일 일정과 관련해 대화를 나누어 보세요. 금요일에만 있는 두바이 직행 항공편을 타야 한다는 제안을 거절 후 수락하고, 그날 일정을 조정해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation about Friday plans. After initially rejecting, accept the proposal to go on the only direct flight to Dubai on Friday and offer to adjust your schedule on the day.

Task.Q1: I’m calling from Mr. Clark’s office to touch base with you about Friday plans.
Task.Q2: I'm calling from Mr. Clark's office to discuss Friday plans with you.
Task.Q3: I'm calling to discuss Friday plans.
Task.Guide: 듣고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[All right, I'm listening]}.
Go on, I'm listening.
What about Friday? Tell me.
So what is happening on Friday? Tell me.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you're listening?

Task.Q0: I reserved a seat for you.
Task.Q1: It leaves at 11:50 am and arrives at Dubai National Airport at 7:30 am.
Task.Q2: The flight departs at 11:50 am and arrives at Dubai National Airport at 7:30 am.
Task.Q3: You're scheduled to leave here at 11:50 am and arrive in Dubai at 7:30 am.
Task.Guide: 못 지킬 것 같다고 말하면서 오전9시에 무언가가 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can't make it}. [I have something] [at 9:00 am that day].
I can't make it. I have plans at 9:00 am on the day.
I don't think I can make it. I actually have something at 9:00 am on Friday.
I am occupied then, with plans starting at 9:00 am.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't make it?

Task.Q1: Did you say can or can’t?
Task.Q2: Did you say you confirmed?
Task.Q3: Say that again?
Task.Guide: 할 수 없다고 말하고, 더 늦은 항공편을 탈 수 없는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Can’t, as in cannot}. So, [is there any way to] [take a later flight?]
Cannot. Do you know whether I can take a later flight?
I can't, as in no. Could you find a flight for me to take later on?
I can't, as a matter of fact. Can I take a flight later on?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if there is any way to take a later flight?

Task.Q1: Just a moment...No, unfortunately that’s the last direct flight on Friday.
Task.Q2: One moment. It looks like that's the last direct flight on Friday.
Task.Q3: No that's actually the last direct light on Friday.
Task.Guide: 알겠다고 하면서 어쨌든 일정을 조정해보겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I see. Anyway, {I’ll} [try to rearrange things].
I see. At any rate, I'll try and turn things around.
Fine. I will try to reschedule my plans on that day.
That's too bad. I am going to change my plans for that day.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you'll try to rearrange things?
Task.Key: Anyway, {I’ll} try to rearrange things.
Use_Key: I will go to fix the misunderstandings.
I will have to follow the directions.
I will fight to live another day.
Use_Guide: 나는 오해를 풀러 갈 것이라고 말해보세요.
나는 지시를 따라야 할 것이라고 말해보세요.
나는 하루를 더 살기 위해 싸울 것이라고 말해보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Yes, look into it please.

content_name: Speak Like a Native : Weather & Season 1
description: 17.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_중급 원어민 표현 마스터_원어민 코스프레 : 날씨 & 계절편 1

Title.Title_En: Speak Like a Native : Weather & Season 1

Description.Description_Ko: {"원어민 코스프레 : 날씨 & 계절편 1"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Speak Like a Native : Weather & Season 1"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 친구에게 영어로 날씨를 묘사해 보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's describe the weather to a friend in English.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What happened?
Quiz.Guide: {"soaking wet"}를 이용해 {"내 옷이 흠뻑 젖었어."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: My clothes are soaking wet.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Is it raining again?
Quiz.Guide: {"stopped raining"} 또는 {"cleared up"}를 이용해 {"지금은 비가 갰어."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It stopped raining now.
It cleared up now.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여기 오는 길에 비가 많이 왔어?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Did it rain a lot on your way here?
Quiz.Guide: {"raining cats and dogs"} 또는 {"pouring"}를 이용하여 {"비가 억수같이 내렸어."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It was raining cats and dogs.
It was pouring.

Quiz.Quiz_En: They didn't say it would rain today.
Quiz.Guide: {"unpredictable"}를 이용해 {"날씨가 예측 불가해."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The weather is unpredictable.

Quiz.Quiz_En: It's been raining a lot lately.
Quiz.Guide: {"rainy season"}를 이용하여 {"우기가 막 시작되었어."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The rainy season just started.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 비가 오면, 이렇게 덥지 않아야 하는데.
Quiz.Quiz_En: If it's raining, it shouldn't be this hot.
Quiz.Guide: {"humid"}를 이용하여 {"공기가 너무 습해."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
The air is too humid!
The air is so humid!

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: How's the jet lag 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 새로 온 컨설턴트에 대해 얘기해 보세요. 점심에 초대해보라는 제안도 하세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about the new consultant. Make a suggestion to invite him for lunch.

Task.Q1: That consultant from New York came this morning.
Task.Q2: The consultant from New York came in the morning.
Task.Q3: The consultant came by.
Task.Guide: 들었다고 말하면서, 그와의 만남을 기대하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
So I heard. {I'm looking forward to} [meeting him].
I heard. I'm anticipate seeing him.
I know. I look forward to the meet with him.
I know. I am excited about meeting him.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you're looking forward to meeting him?
Task.Key: {I'm looking forward to} meeting him.
Use_Key: I'm looking forward to welcoming the guests.
She's looking forward to performing next time on stage.
We are looking forward to giving children hope.
Use_Guide: 나는 방문객을 환영하는 것을 기대하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 다음에 무대 위에서 공연하기를 기대하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 아이들에게 희망을 주는 것을 기대하고 있다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I probably shouldn't be, but I'm a little nervous.
Task.Q2: As for me, I am a little nervous.
Task.Q3: I am nervous.
Task.Guide: 왜 그런지 물어보면서 그는 당신의 팀에 만족할 것이 확실하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Why? {I'm sure} [he'll be happy] [with your team].
Why? I'm certain he'll be happy with the team members.
Why should you? He will be satisfied with the team.
I don't know why you should. He will be satisfied with the team's work.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he'll be happy with my team?

Task.Q1: I needed another month. I just hope I don't come across as unprepared.
Task.Q2: I could use another month. I hope I don't sound unprepared.
Task.Q3: Another month would be useful. I wouldn't sound unprepared.
Task.Guide: 그를 점심에 초대해 더 자세히 알아보는 것은 어떤지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How about} [inviting him for lunch] [to get a better feel for him?]
How about having lunch together to get to know him better?
Why don't you have lunch with him to know him a bit better?
Why not invite him for lunch so that you two can introduce yourselves?
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I should invite him for lunch to get a better feel for him?

Task.Q1: Can't say I'm thrilled with that idea. That can be your job.
Task.Q2: I'm not exactly thrilled at that idea. That is more suited as your job.
Task.Q3: Not exactly thrilled at that idea. Why don't you do it?
Task.Guide: 물론, 내가 우리 둘 중에서 더 내놓을만하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Sure, {I'm definitely the more presentable} [out of the two of us].
Sure, I'm certainly more presentable than you are.
Why not? I'm much more presentable.
Why not? I'm the more presentable one.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're the more presentable out of the two of us?

Complete.Reaction: Is that so?

Mission.Title: Talking over the phone 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 두바이에서 따라야 할 행동규칙을 듣고, 적절한 반응을 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Listen to the do's and don'ts in Dubai, then respond appropriately.

Task.Q1: Thank you for rearranging your schedule. Would you like me to email you tips about Dubai?
Task.Q2: Thanks for rearranging your Friday plans. Do you want to read advice on Dubai via email?
Task.Q3: Thanks for rearranging. How about emailing you on Dubai?
Task.Guide: 그냥 행동 방침에 대해 얘기하라고 말하세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Just tell me the do's and don'ts]}.
No, tell me what I should do.
Just tell me instead.
Just talk to me about it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should just tell you the do's and don'ts?

Task.Q1: Here's the breakdown: first, don't offer to shake hands with a woman. Second, take your shoes off when you enter a home..
Task.Q2: Here it is: first, don't shake hands with women. Second, take your shoes off when entering homes.
Task.Q3: Don't shake hands with women and be sure to take shoes off in homes.
Task.Guide: 대부분의 아시아 문화와 같다고 말하세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[They're like most Asian cultures]}.
Typical of Asian cultures.
Not surprising, like most Asian cultures.
How surprising, like I did not know about Asian cultures.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean they're like most Asian cultures?

Task.Q1: You're flight arrives during Ramadan, so don't smoke, eat, or drink in public during the day.
Task.Q2: The flight arrives during Ramadan, so during the day, do not smoke, eat, drink in public.
Task.Q3: You arrivce on Ramadan, so don't smoke, eat, drink there in public.
Task.Guide: 유감이라고 하면서 라마단은 얼마나 오랫동안인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That's unfortunate]. {How long} [is Ramadan?]
That's too bad. How long does Ramadan last?
Why that's unfortunate. How long will I have to do this?
How unfortunate. Is Ramadan long?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how long Ramadan is?
Task.Key: {How long} is Ramadan?
Use_Key: How long can you stay during the holidays?
How long does it take to the airport?
How long was the trip do you know?
Use_Guide: 휴일 동안 얼마나 오래 있을 수 있는지 물어보세요.
공항까지 가는데 시간이 얼마나 걸리는지 물어보세요.
여행이 얼마나 걸렸는지 아는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I believe it is for 30 days this year, sir.
Task.Q2: I think it is for 30 days this year.
Task.Q3: For 30 days this year.
Task.Guide: 30일이라는 것에 놀라움을 표하고, 오늘 다룰 수 있는만큼 모두 들었다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Wow, 30 days?! {I think} [we covered] [all I can handle], thanks.
30 days? I think I heard all I can handle.
30 days in total? I don't think I can handle this.
Really? That is so long. I heard enough for the day.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we covered all you can handle?

Complete.Reaction: All right, have a great flight.

Mission.Title: Empty Nest
Mission.Description_Ko: 오랫동안 함께 일한 동료 James가 직장을 떠나는 날입니다. James와 대화를 나눠 보세요
Mission.Description_En: Today, James,you have been working with for a long time, is leaving the office. Talk with James before he leaves.
Mission.Guide_En: James, are you all set to go?

Task.Q0: Well I think this is the last one.
Task.Q1: I'm not forgetting anything, am I?
Task.Q2: Do I have everything I need to take?
Task.Q3: Am I not leaving anything behind?
Task.Guide: 역시 박스가 엄청 많다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You sure have} [a lot of boxes].
That is a heavy load of boxes you got there.
What a load of boxes you've got there.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I sure have a lot of boxes?

Task.Q0: I'm not getting any younger.
Task.Q1: I certainly have to move on and be all I can be.
Task.Q2: I should definitely start new and find the best in me.
Task.Q3: I really need to venture out and spread my wings.
Task.Guide: 무슨 말인지 이해한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I know what you mean]}.
You're right about that.
I can't deny it.
I know what you're talking about.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you know what I mean?

Task.Guide: 가끔은 뒤를 돌아봐 줬으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Hopefully] {you'll} [look back every now and then].
We hope that you look back once in a while.
We hope you look back time to time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying to look back every now and then?

Task.Q0: What do you mean?
Task.Guide: 지금까지 도와준 사람들의 안부도 챙기면 좋을 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I hope} [you check in on] [those who've gotten you this far].
Always remember those who helped you to be who you are now.
Don't forget the people who hepled you get this far.
Task.Are_you_saying: You hope I check in on those who've gotten me this far?

Task.Q1: You should stop by and say hello.
Task.Q2: You'll have to come and visit me.
Task.Q3: I'll be waiting for your visit.
Task.Guide: 꼭 연락하라고 말해 보세요
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Make sure] [you keep in touch]}.
Don't forget to call.
Remember to call every once in a while.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking to keep in touch?
Task.Key: {Make sure} you keep in touch.
Use_Key: Make sure you call me when you get home.
Make sure you do your homework.
Make sure you check the email tonight.
Use_Guide: 집에 도착하면 꼭 전화하라고 말해 보세요.
꼭 숙제 하라고 말해 보세요.
오늘 밤 이메일을 꼭 확인하라고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: I certainly will.
