description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_내가 꿈꾸는 여행

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 수업에서 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that you can use today before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 질문들의 핵심 표현을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some key expressions in the question first. Read after the AI tutor!

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: feel small in front of nature

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 이번에는 질문에 대답할 때 유용하게 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: From now on, let's practice some useful expressions that you can use to answer the questions.

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 내가 원하는 곳을 자유롭게 갈 수 있는
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: free to go wherever I want

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can use for today's lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~와 연락하고 지내다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"가장 기억에 남는 순간"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"놀라운(기억에 남는) 랜드마크"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"현지 시장을 구경하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"입이 떡 벌어지는"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the expressions perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 튜터와 당신이 꿈꾸는 여행에 관해 말해보는 시간을 가져보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, share you’re the travel of your dreams with the tutor through the class.

Mission.Title: Understanding Cultural Diversity
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 새로운 프로젝트를 맡게 되면서 스웨덴에 4주동안 출장을 가게 되었습니다. 스웨덴에 다녀와 본 동료 Robert에게 스웨덴 문화에 대한 조언을 구해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your team has put you in charge of the upcoming project and you are now going on a business trip to Sweden for four weeks. Ask Robert, who has been there before, to give you some advice about the culture.

Task.Q1: I heard you are going to Sweden on business.
Task.Q2: You are going to Sweden on business, aren't you?
Task.Q3: Are you going to Sweden on business?
Task.Guide: 팀이 나에게 새로운 프로젝트를 맡기기로 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, my team {decided to} [put me in charge of] [the upcoming project].
Yeah, I'm now in charge of the upcoming project.
My team has put me in charge of the new project.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your team decided to put you in charge of the upcoming project?

Task.Q0: You know I've been there before.
Task.Guide: 처음 가는 건데 실수하고 싶지 않다고 말하고, 문화에 대해 조언해 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[This is my first visit, and I don't want to make mistakes]. {Can you} [give me some advice about the culture?]
I have never been there before, and I don't want to make mistakes. Could you advise me on the culture?
I don't want to make mistakes because I'm new to the culture. Would you please give me some advice?
This is my first visit, and I'm afraid that I might make mistakes. Why don't you give me some advice about the culture?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I can give you some advice about the culture?

Task.Q0: How long are you going to stay there?
Task.Guide: 한달이라고 말하고, 4주 출장이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[About a month]. {[My business trip is four weeks long]}.
I'm going to stay there for a month as the trip is four weeks long.
This business trip is four weeks long, so about a month.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean your business trip is four weeks long?

Task.Q0: Then you shouldn't need a visa, but just in case, call the local Swedish embassy to check.
Task.Q1: Oh and most Swedes speak very good English.
Task.Q2: Oh and most Swedes are very fluent in English.
Task.Q3: Oh and most Swedes speak English.
Task.Guide: 약속은 최소 2주 전에 잡는 게 좋다고 들었는데, 맞는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I was told} that [it is good to make appointments] [at least two weeks in advance]. Is it?
I've heard that it is good to make appointments at least two weeks in advance. Am I right?
People say I should make appointments at least two weeks in advance. Is it really?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if it is good to make appointments at least two weeks in advance?

Task.Reaction: Yes. That is very important to Swedish people.
Task.Q0: You need to be punctual for all business and social appointments.
Task.Guide: 스웨덴 사람들은 일할 때 직설적이다고도 들었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I was also told} that [Swedes prefer to] [be direct in business].
I've also heard that they like to be direct in business.
People told me that Swedes are direct in business.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you were also told that Swedes prefer to be direct in business?
Task.Key: {I was told that} Swedes prefer to be direct in business.
Use_Key: I was told that Spanishes prefer to have business dinner.
I was told that Australians prefer to spend quality time with family after work.
I was told that Rachel is moving to France next month.
Use_Guide: 스페인들은 저녁 회식을 선호한다고 들었다고 말해 보세요.
호주 사람들은 퇴근 후 가족과 시간을 보내는 것을 선호한다고 들었다고 말해 보세요.
Rachel이 다음 달에 프랑스로 이사간다고 들었다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [Australians prefer to], [spend quality time with family], [after work]

Task.Q0: And don't get emotional.
Task.Q1: Also, during the meeting it isn't necessary to talk if you don't have anything to say.
Task.Q2: Also, you can stay quite if you don't have anything to say during the meeting.
Task.Q3: Also, it's totall okay not to talk if you don't have anything to say.
Task.Guide: 조언을 받아들이겠다고 말하고, 감사인사를 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Okay, {[I'll take your word for it]}. [Thank you so much].
I'll keep that in mind. Thank you for your useful words.
I'll be well aware of all those things. Thank you for your advice.
I'll bear that in mind. Thanks for your advice. It is so helpful.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you'll take my word for it?

Complete.Reaction: My pleasure. I hope you have a great time in Sweden.

Mission.Title: Different Communication Styles
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Sarah에게 일어난 일을 Anne과 함께 이야기해 보세요. 문화차이로 인해 Sarah가 상사의 의도를 오해한 것 같다고 말하고 이를 설명해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Anne about what happened to Sarah. Tell her that you think Sarah has misunderstood her boss's good intention due to their different cultures and explain why you think so.

Task.Q1: Did you hear what happened to Sarah?
Task.Q2: Have you heard what happened to Sarah?
Task.Q3: You know what happened to Sarah, don't you?
Task.Guide: 아니라고 말하고, 무슨 일이냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[No], {[what happened?]}
No, I didn't. Tell me about it.
No, I haven't. What happened?
I have no clue. What happened to her?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you didn't hear what happened to Sarah?

Task.Q0: Her boss asked her to move to the Tech Support Team.
Task.Q1: Since  then, she's been so bummed out.
Task.Q2: Since then, she's been so diasppointed.
Task.Q3: She is not happy about it.
Task.Guide: 왜 Sarah가 낙담해 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Why is she bummed out?]}
Why is she disappointed?
What makes her bummed out?
Why is she not happy about it?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking why she is bummed out?

Task.Q0: Why would your boss want to transfer you to another division unless you're a pain in her neck?
Task.Q1: Sarah always thought her boss played favorites and that she was always chosen for the great tasks.
Task.Q2: Sarah thought that she was one of her boss's favorites who get great tasks.
Task.Q3: Sarah thought her boss liked her.
Task.Guide: 진짜냐고 묻고, 오해가 있는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Are you serious?] {I think} [it's all a misunderstanding].
Are you sure? I think it's a big misunderstanding.
Are you sure? I'm sure it's a big misunderstanding.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think it's all a misunderstanding?

Task.Guide: 그녀의 상사는 그녀가 색다른 것을 경험하면서 견문을 넓히는 좋은 기회를 주고 싶어한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Her boss wants to give her a great opportunity to widen her horizons] {[by experiencing something different]}.
Her boss wants her to have a chance to widen her horizons by experiencing something different.
Her boss wants her to experience something different so that she can widen her horizons.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying her boss wants to give her a great opportunity to widen her horizons by experiencing something different?

Task.Q0: What makes you say that?
Task.Guide: 상사가 미국 사람 아니냐고 물어 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Isn't her boss from the States?]}
Isn't her boss an American?

Task.Q0: I think she's from Seattle.
Task.Guide: 상사의 문화에서는 사람들이 견문을 넓히기 위해 보통 같은 업계에서 직무를 바꾼다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{In her culture}, [people generally change jobs within the same industry] [because it gives them a broader base of experience].
In the States, people want to change jobs within the same industry because they can have a broader base of experience.
She's from the culture where changing jobs within the same indsutry is a great opportunity to have a broader base of experience.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying in her culture, people generally change jobs within the same industry because it gives them a broader base of experience?

Task.Q0: I think she's from Seattle.
Task.Guide: 그들은 직무 변경을 스스로를 더 좋은 위치로 올려주는 방법으로 본다고 말하고, 그래서 상사가 호의를 베푼 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[They view a job change as]} [a way of promoting themselves to a better position]. [Her boss is trying to do her a favor].
She sees a job change as an opportunity to have a better position. So she is actually doing her a favor.
From her point of view, a job change is a way of promoting people to a better position. So she is trying to offer her a great opportunity.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying her boss is trying to do her a favor?
Task.Key: They {view} a job change {as} a way of promoting themselves to a better position.
Use_Key: Koreans view having a meal together as a way of getting to know someone better.
I view this meeting as our chance to go through all the details.
She viewed this interview as a way of finding the best candidate for the position.
Use_Guide: 한국인들은 식사를 함께 하는 것을 상대를 더 잘 알아가는 방법이라고 본다고 말해 보세요.
나는 이 회의가 우리가 모든 세부사항을 짚어보는 기회라고 본다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 이 인터뷰를 가장 적합한 인재를 찾는 방법으로 봤다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [having a meal together], [a way of getting to know someone better]
[this meeting], [our chance to go through all the details]
[this interview], [a way of finding the best candidate for the position]

Complete.Reaction: Wow, now that you mention it, it was just a cultural misunderstanding.

Mission.Title: Global Business Success
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 성공한 글로벌 브랜드 Johnson & Johnson의 대표입니다. Johnson & Johnson의 성공 비법을 인터뷰하러 온 Alex의 질문에 답변해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are the CEO of a successful global brand called Johnson & Johnson. Answer to Alex's questions, who has come to ask you how you have become so successful.

Task.Reaction: Thank you for your time in advance. Let me start with this question.
Task.Q1: What are the factors that led Johnson & Johnson to become a successful global brand?
Task.Q2: What led Johnson & Johnson to become a successful global brand?
Task.Q3: How did Johnson & Johnson become a successful global brand?
Task.Guide: 많은 요인이 있지만, 가장 큰 것은 글로벌 수요를 잘 이해한 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[There are a number of factors], but {the main one is to} [truly understand the global needs].
Among all the factors, the main one is to truly understand the global needs.
Most importantly, we truly understood the global needs.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the main factor is to truly understand the global needs?

Task.Guide: 항상 고객의 관점에서 생각하려고 노력하고, 우리에게 무엇을 원하는지 알아내려고 노력한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We always try to} [put ourselves in our customers' shoes] and [find out what they truly want from us].
We always try to see things from our customers' point of view and understand what they want from us.
We always value our customers' feedback and try to understand what they are expecting from us.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you always try to put yourselves in your customers' shoes and find out what they truly want from you?

Task.Q0: What else is the key to becoming a successful, top-notch brand?
Task.Guide: 좋은 관찰자가 되는 것은 우리에게는 충분하지 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Being just a good observer] {isn't} [good enough for us].
Being just a good observer isn't enough for us.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean being a good observer isn't good enough for you?
Task.Key: Being just a good observer {isn't good enough for} us.
Use_Key: Winning the game wasn't good enough for him.
Having a decent job isn't good enough for our happiness.
Taking a day-off wasn't good enough for me to release stress.
Use_Guide: 이번 경기의 승리가 그에게는 충분하지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
좋은 직장은 행복을 보장하지 못한다고 말해 보세요.
연차를 냈지만 스트레스가 다 풀리지 않았다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 상품들은 최고 중의 최고여야 한다고 말하고, 이쪽 업계의 경쟁이 매우 심하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[The products should be the best of the best], and {[the competition in this industry is pretty cut-throat]}.
As the competition is very high in this industry, our products have to be the best of the best.
The products need to be the best of the best as the competition in this industry is high.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the competition in this industry is pretty cut-throat?

Task.Q0: That's for sure.
Task.Q1: Have you ever caved under pressure, thinking by the time a new product launches, things might go wrong?
Task.Q2: Have you ever felt pressured before a new product is launched, thinking something might go wrong?
Task.Q3: Have you ever been anxious thinking something might go wrong before launching a new product?
Task.Guide: 있다고 말하고, 당신의 최선이 고객에게는 부족할 때가 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, [to customers], {[sometimes your best isn't good enough]}.
Yes, of course. No matter how hard you try, sometimes your best isn't good enough for customers.
Your best doesn't guarantee your success in satisfying customers. So, yes, I have.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean to customers, sometimes our best isn't good enough?

Task.Q0: To become the world's best, you must have had to be perfect all the time.
Task.Guide: 어떤 미래가 우리를 기다리고 있는지 모르겠지만, 고객을 만족시킬 수 있는 상품을 내놓는 것이 언제나 우리의 미션이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I don't know what the future holds for us], but {our mission is still to} [bring the most satisfying products to the world].
I'm not sure what is waiting for us in the future, but our mission is still to bring the most stisfying products to the world.
I don't know what our future will look like but our mission is always to produce the most satisfying products.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your mission is still to bring the most satisfying products to the world?

Complete.Reaction: Thank you so much for your time and words.

content_name: If only I had done more 1

Mission.Title: If only I had done more 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 해고된 직원에 대해 얘기하고, 최근 다녀온 세계 여행에 대해서도 말해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about the fired employee, and also about the trip around the world you returned from.

Task.Q1: Pat got fired last Friday!
Task.Q2: Pat got laid off Friday!
Task.Q3: Pat was fired!
Task.Guide: 소식을 듣게 되서 유감스러우며, 내가 그녀를 도울 수 있었으면 좋았을 거라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Ugh, {I'm sorry to hear that}. [I wish I could have helped her].
I'm sorry to hear that. I wish that I could have helped somehow.
So sorry to hear that. Perhaps I could have helped her.
I can't believe it. I'm sorry I couldn't help her.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you wish you could have helped her?

Task.Q1: If you had helped her, she'd still be in a job she hates.
Task.Q2: If you helped her, she would be in a job she hates.
Task.Q3: If you did, she would still be stuck here.
Task.Guide: 그런 것 같다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I guess.]}
I suppose.
Perhaps.
Maybe.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you guess so?

Task.Q1: And she wouldn't have gotten such a great severance package. She's in Hawaii right now!
Task.Q2: And she would't have received the severance package. She's in Hawaii now.
Task.Q3: And not have gottten the severance package. She's in Hawaii now.
Task.Guide: 내가 조만간 해고되면, 그 곳이 내가 갈 곳이라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, {[if I get fired anytime soon, [that's where I'll go]}.
Well, if I get laid off soon enough, that's where I'll visit.
If I get fired soon, I will go there too.
If I get laid off soon, I will visit the place as well.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you will go there if you get fired?

Task.Q1: You just got back from a trip halfway around the world. How was it anyway?
Task.Q2: You just returned form a trip around the world. How was it?
Task.Q3: Just returned from a world trip? How was it?
Task.Guide: 정말 근사했다고 말하면서 시간이 더 있었더면, 더 둘러 보았을 것이라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Really neat. {If I had} [more time], I would [have looked around more], though.
Quite neat. If I had the time, I would have looked around a bit.
Stunning. I would have looked around, if I had free time.
Fabulous. I would have gone to more places, had I the time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you would have looked around more if you had more time?
Task.Key: If I had more time, I would have looked around more, though.
Use_Key: If I had money, I would have bought everything.
If he had power, he would have destroyed his rivals.
If they had common sense, they would have avoided nonsense.
Use_Guide: 내가 돈이 있었다면, 모든 것을 구입했었겠다고 말해보세요.
그가 권력이 있었다면, 그는 그의 경쟁자를 파괴했을 것이라고 말해보세요.
그들이 상식이 있었다면, 말도 안되는 짓을 피했을 것이라고 말해보세요.

Complete.Reaction: That's always the case. So what did you bring me?

Mission.Title: Informed consumers 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 쇼핑을 하면서 점원과 대화를 나누어 보세요. 새로운 직함에 필요한 바지에 대한 정보도 얻으세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a discussion with the store clerk while shopping. Obtain information on the pants you need for your new position.

Task.Q1: So what are we looking for today?
Task.Q2: What are we searching for today?
Task.Q3: Looking for something?
Task.Guide: 모든 것을 조금씩 가지고 싶다고 말하면서 새로운 직함을 시작한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
A bit of everything. {I’m just starting} [at a new position].
A bit of everything. I'm starting at a new position now.
Little bit of everything. I have recently started a new position.
Little bit of everything. I have begun a new position recently.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you're just starting at a new position?

Task.Q1: And you have to look the part. Anything in particular?
Task.Q2: So have to look suited for the position. Anything particular you want?
Task.Q3: What should we get you then to look the part?
Task.Guide: 슬렉스 바지로 시작하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let’s start with} [some slacks].
Let's begin with the slacks.
Why don't we start with some slacks.
Why don't we begin with the slacks.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we should start with some slacks?

Task.Q1: Pleated or flat front?
Task.Q2: So pleated or flat front?
Task.Q3: Pleated or flat?
Task.Guide: 주름진 것이 더 낫다고 말하면서 주름진 것은 얼마인지도 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [pleated is a little nicer]. [How much are those?]
I would think pleated is a bit nicer. What is the price for one?
Pleated might be a little nicer. How much for those?
Pleated is maybe a little nicer. How much is it for one?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how much the pleated ones are?

Task.Q1: $350. They’re out of season, so they’re cheaper than you might expect.
Task.Q2: $350. Since they're out of season, they're cheaper.
Task.Q3: $350. They're cheaper, as they are out of season.
Task.Guide: 사실 그것은 내가 예상했던 것 보다 더 비싸다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Actually, [that’s more expensive] {than I expected}.
Actually, that's quite expensive for me.
That price is higher than I thought.
That is not exactly cheap. It's more than I expected.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean that's more expensive than you expected?
Task.Key: Actually, that’s more expensive {than I expected}.
Use_Key: The food is more delicious than I expected.
The movie is less interesting than I expected.
The view is more amazing than I expected.
Use_Guide: 음식이 내가 예상했던 것 보다 더 맛있다고 말해 보세요.
영화가 내가 예상했던 것 보다 덜 흥미롭다고 말해 보세요.
뷰가 내가 예상했던 것 보다 더 놀랍다고 말해 보세요.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_얼마나 자주하니?

Description.Description_Ko: {"얼마나 자주하니?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Frequency Game"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 다양한 빈도 부사를 활용하여 어떤 행동을 얼마나 자주 하는지 말해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about how often you do things by using various adverbs of frequency.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What time do you get up in the morning?
Quiz.Guide: {"generally"}를 이용해 {"저는 일반적으로 6시쯤에 일어나요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I generally get up around six.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What do you do before going to bed?
Quiz.Guide: {"always"}를 이용해 {"나는 자기 전에 항상 TV 쇼를 봐요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I always watch TV shows before going to bed.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How often do you order food for delivery?
Quiz.Guide: {"occasionally"}를 이용해 {"나는 이따금 배달 음식을 주문해요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I occasionally order food for delivery.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 얼마나 자주 주변 사람들에게 거짓말을 하시나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, how often do you lie to the people around you?
Quiz.Guide: {"hardly ever"}를 이용해 {"나는 내 주변 사람들에게 거의 거짓말을 하지 않아요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I hardly ever lie to the people around me.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 당신의 SNS에 얼마나 자주 사진이나 포스트를 올리나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: How often do you upload photos or posts on your social network?
Quiz.Guide: {"sometimes"}를 이용해 {"나는 때때로 내 SNS에 사진이나 게시글을 올려요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I sometimes upload photos or posts on my social network.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 얼마나 자주 양치를 하지 않은 채 잠자리에 드나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: How often do you fall asleep without brushing your teeth?
Quiz.Guide: {"rarely"}를 이용하여 {"저는 정말 드물게 양치를 하지 않은 채 잠자리에 듭니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I rarely fall asleep without brushing my teeth.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How often do you stay up all night?
Quiz.Guide: {"never"}를 이용하여 {"저는 절대 밤을 새우지 않아요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I never stay up all night.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 16.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_중급 해외 여행 대비_길 안내하기

Description.Description_Ko: {"길 안내하기"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Giving Directions"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 길을 물어보는 사람에게 길을 안내해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's give directions.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I get to the AB bank?
Quiz.Guide: {"Go straight"}을 이용해 {"이 길을 따라 쭉 가세요."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Go straight along this street.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where is the XZ museum?
Quiz.Guide: {"opposite"}을 이용해 {"지하철역 맞은 편에 있어요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's opposite the subway station.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where is the subway station?
Quiz.Guide: {"at the corner of"}를 이용해 {"다음 거리 모퉁이에 있어요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's at the corner of the next street.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 가장 가까운 경찰서는 어떻게 가면 되나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I get to the nearest police station?
Quiz.Guide: {"Go past"}를 이용해 {"공원을 지나치세요, 그러면 찾으실 거예요."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Go past the park, then you'll find it.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where is the DM post office?
Quiz.Guide: {"between"}을 이용해 {"박물관과 도서관 사이에 있어요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's between the museum and the library.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: AC 약국에 어떻게 갈 수 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I get to the AC pharmacy?
Quiz.Guide: {"turn left"}를 이용하여 {"다음 모퉁이에서 왼쪽으로 꺾으세요."}라고 답변해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Turn left at the next corner.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I get to the AF station?
Quiz.Guide: {"turn right"}를 이용하여 {"첫 번째 모퉁이에서 오른쪽으로 꺾으세요."}라고 답변해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Turn right at the first corner.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I get to the DF hospital?
Quiz.Guide: {"Cross"}를 이용하여 {"길을 건너세요. 그러면 찾으실 겁니다."}라고 답변해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Cross the street. Then you'll find it.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 05.[AI-Tutor] 예습_입문 서바이벌 워킹홀리데이_당신은 어떤 기분이신가요?

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 단어들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"How do you feel?"}은 기분을 물어볼 때 흔히 사용하는 문장입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "How do you feel?" is a common question to ask about someone's feelings.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 앞선 질문에 대답하기 위해 다양한 기분들을 영어로 배워봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Before telling feelings, let's preview some useful expressions. Read after the AI tutor!

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 단어들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the words of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 단어들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the words!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"신이 난, 들뜬, 흥분한"}을 의미하는 단어는 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 단어들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 여러분은 이제 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었습니다. 튜터와 함께 기분을 말하는 방법을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning how to tell your feeling with your tutor!

Mission.Title: I Can't Stand Her.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 당신의 언니/누나 Stephanie와 사이가 좋지 않습니다. 당신의 허락없이 Stephanie를 파티에 초대한 Jeff와 이에 대해 이야기 해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You don't get along with your sister, Stephanie. Talk to Jeff you have invited her without asking for your opinion.

Task.Q0: Did you know,
Task.Q1: I got a call from your sister yesterday and heard about the party.
Task.Q2: Your sister gave me a ring yesterday and we talked about the party.
Task.Q3: Your sister called me yesterday and told me about the party.
Task.Guide: 그녀는 파티에 못 온다고 말하고, 더 이상 얘기하지 않겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[She's not coming] and {[that's all there is to it]}.
She can't come to the party, period.
She's not welcomed to the party, I'm not going to repeat that.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that she can't come to the party?

Task.Q1: You and your sister used to be really intimate.
Task.Q2: You two were so close before.
Task.Q3: You two used to be so close.
Task.Guide: 나와 언니는 더 이상 친하게 지내지 않는다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[My sister and I] {don't} [look eye to eye] [on very much these days].
We don't get along well with each other anymore.
My sister and I aren't as intimate as we used to be.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your sister and you don’t look eye to eye on very much these days?

Task.Q1: That's too bad. I didn't know it was that serious.
Task.Q2: That's unfortunate. I didn't know it was that bad.
Task.Q3: That's too bad,. I never knew it was that big of a deal.
Task.Guide: 그녀가 파티를 망칠게 분명하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm quite sure]} [she'll ruin the party].
I'm pretty sure that she'll mess up the party.
I'm quite confident that she'll screw up the party.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're sure she'll ruin the party?
Task.Key: {I'm quite sure} she'll ruin the party.
Use_Key: I'm qutie sure he won't be able to come.
I'm quite sure he can play the piano.
She was quite sure he would fail in the exam.
Use_Guide: 그가 못 올 거라고 확신한다고 말해 보세요.
나는 그가 피아노를 칠 수 있다고 확신하다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 그가 시험을 망칠 거라고 확신했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Then I guess I shouldn't have told her she could come then.
Task.Q2: Then, it was wrong for me to tell her that she could come.
Task.Q3: Then I think I shouldn't have told her she is welcomed to the party.
Task.Guide: 절대 그런일을 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Over your dead body?

Task.Q0: We're all adults here.
Task.Q1: Surely we can work this out.
Task.Q2: I'm sure we can figure out a way.
Task.Q3: I'm sure there is a solution to the problem.
Task.Guide: 그것에 대해 말하기 싫다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I don't want to} [talk about it].
Let's not talk about it.
I don't want to say another word about it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you don't want to talk about it?

Task.Q0: You're going to have to get along someday.
Task.Q1: Take her out to lunch and turn things back to normal.
Task.Q2: Buy her lunch and put things back as the way they were.
Task.Q3: Treat her lunch and make things as the way they were in the past.
Task.Guide: 그 약속은 못 지킬 수도 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I can't give you my word]}.
I can't guarentee.
I can't promise you that.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you can't give me your word?

Complete.Reaction: Give it a try.

content_name: I'm Just Going To Delete My Account.

Mission.Title: I'm Just Going To Delete My Account.
Mission.Description_Ko: 소셜미디어로 인해 스트레스를 받고 있는 Tom과 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Tom who is greatly stressed because of social media.

Task.Q0: I don't know what to do.
Task.Q1: Everyone is commenting about the photo of me at the bar last night.
Task.Q2: Everyone is adding replies on the picture of me taken last night at the bar.
Task.Q3: Everyone is writing comments about the photo of me at the bar that was taken last night.
Task.Guide: 너의 허락 없이는 아무것도 못 올리게 개인설정을 바꿀 수 있는거 아냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You know} [you can change your privacy settings] so [no one can post stuff without your approval].
Did you know you can change your privacy settings so no one can upload things without your permission?
Did you know you can change your privacy settings so no one can upload contents without our consent?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that I can change my privacy settings so no one can post stuff without my approval?

Task.Q0: I didn’t know that.
Task.Q1: If I only knew earlier.
Task.Q2: I wish I had known that earlier.
Task.Q3: Why didn’t I know that earlier?
Task.Guide: 하지만 이게 가족과 친구들과 지속적으로 소통하기에는 가장 좋은 방법이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{But} [this is the best way] [to stay in the loop with family and friends].
But this is the best way to keep in touch with family and friends.
But this is the best way to stay connected with family and friends.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that this is the best way to stay in the loop with family and friends?

Task.Q0: Aren't you afraid of your personnal information being all over the internet?
Task.Q1: I think our personal information is sold to many businesses.
Task.Q2: I believe our private information is being sold to all businesses.
Task.Q3: I assume that our personal information is sold to numerous businesses.
Task.Guide: 내가 올리는 내용에 대해서는 조심하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm pretty careful about] [what I put up there]}.
I'm quite careful about what I upload on the net.
I'm fairly careful about wha I post on the web.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're careful about what you put up there?

Task.Q0: Even if you're careful,
Task.Q1: Things happen so sudden.
Task.Q2: No one knows what's going to happen.
Task.Q3: Things pop up all of a sudden.
Task.Guide: 게다가 누가 나같은 사람에게 관심을 갖겠냐고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Besides}, [why would anyone be interested in me?]
Besides, there's no reason anyone would be interested in me.
Besides, no one would even care about me.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying why would anyone be interested in you?
Task.Key: {No one knows} what's going to happen.
Use_Key: No one knows where he went yesterday.
No one knows about the accident from yesterday.
No one knows when this fight would be over.
Use_Guide: 어제 그가 어디 갔는지는 아무도 모른다고 말해 보세요.
어제 사고에 대해 아는 사람이 하나도 없다고 말해 보세요.
이 싸움이 언제 끝날지 아무도 모른다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: A stranger captured my friend's photo and started spreading it all over.
Task.Q2: An unknown person copied my friends picture and posted everywhere.
Task.Q3: An anonymous person captured my friends photo and spread it all over.
Task.Guide: 그건 정말 무섭다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That's really freaky]}.
That's very scary.
That's quite frightening.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's really freaky?

Task.Q0: I don't want that happening to me.
Task.Q1: I have my ways staying connected.
Task.Q2: I have my own method of keeping in touch.
Task.Q3: I have my own ways of knowing how they are doing.
Task.Guide: 지나친 조심도 나쁘지는 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It's not bad] [to be too careful]}.
It's good to be cautious.
It's okay to be real careful.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's not bad to be too careful?

Complete.Reaction: You're right.

content_name: Do You Think It Really Happened?

Mission.Title: Do You Think It Really Happened?
Mission.Description_Ko: 신기한 경험담을 들은 친구 Martha와 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Martha who heard about a mysterious experience.

Task.Q0: Do you want to hear something really strange?
Task.Q1: My sister claims to have had the most unbelievable experience.
Task.Q2: My sister told me that she has experienced something really unbelievable.
Task.Q3: My sister said that she has experienced something you wouldn't believe.
Task.Guide: 전혀 놀라지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I'm] {not at all} [surprised].
I'm not surprised at all.
I don't find that surprising at all.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you're not surprised?

Task.Guide: 그녀는 항상 이상한 이야기들을 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
She's {always} [telling] [these weird stories].
She always has strange stories to tell.
She is always loaded with weird stories.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she's always telling weird stories?

Task.Q0: This time she has outdone herself.
Task.Q1: I'm convinced she's pulling my leg.
Task.Q2: I know she's telling a lie.
Task.Q3: I'm confident that she's joking.
Task.Guide: 알겠어, 말해 보라고 해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Okay, let me have it]}.
Okay, go ahead and tell me.
Okay, shoot.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking me to tell you?

Task.Q0: She says that she and her husband were driving home last night.
Task.Q1: They saw a gigantic cross light up out of nowhere.
Task.Q2: They saw a huge cross suddenly turned bright out of nowhere.
Task.Q3: They saw a enormous lit up cross that appeared out of nowhere.
Task.Guide: 그것 때문에 정말 기겁했겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That] {[must have freaked her out]}.
That must have gotten her really scared.
That must have horrified her.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that must have freaked her out?
Task.Key: That {must have freaked} her out.
Use_Key: That must have surprised him.
That must have worried them.
That must have scared you.
Use_Guide: 그것 때문에 그가 놀랐겠다고 말해 보세요.
그것 때문에 그들이 걱정했겠다고 말해 보세요.
그것 때문에 네가 무서웠겠다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: She's currently going through this religious introspection.
Task.Q1: She even claimed that it was a divine sign.
Task.Q2: She even said that it was sign from God.
Task.Q3: She even told me that the sign was from God.
Task.Guide: 말도 안되는 이야기인 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Sounds like} [a real cock and bull story to me].

Sounds like a made up story to me.

Task.Q0: As a matter of fact, my husband has demystified the incident.
Task.Q1: I'll tell you about it at lunch.
Task.Q2: Let's talk about it over lunch.
Task.Q3: I'll tell you during lunch time.
Task.Guide: 빨리 듣고 싶다고 말해 보세요.

{[I can’t wait to hear it]}.
I'm so looking forward to hearing the story.
I really want to hear the story.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't wait to hear it?

Mission.Title: Do Something About it.
Mission.Description_Ko: 환경을 생각하는 친구 Jessica와 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Jessica who thinks greatly about the environment.

Task.Q0: Can you belive all this garbage?
Task.Q1: It's a whole mountain full of trash.
Task.Q2: This is a heavy load of trash.
Task.Q3: This is massive amount of trash.
Task.Guide: 그러니까, 어렸을때 우리가 여기에서 놀았는데..라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I know,] we {used to} [play here when we were kids].

Task.Answer_Set:
Of course, but [the car ran the red light] {and} [slammed right into the back of our car].
Of course, but the car ignored the red light and crashed into our car.
Of course, but the car ran through the red signal and bumped into our car.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean the car ran the red light and slammed right into the back of our car?

Task.Q1: How in the world are we going to get to the party?
Task.Q2: Is there a way we can get to the party?
Task.Q3: How can we ever go to the party?
Task.Guide: 그런 거 걱정할 때가 아니라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That's the last thing] [to worry about]}.
That's the least important thing to worry about.
That's nothing to worry about
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's the last thing to worry about?

Task.Q1: I think I hurt my neck seriously.
Task.Q2: I think I have a severe neck injury.
Task.Q3: I think my neck is seriously injured.
Task.Guide: 일단 병원가서 진찰 받아 보자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[First], {[I'll have you examined]} [at the hospital].
First, we'll have you get checked at the hospital.
First , let's get you diagnosed at the hospital.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll have me examined at the hospital?

Task.Q1: Too bad we're missing out the party.
Task.Q2: It's so unfortunate we're missing out the party.
Task.Q3: Too bad we can't go to the party.
Task.Guide: 파티는 생각하지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Never mind about the party]}.
Don't think about the party.
Party is not the thing to think about now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying never mind about the party?
Task.Key: {Never mind about} the party.
Use_Key: Never mind about the meeting.
Never mind about the trip.
Never mind about the promotion.
Use_Guide: 회의에 대해 생각하지 말라고 말해 보세요.
여행은 생각하지 말라고 말해 보세요.
승진에 대해 생각하지 말라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: What about you?
Task.Q1: Are you feeling okay?
Task.Q2: How are you feeling?
Task.Q3: How do you feel?
Task.Guide: 아직은 모르겠는데 경찰에 신고한 후에 검사 받아야 할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I'm not sure yet], but I {should} [get a check up after the police report].
I don't know yet, but I should go to the hospital after the police report.
I'm not sure yet, but I'm going to get a check up at the hospital after the police report.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you should get a check up after the police report?

Complete.Reaction: I hope you're okay.

Mission.Title: A Blast from the Past
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 엄마의 옛날 물건들을 우연히 찾았습니다. 엄마와 엄마의 추억에 대해 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You happened to have found some of your mom's old belongings. Have a conversation with your mom about her memory.

Task.Q0: Do you know this song?
Task.Q1: This song is really a blast from the past.
Task.Q2: This song was a big hit in the past.
Task.Q3: This song was really popular when I was young.
Task.Guide: 다락방에서 엄마의 소품들을 뒤적거리다가 찾았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I found it] {as} [I was rummaging through] [some of your old keepsakes in the attic].
I found it in your old box as I was going through some of your belongings.
I found it as I was digging through some of your old possesions in the attic.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you found it rummaging through some of my old keepsakes in the attic?
Task.Key: I found it {as} I was rummaging through your stuff.
Use_Key: I found it as I was walking down the street.
I found it as I was cleaning my room.
I found it as I was talking on the phone.
Use_Guide: 길 가다가 찾았다고 말해 보세요.
내 방을 청소하다가 찾았다고 말해 보세요.
전화 통화하다가 찾았다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I have a lot more in my memory box
Task.Q2: There are many more in my treasure box.
Task.Q3: I have stack load of those in my box.
Task.Guide: 십대 때의 모든 것을 보관하고 있는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[You have everything] {from} [your teenage life].
You've got your entire teenage existence catalogued and preserved.
You've got your whole memories organized and kept.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I have everything from my teenage life?

Task.Guide: 이 사진 속 엄마 아빠가 너무 행복해 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[You and dad look really joyful together] {in} [this picture].
You and dad look really happy together in this photo.
You and dad look so happy in this photo.
You and dad look perfect in this picture.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying dad and I look really joyful together in this picture?

Task.Q0: We were, until your father spilled punch all over my dress.
Task.Guide: 그 이야기를 안다고 말하고, 아빠가 둘이 있을 때 가끔 말해 주신다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I remember that story!] [Dad tells me that story time to time] {when} [we are alone].
I know that story. Dad sometimes talks about that story when there's just the two of us.
I know that story. Dad tells me that story once in a while when we are alone.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying dad tells you that story time to time when you're alone?

Task.Q1: I'm sure your father tried to beautify the story.
Task.Q2: I know that your father tried to tell you that story in a very nice way.
Task.Q3: I'm sure that your father didn't tell you the story as the way it happened.
Task.Guide: 다른 재미있는 이야기가 또 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [have any other fun story] [to tell]?
Do you have any other fun story for me?
Please tell me other fun story if you have.
I want to hear about other stories as well.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have any other fun story to tell?

Task.Guide: 아빠는 나에게 해 줄 이야기가 많이 없는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It felt like} [dad didn't have a lot of stories] [to tell].
It felt like dad had little stories to tell.
It felt like dad didn't have many stories to tell.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it felt like dad didn't have a lot of stories to tell?

Complete.Reaction: Well, I have one interesting story that your dad didn't want me to tell you.

Mission.Title: Crunched for Time.
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 승진을 위한 자격증 시험을 앞두고 시험 준비에 대해 이야기 하고 있습니다. 컨닝할 준비를 하고 있는 동료 Cedrick에게 경고의 메시지를 전해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You have a certificate test for promotion on Friday. Your colleague Cedrick is planning to cheat. Give him a warning about it.

Task.Guide: 금요일에 보는 자격증 시험 준비는 다 됐는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are you ready for} [our certificate] [on Friday?]
Are you ready to take the test on Friday?
Are you all prepared for the exam on Friday?
Are you all set for the test on Friday?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I'm ready for our certificate on Friday?

Task.Q1: I'm all set for the test.
Task.Q2: I'm all ready for the exam.
Task.Q3: I've got this test under control.
Task.Guide: 나는 오늘밤 Joe의 집에서 밤을 샐 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'll} [be pulling an all-nighter] [at Joe's tonight].
I'll be staying up all night at Joe's house tonight.
I'm going to study all night at Joe's house tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll be pulling an all-nighter at Joe's tonight?

Task.Q1: That won't be necessary for me.
Task.Q2: I don't need to go through that trouble.
Task.Q3: That's not going to be necessary for me.
Task.Guide: 시험 준비를 철저히 했나 보다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
You {must have studied} [really hard] [for the test].
I believe you've finished studying everything already.
You must have studied super hard for the test.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I must have studied really hard for the test?
Task.Key: {You must have} studied really hard for the test.
Use_Key: You must have been tired.
You must have been really worried.
You must have been happy.
Use_Guide: 피곤했겠다고 말해 보세요.
많이 걱정했겠다고 말해 보세요.
행복했겠다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I just loaded my phone with everything so the invigilator won't notice.
Task.Q2: I put everything in my phone so the invigilator won't catch me.
Task.Q3: I got everything saved in my phone so he can't notice.
Task.Guide: 만약에 걸리면 승진 기회를 잃을 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{If} [you get caught], [you will miss your chance for promotion].
If the invigilator finds out, you'll lose your promotion opportunity.
If you get caught, you'll have to say bye to your promotion.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying if I get caught, I will miss my chance for promotion?

Task.Q0: I know.
Task.Q1: I'm going to do just well enough not to arouse his suspicions.
Task.Q2: I'm going to be really careful not to get his attention.
Task.Q3: I'm going to be extra cautious so he won't notice anything.
Task.Guide: 그는 네가 생각하는 것처럼 어리숙하지 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He's not} [as dumb as] [you think].
He is smarter than you think.
He's not as silly as you think.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean he's not as dumb as I think?

Task.Q1: I'm sure I can get away with it.
Task.Q2: I know I won't get caught.
Task.Q3: I'm confident that I'll pass without being noticed.
Task.Guide: 행운을 빈다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, {[good luck]}.
Wish you luck.
Hope you pass.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying good luck?

Complete.Reaction: No need to worry. See you in class!

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_시간 말하기 3

Description.Description_Ko: {"시간 말하기 3"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Telling the time 3"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 영어로 시간을 말하는 법을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice telling the time in English.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"past"}를 이용해 {"6시에서 8분 지났어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It's eight minutes past six.
It's eight minutes after six.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"oh"}를 이용해 {"4시 5분이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's four oh five.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What time did you finish studying?
Quiz.Guide: {"I finished studying at"}을 이용해 {"저는 3시 정각에 공부를 끝냈어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I finished studying at three o'clock.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"to"}를 이용해 {"4시 15분 전이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's quarter to four.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What time is your lunch with Bob?
Quiz.Guide: {"My lunch with Bob is"}과 {"past"}를 이용해 {"Bob과의 점심은 12시 반이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: My lunch with Bob is at half-past twelve.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 빅 벤에 따르면 지금 몇 시인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: What is the time according to Big Ben?
Quiz.Guide: {"to"}와 {"according to Big Ben"}을 이용해 {"빅 벤에 따르면 3시 25분 전이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It's twenty-five minutes to three according to Big Ben.
It's twenty-five minutes till three according to Big Ben.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Meeting New People 2
Mission.Description_Ko: Pete로부터 새로운 직원 Beth을 소개 받았습니다. Beth와 직접 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Pete introduced you to a new colleague Beth. Have a conversation with her.

Task.Q1: How has your life been treating you?
Task.Q2: How's everything?
Task.Q3: How are you?
Task.Guide: 잘 지낸다고 대답하면서 억양이 익숙하지 않은데 어디에서 왔냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I'm good, thanks. {I can't quite place} [your accent]. [Where are you from?]
Good. Your accent sounds a bit different. May I ask where you're from?
I'm doing well. I wonder where you're from because your accent is a bit different.
I'm good. Your accent is a little different. Can I ask where you're from?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking where I'm from?

Task.Q1: I'm from Australia. Have you ever been to Australia?
Task.Q2: From Australia. Have you ever visited Australia?
Task.Q3: From Australia. Have you ever been there?
Task.Guide: 호주에 가 본 적 없다고 말하면서 아주 아름답다고 들었다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, I haven't. {I hear} [it's really beautiful there].
No, but I've heard that it's really beautiful in Australia.
No, I haven't yet. But I heard that it's really beautiful down there.
Not yet, but I hear it's very beautiful there.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you hear it's really beautiful there?
Task.Key: {I hear} it's really beautiful there.
Use_Key: I hear the food is amazing there.
I hear the view is fantastic there.
I hear the movie is interesting.
Use_Guide: 그 곳 음식이 놀랍다고 들었다고 말해 보세요.
그 곳 뷰가 환상적이라고 들었다고 말해 보세요.
그 영화가 흥미롭다고 들었다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: You should see it for yourself sometime.
Task.Q2: You definitely should visit it sometime.
Task.Q3: I strongly recommend you to visit it.
Task.Guide: 참 좋은 계획이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Sounds like a plan]}.
Sounds great.
Sounds good.
Sounds awsome.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean it sounds like a plan?

Task.Q1: So, what are you up to?
Task.Q2: So, what are you up to?
Task.Q3: So, what are you up to?
Task.Guide: 이 만남을 짧게해야 해서 미안하지만, 2시에 미팅이 있어서 가야한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Sorry to cut this short}, but [I've got a meeting] [at 2:00 pm].
Sorry to shorten this, but I have a meeting at 2:00 pm.
I apologize for having to leave, but I must get to a meeting by 2:00 pm.
I apologize for leaving now, but I must attend a 2 pm meeting.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've got a meeting at 2:00 pm?

Complete.Reaction: Alright talk to you later then.

description: 16.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_중급 해외 여행 대비_길 물어보기

Description.Description_Ko: {"길 물어보기"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {Asking for Directions}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 지나가는 행인에게 길을 물어봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's ask a passerby for directions.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Are you lost? Can I help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"How can I get to"}를 이용해 {"네. 해튼 크로스 역으로 어떻게 가나요?"}라고 질문해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, please. How can I get to Hatton Cross Station?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 길을 잃으셨나요? 제가 도와드릴 수 있을 것 같아요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Are you lost? I can help you.
Quiz.Guide: {"How far away is"}를 이용해 {"네, 감사합니다. 스페이스 니들은 얼마나 멀리 떨어져 있나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, thanks. How far away is the Space Needle?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Are you lost? Can I help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is this the right way to"}를 이용해 {"네. 여기가 나이아가라 폭포로 가는 길이 맞나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, please. Is this the right way to Niagara Falls?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you need help?
Quiz.Guide: {"Could you show me the way to"}를 이용하여 {"네, 감사합니다. 빅 벤으로 가는 길을 알려주실 수 있나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, thanks. Could you show me the way to Big Ben?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 길을 잃으셨나요? 제가 도와드릴 수 있을 것 같아요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Are you lost? I can help you.
Quiz.Guide: {"Could you help me find"}를 이용해 {"근처에 있는 편의점을 찾는 것을 도와주실 수 있나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Thanks. Could you help me find the convenience store nearby?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you need any help?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is this the right way to"}를 이용해 {"이 길이 나이아가라 폭포로 가는 맞는 길인가요?"}라고 질문해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is this the right way to Niagara Falls?

Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"Where is"}를 이용해 {"브루클린 다리가 어디에 있나요?"}라고 질문해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Where is the Brooklyn Bridge?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: It's Time 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 만날 장소와 시간을 정하기 위한 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on the place and time to meet.

Task.Q1: I’m free anytime this week after work.
Task.Q2: I'm available after work this week.
Task.Q3: After work anytime this week.
Task.Guide: 평소에 언제 퇴근하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[When do you usually get off?]}
When do you normally finish?
When is it that you get off?
At which time do you get off?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking when I usually get off?

Task.Q1: Most days I’m off by five-ish.
Task.Q2: On most days, I get off by five.
Task.Q3: Most of the time, by five.
Task.Guide: 오후 5시 이후는 괜찮다고 말하면서 화요일이 가장 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{After 5:00 pm is fine}. [Tuesday works best for me].
After 5:00 pm is totally fine. Tuesday works the best.
Five pm is fine with me. Tuesday also works the best for me.
Five pm is totally fine. Tuesday is also the best time for me.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean Tuesday works best for you?

Task.Q1: I have a meeting at four o’clock that should wrap up by half-past five at the latest.
Task.Q2: I have a meeting at four that should finish by five thirty at the latest.
Task.Q3: I meet at four pm and finish at five thirty.
Task.Guide: 여섯시 15분 전이 어떠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Let’s say quarter to six?]}
Let's say then five forty-five?
Okay then how about quarter to six?
So how about five forty-five?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we should meet at quarter to six?

Task.Q1: 5:45 it is. Do you mind meeting at the coffee shop on 8th Avenue?
Task.Q2: 5:45 it is. How about meeting at the 8th Avenue coffee shop?
Task.Q3: Sure. Let's meet at the 8th Avenue coffee shop.
Task.Guide: 그것은 내게 알맞는다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That] {works for me}.
That works. I'll see you there.
That would work. See you there.
Okay. See you soon.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say that works for you?
Task.Key: That [works for me}.
Use_Key: Meditating and doing yoga works for me.
Working late hours doesn't work for me.
Choosing money over love works for me.
Use_Guide: 참선을 하고 요가를 하는 것은 내게 맞는다고 해보세요.
늦게 일하는 것은 나와 맞지 않는다고 말해보세요.
사랑 대신 돈을 선택하는 것은 내게 알맞다고 말해보세요.

Complete.Reaction: I’ll call you Tuesday morning to confirm.

Mission.Title: Navigating Your Area 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 직원 회의가 열리는 방으로 가기 위해 안내데스크 직원에게 길을 물어보고 안내를 받으세요.
Mission.Description_En: Ask the receptionist where the staff meeting is being held and get directions.
Mission.Guide_En: How may I help you John?

Task.Q1: Excuse me, could you tell me what room the staff meeting is in?
Task.Q2: Excuse me, which room is the staff meeting taking place?
Task.Q3: Excuse me, where is the staff meeting?
Task.Guide: 복사기가 있는 방이 어디인지 아는지 물어보세요.
