Mission.Title: Working things out
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 베스트프렌드인 Karla와 Michelle은 지난 주에 다퉜습니다. 그 다툼에 대해 Karla에게 Michelle과 사과할 것을 제안해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your best friends Karla and Michelle had a fight last week. Suggest that they should make it up with each other.

Task.Guide: 내 메시지에 왜 답이 없었냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Why haven't you been answering my messages?]
Why haven't you been responding to my messages?
Why have you been ignorning my messages?
Why have you been missing my messages?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking why I haven't been answering you?

Task.Guide: 너를 몹시 걱정했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I've been} [worried sick aboout you].
I've been so worried about you.
I've been terribly worried about you.
You got me worried sick about you.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you've been worried about me?

Task.Q1: I turned my phone off. I just needed to be alone.
Task.Q2: I just wanted to disconnect from the world, so I turned my phone off.
Task.Q3: I needed some alone time.
Task.Guide: 지난 주의 Michelle과의 그 다툼이 아직도 신경 쓰이냐고 물어 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are you still bothered about} [that fight with Michelle] [last week?]
Are you still hung up on the fight with Michelle last week?
Is the fight with Michelle last week still bothering you?
Is it the fight with Michelle last week that's still bothering you?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that I'm still bothered about the fight with Michelle?
Task.Key: {Are you still bothered about} that fight with Michelle last week?
Use_Key: Are you still bothered about the meeting with your boss yesterday?
Are you still bothered about the mistake this morning?
Are you still bothered about the blind date last weekend?
Use_Guide: 어제 있었던 상사와의 미팅이 아직도 신경 쓰이냐고 물어 보세요.
오늘 아침에 있었던 그 실수가 아직도 신경 쓰이냐고 물어 보세요.
지난 주말에 있었던 소개팅이 아직도 신경 쓰이냐고 물어 보세요.

Task.Guide: 그녀가 말한 것들에 대해 그녀가 꽤 미안해할 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I know that} [she's pretty sorry about] [the things she said].
I'm certain that she's very sorry about the things she said.
I know that she feels very sorry about the things she said.
I know that she's regretful for the things she said.
I know that she's not feeling too good about the things she said.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean she is pretty sorry about what she said?

Task.Guide: 그녀가 너희들 사이에 일어난 일에 대해 보상할 준비가 되어 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[She's ready] [to make amends for what happened between you guys].
And she's ready to make things better for what happened between you guys.
And she's waiting to mend things for what happened between you guys.
And she's ready to make an effort to improve the relationship she has with you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she is ready to apologize?

Task.Q0: Whatever.
Task.Guide: 지나간 일은 지나간 채로 둘 수 없겠냐고 물어 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Can't we just let bygones be bygones?]}
Wait, can't we just forget about the past?
Wait, can't we just let go of what has happened?
Hold on, can't we allow the unpleasant things be forgotten?
Hold on, can't we just let the past remain in the past?
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean we should let bygones be bygones?

Task.Guide: 우리가 어릴 때부터 우리 셋은 베스트 프렌드였다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I mean}, [the three of us] [have been] best friends [since we were kids].
I mean, the three of us have been the closest since we were young.
I mean, us three have been best friends since we were children.
Afterall, the three of us have been super close since we were young.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we've been beest friends since we were kids?

Task.Q1: I suppose this was all some big understanding, right?
Task.Q2: I think it was all just a big misunderstanding.
Task.Q3: I think this can easily be resolved if we just talk.
Task.Guide: 그녀가 절대 너에게 상처 줄 의도는 아니였다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[She never meant to hurt you]}.
She didn't mean to hurt you in any way.
At no time did she mean to hurt you.
She had no intentions to hurt you at all.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she never meant to hurt me?

Task.Guide: 게다가 너도 후회할 만한 것들을 말하지 않았냐고 물어 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Besides}, [you said some things] [that you regret, too], [right?]
Besides, I'm sure you also said things that you regret, no?
Also, didn't you also say things that you regret?
Likewise, don't you have things that you regret saying as well?
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I made mistakes too?

Task.Q1: I just don't understand why she is always doing this kind of thing, you know?
Task.Q2: I just don't know what she is thinking.
Task.Q3: I just don’t understand her sometimes.
Task.Guide: 너희가 일을 잘 해결할 거라고 확신한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sure that} you can [work these things out].
I'm certain she'll tell you and you can work these things out.
I'm sure you can work things out.
I'm pretty sure you can go work things out.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're sure we can work things out?

Complete.Reaction: Thank you. You are a true friend.

Mission.Title: Trending Topics 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 연간 세일즈 내용을 담은 그래프에 대해 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on the graph containing information regarding annual sales.

Task.Q1: As you can see by the blue line, annual sales took a big hit in 2010.
Task.Q2: As the blue line indicates, annual sales took a big downfall in 2010.
Task.Q3: The blue line indicates that annual sales took a toll in 2010.
Task.Guide: 그것을 읽을 수 없다고 말하면서 어떤 것에 실패를 했는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can't read that}. What did they [bottom out at?]
I can't see that clearly. What was it they bottomed out at?
I can't understand that. What did they fall out in?
I can't comprehend that. They fell out in which area?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what they bottomed out at?

Task.Q1: $50,000. But then there was a gradual rise in sales that peaked at $400,000.
Task.Q2: The $50,000, but sales rose gradually and peaked at $400,000.
Task.Q3: $50,000, but sales rose and peaked at $400,000.
Task.Guide: 그 이후부터 세일은 평탄해졌다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Since then} they've more or less [leveled off].
Since then, they've gotten more or less even.
Afterwards, the sales have evened out.
Afterwards, the sales stopped fluctuating.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying since then they've more or less leveled off?

Task.Q1: But not for our competitors.
Task.Q2: But not for our competitiors.
Task.Q3: Not for our competitors.
Task.Guide: 빨간 색 줄은 R.Motors 것인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Is the red line R. Motors?]}
The red line there, is it R.Motors?
And the red line is R.Motors?
How about the red line? Is it R.Motors?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if the red line is R. Motors?

Task.Q1: That's B. Automotives. R. Motors is the green line.
Task.Q2: It's actually B.Automotives. The green line is R.Motors.
Task.Q3: B. Automotives. R.Motors is the green line.
Task.Guide: 서로 다른 방향으로 가고 있는 것 같다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
It {looks like} they're [trending in] [different directions].
It seems like they're going in different directions.
The two appear to be trending in different directions.
The two seem as if they are going in different directions.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean they're trending in different directions?
Task.Key: It {looks like} they're trending in different directions.
Use_Key: It looks like the trend is going to fluctuate.
I look like I am doing just fine.
We look like we are working too much, but the truth is, we are not.
Use_Guide: 동향은 변동할 것으로 보인다고 말해보세요.
나는 아주 잘하고 있는 것처럼 보인다고 말해보세요.
우리는 너무 많이 일하는 것처럼 보이지만, 사실 우리는 많이 일하지 않는다고 말해보세요.

Complete.Reaction: But we're staying the same.

Mission.Title: Getting Some Help 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 이전 이메일을 검토한 것에 대해 감사하다고 하고, 검토 한 번 더 해줄 수 있냐고 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Thank Liz for revising the earilier email, and ask her if she could look at another email.

Task.Q1: Thanks for your help with that e-mail earlier.
Task.Q2: Thanks for helping me with the email earlier.
Task.Q3: Thanks for the help earlier.
Task.Guide: 괜찮다고 말하면서, 언제든지 물어보라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[No problem. Anytime]}.
No problem, just ask me anytime.
No sweat. Feel free to ask me anytime.
No sweat. You can ask me anytime.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say there's no problem?

Task.Q1: I hate to do this to you, but I have to ask.
Task.Q2: I hate to do this, but I have another request.
Task.Q3: Another favor to ask you.
Task.Guide: 또 다른 이메일을 말하는 것인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Another e-mail?]}
You need me to revise another email?
Is it regrading email?
Is it over email?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say another e-mail?

Task.Q1: Would you mind looking at another one for me?
Task.Q2: Would you like to look at another one for me?
Task.Q3: Can you look at another one?
Task.Guide: 사실 나는 많은 시간이 있지 않다고 말하면서 하지만 Ben은 시간이 있을 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Actually, {I don't have a lot of time} right now. But [I think] [Ben is free].
Actually, I have little time right now. Ben may be free though.
I actually don't have much time right now. But maybe Ben is free.
I actually don't have the time right now. But perhaps Ben is free.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you think Ben is free?

Task.Q1: I don't know. I guess I'm not that close with him.
Task.Q2: I'm not sure. I am not that close to him.
Task.Q3: I'm not so sure about him.
Task.Guide: 그는 멋진 사람이라고 말하면서, 내가 너였으면 나는 그에게 확실히 물어보겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
He's a great guy. {If I were you}, [I'd definitely] [ask him].
He's a wonderful guy. If I were you, I'd certainy ask him.
Not to worry. He's a great person. I'd ask him if I were you.
Not to worry. He's an awsome person. I'd question him if I were in your position.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean if you were me, you'd definitely ask him?
Task.Key: {If I were you}, I'd definitely ask him.
Use_Key: If I had a choice, I'd go ask him.
If they were here, I'd ask them.
If I were free tonight, I'd hang out with you.
Use_Guide: 내가 선택권이 있었다면, 나는 그에게 물어봤을 거라고 말해 보세요.
그들이 여기에 있었다면, 나는 그들에게 물어봤을 것이다고 말해 보세요.
내가 오늘 밤에 시간이 있었다면, 너랑 시간을 보냈을 것이라고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Just one more e-mail. Come on, it'll just take a minute.

Mission.Title: Let's Call It a Night
Mission.Description_Ko: 내일 아침 해야하는 프레젠테이션 때문에 친구와의 술자리를 이만 정리하려고 합니다. 한 잔 더 하자는 친구의 제안을 거절하고 술자리를 정리해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are drinking with your friend. Now you want to call it a night as you have a presentation tomorrow morning.

Task.Q1: But don't you want to get one more round?
Task.Q2: Should we get one more drink?
Task.Q3: Would you like another drink?
Task.Guide: 그만 마시는 게 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, I am [slowing down]. 
I think I should stop here now. 
I don't think I should get one more drink. 
I'm not sure if I should get one more drink.
I'm thinkin I'd better stop here for today.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are slowing down?

Task.Q1: Are you going to leave me so early?
Task.Q2: Let's have one more round.
Task.Q3: Let's have just one more.
Task.Guide: 회의 때문에 내일 일찍 일어나야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I {have to} [get up early] [for a meeting].
I just have to crawl out of bed early tomorrow for a meeting. 
I have an meeting tomorrow morning. 
I have to get out of bed at 6am tomorrow.
I should head out early tommorow morning for a meeting.
I have to go to work early for a meeting tomorrow. 
I really need to go to work early for a metting tomorrow.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you have to get up early for a meeting tomorrow?

Task.Q1: I really wanted to have one more drink with you.
Task.Q2: I really wanted to have one more.
Task.Q3: I really wanted to have one more drink with you.
Task.Guide: 일찍 가야 해서 미안하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sorry to} have to [leave early]. 
I'm sorry I have to leave so early.
I am really sorry that I'm leaving this early.
I feel bad to leave this early.
You know I'm sorry to leave early today, don't you?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are sorry to leave early?

Task.Q1: I guess it's time to call it a night.
Task.Q2: I guess it's time to head home.
Task.Q3: I guess its time to go home.
Task.Guide: 내일 프레젠테이션을 잘하고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {I need to} [make sure] my presentation tomorrow is [good]. 
I don't want my presentation to be bad. 
I want my presentation to be good. 
I want to do well on my presentation tomorrow. 
I'm really hoping that I will do well on my presentation tomorrow.
I've prepared for this for a long time and I really have to do well tomorrow.
Task.Are_you_saying: You want to make sure your presentation tomorrow is good?
Task.Key: I guess it's time to {call it a night}.
Task.Use_Key: Why don't we call it a night?

Complete.Reaction: Yeah, go sleep it off. I don't want to get blamed if your presentation is bad tomorrow.

Mission.Title: Everything You Want 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 회사에서 휴식을 취하기 위해 술을 마시려고 합니다. 관련 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on drinking while taking a break at work.

Task.Q1: You still want to get that drink?
Task.Q2: Still want to get that drink?
Task.Q3: Still want to drink?
Task.Guide: 당연하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Absolutely]}.
Certainly.
You're telling me.
For sure.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say absolutely?

Task.Q1: I need to blow off a little steam. Where did you have in mind?
Task.Q2: I would need to blow off steam. Where do you want to go?
Task.Q3: I need to blow off steam somewhere. Any suggestions?
Task.Guide: 내가 방문하고 싶었던 Momos라는 곳이 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{There's this place} called [Momo's] I've been [wanting to try].
There's a place called Momo's that I wanted to try.
A place called Momo's. I was wanting to visit the place.
Momo's. I was wanting to visit the place for a long time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean there's a place called Momo's you've been wanting to try?

Task.Q1: Count me in. I need to get my mind off work a bit.
Task.Q2: Incude me. I need to refresh my mind a bit.
Task.Q3: Include me. I need to focus on other things.
Task.Guide: 솔직히 말하자면 오랫동안 술집을 개업하기를 원했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I've been wanting to} [open a bar] [for a while now].
I've wanted to open a bar for a while.
I wanted to open a bar for some time.
I wanted to open a bar for a long time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you've been wanting to open a bar for while now?

Task.Q1: So, what's your point?
Task.Q2: So, what's the verdict?
Task.Q3: And what are you trying to say?
Task.Guide: 그래서 말인데 나와 함께 확인해보지 않겠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Speaking of which, {do you mind} [checking it out] [with me?]
I mean, how about checking it out with me?
What I'm trying to say is, do you want to check it out with me?
So, would you like to check it out with me?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I mind checking it out with you?
Task.Key: {Do you mind} checking it out with me?
Use_Key: Do you mind seeing if the tickets are still available?
Do you mind bringing some more blankets?
Do you mind being in the center of attention?
Use_Guide: 티켓이 아직도 남아 있는지 볼(확인)해도 되는지 물어보세요.
담요를 좀 더 가져올 수 있는지 물어보세요.
너는 주목 받는 것에 신경쓰는지 (괜찮아하는지) 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Sure, why not.

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_명언 따라읽기 : 행복편

Description.Description_Ko: AI 튜터와 마지막으로 행복과 관련된 명언들을 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the happiness quotes you've learned. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {'Happiness held is the seed; happiness shared is the flower.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Happiness held is the seed; happiness shared is the flower.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The most worthwhile thing is to put happiness into the lives of others.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The most worthwhile thing is to put happiness into the lives of others.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다.
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly.

Mission.Title: Finally Hitched!
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 방금 결혼식을 했습니다. 당신을 축하해주러 온 친구 Jane과 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You just got married now. Talk to your friend Jane who has come to the wedding to celebrate your big day.

Task.Q0: Congradulations on your big day!
Task.Q1: You look gorgeous.
Task.Q2: You look fantastic.
Task.Q3: You are glowing.
Task.Guide: 너를 봐서 너무 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It' s great to} [see you].
I'm so glad to see you.
I'm so happy to see you.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean it's great to see me?

Task.Q0: The whole ceremony was just so perfect.
Task.Q1: and the food was divine!
Task.Q2: and the food was absolutely amazing!
Task.Q3: and the food was excellent!
Task.Guide: 날아갈 것 같은 기분이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'm absolutely floating on air]}.
I'm so happy.
I'm so excited.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're absolutely floating on air?

Task.Q0: So you finally tied the knot after all this time.
Task.Q1: I always knew you and Ashton were perfect for each other.
Task.Q2: I always knew you two were a perfect match.
Task.Q3: I always know you and Ashton would go well together.
Task.Guide: 안그랬으면 우리 부모님은 충격을 받으셨을 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[My parents would have been shocked] [if we hadn't]}.
My mom and dad would have fainted if we hadn't
M mother and father would been knocked out if we hadn't
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying they would have been shocked if you guys hadn't?
Task.Key: My parents {would have been shocked} if we hadn't.
Use_Key: I would have been disappointed if I hadn't got this job.
She would have been upset if you hadn't invited her.
He would have been excited if he had met her yesterday.
Use_Guide: 내가 이번에 취업을 못했으면 실망했을 거라고 말해 보세요.
네가 그녀를 초대하지 않았으면 그녀는 속상해 했을 거라고 말해 보세요.
그가 어제 그녀를 만났으면 신나 했을 거라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: Alex and I wanted to give you a little something.
Task.Q1: It's not suprisingly big.
Task.Q2: It’s not something special.
Task.Q3: It's nothing special.
Task.Guide: 안 그래도 됐는데라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[You didn't have to]}.
It's very thoughtful of you.
Thank you so much.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I didn't have to?

Task.Q0: It's not every day my best friend gets married right?
Task.Q1: You know how special you are to me.
Task.Q2: You are really special to me.
Task.Q3: You are my closest friend.
Task.Guide: 정말 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I really appreciate it]}.
Thanks so much.
I'm so grateful.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you really appreciate it?

Task.Q0: I know you'll have fun.
Task.Q1: I hope your years to come be filled with gladness.
Task.Q2: I'll pray you have a joyful future.
Task.Q3: Wishing you many years of happiness.
Task.Guide: 네가 최고라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I'm the best?

Complete.Reaction: Thanks again.

Mission.Title: A New Friend
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 애견 분양사입니다. 강아지를 새 가족으로 맞이한 Melinda의 질문에 대답을 해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are helping Melinda who has decided to bring a dog as her new family member. Listen carefully and answer to her questions.

Task.Q0: I've had my heart set on getting a Yorkie for a long time.
Task.Q1: I didn't know this day would come.
Task.Q2: I can't believe today is the day.
Task.Q3: It feels like like a dream.
Task.Guide: 정말 좋아하실거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[You're going to love it]}.
You're definitely going to like it a lot.
I'm sure you'll adore it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I'm going to love it?

Task.Q0: I've heard they bark a lot though.
Task.Q1: So I'm worried about my neighbors.
Task.Q2: So I'm concerned about my neighbors.
Task.Q3: So, I can't stop thinking about my neighbors.
Task.Guide: 조용히 하도록 훈련시킬 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{They can} [be taught] [to be quiet].
They can learn to be quiet.
It is possible to teach them to be quiet.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that they can be taught to be quiet?

Task.Q0: Are they hard to housetrain?
Task.Q1: I've heard so many people had hard times.
Task.Q2: I was told that many people had difficulties.
Task.Q3: People said that it was quite tough.
Task.Guide: 적응하면 문제없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[There are no problems] {when} [they get used to it].
Everything is going to okay when they adapt to it.
Hard times pass when they think it's their home.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that there are no problems when they get used to it?

Task.Q0: Does he have all his shots?
Task.Q1: This is so essential.
Task.Q2: This is really mandatory.
Task.Q3: This is a must do thing.
Task.Guide: 두 번 확인했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I've double checked it]}.
I've checked it twice
I checked it at least twice.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've double checked it?

Task.Q0: Is there anything else I need to know?
Task.Q1: I want to double check all the requirements.
Task.Q2: I would like to make sure everything I need is checked.
Task.Q3: I want to be certain that I didn't miss anything.
Task.Guide: 준비가 다 된 것을 확신한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sure} [you're all set].
I've positive that you're all ready.
I can assure that you've got everything.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're sure I'm all set?
Task.Key: {I'm sure} you're all set.
Use_Key: I'm sure they are leaving tonight.
I'm sure he said it to me the other day.
Are you sure you don't want this?
Use_Guide: 그들이 오늘 떠나는 것을 확신한다고 말해 보세요.
그가 지난 번에 내게 그 말을 한 것을 확신한다고 말해 보세요.
이것을 진짜 원하지 않냐고 물어보세요.
Use_Hint: [he said it to me], [the other day]

Task.Q0: Thanks for all your help.
Task.Q1: He's going to make a great addition to the family.
Task.Q2: He'll be a wonderful new member of the family.
Task.Q3: He's going to be a perfect member of the family.
Task.Guide: 강아지가 주인을 잘 만났다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[He's in good hands]}.
He met a good master.
His master is trustworthy.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he's in good hands?

Complete.Reaction: I hope so too.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 과제 편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 과제와 관련하여 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you talk about your assignment.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"look up ~"}은 "~을 찾아보다, 검색하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "look up ~" is an expression telling you are searching for.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"look up ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "look up ~." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"look up ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "look up ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 과제에 대해 말할 때 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use when you talk about your assignment.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"cram for ~"}는 "~을 벼락치기로 공부하다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "cram for ~" is an expression telling what you study.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"cram for ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "cram for ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"cram for ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "cram for ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 과제와 관련하여 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used to talk about papers or projects.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"finish by ~"}은 "~까지 끝내다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "finish by ~" is an expression answering the destination.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"finish by ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "finish by ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"finish by ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "finish by ~."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 유학 생활 중 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used during studying abroad.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

content_name: Is there a nice coffee shop around here?

Mission.Title: Is there a nice coffee shop around here?
Mission.Description_Ko: 커피를 마시고 싶은 당신, 친구 Sean에게 근처에 카페가 있는지 묻고 서점도 있는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You want to have some coffee. Ask your friend, Sean, if there is a coffee shop nearby and ask if there is a book store, too.

Task.Q1: I'd like some coffee.
Task.Q2: I want some coffee.
Task.Q3: I need coffee.
Task.Guide: Sean에게 근처에 좋은 커피숍이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is there} [a nice coffee shop] [around here?]
Do you know a nice cafe nearby?
Any good coffee shops near here?
A nice coffee shop around here?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying is there a  nice coffee shop around here?
Task.Key: {Is there} a nice coffee shop {around here}?
Use_Key: Is there a good restaurant around here?
Is there a bank around here?
Is there a convenience store around here?
Use_Guide: 근처에 좋은 식당이 있는지 물어보세요.
근처에 은행이 있는지 물어보세요.
근처에 편의점이 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: There is one just around the corner.
Task.Q1: There is a coffee shop.
Task.Q2: A coffee shop is there.
Task.Q3: There it is.
Task.Guide: 커피가 맛있냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is their coffee} [good]?
Does the coffee taste good?
Do they have good coffee?
Does the shop have nice coffee?
How is the coffee like?
Is it any good?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if their coffee is good?

Task.Q0: You will like it.
Task.Q1: Their coffee is really wonderful.
Task.Q2: Their coffee tastes so good.
Task.Q3: Their coffee is good.
Task.Guide: 근데 커피숍 주변에 서점도 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Is there} [a book store] [near the coffee shop?]
Do you also know if there is a book store near the coffee shop?
Any bookstores near the coffee shop?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if there is a book store near the coffee shop?

Task.Q1: There is a big book store near the coffee shop.
Task.Q2: There is a big book store around the shop.
Task.Q3: There is one near the shop.
Task.Guide: 책을 한 권 사야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I need to} [buy] [a book].
I want to buy a book.
I have to buy a book.
I'd like to buy a book.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you need to buy a book?

Task.Guide: 커피를 마시고 같이 가자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Let's} [go there] [after coffee].
Can we go there after coffee?
Would you like to go there after coffee?
Why don't we go there after coffee?
How about go there after coffee?
Do you want to go there after coffee?
Task.Are_you_saying: You want to go there after coffee?

Complete.Reaction: Sounds good! I might buy one, too.

Mission.Title: Which way are you going?
Mission.Description_Ko: 공항에 가야하는 친구 Jake가 당신에게 가장 빠른 길을 물어봅니다. 공항까지 가는데 시간이 가장 적게 소요되는 길에 대한 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Your friend Jake is asking you about the shortest route to get to the airport. Talk to him about it.

Task.Reaction: Hey, can I ask you something?
Task.Q1: I'm worried I won't get to the airport in time for my flight.
Task.Q2: I'm worried that I won't arrive on time for my flight.
Task.Q3: So worried about arriving late for my flight.
Task.Guide: 어느 길로 가는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Which way are you going?]}
Which is the way you are going?
Which route are you taking?
What road do you plan on taking?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking which way I am going?

Task.Q1: I’m taking the expressway.
Task.Q2: Via the expressway.
Task.Q3: The expressway.
Task.Guide: 그 길은 혼잡하기 때문에 다른 길로 가야한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You should} [try another route]. [That road is always busy].
You should try going another route. The road you're taking is always busy.
Try going another route. The road you're currently taking is always busy.
Try going another route. The road you're taking now is busy all the time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I should try another route as that road is always busy?

Task.Q1: What’s the best way to get there?
Task.Q2: What's the optimal route?
Task.Q3: What's the best way then?
Task.Guide: 이전(오래된) 고속도로를 타라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Take the old highway]}.
Go by the old highway.
Travel via the old highway.
Via the old highway.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I'd better take the old highway?

Task.Q0: What do you mean?
Task.Guide: 그 길은 차가 안 막힌다고 설명해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {[there’s never any traffic]}.
Yes, the old highway has no traffic.
Yes, because there's never traffic in the area.
Yes, it should be chosen because there is no traffic.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying there's never any traffic?
Task.Key: Yes, {there is} never any traffic.
Use_Key: There were never any warnings when we left.
There was no one to help me at that time.
There have never been any complaints about the new rules.
Use_Guide: 우리가 떠날 때 단 한번의 경고조차 없었다고 말해 보세요.
그 때는 나를 도와줄 수 있는 사람이 아무도 없었다고 말해 보세요.
새로운 규칙에 대해 여태껏 단 한번도 불평이 없었다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Alright then. I'll go there.

Mission.Title: Going hiking in the Himalayas
Mission.Description_Ko: 히말라이야 산맥으로 휴가를 떠나는 Jaden과 대화를 나누어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation with your friend Jaden on spending vacation in the Himalayas.

Task.Q0: You know what?
Task.Q1: I’m looking forward to my vacation.
Task.Q2: I anticipate spending my upcoming vacation.
Task.Q3: I'm happy about my next vacation.
Task.Guide: 어디로 가는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Where are you going?]}
Where do you plan on visiting?
Where is it that you want to go?
What place are you going to?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking where I am going?

Task.Q1: I’m going hiking in the Himalayas.
Task.Q2: I'm going to go hiking in the Himalayas.
Task.Q3: The Himalayas.
Task.Guide: 어렵지 않을까 걱정되지 않냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Aren’t you worried]} [it might be difficult?]
Aren't you worried about it being difficult?
Don't you think it would be difficult?
Don't you think it is going to be difficult?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I'm not worried it might be difficult?
Task.Key: {Aren’t you worried} it might be difficult?
Use_Key: Aren't you shocked it didn't work?
Isn't he serious about vacationing in the Himalyas?
I am amazed at the beautiful scenery.
Use_Guide: 잘 되지 않아서 놀라지 않았냐고 물어보세요.
그는 진지하게 히말라야 산맥에서 휴가를 보내는 거 아니냐고 물어보세요.
나는 아름다운 광경에 놀랐다고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: I’m optimistic about the experience. The views will be great.
Task.Q2: I'm positive that it won't be so hard and the views will be great.
Task.Q3: It's going to be easy and beautiful.
Task.Guide: 신나겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I bet} [you’re excited].
I can tell you're very excited.
Yeah you're so excited.
Yeah you're very excited.
Task.Are_you_saying: You bet I'm excited?

Task.Q1: I’m ready to start my vacation now. I don’t know if I can wait another week.
Task.Q2: I'm ready to start vacationing now. I can't wait one more week.
Task.Q3: I can't wait another week.
Task.Guide: 돌아오면 여행 얘기를 해 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I can’t wait to} [hear about it] [when you get back].
I can't wait to listen to you when you get back.
I look forward to hearing about it when you get back.
I look forward to listening to you when you get back.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you can't wait to hear about it when I get back?

Complete.Reaction: Yes, I'll tell you all about it.

Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 여러분은 이제 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었습니다. 튜터와 함께 문구류를 소개하는 방법을 배워보세요!
