description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_얼마나 자주 하니?

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 빈도를 나타낼 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you talk about the frequency of actions.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"usually"}은 "대체로, 대개, 대부분의 경우에"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "usually" is an expression talking about what you do at most times.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"usually"}와 같이 쓰일 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "usually." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"usually"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with "usually."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 다른 표현을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"sometimes"}은 "때때로"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "sometimes" is an expression talking about what you do at times.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"sometimes"}와 같이 쓰일 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used "sometimes."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"sometimes"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "sometimes."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 마지막 표현을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"rarely"}는 "정말 드물게"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "rarely" is an expression talking about what you do at times.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"rarely"}와 같이 쓰일 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used "rarely."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"rarely"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "rarely."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 빈도를 나타낼 때 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used to express frequency.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 과제편

Description.Description_Ko: {"Campus English : 과제편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Campus English : Papers & Projects"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 대학교에서 시험과 과제에 대해 이야기해보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about your exams and projects in college.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Can I help you with anything?
Quiz.Guide: {"look up"}을 이용해 {"중간고사 결과 좀 찾아봐 줄래?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Can you look up the results of the midterm?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 내가 듣기론 그거 내일 게시된다던데. 그거 어디에서 확인할 수 있어?
Quiz.Quiz_En: I heard that it'll be posted tomorrow. Where can I check it?
Quiz.Guide: {"post A on B"}를 이용해 {"Park 교수님이 학습 강의실 사이트(class site)에 결과를 게시하실 거야."}'라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Professor Park will post the results on the class site.
Professor Park will post it on the class site.
Professor Park will post it on the class website.
Professor Park will post the results on the class website.

Quiz.Reaction: I see. Then I'll look it up.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Hey, do you want to go to the movies?
Quiz.Guide: {"아니, 나 도서관에 갈 거야."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
No, I'm going to the library.
I can't. I'm going to the library.
No, I'm going to go to the library.
I can't. I'm going to go to the library.

Quiz.Quiz_En: It's Friday night!
Quiz.Guide: {"cram for"}를 이용해 {"나 기말고사를 위해 벼락치기를 해야 해."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I need to cram for my final exam.
I should cram for my final exam.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Didn't you prepare for that?
Quiz.Guide: {"pull an all-nighter"}를 이용하여 {"나는 밤을 새워야할 것 같아."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I might have to pull an all-nighter.
I need to pull an all-nighter.
I should pull an all-nighter.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그럼 너 너의 조별 과제는 다 했어?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Did you finish your group project then?
Quiz.Guide: {"be working with"}를 이용하여 {"아직 안 했어. 아직 조원들과 작업 중이야."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Not yet. I am still working with my group members.
No. I am still working with my group members.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have a lot left to do?
Quiz.Guide: {"finish … by"}를 이용해 {"내 생각에 우리는 다음 주까지 프로젝트를 끝낼 수 있을 것 같아."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I think we will finish it by next week.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_상황별 표현 : 대중교통편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 대중교통 이용 시 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 예습해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions to use transportation abroad. Read after the AI tutor!

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Is this bus heading to Central Park?
Which stop should I get off at?
Do I have to transfer to another line?
I'll be there in a minute.
Can you drop me off next to the park?

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"1분 내로 도착하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"그곳에 1분 내로 도착합니다."}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I'll be there in a minute.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 단어들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

Mission.Title: Meeting New People
Mission.Description_Ko: 회사에 새로 온 동료 John에게 말을 걸어보세요. 어느 부서 소속인지, 무슨 일을 하는지 물어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to your new colleague John. Ask him which department he is in and what he does?

Task.Q1: Pleased to meet you. I'm John.
Task.Q2: Nice to meet you, too. I'm John.
Task.Q3: Nice to meet you.
Task.Guide: 전에 본 적이 없는데 새로 왔냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I haven't seen you around before]}. [Are you new?]
I don't think I have met you. Are you new?
Are you new? I don't remember seeing you around here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you haven't seen me around before?
Task.Key: I {haven't seen} you around before.
Use_Key: I haven't talked to her since this summer.
She hasn't finished the project yet.
He hasn't told me that he quit the job.
Use_Guide: 이번 여름 이후로 그녀와 이야기한 적이 없다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 아직 그 프로젝트를 끝내지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
그는 아직 나에게 일을 그만뒀다고 말하지 않았다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: I just transferred from the Chicago branch.
Task.Q2: I just moved from the Chicago branch.
Task.Q3: I'm from the Chicago branch.
Task.Guide: 어느 부서 소속인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set: {[Which department are you in?]}
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking which department I am in?

Task.Guide: 그럼 광고를 만드는 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
So {do you} [make advertisements?]
Then, are you making advertisements?
You make advertisements, don’t you?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I make advertisements?

Task.Q0: I'm a brand strategist.
Task.Q1: So I'm responsible for brand development. How about you?
Task.Q2: So I'm in charge of brand development. How about you?
Task.Q3: So I'm in brand development.How about you?
Task.Guide: 나는 회계사라서 예산 관리를 하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I'm an accountant], so [basically I'm in charge of budget management].
I'm an accountant so I'm responsible for budget management.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are an accountant?

Complete.Reaction: I see. Well, I have to go now but hope to have a chat soon again.

Mission.Title: Time for Employee Reviews
Mission.Description_Ko: 중요한 프로젝트에 대해 진행사항을 묻는 John과 대화해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with John who is asking about the process of an important project.

Task.Q0: How have you been?
Task.Q1: Long time, no talk.
Task.Q2: It's been an long time.
Task.Q3: It's been quite a while.
Task.Guide: 프로젝트 때문에 엄청바쁘게 지냈다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I've been all tied up} [with the project].
I was so busy working on the project.
I did nothing but working on the project.
I've been so busy with the project.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've been really busy working on the project?
Task.Key: {I've been all tied up} with the project.
Use_Key: I've been all tied up with my homework last weekend.
I've been all tied up with my paper that's due next week.
I've been all tied up studying for the test.
Use_Guide: 주말동안 숙제하느라 꼼짝을 못했어라고 말해보세요.
다음주에 마감인 논문쓰느라 꼼작을 못했어라고 말해보세요.
시험공부하느라 꼼짝 못했어라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q0: Oh, by the way,
Task.Q1: Are you aware that employee evaluations are around the corner?
Task.Q2: Did you know that employee evaluations are coming up soon?
Task.Q3: Were you informed  about the upcoming employee evaluations?
Task.Guide: 그렇다고 말하면서 그래서 시간이 촉박하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {that's why} we are [so pressed] [for time].
Yes, that's why we are in such a hurry.
Yes, that's why we don't have much time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you are hurrying things up?

Task.Q0: The results must affect the team-achievement this year.
Task.Q1: Just be sure not to micromanage every detail of the process.
Task.Q2: Make sure not to look after every detail of the process.
Task.Q3: Keep in mind that you shouldn't care about every detail of the process.
Task.Guide: 직원들에게 근무장소 자율성을 줬을때 더 생산적인 것에 대해 동의한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I agree that} [employees] [with workplace autonomy] are [more productive].
I know that employees work better when given the freedom to choose their workplace.
I agree that employees show better results when they can work in and out of the office.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying employees are more productive with workplace autonomy?

Task.Q0: Sometimes the more responsibility you delegate on your staff, the better.
Task.Q1: Your team can expect more effective fringe benefits next year.
Task.Q2: Your team might be able to get more extra benefits next year.
Task.Q3: Your team may look forward to getting more benefits other than their salary next year.
Task.Guide: 우리 팀원들은 아직 회사임금제도가 성과위주라는 것을 알고있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Our team memebers {still recognize that} our company has a [performance-based] [wage system] as well.
Our team members still know that our company's wage system is based on their performances
Our team members still understand that our company wage system depends on their performances.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that your team members still recognize that your company has a performance-based wage system?

Complete.Reaction: As a team leader though, you could expect to asencd the corporate ladder more swiftly.

Mission.Title: Prospecting the Future
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 사업차 프랑크푸르트로 갑니다. David Miller라는 사람을 만나게 되어 서로 왜 프랑크푸르트에 가는지에 대해 이야기를 나눕니다.
Mission.Description_En: You are going to Frankfurt on business. You meet a man named David Miller. You ask him why he's going to Frankfurt, so he tells you about his company.
Mission.Guide_En: Hi, it's nice to meet you.

Task.Q1: Pleased to meet you.
Task.Q2: Nice to meet you.
Task.Q3: Very nice to meet you.
Task.Guide: 프랑크푸르트로 가냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Are you heading for]} [Frankfurt?]
Are you on your way to Frankfurt?
Are you going to Frankfurt?
Are you making your way over to Frankfurt?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking am I heading for Frankfurt?

Task.Q0: I have some business there.
Task.Q1: I work for a mobile communication service provider, EU-Mobile.
Task.Q2: I work for EU-Mobile, a mobile communication service provider.
Task.Q3: I work for a mobile communication service provider.
Task.Guide: EU-모바일은 유럽에서 1세대 아날로그를 시작한 회사가 아니냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
EU-Mobile? {[Isn't that the company] [that launched the first generation analog in Europe?]}
EU-Mobile? Isn't that the company to first launch analog in Europe?
EU-Mobile? That's the first company that launched the first generation analog in Europe, no?
EU-Mobile, the company that launched the first generation analog in Europe?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean isn't that the company that launched the first generation analog in Europe?

Task.Q0: In fact, that is one of the reasons I am flying to Germany.
Task.Q1: We've just launched EUTouch 4G, one of the largest touch screens offered by any of the major carriers.
Task.Q2: We've just launched EUTouch 4G, the largest touch screens offered by the major carriers.
Task.Q3: We've just brought out one of the largest touch screens.
Task.Guide: 오늘 아침에 그것에 대한 기사를 읽었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Oh, I [read an article] {on} [that this morning].
Right, I saw an article on that this morning.
Sure I read about it this morning.
Yup, I came across an acrticle on that this morning.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you read an article on that this morning?
Task.Key: I read an article {on} that this morning.
Use_Key: I read a newspaper article on that this evening.
I found an article on that this morning.
I spotted an article on KPOP this month.
Use_Guide: 오늘 저녁에 그것에 대한 신문 기사를 읽었다고 말해 보세요.
오늘 아침에 그것에 관한 기사를 찾았다고 말해 보세요.
이번 달에 KPOP에 관한 기사를 발겼했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: How about you?
Task.Q1: What will you be doing in Frankfurt?
Task.Q2: What brings you to Frankfurt?
Task.Q3: Why are going to Frankfurt?
Task.Guide: 나도 거기에 볼 업무가 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I [have some business there] [as well]}.
I have some work to do there as well.
My business is there as well.
I have an office there as well.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have some business there as well?

Complete.Reaction: Wonderful. Bon voyage!

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_당신의 이름은 무엇인가요?

Description.Description_Ko: {"당신의 이름은 무엇인가요?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"What Is Your Name?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 이름들을 소개해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's introduce the names.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is your name?
Quiz.Guide: {"My name is"}을 이용해 {"저의 이름은 Bella입니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: My name is Bella.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is his name?
Quiz.Guide: {"His name is"}를 이용해 {"그의 이름은 조지입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: His name is George.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are their names?
Quiz.Guide: {"Their names are"}을 이용해 {"그들의 이름은 미아, 마크, 킴입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Their names are Mia, Marc, Kim.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then what is the cat's name?
Quiz.Guide: {"Her name is"}를 이용해 {"그녀의 이름은 릴리입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Her name is Lily.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is it then?
Quiz.Guide: {"Its name is"}를 이용해 {"이것의 이름은 해바라기입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Its name is a sunflower.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this one?
Quiz.Guide: {"Its name is"}를 이용해 {"이것의 이름은 야자나무입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Its name is a palm tree.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is the baseball team's name?
Quiz.Guide: {"The baseball team's name is"}를 이용하여 {"야구팀의 이름은 이글스입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: The baseball team's name is EAGLES.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_명언 따라읽기 : 우정편

Description.Description_Ko: AI 튜터와 마지막으로 우정과 관련된 명언들을 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the friendship quotes you've learned. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Friends are the siblings God never gave us.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {A single rose can be my garden. A single friend is my world.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: A single rose can be my garden. A single friend is my world.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {There are no strangers here; only friends you haven't yet met.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: There are no strangers here; only friends you haven't yet met.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다.
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly.

Mission.Title: Turnaround.
Mission.Description_Ko: 역전을 꿈꾸는 Isabelle과 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Jasper who is hoping a turnaround.

Task.Q0: If we get bought out by our competitor,
Task.Q1: It is probably because we have not made enough gutsy decisions.
Task.Q2: It is maybe because we have not made enough brave decisions.
Task.Q3: There is a possibility that the reason came from our intimidated decision making.
Task.Guide: 반면에 우리 사장님은 상황판단이 빠른 사람으로 유명하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{On the other hand}, our boss [has a reputation] [for being shrewd].
On the other hand, our boss is known for being calculative.
On the other hadn, our boss is famous for being astute.
In contrast, out boss is famous for being nimble.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that our boss is famous for being shrewd?
Task.Key: {On the other hand}, our boss has a reputation for being shrewd.
Use_Key: On the other hand, he is really good at sports.
On the other hand, I can go to the U.S instead.
On the other hand, we have a nice house.
Use_Guide: 반면에 그는 운동을 엄청 잘한다고 말해 보세요.
반면에 나는 대신 미국에 갈 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
반면에 우리는 좋은 집이 있다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: But I think being charismatic is also important.
Task.Q2: But that's not enough.
Task.Q3: But I think we need something more than that.
Task.Guide: CEO로부터 더 많은 카리스마와 행동력이 필요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We could use} [more charisma and action] [from the CEO].
We need stronger leadership and  movement from our boss.
There should be more charisma and action from the CEO.
We need more charisma and action from the CEO.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we could use more charisma and action from the CEO?

Task.Q0: However,
Task.Q1: Let's not give up hopes yet.
Task.Q2: It's too early to give up.
Task.Q3: Let's not put eveything down yet.
Task.Guide: 맞다고 말하면서 우리는 대담해질 필요가 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That's right}, we [need to] be [bold].
Right, we need to be strong.
True, we need to stay firm.
Right, we should be daring.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we need to be bold?

Task.Q1: Mentality and team spirit are a big part of the enterprise.
Task.Q2: The mind and team motivation are a major factor of a company.
Task.Q3: Determination and team spirit are an important part of the business.
Task.Guide: 리더십의 중요성을 과소평가하지 말아야겠다는 것을 배웠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I have learned} [never to undervalue] [the importance of leadership].
I have learned that leadership is something you should not underestimate.
I have learned to consider leadership as prior values over many.
I have learned that we shouldn't underestimate the importance of leadership.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've learned never to undervalue the importance of leadership?

Complete.Reaction: You're definitely right.

Mission.Title: Downtime
Mission.Description_Ko: 업무로 인해 힘들어하는 Ethan과 대화해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Ethan who is having a hard time with work.

Task.Q0: All these deadlines are really getting to me.
Task.Q1: I can't wait to have some quality downtime this weekend.
Task.Q2: I am desperate to have some nice relaxing moments on the weekend.
Task.Q3: I am so much looking forward to having some good time off this weekend.
Task.Guide: 이 문제들은 보기보다 작다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{These problems} are not [as big as] [it seems].
Thses problems are smaller than you think.
These problems are less critical than it looks.
These problems might not be as big as you think.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that these problems are not as big as it seems?

Task.Q0: We're always facing trade-offs.
Task.Q1: To get more success requires more sacrifice.
Task.Q2: More sacrifice is needed in order to gain greater success.
Task.Q3: There has to be more sacrifice to obtain more success.
Task.Guide: 때로는 성공을 내려놓고 덜 희생하고싶다라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Sometimes {I want to} [put down success] and [sacrifice less].
I want to give up success and sacrifice less time to time.
I occasionally want to let go of success and make less sacrifices.
I sometimes just want to give up success and sacrifice less.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you wand to put down success and sacrifice less?

Task.Q0: I believe we all need to slow down once in a while.
Task.Q1: We should prevent ourselves from being deflated.
Task.Q2: We don't want to over-do ourselves
Task.Q3: We shouldn't burn ourselves out.
Task.Guide: 맞다고 말하면서 우리는 예전 방식의 휴식이 필요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You're right}, we need [old fashioned] [R&R].
True, we need old fashioned rest and relaxation.
I agree, we need the original rest and relaxation.
That's right, we need old fashioned R&R.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that we need old fashioned R&R?

Task.Q1: Even email seems to be another barrier before I start my real work.
Task.Q2: Even email seems to be another hill to climb before getting to my real work.
Task.Q3: Even email seems like a hassle  before starting my real duty.
Task.Guide: 매 분기마다 새로운 판에 시작할 수 있었으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I wish I could} [start each quarter] [with a clean slate].
I hope I could start fresh each quarter clean and new.
I wish I can start each quarter with nothing on top of each other.
I wish I could start each quarter from the whole new point.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you wish to start each quarter with a clean slate?
Task.Key: {I wish I could} start each quarter with a clean slate.
Use_Key: I wish I could be like him.
I wish I could travel around the world.
I wish I could tell you the truth.
Use_Guide: 그와 같이 될 수 있었으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
세계를 여행할 수 있었으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
너에게 사실대로 말할 수 있었으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: So do I.

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_제대로 발음하자! : F & P편

Description.Description_Ko: 자주 혼동되는 /F/와 /P/ 발음. AI 튜터와 마지막으로 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the confusing pronunciations in English of {"/F/ and /P/"} for the last time with me. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Four fantastic frogs flew from feisty five hundred fifty fish.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Four fantastic frogs flew from feisty five hundred fifty fish.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Five founders of the patty pineapple pound cake are finally found.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Five founders of the patty pineapple pound cake are finally found.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Followers of freaky Fred pause for proper applause.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Followers of freaky Fred pause for proper applause.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Paul's furry cat Perry purred when Paul put his pills inside of the plastic bag.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Paul's furry cat Perry purred when Paul put his pills inside of the plastic bag.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {A French patriot who face painted the flag of France is practicing to run for his country with his pacemaker.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: A French patriot who face painted the flag of France is practicing to run for his country with his pacemaker.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Princess Fiona picked a pair of fish she fished from the pond and fried them with a frying pan.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Princess Fiona picked a pair of fish she fished from the pond and fried them with a frying pan.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 혼동되는 /F/ /P/ 발음을 이제 정말 마스터하셨네요! 축하합니다. :)
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You’ve mastered some of confusing pronunciation in English. Congratulations!

Mission.Title: Visiting parents
Mission.Description_Ko: 다가오는 이번 휴일에 무엇을 할 것인지에 대해 동료 Tracy와 대화를 나누어보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation with your colleague, Tracy, on what you are going to do over the coming weekend.

Task.Q1: What are you doing for the long weekend?
Task.Q2: What do you plan on doing this weekend?
Task.Q3: Do this weekend?
Task.Guide: 나는 부모님을 뵈러 갈 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm going to} [visit my parents] [while I'm off work].
I'm going to see my parents after working during the day.
I will visit my parents when I get off work.
I will see my parents after I finish working.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're going to visit your parents while you're off work?
Task.Key: {I'm going to} visit my parents while I'm off work.
Use_Key: I'm going to do my homework in the meanwhile.
I'm going to be on vacation next week.
She isn't going to go home right away.
Use_Guide: 그 사이에 나는 숙제를 할 거라고 말해 보세요.
나는 다음 주에 휴가 중일 거라고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 바로 집에 가지 않을 거라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Where do your parents live?
Task.Q2: Do you know where your parents live?
Task.Q3: Your parents live where?
Task.Guide: Georgetown에서 사신다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
They [live] {in} [Georgetown].
They reside in the town called Georgetown.
I do. They live in the Georgetown area.
In Georgetown, no doubt.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying they live in Georgetown?

Task.Q1: That’s not too far away.
Task.Q2: It's not too far off.
Task.Q3: Not too far then.
Task.Guide: Tracy에게 이번 휴일에 뭔가를 계획하고 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are you planning on} [doing anything] [for the holiday?]
What about you? Planning on doing anything this holiday?
And you? Do you plan on doing something for the holidays?
And you? Are you going to do anything over the holidays?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean am I planning on doing anything for the holiday?

Task.Q0: Unfortunately
Task.Q1: I might have to work. I have a big presentation to work on.
Task.Q2: I may work. I have a big presentation to prepare.
Task.Q3: Work perhaps, on my presentation.
Task.Guide: 안됐다고, 휴일에 쉬었으면 좋았을텐데라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That’s too bad]. {It would be great} [to take the holidays off].
Too bad. It would be great to rest over the holidays.
What a shame. You should take holidays off.
What a pity. You should rest on holidays.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it would be great to take the holidays off?

Complete.Reaction: I know, but it's a must!

description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_What would you do? : Travel편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 수업에서 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that you can use today before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 우선 토픽 카드 속 질문들의 핵심 표현을 확인해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check some key expressions in the question first. Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 이번에는 질문에 대답할 때 유용하게 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: From now on, let's practice some useful expressions that you can use to answer the questions.

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can use for today's lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~와 완전히 다른"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"문화적 차이를 마주하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~를 신경 쓰지 않다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"못 들은 척 하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"손가락으로 귀를 막다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"자리를 봐 달라고 요청하다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"어쩔 수 없는"}을 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the expressions perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 튜터와 여행 중에 곤란한 상황에 대처하는 방법에 관해 말해보는 시간을 가져보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, share your ideas of how to deal with the trouble during the trips with the tutor through the class.

Mission.Title: Organizational Structure
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 상사가 은퇴를 앞두게 되면서, 승진 인터뷰를 보게 되었습니다. 면접관 Ms.Jenkins에게 왜 당신이 그 직책의 적임자인지 설명해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: As your boss is retiring, you have been considered as a candidate for his replacement. Explain why you are an excellent candidate for the position to Ms.Jenkins who is interviewing you.

Task.Q1: I hope that you didn’t have to wait too long.
Task.Q2: Hopefully you didn't wait here long.
Task.Q3: Did you wait long?
Task.Guide: 괜찮다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It was no problem]}.
It was no sweat.
No, it was okay.
No, it was fine.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it was no problem?

Task.Q0: Let's get down to buisness.
Task.Q1: Have you heard about the staff changes in your department? I suspect that you have heard that your boss is retiring soon.
Task.Q2: Did you hear about the staff changes in your department? I heard that your boss is retiring soon.
Task.Q3: There will be staff changes in your department. Your boss will retire soon.
Task.Guide: 들었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Yes, I have]}.
Yes, I have heard.
Yes, I heard about it.
Yes, so I hear.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you have?

Task.Reaction: Well, I want to let you know that you are being considered for his position.
Task.Q0: I've asked you here today to find out where you see your future with this company.
Task.Q1: Is it okay if I ask you to describe your current responsibilities?
Task.Q2: Can I ask you to describe your current responsibilities?
Task.Q3: What are your current responsibilities?
Task.Guide: 현재 나는 12명의 직원들로 이루어진 팀을 이끌고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Currently], {[I lead a team of 12 employees]}.
Yes, I'd be glad to. Currently, I am leader of a team of 12 employees.
Sure. I currently lead a team of 12 people.
Sure. I currently lead a 12-member team.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you currently lead a team of 12 employees?

Task.Guide: 나는 팀 내에서 판매 목표를 배정하고 업무를 위임한다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I assign sales goals and delegate tasks] {within} [the team].

Yes, I'd be glad to. Currently, I am leader of a team of 12 employees.
I assign sales goals and delegate tasks among the team members.

Sure. I currently lead a team of 12 people, assigning and delegating sales goals and tasks to them.

Sure. I currently lead a 12-member team, assigning them sales goals and delegating the tasks.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you assign sales goals and delegate tasks within the team?

Task.Q1: Why should we consider you for this promotion?
Task.Q2: Why do we have to consider you for this promotion?
Task.Q3: Why should we promote you?
Task.Guide: 내 부서 내에서의 성과들이 내가 이 직책의 적임자임을 보여준다고 생각한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I feel that} [my accomplishments within my department] [make me an  excellent choice for this position].
I feel that my department accomplishments make me an excellent candidate for the position.
My department achievements make me an excellent candidate for the  position.
My department achievements prove that I am an excellent candidate for the position. .
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you feel that your accomplishments within your department make you an excellent choice for this position?
Task.Key: {I feel that} my accomplishments make me an excellent choice for this position.
Use_Key: I feel that he is an excellent candidate for the position.
I feel that you should go talk to him in person.
I felt that they would never come back.
Use_Guide: 나는 그가 그 직책의 적임자라 생각한다고 말해 보세요.
나는 네가 그를 직접 찾아가 이야기해야 한다고 생각한다고 말해 보세요.
나는 그들이 다시 돌아오지 않을 거라 생각했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 그리고 우리 팀은 꾸준히 분기 목표를 초과했고 내가 리더로 부임한 이후로 판매량은 12% 증가했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[My team has consistently exceeded their quarterly goal] [and sales volume has increased 12%] {since} [I took over as team leader].
My team has persistently exceeded quarterly goals and sales volume increased 12% since I became team leader.
In addition, my team constantly exceeeded quarterly goals. As a result, sales volume increased by 12% since taking over as team leader.
Moreover, my team has exceeded quarterly goals continuously. Sales volume increased by 12%, as a result, since I have taken over as team leader.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean your team has consistently exceeded their quarterly goal and sales volume has increased 12% since you took over as team leader?

Complete.Reaction: I have to say that is quite impressive.

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_당신은 누구인가요? : 직업편

Description.Description_Ko: {"당신은 누구인가요? : 직업편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Who are you : Job"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 여러 직업 표현들을 말해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's name some words of jobs.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is her job?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 교사입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is a teacher.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, who are they?
Quiz.Guide: {"They are"}를 이용해 {"그들은 군인입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: They are soldiers.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then what is his job?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 사진작가입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is a photographer.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then what is his job?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 판사입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is a judge.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, who is he?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 우주 비행사입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is an astronaut.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, who is she?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 소방관입니다."}라고 답해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is a firefighter.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Last question! What is her job?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 수의사입니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is a veterinarian.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Collaborating with Co-Workers
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료와 파워포인트 수정사항에 대해 논의해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Discuss with your colleague, the revisions to be made on the powerpoint.

Task.Q1: We came by to check on how you are doing on the PowerPoint. Would you mind if we took a look at what you’ve finished so far?
Task.Q2: We came to check on your progress on the PowerPoint. Do you mind if we take a look?
Task.Q3: Can we check your progress on the PowerPoint?
Task.Guide: 처음 해보는 거니까 피드백을 주시면 정말 감사하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Of course not. [It’s my first time doing this], {so} [I’d really appreciate your feedback].

Of course not. It's my first time, so I would appreciate your feedback.

No, not at all. I did this for the first time, so I would appreciate any feedback.

Sure, why not. I have never done this before, so I would appreciate they feedback.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd really appreciate my feedback as it's your first time doing this?

Task.Q1:
Overall, everything looks good, but this slide is a little
unclear. What do you think, Mr. Gupta?
Task.Q2: Everything looks good overall. This slide though is a bit unclear. Any thoughts?
Task.Q3: Everything's good, except this slide, which is unclear. Any thoughts?
Task.Guide: 그래프의 색 구성표를 바꾸는 것에 대해 어떻게 생각하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I agree…{what do you think about} [changing] [the color scheme of the graph?]

I agree…what are your thoughts on changing the graph's color scheme?

I think so too. How about changing the color scheme of the graph?

I think so as well. Do you think you can change the color scheme of the  graph?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I think about changing the color scheme of the graph?
Task.Key: {What do you think about} changing the color scheme of the graph?
Use_Key: What do you think about moving to Jeju island?
What do you think about buying this coffee machine for her?
What do you think about hiring him for the position?
Use_Guide: 제주도로 이사가는 것에 대해서 어떻게 생각하는지 물어보세요.
그녀에게 이 커피 머신을 사주는 것에 대해서 어떻게 생각하는지 물어보세요.
그 직책에 그를 고용하는 것에 대해서 어떻게 생각하는지 물어보세요.

Task.Guide: 구성은 좋은데 읽기가 좀 어렵다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[The organization is great], {but} [it’s a little hard to read].
The organization is great, but it's a bit hard to comprehend.
It has great organization, but it is a little hard to read.
It has great organization, but the content is almost  incomprehensible.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying the organization is great but it's a little hard to read?

Task.Q1: What did you have in mind?
Task.Q2: What is it that you had in mind?
Task.Q3: You had in mind?
Task.Guide: 좀 더 밝은 색이 나을지도 모르겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Maybe] [lighter colors would be better]}.

Perhaps lighter colors are better.

Lighter colors would be better.

Ligher colors may be better.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying maybe lighter colors would be better?

Task.Q0: I think I know what you are saying.
Task.Q1: Just a second…. how about this?
Task.Q2: Just a moment… how is this?
Task.Q3: How's this?
Task.Guide: 훨씬 나아 보인다고 말하고 거의 다 된 거 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That looks much better]. {I think} [it's almost finished].

That looks much better. Looks like it's almost finished.

It looks much better. It also seems like it's nearly complete.

It looks very good. In addition, it seems almost complete.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that looks much better?

Task.Guide: 다음 분기의 판매 목표가 들어간 슬라이드를 만들겠다고 말하고, 추가할 것이 있냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I'll also [make a slide with next quarter’s sales targets]. {[Do you have anything to add?]}

I'll use make a slide with next quarter's sales targets. Do you have something to add?

I'll make a slide with sales targets for next quarter. Anything you want to say?

I'm going to make a slide with sales targets for next quarter. Anything you want to add?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have anything to add?

Complete.Reaction: No, I think that everything looks great.

Mission.Title: Hedging Bets
Mission.Description_Ko: 회사의 중요한 결정을 앞둔 Leah와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Leah who has to make an essential decisions in her company.

Task.Q0: Did you see today's headline and stock index in the Financial News?
Task.Q1: Our sector looks all but moribund for the forseseeable future.
Task.Q2: The future of our sector seems to be going down.
Task.Q3: The stocks of our sector is probably going to drop soon.
Task.Guide: 말도안되는 상황이다라고 말해보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's wretched?

Task.Q1: What do you think about hiring a new CRO?
Task.Q2: How about recruiting a new CRO?
Task.Q3: Do you think bringing in a new CRO is necessary?
Task.Guide: 맞아, 보다 전문적인 사람이여야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Right, {[We need someone] [with more expertise]}.
Exactly, With more experience.
Of course, someone who is more professional.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we need someone with more expertise?

Task.Q1: Being able to winnow out the toxic options is a big part of handling dilemmas.
Task.Q2: Taking out the bad options is a major part in averting catastrophes.
Task.Q3: Filtering toxic options is an important part in taking care of compex situations.
Task.Guide: 추가적으로 발생하는 나쁜 결과에 빠른 대응이 필요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We should} [be agile] [to respond to further fallout].
We must be swift to act to extra failure.
We have to be quick to respond to further bad results.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we should be agile to respond to further fallout?

Task.Q1: To make the matter worse, our economy isn't doing very well.
Task.Q2: On top of that, our economy is going downstream.
Task.Q3: Not to mention, our national budget is going downhill.
Task.Guide: 상황이 더 나빠지기 전에 조치를 취해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{We'd better} [find a solution] [before things get worse].
Action is always better than inaction.
We have to figure out a way before matters become worse.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that we'd better find a solution before things get worse?
Task.Key: {We'd better} find a solution before things get worse.
Use_Key: We'd better go home before it's too late.
We'd better make a reservation by tomorrow.
We'd better sell our house before the price drops.
Use_Guide: 너무 늦기 전에 집에 가는게 좋겠다고 말해보세요.
내일까지 예약하는게 좋을 것 같은데라고 말해보세요.
집 가격이 떨어지기 전에 파는게 좋을 것 같다라고 말해보세요.

Complete.Reaction: I hear you.

Mission.Title: Describing People
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Larry와 동네 카페에서 이야기하고 있는데, Larry가 고교 동창 Lizzy Jenkins가 문을 열고 들어왔다고 이야기합니다. 이에 대해 이야기해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are hanging out with your friend Larry at a cafe in the neighborhood. Larry is saying Lizzy Jenkins from high school just walked in. Talk to him about this.

Task.Q1: Look who just walked in the door!
Task.Q2: Look who just came in!
Task.Q3: Look who came!
Task.Guide: 누구를 말하는 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Who] [are you talking about?]}
Which person are you talking about?
Who do you mean?
What person are you taking about?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying who am I talking about?

Task.Q1: It's Lizzy Jenkins from high school.
Task.Q2: Lizzy Jenkins from high school.
Task.Q3: Lizzy Jenkins.
Task.Guide: 머리를 올린 키 큰 금발 여자를 말하는 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The tall blonde] [with her hair up?]}
The tall blonde who has her hair up?
The tall girl who has her blonde hair up?
That tall blonde who has her hair up?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean the tall blonde with her hair up?

Task.Q1: You got it.
Task.Q2: That's right.
Task.Q3: Yup.
Task.Guide: 확실하냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Are you sure} [that's her?]
Are you confident that's her?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean am I sure that's her?

Task.Q1: Her hair is different but I never forget a face.
Task.Q2: Her hair is different but I remember the face.
Task.Q3: Different hair, but I always remember the face.
Task.Guide: 머리 말고는 고등학교 때하고 변한 게 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Other than the hair], {she hasn't changed a bit} [since high school].
Besides the hair, she hasn't changed a bit since high school.
She hasn't changed a bit since high school, besides the hair.
She looks the same since high school, other than the hair.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying other than the hair, she hasn't changed a bit since high school?
Task.Key: She {hasn't changed} a bit since high school.
Use_Key: You haven't changed a bit since college.
He hasn't changed a bit since middle school.
You haven't changed a bit since last year.
Use_Guide: 너는 대학 때랑 변한 게 없다고 말해 보세요.
그는 중학교 때랑 변한 게 없다고 말해 보세요.
너는 작년이랑 변한 게 없다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: I haven't seen her since graduation.
Task.Q1: I heard she moved across the country.
Task.Q2: She moved across the country.
Task.Q3: She moved away.
Task.Guide: 가서 인사할 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Should we} [go over and say hi]?
Do you think we should go over and say hi?
Do you want to go over and say hi?
Would you like to go over and say hi?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying should we go over and say hi?

Complete.Reaction: Yeah. I can't wait to see what she's been up to.

content_name: Speak like a native : Negotiate & Request
description: 02.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_중급 해외 여행 대비_원어민 코스프레 : 여행 중 협상 표현편

Title.Title_Ko: 원어민 코스프레 : 여행 중 협상 표현편
Title.Title_En: Speak like a native : Negotiate & Request

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 여행 중 협상이 필요한 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 예습해봅시다. AI 튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expression to negotiate or request while traveling. Read after the AI tutor!

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I would like to change my seat.

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"비행기 예약이 다 찼습니다."}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~의 자리를 바꾸다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"지독한 담배 냄새가 풍기다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning some more expressions through the class with the tutor.

Mission.Title: Fast Mover
Mission.Description_Ko: 새로운 기회에 대해 Ross와 대화해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Ross about a new opportunity.

Task.Q0: Well, even though sales are sluggish now,
Task.Q1: I think that we can enhance our product by teaming up with a foreign producer.
Task.Q2: I believe that we can upgrade our product by holding hands with a foreign producer.
Task.Q3: I think that we can improve our product by partering up with a foreign producer.
Task.Guide: 그건 새로운 기회로 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That seems like} [a window of opportunity].
That looks like a good chance.
That seems like a new opening.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it seems like a window of opportunity?

Task.Q1: Research confirms that international partnership is great leverage.
Task.Q2: According to research, global partnership is a great help.
Task.Q3: Research shows that international partnership is great synergy.
Task.Guide: 전 세계 사람들이 이 제품을 사용하는데 어렵지 않게 하는게 중요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It is important to} [make sure] [that people across cultures find the products natural to use].
It's vital to assure that people around the world find the products easy to use.
It is crucial to make sure that everyone across the world find the products simple to use.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it is important to make sure that people across cultures find the products natural to use?
Task.Key: {It is important to} make sure that people across cultures find the products natural to use.
Use_Key: It's important to wear seatbelts.
It's important to finish this project in time.
It's important to eat three meals a day.
Use_Guide: 안전벨트를 하는 것이 중요하다고 말해보세요.
시간 내에 이 프로젝트를 마무리하는 것이 중요하다라고 말해보세요.
하루에 세번 식사 하는 것이 중요하다라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: Our CEO always preaches about first mover advantage.
Task.Q2: Our boss always emphasizes about the advantage of first mover.
Task.Q3: Our CEO always gives sermon regarding the advantage fo first mover.
Task.Guide: 그의 철학을 증명할 때가 온 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} [it's a fine time] [to prove his philosophy].
I think it's a perfect time to see his philosopy in motion.
I think it's a right time to check his philosopy come to life.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it's a fine time to prove his philosophy?

Task.Q1: Moving abroad and moving quickly poses hazards, so we must be thoughtful too.
Task.Q2: Going abroad quickly poses dangers, so we should also be careful.
Task.Q3: Moving abroad and moving quickly poses risks, so we have to be extra cautious too.
Task.Guide: 요즘은 생각할 것들이 너무 많다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[There's so much to consider these days]}.
There's so much to think about these days.
There's so much to check these days.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying there's so much to consider these days?

Complete.Reaction: Tell me about it.

Mission.Title: Smarter, Not Harder
Mission.Description_Ko: 기술발전이 가져온 편리성에 대해 George와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with George about the convenience brought by technology development.

Task.Q0: Hunter things have changed so much over the past ten years.
Task.Q1: We not only compete with domestic compeditors, but firms everywhere from Copenhagen to Mumbai.
Task.Q2: We not only have competition between our national brands, but companies all around the world.
Task.Q3: We not only have domestic compeditors, but also firms around the globe.
Task.Guide: 맞아, 기술과 무역은 우리 능력을 향상시켜줬다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[So true]. {[Technology and trade] [have boosted performance]}.
Exactly. Our performance has went up dramatically because of technology and trade.
I know, Technology and trade have strengthened our performance.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that technology and trade have boosted performance?

Task.Q1: We can turn out a new product twice as fast as before.
Task.Q2: We are able to launch a new product two times as fast.
Task.Q3: We are capable of turning out a new product at a doubled speed.
Task.Guide: 맞아, 하지만 언제든지 새로운 아이디어가 준비되었다는 것을 확인해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yep, but {we need to} [make sure] [that we always have new ideas on the horizon].
That's right, but we need to assure that we always have new ideas ready to go.
Yes, we need to double check that we always have new ideas ready to fire.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that we need to make sure that we always have new ideas on the horizon?
Task.Key: {We need to make sure} that we always have new ideas on the horizon.
Use_Key: We need to make sure the money is in a safe place.
We need to make sure that the children are safe at home.
We need to make sure the house has no loans.
Use_Guide: 우리는 돈이 안전한 곳에 있는지 확인해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 아이들이 집에 안전하게 있는지 확인해야 한다고 말해보세요.
우리는 집에 대출이 없는 것을 확인해야 한다라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: Not checking our weak spots could lead to big problems.
Task.Q2: Big problems can occur if we don't check our weak spots.
Task.Q3: Not checking our weakness could bring major problems.
Task.Guide: 그래서 1안과 2안이 모두 필요한 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That is why we need plan A and plan B]}.
That is the reason why plan A and B is necessary.
That is why we must have plan A and plan B.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's why we need plan A and B?

Task.Q1: Even if we do have backup plans, there're always a surprise.
Task.Q2: Unexpected things happen even with back up plans.
Task.Q3: Things may go in a different direction even with plan B.
Task.Guide: 무적의 힘을 줄 수 있는 특허라도 있었으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I wish} [we had the perfect patent] [that would make us invincible].
I hope we had the power to be indestructive.
I wish we had some kind of magic that can keep us untouchable.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you wish we had the perfect patent that would make us invincible?

Complete.Reaction: I used to think that when I was young.

I enjoy riding a bike.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you from?

Quiz.Answer_Set: I am from Seoul, South Korea.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Fudging the Numbers
Mission.Description_Ko: 도덕심에 대해 Jaclyn과 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Jaclyn about moral fiber.

Task.Q0: It's quite shocking to hear the news.
Task.Q1: Braxton seemed to be full of so much moral fiber.
Task.Q2: Braxton seemed honest.
Task.Q3: Braxton appeared to be an ethical person.
Task.Guide: 알고보니 그는 사기꾼이였다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It appears that} [he's been fudging the numbers].
The truth is that he's been dishonest with money.
It turned out he's been stealing company's money.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that he's been fudging the numbers?

Task.Q1: Maybe, an automatic alert system could screen for irregularity.
Task.Q2: Perhaps, a smart defense would be a computer system raising red flags for any suspicious activity.
Task.Q3: Maybe, an AI security system can keep these things from happening.
Task.Guide: 많은 돈이 들 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That would cost  a lot of money]}.
It's going to cost quite a lot.
That's going to need great amount of money.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it would cost a lot of money?
Task.Key: {That would cost}  a lot of money.
Use_Key: That would cost a fortune.
That would cost more than we expected.
That would cost him his life.
Use_Guide: 돈이 엄청 많이 들 거라고 말해 보세요.
우리가 생각했던 것 보다 더 많은 돈이 들 거라고 말해 보세요.
그의 목숨을 대가로 지불해야 할 거라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Braxton's work dealt with the subtley between right and wrong.
Task.Q2: His work sure was a gray area at times.
Task.Q3: Braxton's work was hard to know what is perfectly legal or not.
Task.Guide: 잘못된 선택은 때로 유혹의 장난에서 시작된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Sometimes [wrong choices happen] {due to} [the interplay of temptation].
Wrong decision making sometimes come from the interaction of temptation.
False decision making happen because of interplay of temptation.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that wrong choices happen due to the interplay of temptation?

Task.Q1: We need to work harder to make a moral compass, a part of the company's mission.
Task.Q2: We must put in our utmost effort to build a moral compass, a part of the company's vision.
Task.Q3: There must be hard endeavor to establish moral compass, a part of the company's goal.
Task.Guide: 성공의 비결은 높은 도덕심에서 비롯된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Success depends on] [a strong moral compass]}.
Honesty is the key to success.
Strong ethics will lead one to success.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that success depends on a strong moral compass?

Complete.Reaction: I totally agree.

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_무엇을 하고 있나요?

Description.Description_Ko: {무엇을 하고 있나요?} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"What are you doing?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 사람들이 지금 무얼 하고 있는지 이야기해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about what people are doing.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are you doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am"}을 이용해 {"저는 지금 노래를 부르고 있어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am singing.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, what is she doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"She is"}를 이용해 {"그녀는 달리고 있어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: She is running.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is he doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"He is"}를 이용해 {"그는 책 한 권을 읽고 있어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is reading a book.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네. 그러면 그들은 무엇을 하고 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Okay. Then what are they doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"They are"}를 이용해 {"그들은 영화를 보고 있어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: They are watching a movie.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are the friends doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"The friends are"}를 이용해 {"그 친구들은 바다에서 수영하고 있어요."}라고 해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: The friends are swimming in the sea.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are the kids doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"The kids are"}를 이용해 {"그 아이들은 쿠키(들)을 굽고 있어."}라고 답해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: The kids are baking cookies.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are the people doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"The people are"}를 이용하여 {"그 사람들은 테니스를 치고 있어."}라고 답해보세요!
Quiz.Answer_Set: The people are playing tennis.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_발음 교정

Description.Description_Ko: {"발음 교정"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Pronunciation"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 헷갈리는 발음들을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some confusing pronunciations.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One.
Quiz.Guide: {"r과 l"} 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"riddle, little"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: riddle little

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two.
Quiz.Guide: 이번에도 {"r과 l"} 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"crowd, cloud"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: crowd cloud

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three.
Quiz.Guide: 이번에도 {"r과 l"} 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"grow, glow"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: grow glow

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four.
Quiz.Guide: 이번에는 f와 p 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"fail, pale"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: fail pale

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five.
Quiz.Guide: f와 p 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"suffer, supper"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: suffer supper

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six.
Quiz.Guide: th 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"thank, sank"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: thank sank

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven.
Quiz.Guide: th 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"breath, breed"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: breath breed

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Eight.
Quiz.Guide: v와 b 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"very, berry"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: very berry

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Nine.
Quiz.Guide: v와 b 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"volt, bolt"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: volt bolt

Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Ten.
Quiz.Guide: v와 b 발음에 유의하여 다음 두 단어를 말해보세요. {"Kevin, cabin"}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Kevin cabin

Quiz.Quiz_En: Lastly, let's read the sentence carefully.
Quiz.Guide: 다음을 읽어보세요. {"I had to borrow a blouse from one of my friends, who is Kevin's sister."}
Quiz.Answer_Set: I had to borrow a blouse from one of my friends, who is Kevin's sister.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 혼동되는 /R/, /F/, /Z/ 등의 발음을 이제 정말 마스터하셨네요! 축하합니다. :)
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You’ve mastered some of confusing pronunciation in English. Congratulations!

Mission.Title: This is My Favorite Movie!
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 친구 Sam과 영화를 보고 나왔습니다. 영화에 대해 의견을 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You watched a movie with your friend, Sam. Share opinions on the movie with him.

Task.Guide: 영화가 어땠는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What did you think of] [the movie]}?
What do you think of the movie?
What is your impression on the movie?
Do you like the movie?
How was the movie?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying what did I think of the movie?
Task.Key: What did you {think of} the movie?
Use_Key: What did you think of my presentation?
What did you think of my suggestion?
What do you think of the new product?
Use_Guide: 내 발표가 어땠는지 물어보세요.
내 제안에 대해 어떻게 생각했는지 물어보세요.
새 제품에 대해 어떻게 생각하는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: It was really amazing.
Task.Q1: You know what? It is my new favorite.
Task.Q2: I think it is my new favorite movie.
Task.Q3: It is my new favorite movie.
Task.Guide: 남자 주연배우의 연기가 좋았냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Did you} [enjoy] [the main actor’s performance]?
How was the main actor's performance?
Did you like the main actor's performance?
What did you think of the main actor's performance?
Did you like the leading actor?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean did I enjoy the main actor's performance?

Task.Q1: I thought he was amazing.
Task.Q2: I thought his performance was great.
Task.Q3: I loved his performance, too.
Task.Guide: 여자 주연배우의 연기도 좋았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[really liked] [the main actress's performance.] {I also}
I think the main actress's performance was great.
The main actress was also amazing.
The leading actress was good too.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you also liked the main actress's performance?

Task.Q0: I'm happy that we watched it together.
Task.Guide: 연출이 매우 훌륭한 영화였다고 말씀하세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean the movie was directed very well?

Task.Q1: Especially the ending gave me a big surprise.
Task.Q2: Especially the ending was a big surprise.
Task.Q3: Especially the ending was surprising.
Task.Guide: 나도 동의한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I thought so], [too]}.
I agree.
It really was a surprise.
That's exactly what I thought.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you thought so, too?

Complete.Reaction: I'm glad we agree. Let's tell others about the movie.

Mission.Title: Let me see some ID
Mission.Description_Ko: 출국을 위해 공항에 온 당신. 그러나 보안 검사 지점에서, 여권을 찾을 수가 없는 상황입니다. 공항 직원에게 다른 신분증을 건네 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are in an airport to leave the country. However, at the check point, you find out that you have lost your passport. Hand in another identification to the airport staff.

Task.Q1: Could I see your ID and your boarding pass, please?
Task.Q2: Do you have your ID and boarding pass?
Task.Q3: Show me your ID and boarding pass, please.
Task.Guide: 탑승권은 여기 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Here's} my [boarding pass].
Here is my boarding pass.
I have my boarding pass.
Here you go.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say here is your boarding pass?

Task.Guide: 죄송하지만 어디에도 내 여권을 찾을 수 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sorry, but [I can't seem to find] [my passport] anywhere}.
I can’t find my passport anywhere.
Sorry, I can’t find my passport.
I don’t know where my passport is.
My passport seems to be missing.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're sorry, but you can't seem to find your passport anywhere?
Task.Key: {I can't seem to} find my passport anywhere.
Use_Key: I can't seem to concentrate on driving.
I can't seem to access the confidential document.
I can't seem to complete this endless work.
Use_Guide: 운전에 집중할 수 없다고 말해 보세요.

Mission.Title: Company policy
Mission.Description_Ko: 오늘 밤 당신은 친구 James를 부모님께 소개해 드리기로 했습니다. 하지만 그의 상사가 갑자기 급한 업무를 요청한 바람에 만나지 못하게 되었습니다. 상사와 부하 직원의 관계에 대해 James와 이야기 해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You were planning to introduce your friend James to your parents tonight. However, his boss requested an urgent task to finish until tomorrow, and therefore the appointment is cancelled. Talk with James about the relationship between employers and their employees.
Mission.Guide_En: James? Are you still at work?

Task.Q0: Listen, Mr. Fuji has us working another all-nighter, so I don't think I'll be able to make it to dinner tonight.
Task.Q1: I'm sorry to cancel on you again.
Task.Q2: I hate to cancel again. Sorry.
Task.Q3: I must cancel, sorry.
Task.Guide: 괜찮다고 말하고, 나도 부모님께 네가 오늘 밤 만나러 오지 못한다고 전할 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That's OK. I guess [I'll just tell my parents] [you won't be able to meet them tonight] either}.
No problem, I’ll let my parents know that you can’t meet them tonight.
I guess I’ll let my parents know you won’t be able to meet them tonight.
No worries, I’ll let my parents know you will meet them another time.
It’s okay, I’ll tell my parents you won't be able to make it tonight.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's OK, you guess you'll tell your parents I won't be able to meet them tonight either?

Task.Q0: It's just that Mr. Fuji dropped a bomb on us earlier today.
Task.Q1: He told us we have until tomorrow to finish this project he just found out about this morning.
Task.Q2: He found out about a project this morning, and he told us we have until tomorrow to finish.
Task.Q3: He told us we have to finish a new project by tomorrow.
Task.Guide: 그것 참 불공평하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Well, that's [kind of unfair]}.
That seems unfair.
That’s not fair.
That’s not okay.
That is wrong of him.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean that's kind of unfair?

Task.Guide: Mr. Fuji가 자기 직원들이 각자의 삶이 있을 거라고는 이해하지 못하는 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Doesn't Mr. Fuji understand that} [his employees might have] [lives of their own?]
Does Mr. Fuji not care that his employees have their own lives, too?
Doesn’t Mr. Fuji care about his employees?
Doesn’t Mr. Fuji understand his employees' personal lives?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if Mr. Fuji doesn't understand that his employees might have lives of their own?

Task.Q1: It's company policy that the whole team has to stick around until everyone finishes.
Task.Q2: It is a company rule that we all stay until everyone is finished.
Task.Q3: Everyone must stay until the last person finishes their work.
Task.Guide: 나에게는 그가 노예 감시인처럼 들린다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[He sounds like] [a slave driver] {to me}.
He sounds like a terrible boss.
It sounds like he is a slave driver.
It sounds like he is a terrible boss.
He is such a bad boss.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean he sounds like a slave driver to you?

Task.Guide: 내 말은, 왜 상사가 집에 갈 준비가 될 때까지 너도 남아 있어야 하는 건지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I mean, [why should you have to stay] [until the boss is ready to go home?]}
It makes no sense. Why should you stay until your boss finishes his work?
What I mean is, why should you have to stay until he finishes his work?
What I'm saying is, why do you have to stay until the boss is ready for home?
Why do you need to stay late to wait for your boss to finish?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you mean why should I have to stay until the boss is ready to go home?
Task.Key: {Why should you have to} stay until the boss is ready to go home?
Use_Key: Why should you have to get confirmation in every step?
Why should you have to earn money by yourself?
Why should you have to apologize if it's not your fault?
Use_Guide: 왜 네가 매 단계마다 확인을 받아야 하는 건지 물어보세요.
왜 너 혼자서만 돈을 벌어야 하는 건지 물어보세요.
왜 너의 잘못이 아닌데 사과해야 하는 건지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: I've never understood why we have to do that either.
Task.Q1: But, at least he's not like my last boss.
Task.Q2: Luckily, he isn’t as bad as my last boss.
Task.Q3: But, he is better than my last boss.
Task.Guide: 너가 그에 대해 나에게 이야기 해 줬었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Yeah, [you told me about him]}.
I remember you telling me about him.
You told me about him.
Oh, I remember him.
You've told me about him.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean I told you about him?

Task.Guide: 그는 게으름을 피웠고, 감독하는 특권을 누리며, 너가 남의 일을 대신해 주길 기대했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[He lazed around], [enjoying the perks of being in charge], and [expected you to pick up the slack]}.
He expected his employees to do all the work while he just did nothing.
He ordered everyone to do his work, and he ended up doing no work at all.
He was lazy, and you had to do all his work.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he lazed around, enjoying the perks of being in charge, and expected me to pick up the slack?

Complete.Reaction: Yeah, exactly. Oh, gotta go. Mr. Fuji wants to see me.

Mission.Title: Did you hear that?
Mission.Description_Ko: 밤중에 자는 도중 Brenda가 집 안에서 나는 인기척을 듣고 놀라 당신을 깨웁니다. 119에 신고하기 전 직접 살펴볼지 말지에 대해 그녀와 상의해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: In the middle of the night, Brenda hears someone in the house and wakes you up, scared. Discuss whether you should go to check on the noise before calling 911.

Task.Q0: wake up!
Task.Q1: I think I heard someone in the house.
Task.Q2: I think I heard something.
Task.Q3: I hear something.
Task.Guide: 왜 자고 있지 않냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Why aren't you} [asleep?]
What are you doing up?
Why are you awake?
You’re awake?
Are you up?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking why I'm not asleep?

Task.Q1: I think an intruder has broken into the house.
Task.Q2: I think someone broke in.
Task.Q3: I think someone is in the house.
Task.Guide: 내가 119에 전화하면 경찰이 곧 올 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I'll call 911] {and the police will} [be here soon].
I’ll call the police and they’ll be here soon.
I’ll call the police.
I’ll call 911.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll call 911 and the police will be here soon?

Task.Q1: Did you hear that? Go look and see!
Task.Q2: Did you hear that? Go check it out.
Task.Q3: Go look and see what that noise was.
Task.Guide: 최악의 경우는 도둑을 놀래키는 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The worst thing to do] is to [surprise a burglar]}.
That’s a bad idea. We don’t want to surprise the burglar.
It’s a bad idea to surprise a burglar.
It is not a good idea to surprise a burglar.
Frightening a burglar would be the worst situation.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean the worst thing to do is to surprise a burglar?
Task.Key: {The worst thing to do} is to surprise a burglar.
Use_Key: The worst thing to do is to give up my vacation.
The worst thing to do is to pay a fine.
The worst thing to do is to lose all the data.
Use_Guide: 최악의 경우는 나의 휴가를 반납해야 하는 것이라고 말해 보세요.
최악의 경우는 벌금을 내야 하는 것이라고 말해 보세요.
최악의 경우는 데이터를 몽땅 날리는 것이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Guide: 경찰이 일을 하도록 맡기자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Let the police do their job]}.
Wait for the police to come and do their job.
Let's rely on the police.
The police will take care of it.
Wait for the police to do their duty.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say to let the police do their job?

Task.Guide: 바라건대, 그들이 도둑을 체포할 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Hopefully], {they'll} [catch the burglar red-handed].
Hopefully, the burglar will be caught in the act.
I hope they’ll catch them in the act.
I hope they’ll catch them red-handed.
I wish the burglar will be caught red-handed.
Hopefully, they will arrest the burglar.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean hopefully they'll catch the burglar red-handed?

Task.Q0: You sound a bit excited.
Task.Q1: Do you want to go and watch?
Task.Q2: Do you want to see?
Task.Q3: Should we go and watch?
Task.Guide: 그러자고 하고, 누군가 체포되는 모습을 본 적이 있냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Yeah, [have you ever seen] anyone [being caught red-handed?]}
Of course, have you ever seen anyone getting caught in the act?
Have you ever seen anyone getting caught in the act?
Have you ever seen anyone get arrested?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have ever seen anyone being caught red-handed?

Task.Q0: I think we'd better just stay out of the way.
Task.Q1: What if they're armed?
Task.Q2: What if they have a weapon?
Task.Q3: What if they have a gun?
Task.Guide: 너는 우리 경찰에 대한 신뢰가 없구나라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You have} [no faith] in our [police force!]
Don’t you have faith in our police force?

Don’t you think the police will protect us?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say I have no faith in our police force?

[new] [to the neighborhood?] {Are you}

I'm [user's name].

Task.Q2: By the way, I live next door.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_시간 말하기 2

Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Telling the time 2"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 영어로 시간을 말하는 법을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice telling the time in English.

Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}을 이용해 {"6시에서 16분이 지났어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's sixteen minutes past six.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"5시에서 30분 지났어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's half-past five.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Can you tell me the time, please?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"3시 10분 전이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's ten to three.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"10시에서 25분이 지났어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's twenty-five past ten.

Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"7시 11분 전이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's eleven minutes to seven.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"7시에서 15분 지났어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's quarter past seven.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 지금 몇 시인지 알려주실 수 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Can you tell me the time, please?
Quiz.Guide: {"지금은 5시 10분 전입니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's ten minutes to five.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"지금은 7시 되기 15분 전입니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's quarter to seven.
