description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_제대로 발음하자! : J & Z편

Description.Description_Ko: 자주 혼동되는 /J/와 /Z/발음. AI 튜터와 마지막으로 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the confusing pronunciations in English of {"/J/ and /Z/"} for the last time with me. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Jumping Jacky jeered a jesting juggler.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Jumping Jacky jeered a jesting juggler.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Zack zealously zigzagged through the zoo zone.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Zack zealously zigzagged through the zoo zone.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Zoologist Zora Jefferson found a journal of zombie near a zebra.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Zoologist Zora Jefferson found a journal of zombie near a zebra.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Jeez, just don't zoom in on my zits, Mr Journalist!}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Jeez, just don't zoom in on my zits, Mr Journalist!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Zack and jack went to the Jay-Z concert. They zealously jumped in the standing zone.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Zack and jack went to the Jay-Z concert. They zealously jumped in the standing zone.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Zina spilled juice while watching Jaws in her cozy room.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Zina spilled juice while watching Jaws in her cozy room.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 혼동되는 /J/ /Z/ 발음을 이제 정말 마스터하셨네요! 축하합니다. :)
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You’ve mastered some of confusing pronunciation in English. Congratulations!

Mission.Title: Welcoming Visitors
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 Mr.Andes라는 분과 회의를 하러 간 투자자입니다. Mr.Andes 씨를 만나 인사하고, 그 회사 CTO Ms.Jones와도 인사를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are an investor and having a meeting with Mr. Andes today. Greet with Mr.Andes and have a small talk with Ms.Jones before the meeting starts.

Task.Q0: You seem to be a visitor.
Task.Q1: Could you tell me who you’re looking for?
Task.Q2: Who are you looking for?
Task.Q3: Are you looking for someone?
Task.Guide: 마케팅부의 Mr.Andes씨와의 비즈니스 미팅 때문에 왔다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {[I’m here for a business meeting]} [with Mr. Andes of the marketing department].
Yes, I'm here to meet with Mr.Andes in marketing.
I'm here for a meet with Mr.Andes. He's in marketing.
I'm looking to have a meeting with Mr.Andes, of the marketing department.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are here for a business meeting with Mr. Andes of the marketing department?
Task.Key: I'm here {for} a business meeting.
Use_Key: I'm here for a conference.
I'm here for a job interview.
We're here for a meeting with Ms.Oliver of the R&D department.
Use_Guide: 컨퍼런스 때문에 이곳에 왔다고 말해 보세요.
면접 때문에 이곳에 왔다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 R&D 부서의 Ms.Oliver와 미팅하러 이곳에 왔다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: That would be me. You must be <user's name>
Task.Q1: Would you mind following me this way?
Task.Q2: Do you mind following me this way?
Task.Q3: Follow me this way.
Task.Guide: 따라가겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[No, not at all]}.
No, by no means.
Sure, no problem.
Sure, why not.

Task.Q1: Did you have any problems finding our company?
Task.Q2: Did you have problems getting here?
Task.Q3: Have problems coming?
Task.Guide: 아니, 찾기가 꽤 쉬웠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
No, {[it was quite easy to find]}.
No, it was easy getting here.
No, it was easy to come here.
No not at all.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it was quite easy to find?

Task.Q1: Now let me properly introduce myself. I’m John Andes and I’m in charge of the marketing department here. It’s a pleasure to meet you. I would also like to introduce you to our new CTO, Ms. Jones.
Task.Q2: Let me introduce myself properly. I'm John Andes, in charge of the marketing department. It's nice to meet you. Let me introduce you to our new CTO, Ms. Jones.
Task.Q3: Let me introduce myself. I'm John Andes, head of marketing. It's nice meeting you. This is our new CTO, Ms.Jones.
Task.Guide: Ms. Jones 에게 반갑다고 인사해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Very nice to meet you]} Mr. Jones.
Very nice meeting you Mr.Smith. .
Nice meeting you.
Nice to meet you.

Task.Guide: 오늘 회의가 긍정적인 결과를 낳기를 바란다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I hope} [today’s meeting] [produces positive outcomes].
Hopefully today's meeting produces positive outcomes.
I hope this meeting leads to positive outcomes.
Hopefully the meeting can produce positive outcomes.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you hope today's meeting produces positive outcomes?

Complete.Reaction: Me too. Let's get down to business then.

Mission.Title: Dealing with Conflicts
Mission.Description_Ko: 직장에서 동료와 불화를 겪은 내용의 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on the disagreement you had with a colleague.

Task.Q1: How are you doing today?
Task.Q2: How are you today?
Task.Q3: Good today?
Task.Guide: 잘 지내지 못하고 있는데, 이미 알지 않냐고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Not very well], {but} [I think you already knew that].
Not so well, but you may already know that.
Not good, but you might know that already.
Not well, as you may be aware.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you think I already knew that you are not very well today?

Task.Q1: Would you like to talk about your disagreement with Mr.Smith?
Task.Q2: Would you like to discuss your disagreement with Mr.Smith?
Task.Q3: Perhaps discuss your disagreement with Mr.Smith?
Task.Guide: 그건 내 잘못이 아니라고 말하고, 그가 나에게 모욕감을 줬다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It wasn’t my fault]}. [He insulted me].

I wasn't entirely at fault. He insulted me.

I wasn't to blame. He insulted me first.

I was not responsible for the fault. He insulted me first.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he insulted you?

Task.Guide: 그는 나에게 내가 체계적이지 못하다고, 그리고 그가 모든 일을 혼자서 하는 것처럼 느꼈다고 말했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He told me} [that I was disorganized] [and that he felt that he was doing all the work by himself].

I wasn't entirely at fault. He insulted me; he said that I was disorganized and that he felt as if he was doing all the work alone.

I wasn't to blame. He insulted me first, saying that I was disorganized and that he felt like he was doing the work himself.

I was not responsible for the fault. He insulted me first, claiming that I was disorganized and that he was doing all the work alone.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying he told me that you were disorganized and that he felt that he was doing all the work by himself?

Task.Q1: Do you think that is true?
Task.Q2: Is that really true?
Task.Q3: You think so?
Task.Guide: 절대로 그렇지 않다고 말하고, 어떻게 나에게 그 질문을 하냐고 되물어 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Absolutely not]. {[How can you ask me that?]}
Certainly not. How might you ask me that?
Surely not. I don't know how you can ask me that.
Completely not. You cannot just ask me that.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how I can ask you that?

Task.Q1: I’m sorry if I upset you. I think you know that everyone thinks you are doing a great job. Mr. Smith just reacted badly to a stressful situation. I spoke to him and he feels very sorry about how he spoke to you earlier.
Task.Q2: I'm sorry to upset you. Everyone thinks you are doing a great job. Mr. Smith just reacted badly out of stress. I spoke to him and he feels sorry for the way he spoke to you earlier.
Task.Q3: So sorry to upset you. You're doing a great job, and Mr.Smith just reacted to stress. He feels sorry for speaking like that earlier.
Task.Guide: 그가 정말 그렇게 말했냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Did he really say that?]}
Did he truly say that to me?
Are you sure he said that?
How can you be sure he said that?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if he really said that?
Task.Key: Did he {really} say that?
Use_Key: Did she really do that?
Did you really say that to him?
Did they really leave yesterday?
Use_Guide: 정말 그녀가 그랬냐고 물어보세요.
네가 정말 그에게 그렇게 말했냐고 물어보세요.
그들이 정말 어제 떠났냐고 물어보세요.

Complete.Reaction: Yes, he did.

Mission.Title: Business trip
Mission.Description_Ko: 맡고 있는 프로젝트로 바쁜 당신. 상사 Julia가 와서 내일 뉴욕 출장을 다녀오라고 합니다. 이와 관련해서 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are busy with a project at the moment. But your boss, Julia, is asking you to go on a buisness trip to New York tomorrow. Talk to her about this.
Mission.Guide_En: Julia, were you looking for me?

Task.Q1: Can you get on a flight to New York tomorrow? It's urgent.
Task.Q2: Can you fly to New York tomorrow? It's urgent.
Task.Q3: Can you fly to New York tomorrow?
Task.Guide: 나는 다음 주에 캘리포니아에 가야 하는 걸 잊지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Don’t forget that} [I have to go] [to  California next week].
Don’t forget that I need to be in California next week.
I have to be in California next week don’t forget.
I want to remind you that I have to fly to California next week.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying not to forget that you have to go to California next week?
Task.Key: {Don't forget that} I have to go to California next week.
Use_Key: Don't forget that you have a meeting with the CEO tomorrow.
Don't forget that we have to have dinner with Jane this weekend.
Don't forget that you have to pass this exam to get the promotion.
Use_Guide: 내일 대표님과 미팅 있는 거 잊지 말라고 말해 보세요.
이번 주말에 Jane과 저녁 식사하는 걸 잊지 말라고 말해 보세요.
승진하려면 이번 시험을 통과해야 하는 걸 잊지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [you have a meeting with the CEO], [tomorrow]
[we have to have dinner with Jane], [this weekend]
[you have to pass this exam], [to get the promotion]

Task.Q0: But this is urgent.
Task.Q1: I know you are snowed under with this project.
Task.Q2: I know you are very busy with this project.
Task.Q3: I know you are very busy.
Task.Guide: 솔직하게 제 시간에 못 끝낼 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{To be frank},  [I don’t think] [I will be able to finish the project on time].
To be honest with you, I don’t know if I will be able to finish this project.
Honestly, I don’t think I will finish this project before the due date.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you don't think you will be able to finish the project on time?

Task.Q0: I think I can give you a few more days to finish off the project.
Task.Q1: I will be in contact regarding the meeting in New York.
Task.Q2: I  send you some details for the meeting in New York.
Task.Q3: I will tell you what's the meeting in New York will be about.
Task.Guide: 지금 이용가능한 항공편이 없을 수도 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Flights might not be available] [at this late stage]}.
There might not be any flights available at this stage.
At the late stage there might not be flights available.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying flights might not be available at this late stage?

Task.Q0: My apologies for the late notice.
Task.Guide: 일단 항공편을 알아보고 다시 말씀드리겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'll get back to you soon again]} [after I find a flight ticket].
I think I'd better get back to you later after I find a flight ticket first.
Can I get back to you soon again? I think I should get a flight ticket first.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll get back to me soon again after you find a flight ticket?

Complete.Reaction: That sounds great. Thank you.

description: 06.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-예습_입문 따라읽기로 마스터하는 기초 발음 완성_명언 따라읽기 : 성공편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 문장 속 단어들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice some words before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"명언 따라읽기 : 성공편"}은 성공에 관한 명언을 읽으며 발음 연습을 하는 토픽입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "Quotes: Success" is the topic to practice pronunciation by reading quotes.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음에 유의하여 AI 튜터를 따라 화면 속 단어를 읽어보세요.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Read the words on the screen along with the AI tutor.

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 단어들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 단어들의 발음을 마지막으로 연습해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's practice the pronunciation of the words for the last time!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 토픽 카드 속 단어들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 튜터와 함께 명언을 읽으며 영어와 친해져 보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start. Go and start reading quotes with your tutor!

content_name: Campus English - At the admin office
description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 행정실편

Title.Title_En: Campus English - At the admin office

Description.Description_Ko: {"Campus English : 행정실편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Campus English : At the admin office"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 학교 행정실에 방문하여 이야기를 나눠봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's visit the administrative office at your university.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"get a copy of"}를 이용해 {"제 졸업장 사본을 발급받기 위해 왔습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm here to get a copy of my diploma.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is your purpose to get a copy?
Quiz.Guide: {"submit A to B"}를 이용해 {"이 서류를 제 인사 담당자분에게 제출해야 합니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I need to submit this form to my HR manager.
I need to submit this copy to my HR manager.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Is there anything else you need?
Quiz.Guide: {"make an appointment with"}를 이용해 {"Lee 교수님과 약속 시간을 잡고 싶습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I would like to make an appointment with Professor Lee.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What would you like to see him about?
Quiz.Guide: {"have a question about"}을 이용해 {"다음 주에 있을 시험에 관해 질문이 있습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I have a question about the exam next week.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그리고 우리가 가지고 있는 당신의 주소가 이게 맞나요? 만일 아니라면, 이 양식을 작성해주세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: And is your address that we have right? If not, please write down this form.
Quiz.Guide: {"fill out"}을 이용해 {"네. 저의 비자 만료 날짜도 작성해야 하나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Could I also fill out the expiration date of my visa?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그냥 최근 당신의 주소지만 업데이트해 주세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please just update your recent address only.
Quiz.Guide: {"네 알겠습니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Okay, I will.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 친구 사귀기편

Description.Description_Ko: {"Campus English: 친구 사귀기편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Campus English - Hanging out"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 유학 또는 어학연수 중에서 만난 친구들과 친해지기 위해 대화를 해보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's try to make friends at university abroad. You're going to ask your friends from school to hang out.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's up?
Quiz.Guide: {"What are you up to"}를 이용해 {"이번 주말에 뭐 할 거야?"}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: What are you up to this weekend?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have any plans for getting together?
Quiz.Guide: {"up for"}를 이용해 {"영화 보러 갈 생각 있어?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are you up for watching a movie?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 나 하이킹 간지 한참된 것 같아.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I feel like it's been a while since I went on a hike.
Quiz.Guide: {"meet up for"}를 이용해 {"오늘 이따가 하이킹하러 갈래?"}라고 질문해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Do you want to meet up for a hike later today?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 미안해, 오늘은 나 그냥 아무것도 안 하고 쉬고 싶어.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I'm sorry but today I just want to veg out.
Quiz.Guide: {"go with the flow"}를 이용해 {"이봐, 우리는 그냥 흐름에 맡기고 편하게 쉬면 돼(쉬엄쉬엄 다녀오면 돼)."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Come on, we can just go with the flow and take it easy.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그나저나 우리 다음 주 일요일에 만나는 거 맞지?
Quiz.Quiz_En: By the way, are we still on for next Sunday?
Quiz.Guide: {"take a rain check"}을 이용해 {"미안한데 나 미룰게."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm sorry but I will take a rain check.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's going on?
Quiz.Guide: {"우리 부모님이 다음 주말에 방문하시거든."}이라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: My parents are visiting next weekend.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 03.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_공항 영어 : 체크인편

Description.Description_Ko: {"공항 영어 : 체크인편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Airport English : Check-in"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 공항에서 체크인을 해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check-in at the airport.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you flying today?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am flying to"}를 이용해 {"파리로 갑니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am flying to Paris.

Quiz.Quiz_En: May I have your passport?
Quiz.Guide: {"여기 있습니다."}라고 이야기해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Here you go.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Are you checking any luggage today?
Quiz.Guide: {"네, 부쳐야 할 가방이 두 개 있습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, I have two bags to check-in.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you have any carry-on bags?
Quiz.Guide: {"I will take"}를 이용해 {"이 가방을 기내에 가지고 탈 예정입니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I will take this backpack as my carry-on.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 오, 당신의 가방의 무게가 초과하였습니다. 죄송하지만 비용을 지불하셔야 할 것 같습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Oh, your bag is overweight. I'm afraid you will have to pay for it.
Quiz.Guide: {"Can I remove"}를 이용해 {"제 짐들을 좀 빼도 될까요?"}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Can I remove some of my belongings?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 창가 좌석과 복도 좌석 중 어디가 좋으신가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat?
Quiz.Guide: {"I would like to have"}를 이용해 {"복도 좌석이 좋을 것 같습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I would like to have an aisle seat.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Striving for the Deadline
Mission.Description_Ko: 마감일을 앞둔 서로에게 조언해주는 Allen과 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Allen who is advising as they face impending deadline.

Task.Q0: How are you dealing with the impending deadline?
Task.Q1: Are you in serious crunch time?
Task.Q2: Are you running short in time?
Task.Q3: Do you not have a lot of time left?
Task.Guide: 내가 완벽주의 성향을 갖고있다로 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I tend to be} [a perfectionist].
I am the type of person who needs everything to be perfect.
I have the tendency to make everything perfect.
I think I'm a bit of perfectionist.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you are a perfectionist?

Task.Q1: And what does it have with the deadline?
Task.Q2: Does it matter to the deadline?
Task.Q3: So, your point is?
Task.Guide: 그래서 시간을 지키는 것이 어렵다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
So {[being punctual is difficult]}.
So keeping everything according to schedule is hard.
So getting things done at a proper time is not easy.
So keeping the due date is a bit difficult.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that being punctual is difficult?

Task.Q1: So we just need to be continuous and put things according to importance.
Task.Q2: So we just need to be consistant and put first thing first.
Task.Q3: So we just need to be persistant and prioritize.
Task.Guide: 완전 동의한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I completely agree with you]}.
I have the exact same opinion.
That's what I'm saying.
I can't agree more.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you completely agree with me?

Task.Q1: It seems that most procrastination is half the cause of all crisis.
Task.Q2: It seems that most delaying is 50 percent the cause of all critical situations.
Task.Q3: It looks like procrastination is half the reason why things go wrong.
Task.Guide: 우리 사장이 늦게 마치는 직원 싫어하는 것을 알지 않냐고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You know our boss} [loathes] [the tardy worker].
You know our boss hates the late finisher.
You know our boss detests the tardy employee.
You know our boss doesn't like the tardy one.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that our boss loathes the tardy worker?
Task.Key: {You know our boss} hates the late finisher.
Use_Key: You know our boss told everyone to stay after work.
You know our boss treated us dinner yesterday.
You know our boss is a very work-oriented person.
Use_Guide: 우리 사장님이 일 끝나고 다 남으라고 하신 것을 알지 않냐고 말해 보세요.
우리 사장님이 어제 저녁 사주신 것을 알지 않냐고 말해 보세요.
우리 사장님이 굉장히 일 중심적인 사람이라는 것을 알지 않냐고 말해 보세요.

Complete.Reaction: So let's get back to work.

Mission.Title: Business Lunches
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 직원 Ms.Fredman과 점심 식사를 하기로 했습니다. 당신보다 늦게 레스토랑에 도착한 Ms.Fredman을 맞이해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are having lunch with your colleague, Ms.Fredman. Welcome her as she arrives.

Task.Q1: I hope you didn’t wait too long. I was busy parking when you called.
Task.Q2: Hopefully you didn't wait long. I was parking when you called me.
Task.Q3: Did you wait long? I was parking when you called.
Task.Guide: 전혀 아니라고 말하고, 여기서 만나서 반갑다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Not at all]. {[My pleasure to meet you here]}.
No it's fine. My pleasure meeting you here.
No. It's nice to meet you here.
No it's fine. It's nice meeting you here.

Task.Guide: 식당은 어렵지 않게 찾았는지도 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Was it} [difficult] [to find the restaurant?]
Was it difficult finding the restaurant?
It wasn't to difficult finding the restaurant?
Wasn't it difficult finding the restaurant?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if it was difficult to find the restaurant?

Task.Q1: It was quite easy. You gave me excellent directions.
Task.Q2: It was easier than I thought. Your directions were excellent.
Task.Q3: It was easy. Directions were easy.
Task.Guide: 내가 먼저 주방장 특선 요리를 주문했는데 괜찮기를 바란다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I hope you don’t mind], {but} [I went ahead and ordered us the chef’s special].
I hope you don't mind. I ordered us the chef special in advance.
Hopefully you don't mind, but I went ahead and ordered the chef special.
Ok then I hope you don't mind that I ordered the chef special for us.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you went ahead and ordered us the chef's special?

Task.Q0: It looks delicious.
Task.Guide: 더 필요한 것이 있는지 물어보고, 웨이터가 오는 것이 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Would you like anything else?]} [I see the waiter coming by].
Would you like something else? I see the waiter coming.
What else would you like? The waiter is coming now.
What else could you like? The waiter is coming towards us.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying if I'd like anything else?

Task.Q1: I’d better get something to drink. Do you want anything?
Task.Q2: I'd better get a drink. Do you want anything?
Task.Q3: A drink, perhaps. What about you?
Task.Guide: 레몬을 넣은 아이스티를 원한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’d like} [an iced tea with lemon].
I'd like iced tea and lemon.
I prefer drinking iced tea with lemon.
I want iced tea with lemon.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd like an iced tea with lemon?

Complete.Reaction: I'll have the same.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_현재 시제 마스터

Description.Description_Ko: {"현재 시제 마스터"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Present and Present Continuous tense"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 현재 시제를 이용하여 대화를 나눠봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's have a talk using the present tense.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What time do you get up in the morning?
Quiz.Guide: {"저는 매일 아침 7시에 일어나요."}라고 답해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I wake up at seven every morning.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 당신은 음식을 먹을 때 무엇을 사용하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Next. What do you use when you eat food?
Quiz.Guide: {"저는 밥 먹을 때 숟가락과 포크를 사용합니다."}라고 답변해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I use a spoon and a fork when eating.
I use both spoon and fork when eating.
I use a spoon and a fork when I eat.
I use both spoon and fork when I eat.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Does Mr. Kim cook well?
Quiz.Guide: {"네, 그는 요리를 잘합니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, he cooks well.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 이제 나에게 Ms. Park에 대해 말해주세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Now, tell me about Ms. Park.
Quiz.Guide: {"그녀는 금발의 머리를 하고 있어요."}라고 답해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: She has blond hair.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 이번에는, 그 물고기가 어떻게 생겼는지 묘사해주세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: And this time, please describe how the fish looks like.
Quiz.Guide: {"그것은 큰 입을 가졌어요."}라고 답해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It has a big mouth.
It has a huge mouth.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 이제 그가 지금 무엇을 하는지 말해주세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Now, please tell me what is he doing now.
Quiz.Guide: {"그는 문 앞에서 지금 서 있어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
He is standing at the gate now.
Now he is standing at the gate.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What about Justin?
Quiz.Guide: {"그는 지금 커피를 마시는 중이에요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
He is drinking coffee now.
He is now drinking coffee.
Now he is drinking coffee.

Quiz.Reaction: I want to drink one too.
Quiz.Quiz_En: What about your sister's couple?
Quiz.Guide: {"그들은 지금 점심을 먹고 있어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
They are having lunch now.
Now they are having lunch.
They are now having lunch.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 저것 좀 봐. 그 애기는 정말 귀엽다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Look at that. The baby is really cute.
Quiz.Guide: {"애기는 지금 핑크색 모자를 쓰고 있어."}라고 답해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
The baby is wearing a pink hat.
The baby is wearing a pink cap.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그리고 봐봐! 저쪽에 있는 사람 너의 삼촌 아니야?
Quiz.Quiz_En: And look! Isn't he your uncle over there?
Quiz.Guide: {"응. 그는 지금 한강 변에서 뛰고 있는 중이야."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Yes, he is now running by the river.
Yes, he is running by the river now.
Yes, now he is running by the river.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Meeting Preparation
Mission.Description_Ko: 중요한 투자자가 참석하는 회의가 내일입니다. 회의 준비와 관련해 동료 Mr.Plaza와 확인할 사항에 대해 논의를 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Tomorrow is the meeting where an important investor is attending. Have a discussion on the things to prepare for tomorrow's meeting with your colleague, Mr.Plaza.

Task.Q1: Let me take a look at what you have done so far…it all looks good, but keep in mind that an important investor is attending, so we need to be a little more thorough than usual. Where did you get these charts from?
Task.Q2: Let's take a look at what you have done. Everything looks good, but remember that an important investor is attending, so we need to be more thorough. Where are these charts from?
Task.Q3: Looking at what we have done, we can see that it's a good job. Remember that an important investor is attending, so we need to be thorough. Where are the charts from?
Task.Guide: 그 차트는 지난 레포트에서 발췌했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I took them] {from} [the last report].
I got them from the latest report.
I found them in the last report.
I discovered them via the last report.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you took them from the last report?

Task.Q1: It has been a while since we updated them.
Task.Q2: It's been a while since we updated those.
Task.Q3: It's been long since they were updated.
Task.Guide: 안다고 말하고, 오늘 업데이트 할 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Yes, I know]. I {plan to} [update them today].
Yes, I am aware. I plan on updating them today.
Yes, I know. I will update them by today.
Yes, I am aware. I will update them accordingly today.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you plan to update them today?

Task.Q0: Just one more thing.
Task.Q1: Could you come in a little early to set up for our investor’s meeting tomorrow?
Task.Q2: Do you mind coming in a little early to get ready for our investor's meeting tomorrow?
Task.Q3: Can you come early to prepare for the investor's meeting tomorrow?
Task.Guide: 물론 그렇게 할 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Yes, of course]}.
Yes, of course I can.
Yes, I can certainly do that.
Yes, I certainly can.

Task.Q1: I think we are about set now. Any questions?
Task.Q2: We're about set now. Questions?
Task.Q3: We're set now. Questions?
Task.Guide: 얼마나 많은 사람들이 참석하는지 아냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [know] [how many people will be attending?]
Do you know how many people will attend?
Are you aware how many people are going to attend?
Are you aware of the number of people that will attend?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I know how many people will be attending?
Task.Key: {Do you know} how many people will be attending?
Use_Key: Do you know what time the meeting will finish?
Do you know where the conference will be held?
Do you know why the meeting has been canceled?
Use_Guide: 그 회의가 몇 시에 끝날지 아냐고 물어보세요.
그 컨퍼런스가 어디에서 개최되는지 아냐고 물어보세요.
그 회의가 왜 취소됐는지 아냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Guide: 지난 번에 의자가 부족했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Last time], we {didn’t} [have enough chairs].
Last time, we didn't have enough chairs to go around.
We didn't have enough chairs last time.
We didn't have enough chairs to go around last time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we didn't have enough chairs last time?

Complete.Reaction: That’s a good question. I will confirm and get back to you.

Mission.Title: Opening Brainstorming
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Ms. Mable과 함께 파워포인트를 어떻게 수정해야 할지 논의해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Discuss how you will revise the powerpoint with your colleague Ms.Mable.

Task.Q1: I just finished revising the intro for the PowerPoint. What do you think of the layout?
Task.Q2: I finished revising the intro for the PowerPoint. What do you think of it?
Task.Q3: Just finished the intro revision for the PowerPoint. Any thoughts?
Task.Guide: 스타일이 완벽하다고 말하고, 지난 번에 보여줬던 것보다 훨씬 낫다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[The style is perfect!] {It’s much better than} [the one you showed last time].
The style is absolutely perfect! It's better than the one last time.
The style is flawless and better than the one chosen last time.
The style is perfect and better than the one selected last time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's much better than the one I showed last time?

Task.Guide: 발표를 위해 우리의 생각을 어떻게 정리할 것인가에 대해 이야기하면 될 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It seems that} [we just need to talk about] [how to organize our ideas for the presentation].
It seems that we only need to talk about organizing our ideas.
All we need to do now is to talk about organizing our ideas.
We just need to talk about organizing our ideas now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it seems that we just need to talk about how to organize our ideas for the presentation?

Task.Q1: I was thinking that we should begin by outlining our goals for the project and then describe our plan.
Task.Q2: I thought that we should outline our goals for the project first, then describe our plan.
Task.Q3: We should outline our goals for the project, before describing our plan.
Task.Guide: 좋은 계획이라고 말하고, 지금 초안을 작성하는 게 어떤지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[You have a good plan]. {Why don’t we} [type out] [a rough draft now?]
You have a good plan. Why don't we create a rough draft now?
It's a good plan. Why not do a rough draft now?
It's a good plan. Why don't we do a rough draft now?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying why don't we type out a rough draft now?
Task.Key: {Why don’t' we} type out a rough draft now?
Use_Key: Why don't we plan out our trip to Paris?
Why don't we go talk to him in person?
Why don't we learn how to swim this summer?
Use_Guide: 우리의 파리 여행을 계획하는 게 어떤지 물어보세요.
우리가 그를 직접 찾아야 이야기하는 게 어떠냐고 물어보세요.
올 여름에 같이 수영을 배우는 게 어떠냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Guide: 우리는 진행을 하면서 세부사항을 결정해 나갈 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
We {can} [work out the details] [as we go].
We can fill in the details as we go along.
We can complete the details as we continue.
The details can be completed as we continue along.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we can work out the details as we go?

Task.Q1: That’s a good idea. I’ll add in the goals we discussed in the last meeting here. They’re a little wordy, but we can edit them later.
Task.Q2: Good idea. I'll add the goals discussed in the last meet here. They are a bit long, but we can edit later.
Task.Q3: Good idea. I'll add the goals discussed last time here. Even though they're long, we can edit later.
Task.Guide: 그 차트를 다음 슬라이드에 삽입할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [put that chart] [on the next slide?]
Could you place that chart on next slide?
Can you insert the chart on the following slide?
Would it be possible to insert the chart on the following slide?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I could put that chart on the next slide?

Task.Q0: That looks good.
Task.Q1: I’m going to reuse some of the market statistics we found for the sales report here. How does that look?
Task.Q2: I'm going to reuse the market statistics we found for the last report. How does this look?
Task.Q3: I'll reuse the market statistics from the last report. Take a look.
Task.Guide: 완벽하다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It’s perfect]}.
It's flawless.
It looks ideal.
It looks faultless.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's perfect?

Complete.Reaction: Great. I'll get started then.

Mission.Title: Just in Time
Mission.Description_Ko: 걱정했던 것이 메가트렌드가 된 것에 대해 Enzo와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Enzo about what seemed to be a problem that became a megatrend.

Task.Q1: What do you think about the new production schedule?
Task.Q2: What are your opinions on the new production schedule?
Task.Q3: Any comments on the new production schedule?
Task.Guide: 사실 이 불경기에 가격통일하는 것이 우리의 이윤 폭을 엄청 얇게 만들었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, [price matching] {in this brutal economy} has made our [profit margin] [razor thin].
Well, price matching in this harsh economy has made our profit cutline super thin.
Well, price matching in this critical economy has made our profit margin really thin.
Actually, in this brutal economy, price matching has made out profit margin too thin.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that price matching in this brutal economy has made our profit margin razor thin?

Task.Q1: The markets have been so volatile.
Task.Q2: The markets have been fluctuating greatly.
Task.Q3: The markets had a lot of ups and downs.
Task.Guide: 다행스럽게 우리는 탄력성을 보여줬다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Luckily], {we've shown} [resilience].
Fortunately, we've shown flexibility.
Thankfully, we've shown adaptibility.
To my relief, we've shown resilence.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we've shown resilience?

Task.Q1: Now we don't have capital tied up.
Task.Q2: Now we don't have money tied up.
Task.Q3: Now we don't have funds tied up.
Task.Guide: 나는 이 적시생산이 아주 좋아지기 시작했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm starting to love} this [just-in-time production].
I began to love this just-in-time production.
I'm beginning to love this just-in-time production.
I'm loving this just-in-time production.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you are starting to love this just-in-time production?
Task.Key: {I'm starting to love} this just-in-time production.
Use_Key: I'm starting to love this place.
I'm starting to love my new school.
I'm starting to love Korea.
Use_Guide: 이곳이 엄청 마음에 들기 시작하는데라고 말해보세요.
새 학교가 엄청 마음에 들기 시작하는데라고 말해보세요.
한국이 엄청 마음에 들기 시작하는데라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: However, it seems to be a megatrend sweeping the globe.
Task.Q2: However, it looks like it is a huge trend all around the world.
Task.Q3: However, it seems like to be a hot trend world wide.
Task.Guide: 그것은 확실히 판도를 바꿔놓는 요소라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It sure is a game changer]}.
It sure changed things around.
It sure made things different.
It sure is a turining point.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it is a game changer?

Complete.Reaction: You bet it is.

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_제대로 발음하자! : L & R편

Description.Description_Ko: 자주 혼동되는 /L/와 /R/발음. AI 튜터와 마지막으로 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the confusing pronunciations in English of {"/L/ and /R/"} for the last time with me. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Silly little Lucy said that she was looking for the lighthouse near the lake right now but it is a total lie.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Silly little Lucy said that she was looking for the lighthouse near the lake right now but it is a total lie.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Rachel Ray spread rumor about the red road. Red road is where rude Rudy disappeared with a rental car.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Rachel Ray spread rumor about the red road. Red road is where rude Rudy disappeared with a rental car.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {A loyal warrior will rarely worry why we rule the world.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: A loyal warrior will rarely worry why we rule the world.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Lesley loves Roger, but Roger doesn't love Lesley. Roger rather likes Lucy.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Lesley loves Roger, but Roger doesn't love Lesley. Roger rather likes Lucy.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Laura and Larry rarely let their roosters sleep in the yard.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Laura and Larry rarely let their roosters sleep in the yard.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Jerry works, Billy walks right in front of Lily's jelly store for real.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Jerry works, Billy walks right in front of Lily's jelly store for real.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 발음 연습 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {If you don't like to follow my lead, try to read and learn more to be a real leader.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: If you don't like to follow my lead, try to read and learn more to be a real leader.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 혼동되는 /L/ /R/ 발음을 이제 정말 마스터하셨네요! 축하합니다. :)
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You’ve mastered some of confusing pronunciation in English. Congratulations!

description: 09.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 서바이벌 워킹홀리데이_오늘의 날씨

Description.Description_Ko: {"오늘의 날씨"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"How's the Weather Today?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 오늘의 날씨가 어떤지 영어로 말해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about the weather.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How's the weather today?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용하여 {"오늘은 맑습니다."}라고 답변해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is clear.
It's clear.
It is clean.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather like?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용하여 {"화창합니다."}라고 답변해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is sunny.
The sun is shining.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather today?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용하여 {"날씨가 덥습니다." / "날씨가 뜨겁습니다."}라고 답변해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is hot.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather like?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용하여 {"비가 옵니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is raining.
It is rainy.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather today?
Quiz.Guide: 이제는 {"눈이 옵니다."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is snowy.
It is snowing.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather like?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용하여 {"오늘은 추워요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is cold today.
It's cold today.
It is cold.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather today?
Quiz.Guide: {"It is"}를 이용하여 {"오늘은 바람이 많이 불어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is windy.
It's windy.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the weather like?
Quiz.Guide: 이제는 {"안개가 많이 끼었어요. 앞이 잘 안 보이네요."}라고 답해볼까요? 두 문장으로 답해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It is foggy. It is hard to see.
It's foggy. It's hard to see.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_과거 시제 마스터

Description.Description_Ko: {"과거 시제 마스터"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Past and Past Continuous tense"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 과거 시제를 이용하여 대화를 나눠봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's have a talk using the past tense.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그 두 남자분은 지난주에 무엇을 했나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: What did the two men do last weekend?
Quiz.Guide: {"두 남자분은 지난주에 체스를 두셨어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
The two men played chess last weekend.
Last weekend, the two men played chess.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What about last night? How did your mom help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"엄마가 리본을 만드는 걸 도와주셨어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: My mom helped me to make a ribbon.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What did your younger brother do yesterday?
Quiz.Guide: {"그는 어제 혼자 농구를 했어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
He played basketball alone yesterday.
Yesterday, he played basketball alone.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What about your younger sister?
Quiz.Guide: {"그녀는 어제 쇼핑을 하러 갔었어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
She went shopping yesterday.
Yesterday, she went shopping.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What did you have for lunch?
Quiz.Guide: {"저는 점심으로 샐러드를 먹었어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I ate a salad for lunch.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 비행 중에 당신은 무얼 하고 계셨어요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: What were you doing during the flight?
Quiz.Guide: {"저는 비행 중 문서를 읽고 있는 중이었어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I was reading papers during the flight.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 제가 그때 뭐 하고 있는 중이었는지 기억하세요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you remember what I was doing then?
Quiz.Guide: {"당신은 그때 몇 개의 비디오를 보고 있었어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: You were watching some videos then.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 당신이 그곳에 갔을 때 당신의 여동생들은 무엇을 하는 중이었어요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: What were your sisters doing when you got there?
Quiz.Guide: {"그(녀)들은 제가 그곳에 갔을 때 같이 자고 있는 중이었어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
They were sleeping together when I got there.
They were sleeping when I got there.
They were sleeping together when I arrived.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 당신의 고모는 우리가 점심을 먹었을 때 무얼 하시는 중이셨나요? 저는 그녀를 못 봤어요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: What was your aunt doing when we had lunch? I couldn't see her.
Quiz.Guide: {"그녀는 우리가 점심을 먹을 때 소스를 만드는 중이셨어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: She was making sauce when we had lunch.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 당신의 사촌은요? 그는 무얼 하고 있었나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: What about your cousin? What was he doing?
Quiz.Guide: {"그는 그때 사진을 찍고 있는 중이었어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
He was taking pictures then.
He was taking photos then.
My cousin was taking pictures then.
My cousin was taking photos then.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Articulate a Strategy
Mission.Description_Ko: 새로운 전략을 짜고자 하는 Jasmine과 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Jasmine who is trying to make new strategies.

Task.Q0: You know,
Task.Q1: These days we just seem to go around in circles with our strategies.
Task.Q2: These days it seems like getting no where with our tactics.
Task.Q3: These days, we just seem to go round and round with our plans.
Task.Guide: 우리는 특유의 목표를 담은 전략이 필요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [we need a strategy] [with a unique vision].
I think we need a plan with a special goal.
I believe we need a tactic with a unique goal.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we need a strategy with a unique vision?
Task.Key: {I think we need} a plan with a special goal.
Use_Key: I think we need another plan.
I think we need some more time.
I think we need more ideas.
Use_Guide: 우리는 다른 계획이 필요할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
나는 시간이 더 필요하 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
더 많은 아이디어가 필요할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: First, we should start with a strong kick off meeting.
Task.Q2: First, we need to start with a meeting that has a strong impact.
Task.Q3: First, we have to begin with a energetic meeting.
Task.Guide: 맞아, 최근에 받은 피드백과 응답들이 중요하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Sure], {[up to date feedback and responses are crucial]}.
Sure, latest feedback and answers are important.
Sure, recent feedback and responses are crucial.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that up to date feedback and responses are crucial?

Task.Q0: Before we get involved in any projects,
Task.Q1: We should run a few piolot programs.
Task.Q2: We have to run several test programs.
Task.Q3: We must try out a couple of piolet programs.
Task.Guide: 좋은 생각이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it's a great idea?

Task.Guide: 몇 가지 예측을 해 볼 수도 있겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[We could make some predictions]}.
We could make some assumptions.
We could make some hypothesis.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we could make some predictions?

Complete.Reaction: I have a good feeling that this might work.

Mission.Title: My Way or the Highway
Mission.Description_Ko: 사무실에 새로운 사람들에 대한 대화를 Leslie와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Leslie who is talking about new people in the office.

Task.Q0: It's good to catch up with you again!
Task.Q1: I'm liking all these new faces here.
Task.Q2: I am happy with every new people here.
Task.Q3: I'm pleased to with all the new employees here.
Task.Guide: 나이는 상관 안 하지만 현실적일 필요는 있다고 생각한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I certainly don't mind age], {but} [I do insist on having people down to earth].
I don't care about age, but I do want them to be practical.
I don't give much about age, but I do want them to be realistc.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you don't mind age , but do insist on having people down to earth?

Task.Q1: Different minsets seem to be a stumbling block to communication,
Task.Q2: Different thoughts seem to be an obstacle to communication.
Task.Q3: Different ideas seem to be a barrier when it comes to communication.
Task.Guide: 최근에 메니저와 얘기해 봤냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, {have you} [talked to the manager] [lately?]
Well, have you spoke to the manager recently?
Well, have you had a word with the manager these days?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I have  talked to the manager lately?
Task.Key: {Have you} talked to the manager lately?
Use_Key: Have you seen him lately?
Have you been to Europe?
Have you thought about my proposal?
Use_Guide: 그를 최근에 본 적이 있냐고 물어보세요.
유럽 가본 적 있냐고 물어보세요.
내가 제안한 것에 대해 생각해 봤냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: He does seem to have preconceived notions about us new employees.
Task.Q2: He does seem to have judgemental notions about the new employees.
Task.Q3: He does seem to have a prejudice to the new employees.
Task.Guide: 그에게 솔직한 의견을 말해볼까 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Well, {[we could give him some candid feedback]}.
Well, we could give him some honest opinions.
Well, we could give him some frank remarks.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we could give him some candid feedback.

Task.Q1: I just hope that if you do so that it does not backfire.
Task.Q2: I just wish that if you do tell him, it won't come back in a negative way.
Task.Q3: I just hope that if you do tell him, he won't take it out on you.
Task.Guide: 한번 시도해 봐야겠다라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I might just try my luck]}.
I'm going to give it a shot.
I'll see if I can get lucky.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you might just try your luck?

Complete.Reaction: Let me know after.

Mission.Title: Using Humor
Mission.Description_Ko: 지난 출장 비용 보고서가 늦은 것에 대해 담당자 Ms.White에게 해명을 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Explain to Ms.White about the late expense report from the last business trip.

Task.Q0: I still haven’t gotten your expense report from the last business trip.
Task.Q1: You know what they say better late than never, but better never late!
Task.Q2: It's better late than never, but it's always better never late!
Task.Q3: You should never turn them late!
Task.Guide: 그것에 대해 사과하고, 일이 많아서 조금 벅차다고 느꼈다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m sorry about that]. {[I’ve just been a little overwhelmed with work]}.
I apologize about that. I've just been a bit overwhelmed with tasks.
So sorry. I guess I've been burdened with assignments.
So sorry. I guess I've been loaded with assignments.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've just been a little overwhelmed with work?
Task.Key: {I've been a little overwhelmed} with work.
Use_Key: I've been a little overwhelmed with the presentation.
I've been a little overwhelmd with the project.
I've been a little overwhelmed with the report.
Use_Guide: 그 발표가 조금 벅차다고 말해 보세요.
그 프로젝트가 조금 벅차다고 말해 보세요.
그 보고서가 조금 벅차다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: That’s understandable, but you should get that in soon.
Task.Q1: Accounting has been asking. You better make sure it’s flawless really dot your i’s and cross your t’s.
Task.Q2: Accounting requested that it be flawless. Really dot your i's and cross your t's.
Task.Q3: It should be flawless. Dot your i's and cross your t's.
Task.Guide: 당연하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Yes, of course]}.
Yes, certainly.
Yes, definitely.
Yes, absolutely.

Task.Q1: Corporate is kind of picky about having documentation for things charged on the company card. We did get a lot of free meals out of this trip, so you’ve got to put in the proper documentation.
Task.Q2: Corporate is picky about having documentation changed for bill listings on the company card. We had many free meals from the trip, so you must put in the proper documentation.
Task.Q3: Corporate is picky about documenting bill listings on the company card. We got free meals from the trip, so you must document them properly.
Task.Guide: 내 생각엔 작은 댓가를 치르는 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} [it’s a small price to pay].
I guess it's less risky doing so.
I suppose that's reasonable.
I suppose that's not irrational.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you guess it's a small price to pay?

Task.Q1: You can’t have your cake and eat it, too.
Task.Q2: You can't have everything you want.
Task.Q3: Can't have everything.
Task.Guide: 다시 한 번 늦어서 미안하다고 말하고, 앞으로는 좀 더 시간을 엄수하도록 노력하겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Okay. [I’m sorry again about the delay]. [I’ll try to be more punctual] {from now on}.
Okay. So sorry again regarding the delay. I'll try to be very punctual from now on.
All right. I apologize for the delay again. I'll put effort into being very punctual now.
All right. I apologize again with regard to the delay. I'll make the effort to be punctual from now on.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'll try to be more punctual from now on?

Complete.Reaction: That’s okay. Just don’t let it happen again.

Mission.Title: Turning the Table
Mission.Description_Ko: 제품의 가격 인상과 관련하여 Mr.Francis와 대화를 나누어 보세요. 가격 인상을 받아 들이는 대신 구입량을 늘리겠다고 제안해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation with Mr.Francis on the increase in the product price. Suggest that you can increase the number of purchases, instead of accepting the price spike.
Mission.Guide_En: Mr. Francis, nice to meet you.

Task.Q0: Thank you for meeting me here today.
Task.Q1:
I hope you’ve given what we discussed last time some
consideration.
Task.Q2: I hope you've considered what we discussed last time.
Task.Q3: Hopefully you've thought of our discussion last time.
Task.Guide: 내 파트너들과 의논했고, 몇 가지 점에 동의해 주시면 우리도 기꺼이 타협해 드리겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, [I discussed it with my partners], and {I'd be willing to} [comply if you met us on a few points].
Yes, I talked about it with my partners, and I would comply if you met us on a few points.
I discussed it over with my partners. I am willing to comply if you agreed on some points.
I talked it over with my partners. I would surely comply if you compromised on a few points.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd be willing to comply if I met you on a few points?

Task.Guide: 우리 금융팀에 따르면, 우리는 당신이 제안하는 가격 인상을 감당할 수 없을 것 같다고 해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{According to} [our finance team], [it seems that we can’t quite afford the price increase that you are suggesting].
According to finance, it seems that we can't afford the price increase that you suggest.
It seems that we can't afford the price increase you suggest.
We currentlly cant' afford the price increase you suggest. We can give you around 8%, but it's the most that is possible.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can't quite afford the price increase that I am suggesting?

Task.Guide: 8% 더 제안할 수는 있지만 그게 할 수 있는 최선이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[We can offer you 8% more], but {[that’s the best we can do]}.
We can offer you 8% more, but it's the most we can do.
We can offer you around 8%, but it's the best we are able to do.
We can give you around 8%, but it's the most that is possible.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you can offer me 8% more but that's the best you can do?

Task.Q1: But I see no choice but to refuse that offer.
Task.Q2: There is no choice other than to refuse that offer.
Task.Q3: Sorry, but I can only refuse that offer.
Task.Guide: 만약 우리가 더 많은 양을 구매하기로 동의한다면 어떻게 할 것인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:

Mission.Title: Sharing Ideas

Task.Q1: What do you think about using this image for the new expo brochure?

Task.Q3: This image, use it for the new expo brochure?
Task.Guide: 확실하지 않다고 말하고, 그것은 우리가 목표로 하는 고객에게는 조금 옛날식 방식이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m not sure]. {It seems} [a little old-fashioned for our target customer].

Mission.Title: Business Trip Preparations

[I have no problem taking a taxi] {but} [I would prefer to have a fixed plan for my commute].

Mission.Title: Travelling Information

Mission.Description_En: Check in at a place of residence and ask how to get to Park Street. After hearing how you will get there, have your luggage sent to your room, so that you can arrive at your destination in time.

Task.Q1: Here’s your key. Is there anything else I can help you with, Mr. Freeman?
Task.Q2: Here's the key. Anything else I can help you with?
Task.Q3: Here's the key. Can I help with anything else?
Task.Guide: Park Street에 가는데 얼마나 걸리는지 물어보고, 오후에 거기서 회의가 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes. {How long will it take to] [get to Park Street?] [I have a meeting there this afternoon].

Yes. How long does it take to get to Park Street? I have a meeting there in the afternoon.

내 책상을 내 새 사무실에 옮겨줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Mission.Title: Maintaining Positive Relationships
Mission.Description_Ko: 최근에 당신이 한 발표에 대해 Ms. Masters와 얘기를 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Ms.Masters about a presentation you recently did.

Task.Q1: You look well today.
Task.Q2: You look fine today.
Task.Q3: Looking well today.
Task.Guide: 감사하다 하고, 어떻게 지내는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thank you]. {[How are you?]}
Thank you. How do you do?
Thanks a lot. How is it going?
Thanks a bunch. How are you doing?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how I am?

Task.Q1: I’m fine. I just wanted to say that we were all really impressed with your presentation yesterday.
Task.Q2: I'm okay. I wanted to state that we were quite impressed with your presentation yesterday.
Task.Q3: Fine. We were impressed by your presentation yesterday.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 말해줘서 고맙다고 하고, 당신이 신경을 많이 써주는 건 나에게 큰 의미라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Thank you for saying that]. {[It means a lot coming from you]}.
Thank you for saying so. It means a whole lot coming from someone like you.
Thanks for the compliment. Coming from someone like you, it means a lot to me.
Thanks for the recognition. Coming from a person like you, it really means quite a lot.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it means a lot coming from me?

Task.Q1:
What’s your secret for staying so energetic?
You gave such a convincing argument for the clients.
Task.Q2:
Why do you stay so energetic?
You articulated a convincing argument for the clients.
Task.Q3:
Why are you so energetic?
The argument was so convincing for the eclients.
Task.Guide: 난 그저 내가 말했던 것을 정말로 믿었던 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I guess} [I just really believed] [what I was saying].
I guess I merely affirmed what I was claiming.
I suppose I believed the things I were saying.
I suppose I affirmed the things I were claiming.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you just really believed what you were saying?
Task.Key: I {just really believed} what I was saying.
Use_Key: I just really believed what he told me.
I just really believed what I heard from her.
I just really believed what I saw the other day.
Use_Guide: 그가 나에게 말한 것을 진심으로 믿었다고 말해 보세요.
그녀에게 들은 말을 진심으로 믿었다고 말해 보세요.
지난 번에 내가 본 것을 진심으로 믿었다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Anyway, I think you have great presentation skills and that you would be an excellent person to lead our presentation skills seminar for new hires.
Task.Q2: You have great presentation skills and you would be an excellent person to lead the presentation skills seminar for new hires.
Task.Q3: You have great presentation skills. I think you'd be the best leader for the  presentation skills seminar for new hires.
Task.Guide: 나는 그 일에 관심이 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Really? {[I would be interested in] [doing that]}.
Really? I would take interest in doing this.
Seriously? I may be interested in doing that.
Seriously? I may as well be interested in doing so.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you would be interested in doing that?

Complete.Reaction: That’s good to hear.

Mission.Title: Meeting New People 1
Mission.Description_Ko: Pete라는 새로운 직원을 만나 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation with a new colleague you just met, named Pete.

Task.Q1: Pleased to meet you, I’m Pete from Finance
Task.Q2: It's a pleasure to meet you. My name is Pete, from Finance.
Task.Q3: Nice to meet you. I'm Pete from Finance.
Task.Guide: 나도 만나서 반갑다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Nice to meet you, too]}.
It's very nice to meet you, too.
Glad to meet you, too.
Pleasure to meet you, too.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that it's nice to meet me?
Task.Key: Nice to meet you.
Use_Key: Nice to know that.
So great to see the view.
It's good to hear from you.
Use_Guide: 그것을 알게되서 반갑다고 말해보세요.
경치를 볼 수 있게되서 너무 좋다고 말해보세요.
당신으로부터 소식을 들을 수 있어 좋다고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: I haven’t seen you around before. Are you new?
Task.Q2: I haven't seen you before. Arrive recently?
Task.Q3: Haven't met you before. New?
Task.Guide: 응, 나는 막 시카고 지점에서 이전했다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, {I just transferred from} [the Chicago branch].
Yeah, I transferred recently from the Chicago branch.
Yes. I am from Chicago. It hasn't been long since I transferred.
Yes. I come from Chicago. Just started recently.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you just transferred from the Chicago branch?

Task.Q1: Which department are you in?
Task.Q2: Tell me the department you are in.
Task.Q3: So which department?
Task.Guide: 나는 국제 세일즈 부서에 속해 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I’m in} [International Sales].
I'm in charge of International Sales.
I work in International Sales.
I work in sales, on international tasks.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you're in international sales?

Task.Q1: Good line of work. So do you travel a lot?
Task.Q2: Good type of work. Do you travel much?
Task.Q3: Good work. Travel often?
Task.Guide: 사실 그렇지 않고, 나는 선임 관리자이며, 감독의 책임을 가지고 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Actually, not much.} I’m [a senior manager], so I’m [responsible for] [directing staff].
Actually, not a lot. I'm senior manager, so I'm more in charge of directing staff members.
Not so much. As a senior manager, I'm responsible for directing staff.
Not really. As senior manager, I take more responsibility for directing staff.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you're responsible for directing staff?

Complete.Reaction: That's nice.

description: 08.[AI-Tutor] 예습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_이 신체 부위는 무엇인가요?

Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 신체 부위를 나타내는 표현을 배워봐요!

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_시간 말하기 3

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 시간을 말할 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you tell the time.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"minutes after (hour)"}은 "몇 시에서 몇 분이 지난"을 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "minutes after (hour)" is an expression telling the time.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"after"}와 같이 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "after." Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"after"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the "after."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 다른 표현을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"minutes till (hour)"}은 "몇 시 몇 분 전"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "minutes till (hour)" is an expression telling the time.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"till"}과 같이 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used with "till."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"till"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with "till."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 마지막 표현을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 정각을 말할 때 사용하는 o'clock 없이도 정시를 말할 수 있어요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: You can tell time without "o'clock".

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"o'clock"} 없이 시간을 말할 때 사용할 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can be used to telling time without "o'clock".

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! {"o'clock"}없이 시간을 말해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's practice how to tell without "o'clock."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used to tell the time.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 시간 읽는 연습을 해보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning how to tell the time with your tutor!

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 기숙사편

Description.Description_Ko: {"Campus English : 기숙사편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Campus English : Dorm life"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 유학 또는 어학연수 시 기숙사 생활에 관해 이야기해보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about dorm life in college.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you living this year?
Quiz.Guide: {"be living in"}을 이용하여 {"저 ABC홀에 살고 있어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm living in ABC Hall.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How's living in a dormitory?
Quiz.Guide: {"share A with"}를 이용해 {"좋아요, 그런데 20명과 화장실을 같이 써야 해요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
It's nice, but I have to share a bathroom with twenty people.
It's good, but I have to share a bathroom with twenty people.

Quiz.Quiz_En: By the way, where are you going?
Quiz.Guide: {"run out of"}를 이용해 {"비누가 떨어져서 가게에 가고 있어요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm going to the store because I ran out of soap.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Do you know where Selina is going?
Quiz.Guide: {"catch up on"}을 이용해 {"그녀는 학교 과제를 따라잡으려고 도서관에 가고 있어요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
She is going to the library to catch up on schoolwork.
She is going to the library to catch up on homework.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Anyway, who is your roommate?
Quiz.Guide: {"be rooming with"}를 이용해 {"올해에는 Julie와 같이 방을 써요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I am rooming with Julie this year.
This year I am rooming with Julie.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Are you getting along with your roommate?
Quiz.Guide: {"get along with"}를 이용해 {"그녀가 지저분해서 나는 그와 그다지 잘 지내고 있지 않아요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm not getting along with her that much because she is messy.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 12.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_중고급 비즈니스 영어_중고급 비즈니스 : 메일편 1

Description.Description_Ko: {중고급 비즈니스 : 메일편 1} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리 해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Advanced Business : E-Mail 1"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 한 편의 비즈니스 이메일에 쓸 내용을 말로 정리해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's review the content you can use when writing a business e-mail.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 시작해 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please begin your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"Dear ~,"}를 이용해 {"Eliza Wilson님께,"}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Dear Eliza Wilson,

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"inquiry"}를 이용해 {"문의해주셔서 감사합니다."}라고 이야기 해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Thank you for your inquiry.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I am writing to"}를 이용해 {"행사에 대한 정보를 더 제공해드리기 위해서 적습니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I am writing to give more information on the event.
I am writing to offer more information about the event.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"we will hold"} 또는 {"we will be holding"}을 이용하여 {"저희는 미디어 전문가들을 위한 세미나를 열 것입니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
We will hold a conference for media professionals.
We will be holding a conference for media professionals.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"followed by"}를 이용하여 {"각 발표 뒤에는 논의가 이어질 것입니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Each presentation will be followed by a discussion.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.

Title.Title_En: Speak Like a Native : Make a New Friend

Description.Description_Ko: {"원어민 코스프레 : 친구 사귀기편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Speak Like a Native : Make a New Friend"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 새로 만난 이웃에게 영어로 질문하며 다가가 보겠습니다. 오늘 대화에서는 직업과 관심사에 대해 이야기 합니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's make a new friend. Today's conversation will be about jobs and interests.

Quiz.Quiz_En: I just moved in last week.
Quiz.Guide: {"What brings you to ~?"}를 이용해 {"무슨 일로 Portland에 온 거예요?"}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: What brings you to Portland?

Quiz.Reaction: I'm here to continue my music career.
Quiz.Quiz_En: How long have you lived here?
Quiz.Guide: {"What do you do"}를 이용해 {"2년이요. 어떤 일을 하세요?"}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Two years. What do you do?
I's been two years. What do you do?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 저는 힙합 프로듀서입니다. 그리고 사이드 직업으로 온라인에서 신발을 팔아요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I'm a hip hop producer. And I sell shoes online as a side business.
Quiz.Guide: {"cool shoes"}를 이용하여 {"그나저나 신발 멋지네요!"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Cool shoes by the way!
By the way, cool shoes!

Quiz.Quiz_En: They're from the 90's.
Quiz.Guide: {"Where did you get them from"}를 이용해 {"멋지네요. 어디서 구한 건가요?"}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Cool. Where did you get them from?
That's cool. Where did you get them from?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그것들은 경매에서 얻었어요. 저는 엄청난 농구 팬이거든요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I got them in an auction. I'm a huge basketball fan.
Quiz.Guide: {"oh cool"}을 이용하여 {"오 멋져요. 저도예요!"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Oh cool, so am I!
Oh, cool, I am too!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 농구 팬 동료를 만나서 너무 좋은데요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: It's nice to meet a fellow basketball fan.
Quiz.Guide: {"Did you see"}를 이용하여 {"어제 경기 보셨나요?"}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Did you see the game yesterday?

Quiz.Quiz_En: It was spectacular.
Quiz.Guide: {"we should watch"}를 이용하여 {"언제 경기 한 번 같이 봐요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: We should watch a game together sometime.

Description.Description_Ko: {중고급 비즈니스 : 메일편 2} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리 해 봅시다.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 한 편의 비즈니스 이메일에 쓸 내용을 말로 정리해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's review the content you can use when writing a business e-mail.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 시작해 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please begin your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"whom it may concern"}를 이용해 {"관계 되시는 분에게,"}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Dear whom it may concern,
To whom it may concern,

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"sincerely apologize for"}와 {"delayed response"}를 이용해 {"늦어진 대응에 대해 진심으로 사과드립니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I would like to sincerely apologize for the delayed response.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I am writing to"}를 이용해 {"당신의 문의 사항에 답해 드리기 위해 적습니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I am writing to respond to your inquiry.
I am writing to answer your inquiry.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"reviewed your inquiry"}을 이용하여 {"당신의 주문 배송 날짜에 대한 문의를 살펴보았습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I have reviewed your inquiry on the delivery date of your order.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"unfortunately"}를 이용하여 {"안타깝게도, 긴 지연이 있었습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Unfortunately, there has been a long delay.
Unfortunately, there was a long delay.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I regret to inform you that"}를 이용하여 {"유감스럽지만 배송에 2주가 더 소요될 것임을 알려드립니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I regret to inform you that the delivery will take two more weeks.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I would like to know if"}를 이용해 {"당신이 환불을 선호할지 알고 싶습니다."}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I would like to know if you would prefer a refund.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"Could you please"} 또는 {"Would it be possible for you to"}를 이용해 {"가능하다면 5일 내로 답해 주시겠습니까?"}라고 물어봐 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Could you please reply in five days?
Could you please reply within five days?
Would it be possible for you to reply in five days?
Would it be possible for you to reply within five days?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"able to get through to an agent"}를 이용하여 {"당신이 직원에게 연결되지 못했다니 죄송합니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I'm sorry you were not able to get through to an agent.
I'm sorry that you were not able to get through to an agent.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"customer service line"}를 이용하여 {"저희의 고객 서비스 라인이 기술적인 이유로 인해 사용불가능했습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Our customer service line was unavailable due to technical reasons.
Our customer service line was unavailable because of technical reasons.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your e-mail according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I would like to inform you that"}를 이용하여 {"그것이 수리되었다는 점을 알려드립니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
I would like to inform you that it has been repaired.
I would like to inform you that it has been fixed.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 이메일을 마무리해 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please end your email according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"reached at"}를 이용하여 {"아래의 번호들로 저희의 서비스 팀에 연결 되실 수 있습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Our service team can be reached at the numbers below.
