Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 튜터와 함께 명언을 읽으며 영어와 친해져 보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now, you are ready to start. Go and start reading quotes with your tutor!

Mission.Title: Crunching Numbers 2
Mission.Description_Ko: Matt으로 부터 해고 관련 소식을 듣고 관련하여 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Listen to the news on layoffs from Matt, and have a conversation on the issue.

Task.Q1: I just talked to Lynn.
Task.Q2: I just had a chat with Lynn.
Task.Q3: I talked to Lynn.
Task.Guide: 그녀가 해고와 관련하여 무엇을 말했는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What did she say about layoffs?]}
Did she say anything about layoffs?
Did she say something about layoffs?
What did she say about layoffs?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what she said about layoffs?

Task.Q1: She sidestepped the issue a bit, but last quarter was promising.
Task.Q2: She avoided the issue a bit, but last quarter seemed promising.
Task.Q3: She implied that the last quarter was promising.
Task.Guide: 나는 지난 달의 두 배 더 많은 시간을 일했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I worked} [twice as many hours] [last month].
I worked twice as much as last month.
I was working twice as hard this month.
I was working two times harder this month.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you worked twice as many hours last month?
Task.Key: I worked twice as many hours last month.
Use_Key: I put in ten times as much effort this time.
His popularity was twice his rival’s.
The size of the new building is three times that of the old one.
Use_Guide: 나는 이번에 열 배의 노력을 투입했다고 말해보세요.
그의 인기는 그의 경쟁자의 두 배였다고 말해보세요.
새로운 빌딩의 사이즈는 기존 빌딩의 세 배라고 말해보세요.
Use_Hint: [the size of the new building], [three times that of the old one]

Task.Q1: You usually work half as hard as everyone else, so I guess it works out.
Task.Q2: You normally work half as hard as other people, so it makes sense.
Task.Q3: You try half as much as other people do, so it's fair.
Task.Guide: 어쨌든 당신은 내가 무엇을 말하려고 하는지 안다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Whatever}, [you get my point].
Whatever, you get what I'm saying.
You know what I am trying to say!
You get my point!
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that I get your point?

Task.Q1: I'm just giving you a hard time.
Task.Q2: I'm just messing with you.
Task.Q3: Just saying.
Task.Guide: 직업을 잃는 것에 대해 걱정 된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm worried about} [losing my job].
I'm concerned about losing my job.
I'm worried if I lose my job.
I'm concerned if I lose my job.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're worried about losing your job?

Complete.Reaction: Me too.

Mission.Title: Crunching Numbers 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 회의 내용에 대한 대화를 나누면서 Matt의 해고 관련 질문에도 답해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation about the meeting and answer Matt's questions about layoffs.

Task.Q0: Lynn.
Task.Q1: So how was the meeting?
Task.Q2: So how did the meeting go?
Task.Q3: The meeting went okay?
Task.Guide: 나쁘지 않았다고 하면서 좀 짧았다고 말해주세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Not bad}. It was [relatively short].
Not as bad as I thought. It was rather short.
It was short, so not too bad.
It was kind of short, so it was okay.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it was relatively short?

Task.Q1: Those things can drag on forever. Did you go over layoffs?
Task.Q2: Those meetings can go on forever. Were layoffs mentioned?
Task.Q3: They can be so long. Any mention on layoffs?
Task.Guide: 마케팅에 돈을 투자했던 게 기억 나는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you remember} [we spent all that money] [on marketing?]
Remember the way we spent a lot of money on marketing?
Well, you know how we invested a lot in marketing?
Well, you know how we focused on marketing and spent so much money?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I remember how we spent all that money on marketing?
Task.Key: {Do you remember} how we spent all that money on marketing?
Use_Key: Do you remember we watched a movie last weekend?
Do you remember where you put your smartphone?
Do you remember what she said during the meeting?
Use_Guide: 지난주에 우리가 영화 봤던 게 기억 나는지 물어보세요.
너의 스마트폰을 어디에 뒀는지 기억 나냐고 물어보세요.
회의 동안에 그녀가 무엇을 말했는지 기억 나냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Something like a quarter of our annual budget. Around $7.5 million.
Task.Q2: Almost a quarter of our annual budget. Around  $7.5 million.
Task.Q3: Around  $7.5 million.
Task.Guide: 실제로는 800만 달러에 가깝다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Actually}, [more like $8 million].
To be specific, more like $8 million.
Actually around $8 million.
It's closer to $8 million.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean it was actually more like $8 million?

Task.Q1: So my question is, “What does that mean for layoffs?”
Task.Q2: So what does that mean for layoffs?
Task.Q3: So what about layoffs?
Task.Guide: 그들은 자세하게 언급하지 않았지만, 걱정하지 말라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{They didn’t go into great detail}, [but don’t worry].
They didn't mention specifically, but not to worry.
They didn't say exactly, but no worries.
They didn't state things in detail, but do not worry.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I don't have to worry?

Complete.Reaction: I hope so.

Mission.Title: Suitable Activities 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 여태껏 시도해본 활동과 나중에 참여할 활동에 대한 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on activities you've tried so far, and the activities to try later.

Task.Q1: Have you tried any events yet?
Task.Q2: Have you tried the events so far?
Task.Q3: Tried events yet?
Task.Guide: 여태껏 나는 볼링을 했고 다트 놀이를 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{So far I've} [gone bowling] and [played darts].
So far I've done bowling and darts.
I've bowled and played darts thus far.
I've gone bowling and played darts until now.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've gone bowling and played darts so far?

Task.Q1: I did the potato sack race. Fell over a few times. Rolled across the finish.
Task.Q2: I did the potato sack race, fell a couple of times, and rolled to finish.
Task.Q3: The potato sack race. I fell at times, but finished, rolling in.
Task.Guide: 무슨 활동을 해보고 싶은지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[What activities] {would you like to try?}
Are there any activities you'd like to try?
Any activities you're interested in?
Any other activities to try?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what activities I would like to try?
Task.Key: What activities {would you like to try?}
Use_Key: What kind of cocktails would you like to try?
What sports would you like to try?
What kind of salads would you like to try?
Use_Guide: 어떤 종류의 칵테일을 마셔보고 싶은지 물어보세요.
어떤 스포츠를 해보고 싶은지 물어보세요.
어떤 종류의 샐러드를 먹어보고 싶은지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I'm thinking about playing football. How about you?
Task.Q2: I'd like to play football. And you?
Task.Q3: Maybe football. And you?
Task.Guide: 고강도 운동을 좋아해서 릴레이 경주에 참여하고 싶다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I adore high impact sports}, so, [I'd like to] [participate in the relay race].
I like high impact sports, so, I'm thinking about doing the relay race.
Because I prefer high impact sports, I'd like to try the relay race.
Since I love high impact sports, I want to try the relay race.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you'd like to participate in the relay race?

Task.Q1: I liked playing a little football when I was younger, now I just don't have the energy. Same for the relay.
Task.Q2: I liked playing football when I was young, but now I don't have the energy. Same for the relay.
Task.Q3: I enjoyed football in youth, but I am too tired now. I am too tired for relay too.
Task.Guide: 그럼 혹시 줄다리기를 좋아하는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Then what do you like?} [Tug of war?]
So what would you like? Tug of war?
So what is it that you like? Tug of war?
So would you like Tug of War?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I like tug of war?

Complete.Reaction: That's not bad, actually.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_Campus English : 친구 사귀기편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 친구와 시간을 보낼 때 사용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression you can use when you talk with your friends.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"What are you up to ~?"}은 "~에 무엇을 할 건가요?"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "What are you up to ~?" is an expression asking people what they do.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"What are you up to ~?"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 표현들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "What are you up to ~?" Read after the AI tutor!

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"What are you up to ~?"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "What are you up to ~?"

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: What are you up to this weekend?

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_Ko: 다음 주 화요일에 무엇을 할 건가요?
Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: What are you up to next Tuesday?
What are you up to these days?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 친구에게 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the other expression that you can use to your friends.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"up for ~"}는 "~를 하고 싶다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "up for ~" is an expression telling what you want to do.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"up for ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "up for ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"up for ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "up for ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: Are you up for chilling at the park?
Are you up for coming to the get-together?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 친구 관계에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used between friends.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"meet up for/to ~"}은 "~을 하기 위해 만나다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "meet up for/to ~" is an expression telling what people meet to do.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"meet up for/to ~"} 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "meet up for/to ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 {"meet up for/to ~"}에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these expressions with the pattern "meet up for/to ~."

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽에서 배우게 될 표현들을 예습했어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions that you can learn through the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"이번 주말에 무엇을 할 건가요?"}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: What are you up to this weekend?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"모임, 파티에 가다"}를 의미하는 표현은 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: Are you up for coming to the get-together?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 유학 생활 중 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 표현들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've mastered some patterns that can be used during studying abroad.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 여러분은 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 더 다양한 표현들을 배워보세요!
Description.Description_En: Now you are ready to start. Go and start learning more expressions with your tutor!

description: 10.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 발음 마스터_명언 따라읽기 : 성공편

Description.Description_Ko: AI 튜터와 마지막으로 성공과 관련된 명언들을 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?
Description.Description_En: Let's check the success quotes you've learned. Are you ready?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 발음을 연습해봅시다!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Success is never accidental.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Success is never accidental.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't you're right.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't you're right.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Success is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Success is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다.
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly.

Mission.Title: How's the jet lag 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신의 최근 비행 경험에 대해 얘기해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about your recent flight.

Task.Q1: How was your flight? You must be jet lagged.
Task.Q2: Was your flight okay? You have to be jet lagged.
Task.Q3: Flight okay? What about jet lag?
Task.Guide: 잠들기가 힘들었다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, {[it was hard to sleep]}.
Yeah, it was difficult to sleep.
I had a hard time sleeping.
I could not sleep.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it was hard to sleep?

Task.Q1: What happened?
Task.Q2: What was wrong?
Task.Q3: What was the problem?
Task.Guide: 옆에 있던 남자가 신문을 큰 소리로 읽으면서 바스락거렸다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{The guy next to me} [kept rustling his newspaper] [while he read out loud].
The guy next to me rustled his newspaper while he read out loud.
One guy next to me figeted with his newspaper while reading out loud.
Next to me, a guy toyed with his newspaper while reading loudly.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean the guy next to you rustled his newspaper while reading out loud?

Task.Q1: I would’ve been a little annoyed with the flight attendant for not noticing what was going on. So what did you do?
Task.Q2: If I were you, I would have been annoyed with the flight attendant for not noticing. What did you do?
Task.Q3: So annoying. What did you do?
Task.Guide: 그에게 조용히 해달라고 요청했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I asked him to} [keep it quiet].
I asked him to make less noise.
I requested that he keep it quiet.
I asked him to be quiet.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you asked him to keep it quiet?
Task.Key: {I asked him to} keep it quiet.
Use_Key: I asked her to send me a letter.
I asked my boss to call me back.
I asked them to tell me the truth.
Use_Guide: 나는 그녀에게 편지를 보내달라고 요청했다고 말해 보세요.
나는 상사에게 다시 전화해달라고 요청했다고 말해 보세요.
나는 그들에게 진실을 말해달라고 요청했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: How did he handle it?
Task.Q2: How did he respond?
Task.Q3: And?
Task.Guide: 그는 이해해줬다고 하면서 그는 괜찮은 남자인 것 같다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{He was pretty understanding}. [Turns out] [he was a decent guy] after all.
He was understanding. He turned out to be a decent guy.
Not badly. He was understanding, so he seemed to be a decent guy.
Not too bad. He was understanding, so he was decent, after all.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean he was a decent guy after all?

Complete.Reaction: I'm glad.

description: 01.[AI-Tutor] 예습_초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_과거 시제 마스터

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 표현들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 이번 토픽에서는 {'과거 시제'}를 배울 거예요.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: You'll learn 'past tense' on this topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 토픽에서 다룰 단어들을 연습해볼까요? AI 튜터를 따라 말해보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words on the topic before starting the lesson. Read after the AI tutor!

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 표현들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_시간 말하기 1

Description.Description_Ko: {"시간 말하기 1"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Telling the time 1"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 영어로 시간을 말하는 법을 연습해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice telling the time in English.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What time is it?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}을 이용해 {"9시에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's nine o'clock.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What time is it now?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"1시 1분이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's one oh one.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What's the time?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"2시 25분이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's two twenty-five.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Can you tell me the time, please?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"6시 36분이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's six thirty-six.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, what time is it in Moscow?
Quiz.Guide: {"It's"}를 이용해 {"모스크바는 12시 47분이에요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's twelve forty-seven in Moscow.

Quiz.Reaction: I see. Let's move on to the last one.
Quiz.Quiz_En: What time are they having coffee?
Quiz.Guide: {"They are having coffee at"}을 이용해 {"그들은 9시 40분에 커피 마시고 있어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: They are having coffee at nine forty.

description: 09.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 서바이벌 워킹홀리데이_당신의 생일은 언제인가요?

Description.Description_Ko: {"당신의 생일은 언제인가요?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"When is your birthday?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 사람들의 생일에 대해 이야기해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about people's birthday.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째 질문입니다. 당신 아버지의 생신은 언제인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: First question. When is your father's birthday?
Quiz.Guide: 아버지의 생신은 1월 21일이라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
His birthday is on January twenty-first.
My father's birthday is on January twenty-first.
His birthday is on January twenty-first.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째 질문입니다. 당신 어머니의 생신은 언제인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Second question. When is your mother's birthday?
Quiz.Guide: 어머니의 생신은 4월 11일이라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
My mother's birthday is on April eleventh.
My mom's birthday is on April eleventh.
Her birthday is on April eleventh.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째 질문입니다. 당신 남동생의 생일은 언제인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Third question. When is your brother's birthday?
Quiz.Guide: 남동생의 생일은 7월 23일이라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
My brother's birthday is on July twenty-third.
My younger brother's birthday is on July twenty-third.
His birthday is on July twenty-third.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째 질문입니다. 당신 언니의 생일은 언제인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Fourth question. When is your sister's birthday?
Quiz.Guide: 언니의 생일은 9월 1일이라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:

My older sister's birthday is on September first.
Her birthday is on September first.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째 질문입니다. 당신 할머니의 생신은 언제인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Fifth question. When is your grandma's birthday?

Her birthday is on December thirty-first.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째 질문입니다. 당신 할아버지의 생신은 언제인가요?

Quiz.Answer_Set:

His birthday is on July thirtieth.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째 질문입니다. 당신 고모의 생신은 언제인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Seventh question. When is your aunt's birthday?

Quiz.Answer_Set:
My aunt's birthday is on December first.
Her birthday is on December first.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 09.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 서바이벌 워킹홀리데이_당신은 어떤 기분이신가요?

Description.Description_Ko: {"당신은 어떤 기분이신가요?"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"How do you feel?"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 기분을 나타내는 표현들을 말해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about the expressions that express human's mood.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel now?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"신나요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel excited.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel now?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"지루해요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel bored.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"불안해요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel nervous.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"놀랐어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel surprised.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"외로워요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel lonely.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"실망했어요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel disappointed.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel now?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"슬퍼요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel sad.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel now?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"화가 나요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel angry.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"무서워요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel scared.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How do you feel now?
Quiz.Guide: {"I feel"}을 이용해 {"차분해요."}라고 말해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I feel calm.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 14.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_중급 비즈니스 영어_비즈니스 : 발표편 1

Description.Description_Ko: {"비즈니스 : 발표편 1"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Business English : Presentation 1"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 회사에서 영어로 발표를 해보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's give a presentation in English.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Please give the presenter a warm round of applause.
Quiz.Guide: {"Thank you for"}을 이용해 {"오늘 와주셔서 감사합니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Thank you for coming today.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I'm responsible for"}를 이용해 {"저는 제품 디자인을 담당하고 있습니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm responsible for the product design.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"Firstly, I'll show you"}를 이용하여 {"첫째로, 저희의 새로운 제품 라인을 보여드리겠습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Firstly, I'll show you our new product line.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"Following that,"}을 이용하여 {"다음으로, 디자인 프로세스에 대해 말씀드리겠습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Following that, I'll talk about the design process.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"It will take about"}을 이용하여 {"30분 정도 걸릴 것입니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It will take about thirty minutes.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 08.[AI-Tutor] 예습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_무엇을 하고 있나요?

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전 오늘 배울 단어들을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression before taking the lesson.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"What are you doing?"}은 무엇을 하고 있는지 물어볼 때 흔히 사용하는 질문입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "What are you doing?" is a common question to ask what other people are doing.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 사람들의 행동을 나타내는 유용한 단어들을 영어로 배워봅시다. AI튜터를 따라 읽어보세요!
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's learn some useful words of people's action in English. Read after the AI tutor!

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 단어들을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the words of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 단어들을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you remember the words!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"(게임, 놀이 등을) 하는"}을 의미하는 단어는 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"(빵, 쿠키 등을) 굽는"}을 의미하는 단어는 영어로 무엇인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 핵심 단어들을 완벽하게 학습했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Good job! You've practiced the words perfectly.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 시작할 준비가 되었으니 튜터와 함께 다른 사람이 무엇을 하고 있는지 말하는 방법을 배워봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now, go and start learning how to describe what people are doing with the tutor!

description: 08.[AI-Tutor] 예습_입문 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_공항 영어 : 체크인편

Description.Description_Ko: 수업을 시작하기 전, 체크인 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 표현을 연습해봅시다.
Description.Description_En: Let's practice today's expression which can be used at the airport before check-in.

Description.Description_Ko: AI와 함께 오늘 수업을 준비해볼까요?
Description.Description_En: Are you ready to have a preview class with an AI tutor?

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I am flying to ~"}는 "저는 ~로 갑니다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I am flying to ~" is an expression answering the destination.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: "I am flying to ~" 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can come after "I am flying to ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 "I am flying to ~"에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "I am flying to ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I am flying to Los Angeles.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 공항에서 사용할 수 있는 또 다른 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn another expression that can be used at the airport.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I will take ~"}은 "~을 가지고 탈겁니다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I will take ~" is an expression answering what you will take with.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: "I will take ~" 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some words that can come after "I will take ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 "I will take ~"에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these words with the pattern "I will take ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I will take this backpack as my carry-on.
I will take this luggage as my carry-on.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 체크인 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 마지막 패턴을 배워봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Nice! Let's learn the last expression that can be used during check-in.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: {"I would like to have ~"}는 "~가 좋을 것 같습니다"를 의미하는 표현입니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: "I would like to have ~" is an expression answering what you want.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: "I would like to have ~" 뒤에 올 수 있는 단어들을 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice some expressions that can come after "I would like to have ~."

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 좋아요! 이제 방금 배운 단어들을 "I would like to have ~"에 붙여 연습해볼까요?
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Perfect! Now let's use these vocabulaires with the pattern "I would like to have ~."

Vocabulary.Vocabulary_En: I would like to have an aisle seat.
I would like to have a window seat.

Description.Description_Ko: 완벽해요! 당신은 오늘 학습할 토픽의 표현을 배워봤어요.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've learned the expressions of today's topic.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 방금 학습한 표현을 기억하고 있는지 확인해봐요!
Description.Description_En: Now let's check if you can remember the expressions!

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I am flying to Los Angeles.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"나는 이 수화물을 가지고 탈거에요."}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I will take this luggage as my carry-on.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: {"~가 좋을 것 같습니다."}를 영어로 어떻게 말하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Answer the given question in English.
Answer the given question in English.
Quiz.Answer_set: I would like to have a window seat.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! 당신은 체크인 상황에서 사용할 수 있는 몇 개의 패턴들을 마스터했습니다.
Description.Description_En: Perfect! You've mastered some patterns that you can use during check-in.

Description.Description_Ko: 이제 수업을 통해 더 많은 유용한 패턴들을 학습해보세요.
Description.Description_En: Now, learn some more useful patterns through the class.

description: 14.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_중급 비즈니스 영어_비즈니스 : 발표편 2

Description.Description_Ko: {"비즈니스 : 발표편 2"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Business English : Presentation 2"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 회사에서 영어로 발표를 해보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's give a presentation in English.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Please give the presenter a warm round of applause.
Quiz.Guide: {"being here at ~ to ~"}를 이용해 {"이 시간에 제가 말하는 것을 듣기 위해 와계신 모든 분께 감사드립니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Thank you all for being here at this time to hear me speak.
I thank everyone for being here at this time to listen to me speak.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"I'll start with"}를 이용해 {"지난달의 성과부터 시작하겠습니다."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'll start with last month's achievements.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"First of all,"}을 이용해 {"우선 이 차트를 봐주세요."}라고 이야기해 주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: First of all, take a look at the chart.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"In fact,"}를 이용하여 {"사실, 매출이 크게 늘었습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: In fact, sales have greatly increased.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"Let's move on to"}를 이용하여 {"다음 슬라이드로 넘어가겠습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Let's move on to the next slide.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 주어진 가이드에 따라 영어로 발표를 이어가 보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Please continue your presentation according to the given guide.
Quiz.Guide: {"This chart shows"}를 이용하여 {"이 차트는 우리 서비스의 질이 어떻게 개선되었는지 보여줍니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: This chart shows how our service quality has improved.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: It's No Problem.
Mission.Description_Ko: 약속을 취소하는 동료 Jeremy와 다시 시간을 잡는 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You had an appointment with your colleague Jeremy. But now he is canceling on you. Reschedule the appointment with him.

Task.Q1: Can I talk with you for a minute?
Task.Q2: Do you have a moment to talk?
Task.Q3: Can you spare a minute?
Task.Guide: 무슨 일이냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Sure]. {[What's up?]}
Sure. What is it?
Sure. What's the matter?
What's happening?
What is the problem?

Task.Q0: I'm really sorry.
Task.Q1: I'm afraid I can't make it to our appointment.
Task.Q2: I think we should cancel our appointment.
Task.Q3: I have to cancel our oppointment.
Task.Guide: 시간을 다시 정할 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [want to] [reschedule?]
Do you want to meet some other time?
Are you available at any other time?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I want to reschedule?
Task.Key: {I'm afraid I can't} make it to our appointment.
Use_Key: I'm afraid I can't go to your wedding.
I'm afraid I can't finish my report on time.
I'm afraid I can't help you this time.
Use_Guide: 너 결혼식에 못 갈 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
레포트를 시간 내에 못 끝낼 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
이번에는 너를 돕지 못 할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: Please, if you don't mind.
Task.Q1: When are you available?
Task.Q2: When do you have time?
Task.Q3: When are you free?
Task.Guide: 월요일 2시 반은 어떠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Are you available at 2:30 Monday?]}
How about next Monday at 2:30?
Is 2:30 Monday okay with you?
Are you free next Monday at 2:30?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I'm available at 2:30 Monday?

Task.Q0: I have a meeting at 4:30.
Task.Q1: Is it possible to meet earlier than that?
Task.Q2: Can we meet earlier than that?
Task.Q3: Do you have any time before that?
Task.Guide: 점심 전에 잠깐 시간이 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I only have a few minutes] {before} lunch].
I might have a moment before lunch.
I can spare a couple of minutes before lunch.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you only have  a few minutes before lunch?

Task.Q0: Let me see,
Task.Q1: I think I'd better stick with 2:30.
Task.Q2: I think 2:30 would be better.
Task.Q3: 2:30 sounds better for me.
Task.Guide: 그럼 월요일에 보자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I'll see you] [on Monday] {then}.
Catch you on Monday then.
Monday it is.

Task.Q1: Let me know if there is any change of shedule.
Task.Q2: Call me if something comes up.
Task.Q3: Tell me if you have to change our appointment.
Task.Guide: 그런일은 없을 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That's not going to happen]}.
That won't happen.
Not a chance.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's not going to happen?

Complete.Reaction: Okay, have a good one.

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_의문사로 질문해보기

Description.Description_Ko: {"의문사로 질문해보기"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ask using Interrogative words"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 대화를 나눠봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's have a talk.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 나 요즘, 이 보이그룹에 푹 빠져 있어.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I am excited about this boy band these days.
Quiz.Guide: {"그들이 누군데?"}라고 질문해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Who are they?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그들은 한국에서 온 보이 그룹이야. 그건 그렇고, 내 생일이 다가오고 있어.
Quiz.Quiz_En: They are the boy band from South Korea. Anyway, my birthday is coming soon.
Quiz.Guide: {"너의 생일이 언제야?"}라고 질문해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: When is your birthday?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 내 생일은 1월 21일이야. 그리고 나 유럽 여행 계획 세웠어.
Quiz.Quiz_En: It is on January twenty-first. And I'm planning a trip to Europe.
Quiz.Guide: {"비행이 언제야?"}라고 질문해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: When is your flight?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다음 주야. 나는 너무 기대되는데 동시에 너무 피곤해.
Quiz.Quiz_En: It's next week. I am so excited but very tired at the same time.
Quiz.Guide: {"너 왜 피곤해?"}라고 질문해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: Why are you tired?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 왜냐하면 나 밤새도록 인터넷을 검색했기 때문이야. 그런데 너의 백팩 어디에 있어?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Because I searched the Internet all night. Anyway, where is your backpack?
Quiz.Guide: {"left"}와 {"at home"}을 이용하여 {"나 그것을 집에 두고 왔어."}라고 대답해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: I left it at home.

Quiz.Quiz_En: By the way, where is your wallet?
Quiz.Guide: {"in my pocket"}을 이용하여 {"내 주머니에 있어."}라고 대답해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is in my pocket.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그런데 너의 티셔츠에 있는 남자는 누구야?
Quiz.Quiz_En: By the way, who is the man in your T-shirt?
Quiz.Guide: {"그는 내가 가장 좋아하는 남자 배우야."}라고 답변해볼까요?
Quiz.Answer_Set: He is my favorite actor.

Description.Description_Ko: 좋아요! Who, Where, When, Why를 사용해 질문하고, 답변하는 방법을 마스터하셨네요! 축하합니다. :)

content_name: I'm not feeling up to Par

Mission.Title: I'm not feeling up to Par
Mission.Description_Ko: 요 며칠 컨디션이 안 좋았던 당신. 병원에 가서 의사선생님께 증상을 말하고, 진단을 받아 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You haven't been feeling well these days. Go to see a doctor and tell her about your symptoms and get your diagnosis.

Task.Q1: What brings you here today?
Task.Q2: What is the purpose of your visit today?
Task.Q3: How can I help you today?
Task.Guide: 요즘 계속 몸이 좀 안 좋았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I haven't been feeling very well]}.
I was sick recently.
I've been ill for the past few days.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you haven't been feeling very well?

Task.Q1: What exactly are your symptoms?
Task.Q2: What signs did your body send?
Task.Q3: What kind of changes did you feel in your body?
Task.Guide: 지난 3일동안 힘이 없었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I've been feeling} [tired] [for the last three days].
I've had no energy for the past three days.
I felt deflated for the last three days.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you were tired for the last three days?

Task.Q0: I need to check your vital signs.
Task.Q1: Then I'll draw some blood.
Task.Q2: Then I need to get your blood checked.
Task.Q3: Then I have to check your blood.
Task.Guide: 얼마나 걸릴지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{How long} [will that take?]
How long do I have to wait?
When would it finish?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how long it'll take?
Task.Key: {How long} will that take?
Use_Key: How long will you stay here?
How long did it take?
How long can you wait?
Use_Guide: 여기 얼마동안 있을 거냐고 물어보세요.
얼마나 걸렸냐고 물어보세요.
얼마나 오래 기디릴 수 있냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Less than 3 hours.
Task.Q2: Approximately 2-3 hours.
Task.Q3: Maybe under 3 hours.
Task.Guide: 생각보다 오래 걸린다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[That's longer than I thought]}.
That's loner than I expected.
That's more than I thought.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that's longer than you thought?

Task.Q0: Thank you for waiting.
Task.Q1: Here are your test results.
Task.Q2: This is your check up results.
Task.Q3: Here are the results of your check up.
Task.Guide: 진단이 어떻게 나왔는지 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what's your diagnosis?

Task.Q0: It's a repiratory infection. I'll write you a prescription.
Task.Q1: You'll be feeling up to par again.
Task.Q2: You'll be feeing better soon.
Task.Q3: You'll get better in a couple of days.
Task.Guide: 심각한 건 아닌 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if it's serious?

Complete.Reaction: Of course not.

Quiz.Answer_Set: My favorite language is English.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 자기소개를 해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's introduce yourself.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Nice to meet you.
Quiz.Guide: {"저도 만나서 반가워요."}라고 답변해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Nice to meet you too.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is your name?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am"}을 이용하여 {"저의 이름은 Susan입니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am Susan.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where are you from?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am from"}을 이용하여 {"저는 한국에서 왔어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I am from Korea.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Could you tell me when your birthday is?
Quiz.Guide: {"My birthday is on"}을 이용하여 {"제 생일은 1월 21일입니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: My birthday is on January twenty-first.

Quiz.Reaction: I see. Mine is April nineteenth.
Quiz.Quiz_En: What do you do for a living?
Quiz.Guide: {"I am"}을 이용하여 {"저는 선생님입니다."}라고 답해주세요.

Quiz.Reaction: That's awesome. Thank you for sharing.

Description.Description_Ko: AI 튜터와 마지막으로 도전과 관련된 명언들을 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's practice pronouncing.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {You will never win if you never begin.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: You will never win if you never begin.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Believe you can and you're halfway there.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.

description: 04.[AI-Tutor] 복습_ 초급 걱정없이 떠나는 유학_해외에서 살아남기 : 은행편

Description.Description_Ko: {"해외에서 살아남기 : 은행편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Living Abroad : At the bank"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 해외에서 은행에 방문해보겠습니다. 은행에서 활용할 수 있는 표현들을 연습해 봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's visit a bank. We're going to use various expressions we can use in a bank.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How can I help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"open my savings account"}를 이용해 {"저축 예금 계좌를 개설하고 싶습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I want to open my savings account.

Quiz.Reaction: OK. I'll set your account up right now.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Is there anything else you need?
Quiz.Guide: {"issue"}를 이용해 {"새 신용카드를 발급받고 싶습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I want to issue a new credit card.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What else can I do for you?
Quiz.Guide: {"freeze my former account"}를 이용해 {"제 이전 계좌를 정지해주실 수 있나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Could you freeze my account?

Quiz.Reaction: Sure. Please fill out this form.
Quiz.Quiz_En: What else can I help you with?
Quiz.Guide: {"withdraw A from B"}를 이용해 {"제 계좌에서 1,000불을 수표로 인출해야 합니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I need to withdraw a thousand dollars in check from my account.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Anything else you need?
Quiz.Guide: {"check my balance"}를 이용해 {"제 입출금 계좌의 잔고를 확인해주실 수 있나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Could you help me check my checking account balance?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Please fill out this form.
Quiz.Guide: {"네 그럴게요. 감사합니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Okay I will. Thanks.
Okay I will. Thank you.

BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about some problems using electronic devices abroad.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How may I help you?
Quiz.Guide: {"phone plan"}을 이용해서 {"저는 요금제를 바꾸고 싶습니다."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I want to change my phone plan.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Why do you want to change your phone plan?
Quiz.Guide: {"go over"}를 이용해 {"매달 초과 요금을 내고 있어요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I'm going over every month.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Is there any plan you want?
Quiz.Guide: {"unlimited data"}를 이용해 {"데이터 무제한 요금제가 있나요?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Do you have a plan with unlimited data?
Do you have unlimited data plan?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Sure we have.
Quiz.Guide: {"그럼 그걸로 하겠습니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Then I'll take that.
Then I'll take it.
I'll take that.
I'll take it.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What else do you need?
Quiz.Guide: {"connect to WIFI"}를 이용해 {"와이파이에 연결하기 위한 비밀번호 좀 알려주세요."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Please tell me the password to connect to the WiFi.
Please let me know the password to connect to the Wifi.

Quiz.Quiz_En: It's 1234. Anything else?
Quiz.Guide: {"out of"}를 이용해 {"제 핸드폰의 배터리가 다 되었어요."}
Quiz.Answer_Set: My phone is out of battery.

Quiz.Quiz_En: There is a charger over there.
Quiz.Guide: {"감사합니다."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
Thank you.
Thanks.

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_열 고개 답하기 편 : 채소편

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 답하기 편 : 채소편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten questions :  Vegetables"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이것들은 동그란 야채이며 표면은 갈색이고 안쪽은 흰색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. These are round vegetables with brown skin and white insides.
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they…?"}를 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they potatoes?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 이것은 길고 딱딱하며 오렌지색을 띈 채소입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. This is a long, think, orange-colored vegetable.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a carrot?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이것은 안쪽에 여러 겹이 있습니다. 이것의 냄새와 맛은 매우 강렬합니다. 이것은 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. This has many layers on its inside. It has a very strong smell and taste. What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it an onion?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이것들은 먹을 수 있는 곰팡이류입니다. 이것들은 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. These are fungi that people can eat. What are these?
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they…?"}를 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they mushrooms?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이것은 긴 이파리를 가진 작은 양파입니다. 이 채소는 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. This is a small onion with long green leaves. What is this vegetable?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a spring onion?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이것은 크고 일반적인 감자처럼 생겼지만 달콤한 맛이 납니다. 이것은 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This looks like a large ordinary potato but tastes sweet. What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a sweet potato?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이것은 샐러드 그리고 김치의 주요 재료입니다. 이것은 큰 녹색 이파리가 있는 식물입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This is the basic ingredient of salad and Kimchi. This is a plant with large green leaves.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it lettuce?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: There's Nothing Like It!
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료 Lisa와 주말에 한 일에 대해서 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Lisa, your colleague, on what you did over the weekend.

Task.Q1: How was your weekend?
Task.Q2: How did you spend your weekend?
Task.Q3: What did you do on the weekend?
Task.Guide: 별거 안했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I didn't get up to too much]}.
I didn't really do anything.
I barely did anything.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you didn't get up too much?

Task.Q1: I was basically a couch potato all weekend.
Task.Q2: I stayed all day sitting on my couch.
Task.Q3: I didn't leave my house all weekend.
Task.Guide: 네 여동생이 온 줄 알았는데라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I thought} [your younger sister came over].
I thought your sister was staying at your house.
I thought your sister was visiting you.
Task.Are_you_saying: You thought my younger sister came over?
Task.Key: {I thought} your younger sister {came} over.
Use_Key: I thought he moved here last year.
I thought she called me to say sorry.
We thought we lost the game.
Use_Guide: 그가 작년에 이사 온 줄 알았다고 말해 보세요.
그녀가 나에게 사과하러 전화한 줄 알았다고 말해 보세요.
우리는 우리가 진 줄 알았다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: But we just hung out at home.
Task.Q2: But we just spent time at home.
Task.Q3: But we just stayed home doing this and that.
Task.Guide: 네 여동생이 나랑 비슷하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[She's somewhat like me]}.
Kind of like me, then.
We are quite similar.
She and I seem to have something in common.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying she's kind of like you?

Task.Q1: There's nothing like spending a day at home with a warm cup of tea.
Task.Q2: Spending a day at home with a cup of tea is the best.
Task.Q3: It's best to stay home all day with a cup of tea.
Task.Guide: 따뜻한 차 한 잔과 함께 집에 있는 것만한 게 없다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{There's} [nothing like] [spending a day at home with a warm cup of tea].
Spending a day at home with a cup of tea is the best.
It's best to stay home all day with a cup of tea.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying there is nothing like spending a day at home with a warm cup of tea?

Task.Reaction: I do know what you're saying.
Task.Q1: Maybe I should introduce you guys.
Task.Q2: Perhaps I should we should meet all together.
Task.Q3: We should all get together sometime.
Task.Guide: 나는 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I’m game for anything]}.
I'm always open for anything.
I'm looking forward to meeting her.
It would be fun.
I'd love to hang out with you guys.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're game for anything?

Complete.Reaction: Alright, I'll give you a ring when she comes over again.

Mission.Title: New Company
Mission.Description_Ko: 친구 Mark에게 새로 이직한 회사에 대해 이야기해 보세요. 다른 친구들도 어떻게 지내고 있는지 이야기를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Tell your friend Mark about your new company. And talk about how other friends are doing as well.

Task.Q1: How do you like your new company?
Task.Q2: Do you like your new company?
Task.Q3: How is your new company?
Task.Guide: 솔직하게 말하면 조금 힘들지만, 하는 일이 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[To be honest with you]}, [it's tough but I like what I do here].
Frankly spekaing it's not easy but I like what I do.
Honestly, it is hard but I like it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's tough but you like what you do there?

Task.Q1: What are your job responsibilities?
Task.Q2: What are you in charge of ?
Task.Q3: What is your job?
Task.Guide: IT 제품에 대한 판매와 마케팅을 담당하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm responsible for} [sales and marketing of] [our IT products].
I'm in charge of sales and marketing of our IT products.
I'm responsible for our IT products sales and marketing.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if we are in danger of not getting the budget we need?
Task.Key: {I'm responsible for} sales and marketing of our IT products.
Use_Key: I'm responsible for hiring.
I'm responsible for this project.
I'm responsible for making PowerPoint slides.
Use_Guide: 나는 채용을 담당하고 있다고 말해 보세요.
나는 이 프로젝트를 맡고 있다고 말해 보세요.
나는 파워포인트 슬라이드를 만드는 것을 담당하고 있다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: By the way I heard June landed a new job.
Task.Q1: Have you heard anything about his new company?
Task.Q2: Do you know anything about his new company?
Task.Q3: Know something about it?
Task.Guide: 뉴욕에 베이스를 둔 IT 회사라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It's an IT company based in New York]}.
He is working at an IT companyI, its based in New York.
He is working in New York for an IT company.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's an IT company based in New York?

Task.Q0: I also heard Jay is doing well.
Task.Q1: Have you seen him lately?
Task.Q2: Have you talked to him lately?
Task.Q3: Did you speak to him lately?
Task.Guide: 지난주 컨퍼런스에서 우연히 만났다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I bumped into him] [at a conference last week]}.
I bumped into him at a conference a few weeks ago.
I saw him at a conference a few weeks ago.
I ran into him at a conference last week.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you bumped into him at a conference last week?

Complete.Reaction: We should make a time to catch up!

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_열 고개 답하기편 : 과일

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 답하기편 : 과일"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {Ten questions : Fruit}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이것은 길고 휘어있는 과일이고 표면이 노란색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. It is a long curved fruit and has yellow skin.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a banana?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 이 과일은 와인을 만들 때 씁니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. This fruit is used for making wine.
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they…?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they grapes?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이 과일은 정말 크고, 바깥은 녹색 안쪽은 빨간색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. This fruit is really big and it's green outside and red inside.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a watermelon?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이것은 밝은 노란색의 과일이며 매우 신 과즙을 지녔습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. This is a bright yellow fruit with very sour juice.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a lemon?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이것은 작고 빨간 과일이며 부드럽고 과즙이 많습니다. 이것은 작은 노란색 씨들을 많이 가지고 있습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. It is a small red fruit that is soft and juicy. It has tiny yellow seeds.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a strawberry?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이것은 과즙이 많은 과일로 오렌지 색깔을 띕니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This is a juicy fruit with orange-colored skin.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it an orange?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이것은 매우 작고 동그란 과일이며, 표면이 빨간색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This is a very small and round fruit that has red skin.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a cherry?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_열 고개 게임 : 스포츠편

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 게임 : 스포츠편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten questions : Sport"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이것은 두 팀이 크고 갈색인 공을 던지며 점수를 내는 게임입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. This is a game where two teams try to score goals by throwing a large brown ball.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it basketball?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 이것은 사람들이 약 42 킬로미터를 달리는 경주입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. This is a race where people run about 42 kilometers.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a marathon?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이 게임에서는 사람들이 네트 위로 라켓을 이용하여 셔틀콕을 치며 점수를 냅니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. In this game, people score points by hitting a shuttlecock across the net with a racket.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it badminton?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이것은 두 명의 사람이 크고 빨간 글러브를 끼고 규칙에 따라 싸우는 스포츠입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. This is a sport where two people wearing large red gloves fight according to the rules.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it boxing?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이것은 한 팀에서 한명 씩 공을 방망이로 때리고 세 곳의 베이스로 뛰며 홈 베이스로 오는 스포ㅡ입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. This is a sport where players have to run bases and get to the home base to win.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it baseball?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This is the game of table tennis.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It is ping pong?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이것은 사람들이 눈이 있는 경사면을 스노우보드를 이용하여 타고 내려오는 스포츠 또는 활동입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This is the sport or activity that people travel down snowy slopes using a snowboard.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it snowboarding?

content_name: Are you ready to leave for the party?

Mission.Title: Are you ready to leave for the party?
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 친구 Daniel과 파티에 가야 하는데, 가기 전에 끝내야 할 일이 있습니다. 친구에게 강아지 밥을 대신 챙겨달라고 부탁해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You need to leave for a party with your friend Daniel soon. But you also need to finish a few things before you leave. Ask him to feed your dog for you.

Task.Q1: Are you ready to leave for the party yet?
Task.Q2: Are you ready to go to the party now?
Task.Q3: Ready to go party?
Task.Guide: 20분만 달라고 요청해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Give me 20 minutes]}.
I will be in 20 minutes.
Task.Are_you_saying: 20 minutes?

Task.Q0: What takes you so long?
Task.Guide: 나가기 전에 끝내야 할 일이 몇 개 더 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I {need to} [finish a few more things] [before we go out].
I need to get few things done before going out.
I need to complete a few things before going out.
Just until I sort a couple of things.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean you need to finish a few more things before we go out?

Task.Q1: Could I do anything to help?
Task.Q2: Is there anything I can do to help?
Task.Q3: Anything I can help with?
Task.Guide: 내 강이지 밥을 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Would you} [feed my dog] [for me?]
Would you be able to feed my dog?
Could you feed my dog for me?
Could you feed my dog instead?
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean would I feed your dog for you?
Task.Key: {Would you} feed my dog for me?
Use_Key: Would you walk the dog?
Would you tell me what exactly happened yesterday?
Would you pick up my parents at the airport?
Use_Guide: 강아지 산책을 시켜줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
어제 정확하게 무슨 일이 있었는지 말해주겠냐고  물어보세요.
공항에 내 부모님을 모시러 가 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: Where’s the food?
Task.Q2: Where can I find the food?
Task.Q3: The food?
Task.Guide: 부엌 싱크대 밑에 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It’s} [under the kitchen sink].
It's below the sink in the kitchen.
You can find it right under the sink.
You can see that it's beneath the sink.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it is under the kitchen sink?

Task.Q0: I found it.
Task.Q1: How much should I give it?
Task.Q2: What is the amount I should I give?
Task.Q3: So give it how much?
Task.Guide: 빨강색 그릇을 채워서 주라고 요청해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Just [fill up] [the red bowl], {please}.
Just fill the red bowl, if you don't mind.
Until you fill the red bowl.
Fill the red bowl.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean fill up the red bowl?

Complete.Reaction: Will do.

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_열 고개 게임 : 질문편

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 게임 : 질문편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten Questions : Ask"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이것은 피 또는 불의 색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. This is the color of blood or fire.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it red?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 당신은 연필이나 펜을 넣을 때 이것을 사용합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. You use this to put your pencils and pens in.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a pencil case?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이 과일은 정말 크고, 바깥은 녹색 안쪽은 빨간색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. This fruit is really big and it's green outside and red inside.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a watermelon?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 바이올린을 전문적으로 연주합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. The person who has this job plays the violin professionally.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a violinist?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이 나라에서 당신은 피라미드를 보실 수 있습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. You can find Pyramids in this country.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Egypt?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이것은 매우 큰 동물로 길고 유연한 코를 가지고 있습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This is a very large animal with a long, flexible nose.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it an elephant?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. People buy medicines here.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a pharmacy?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다.
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly.

Mission.Title: How much for one?
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 장을 보러 갔습니다. 점원과 대화를 나누고 신선해 보이는 생선을 사 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are at a grocery store. Have a conversation with the store clerk and buy the fish that looks very fresh.

Task.Q1: What can I get for you today?
Task.Q2: How can I help you?
Task.Q3: Need anything?
Task.Guide: 이 생선이 매우 신선해 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[This fish looks very fresh]}.
This fish looks so fresh.
This fish seems very fresh.
This fish seems so fresh.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying this fish looks very fresh?

Task.Guide: 한 마리에 얼마인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[How much for one?]}
How much does it cost?
What is the price for one?
What is the cost of one?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how much for one?

Task.Q1: Which one do you want? I’ll weigh it.
Task.Q2: Tell me which one you want so that I can weigh it.
Task.Q3: Tell me the one you want.
Task.Guide: 가장 큰 생선으로 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [give me] [the biggest one?]
Could you give the biggest one to me?
Could I get the biggest one there?
Can I have the biggest one over there?
Would it be possible to have the largest one there?
Task.Are_you_saying: Oh, you want the biggest one?
Task.Key: {Could you} give me the biggest one?
Use_Key: Could you give them my number?
Could you go and talk to him in person?
Could I give you something in return?
Use_Guide: 그들에게 내 번호를 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
그를 찾아가 직접 이야기해 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요.
내가 보답을 해도 되는지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: It's 2 kilograms.
Task.Q1: So that will cost $6 in total.
Task.Q2: So that will be $6.
Task.Q3: That will be $6.
Task.Guide: 카드로 결제해도 되는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{May I} [pay] [with a card?]
May I pay on credit?
Can I pay by card?
Can you charge it on credit?

Complete.Reaction: Of course. I'll wrap the fish up for you first.

Mission.Title: How About Dinner?
Mission.Description_Ko: 주말에 저녁 초대를 하는 Lisa와 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Lisa who is inviting you over for dinner on the weekend.

Task.Q0: How is your day going?
Task.Q1: Are you hanging in there?
Task.Q2: Is everything okay?
Task.Q3: Are you doing okay?
Task.Guide: 나쁘지 않다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Not too bad]}.
So so.
So far so good.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying not too bad?

Task.Q0: Do you have any plans this weekend?
Task.Q1: It feels like you're schedule is always fully booked.
Task.Q2: You seem to be busy all the time.
Task.Q3: You always look so busy.
Task.Guide: 특별한 계획 없는데 왜 물어보는지 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Why do I ask?

Task.Q0: Would you like to come over to my place for dinner on Saturday?
Task.Q1: I have a free day that day.
Task.Q2: I'm not doing anything that day.
Task.Q3: My schedule is empthy that day.
Task.Guide: 너무 좋다고 말하고 토요일 몇시냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what time on Saturday?
Task.Key: {Would you like to} come over to my place for dinner on Saturday?
Use_Key: Would you like to get something to drink?
Would you like to sit down for a while?
Would you like to come with us?
Use_Guide: 뭐 좀 마시러 가고 싶은지 물어보세요.
좀 앉아 있고 싶은지 물어보세요.
우리와 함께 가고 싶은지 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: It doesn't matter to me.
Task.Q1: What time works best for you?
Task.Q2: When are you available?
Task.Q3: When can you come?
Task.Guide: 6시는 어떠냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how 6 o'clock sounds to you?

Task.Q1: Would 5:30 be an okay time for me to pick you up?
Task.Q2: Do you want me to pick you up at 5:30?
Task.Q3: Should I pick you up at 5:30?
Task.Guide: 딱 좋다고 말하고 뭘 가지고 갈 거냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what you can bring?

Task.Q1: I'll take care of everything.
Task.Q2: You don't have to worry.
Task.Q3: I got everything covered.
Task.Guide: 그때 보자라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[See you then]}.
See you later.
Catch you later.

Complete.Reaction: Okay, later.

Mission.Title: Dinner with the CEO
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신과 당신의 동료 Anne은 대표님과의 미팅이 있습니다. 무엇에 관한 미팅인지 이야기 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You and your colleague Anne are having a meeting with the CEO separately. Talk with her about what your meeting is going to be about.

Task.Q1: Are you available for dinner tonight?
Task.Q2: Can we meet for dinner tonight?
Task.Q3: Can you have dinner with me tonight?
Task.Guide: 대표님과 미팅이 있다고 말하고, 다음으로 미룰 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if you can take a rain check?

Task.Reaction: You have a meeting with th CEO?
Task.Q1: I am also scheduled for a meeting  with the CEO tomorrow.
Task.Q2: My meeting with the CEO is scheduled for tomorrow.
Task.Q3: ahh I have a meeting with the CEO tomorrow.
Task.Guide: 내일 대표님과의 미팅 잘하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Good luck in} [your meeting with the CEO] [tomorrow].
Good luck for tomorrows meeting with the CEO.
Good luck in tomorrows CEO meeting.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying good luck in my meeting with the CEO tomorrow?

Task.Q1: What is your meeting in regards with?
Task.Q2: What is the topic of your meeting?
Task.Q3: What is your meeting about?
Task.Guide: 새로운 신기술에 대한 거라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It's about} [the up and coming cutting edge technology].
With regards to  cutting edge up and coming technology.
Discussion about the some up and coming, cutting edge technology.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's about the up and coming cutting edge technology?
Task.Key: {It's about} the up and coming cutting edge technology.
Use_Key: It's about his new movie.
It's about how people spend their holidays.
It's about how we should talk to each other.
Use_Guide: 그의 새 영화에 대한 거라고 말해 보세요.
그것은 사람들이 휴가를 어떻게 보내는가에 대한 거라고 말해 보세요.
우리가 서로에게 어떻게 이야기해야 하는지에 대한 거라고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [how we should talk to each other]

Task.Q1: How fascinating!
Task.Q2: That’s interesting!
Task.Q3: Sounds interesting!
Task.Guide: 잘 진행되기를 바라자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Let's hope it all pans out well]}.
Let's hope its pans out.
I hope it all pans out.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying let's hope it all pans out well?

Complete.Reaction: Yes, I do hope so.

content_name: If only I had done more 2

Mission.Title: If only I had done more 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 여행 기념품을 전달하면서 관련 대화를 하고, 회사의 최근 소식에 대해서도 말을 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Discuss souvenirs brought back from the trip and talk about recent developments at the workplace.

Task.Q0: Welcome back
Task.Q1: It’s great to see you.
Task.Q2: So nice to see you.
Task.Q3: Nice seeing you.
Task.Guide: 고맙다고 하면서 여기 기념품을 가져왔다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Thanks. {[Here, I brought you a souvenir]}.
Thank you. Here's a souvenir for you.
Thanks. I bring you a souvenir.
Thank you. Take this souvenir.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you brought me a souvenir?

Task.Q1: You shouldn’t have. Thank you!
Task.Q2: You really shouldn't have.
Task.Q3: You shouldn't have.
Task.Guide: 나는 네가 초콜릿을 얼마나 좋아하는지 알고 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I know how much you like chocolate]}.
I am aware how much you like chocolate.
I know you love chocolate.
I know you're such a chocoholic.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you know how much I like chocolate?

Task.Q0: So
Task.Q1: I guess you heard about Pat. And they increased everyone’s quotas.
Task.Q2: You heard about Pat, right? They also increased everyone's quotas.
Task.Q3: Pat got fired. And people's quotas increased.
Task.Guide: 그들이 우리에게 이렇게 더 열심히 일하게 만들 것을 알았다면, 나는 아마 돌아오지 않았을 것이라고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{If I had} [known] [they were going to make us work harder], maybe I [wouldn’t have come back].
If I had known that we had to work harder, I wouldn't have returned.
Yes. Had I known that we were going to work harder, I wouldn't have returned.
Yes. Had I known that we were to work harder, perhaps I wouldn't have returned.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you wouldn't have come back if you had known they were going to make us work harder?
Task.Key: {If I had} known they were going to make us work harder, maybe I wouldn’t have come back.
Use_Key: If I had done this before, I would not have struggled.
If we had been warned, we would have avoided trouble.
If they had eaten earlier, they would not have been late.
Use_Guide: 내가 이것을 이전에 해봤다면, 허우적거리지 않았을 것이다라고 말해보세요.
우리가 경고를 받았다면, 우리는 문제를 피했을 것이라고 말해보세요.
그들이 더 일찍 먹었다면, 그들은 늦지 않았을 것이다라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: Please, you won't have any trouble. You bring more to the table than anyone.
Task.Q2: You wouldn't have trouble, anyhow. You contribute the most.
Task.Q3: You're going to be fine. You're the best.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 말해줘서 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Thank you for saying that]}.
I appreciate that you said that.
Thank you.
Thanks for saying that.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you thank me for saying that?

Complete.Reaction: Well you know it's kind of true. And everyone knows it.

Mission.Title: Socializing
Mission.Description_Ko: 6개월간 북경에서 뉴욕지사로 옴겼습니다. 뉴욕 오피스 상사와 대화를 나누어 보세요. 그는 금요일 모임에 당신을 초대할것입니다.
Mission.Description_En: You have moved from Beijing to the New York branch for 6 months. Engage in a conversation with your boss in New York. He will invite you to a gathering on Friday.

Task.Q1: You must be <user's name> from the Beijing office. Please come in.
Task.Q2: Are you <user's name> from the Beijing office? Please come in.
Task.Q3: <user's name> from the Beijing office? Please come in.
Task.Guide: Ms. Jones에게 드디어 만나서 반갑다고 말하고, 앞으로 6개월간 당신의 팀에서 일하게 되었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It's nice to finally meet you]}. [I will be working on your team for the next six months].
Mr Jones, right? It's really great to finally meet you. I will be on your team for the next six months.
Mr. Jones? I'm so happy to finally see you. I look forward to being on your team for the next six months.
You must be Mr. Jones. Finally, I get to meet you! I will be working on your team for the next six months.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you will be working on my team for the next six months?

Task.Q1: How is your first week in New York treating you?
Task.Q2: How has your first week in New York been?
Task.Q3: How is your first week in New York going?
Task.Guide: 새로운 프로젝트 하느라고 많이 바빴다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I've been all tied up with]} [catching up on the newly-assigned project].
I've been busy working on the newly-assigned project.
I've been caught up with the newly-assigned project.
I've been super busy catching up on the recently-assigned project.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you've been all tied up with catching up on the newly-assigned project?
Task.Key: {I've been all tied up with} catching up on the newly-assigned project.
Use_Key: I've been busy with working on the newly-assigned project.
I've been tied up with catching up on my homework.
I've been super occupied with working on the new project.
Use_Guide: 새로운 프로젝트 하느라고 많이 바빴다고 말해 보세요.
밀린 숙제하느라 바빴다고 말해 보세요.
새로운 프로젝트 하느라고 많이 바빴다고 말해보세요.

Task.Q0: You must be tired.
Task.Q1: How are you getting along with the office members?
Task.Q2: How are you doing with the team?
Task.Q3: How's the office treating you?
Task.Guide: 사무실 직원 모두 다 친절하고 잘해주고, 잘 기다려준다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Everyone in the office is friendly and nice], and [they are all patient with me]}.
Everyone in the office is treating me well. They are all kind, friendly and patient.
All the office members are friendly and nice. They are all being patient with me.

Mission.Title: Work Environment

Mission.Description_En: Your boss asks you about creating a positive working environment. Discuss some ways to improve your office. For example, talk about treating others with the same respect you want to receive from them.

Task.Reaction: We all know that a happy work environment resuts in harder workers.
Task.Q0: So, how can we create a trusted, productive, and positive work environment?
Task.Q1: What's your take on this?
Task.Q2: What's your opinion?
Task.Q3: What do you think?

가장 중요한 것은 가족을 사랑과 존중으로 대하는 것이라고 말해 보세요.
가장 중요한 것은 고객을 대할 때 당신이 그들에게 줄 수 있는 최대의 존중을 해 주는 것이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: Can you go more in depth about it?

Complete.Reaction: Don't worry about it. Just remember for the future.

Mission.Title: Saying Goodbye 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 동료와 이별인사를 나누어 보세요. 중요한 파트너십 협상을 하는데 도움을 줬다면서 감사를 표하고, 다음에는 내게 도움을 요청하라고 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Exchange goodbyes with a colleague. Tell him thank you for helping to negotiate an important partnership and tell him to ask you for help next time.

Task.Q1: So you came to say goodbye.
Task.Q2: So did you come to say goodbye?
Task.Q3: Came to say bye?
Task.Guide: 그러할만한 시간이 되었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, {[it's about that time]}.
Yeah, it's around that time.
Yes, that's about right.
Yes, I did.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean it's about that time?

Task.Q1: I just want you to know how much we enjoyed having you here.
Task.Q2: I want you to know that we enjoy having you here.
Task.Q3: Well, just know that we enjoy having you here.
Task.Guide: 그 기쁨은 내 것이었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
The pleasure was mine.
It was my pleasure to meet you.
It was a pleasure to have met you.
I enjoyed meeting you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say the pleasure was yours?

Task.Q1: You helped negotiate an important partnership and I genuinely appreciate your efforts.
Task.Q2: You aided in negotiating an important partnership and I truly value your effforts.
Task.Q3: I value your effort in negotiating an important partnership.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 말해준 것에 대해 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Thank you for} [saying so].
Thank you for the compliment.
Thank you so much for the comment.
Thanks a lot for saying so.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you thank me for saying so?
Task.Key: {Thank you for} saying so.
Use_Key: Thank you for having me at the party.
Thank you for helping me with the sales report.
Thank you for giving a great lecture.
Use_Guide: 파티에 초대해줘서 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
영업 보고서를 도와줘서 고맙다고 말해 보세요.
좋은 강의를 해줘서 고맙다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: If you're ever in the area again, please let me know.
Task.Q2: If you're in the area sometime, kindly let me know.
Task.Q3: Let me know if you come around again.
Task.Guide: 나는 반드시 그렇게 할 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I'll be sure to do that]}.
Sure.
Of course.
Certainly.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you'll be sure to do that?

Complete.Reaction: Absolutely.

Mission.Title: Saying Goodbye 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 다른 직장으로 이직하는 동료와 이별 인사를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Exchange goodbyes with a colleague who is moving to another workplace.

Task.Q1: I heard you're leaving us.
Task.Q2: I hear you're leaving.
Task.Q3: You're leaving?
Task.Guide: 그렇다고 말하면서 유감스럽게도 이제 움직일 때가 되었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, {I'm afraid} [it's time to] [move on].
Yeah, I'm afraid I must move on.
Yes, I'm sorry but I need to move on.
Yes, I apologize, but I should move on.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you're afraid it's time to move on?
Task.Key: Yeah, {I'm afraid} it's time to move on.
Use_Key: I'm afraid that I have to go now.
I'm afraid that I have bad news for you.
I'm afraid that I can't make it to the party.
Use_Guide: 유감스럽지만, 나는 이제 가야 한다고 말해보세요.
미안하지만 안좋은 소식을 전해주어야 할 것 같다고 말해보세요.
미안하지만 나는 파티에 참석할 수 없을 것이라고 말해보세요.

Task.Q1: To greener pastures no doubt.
Task.Q2: For certain, to greener pastures?
Task.Q3: To greener pastures?
Task.Guide: 그러길 희망한다고 말하면서, 너는 계속 있을 것인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I hope so. {[You're sticking around?]}
I hope so. Will you be sticking around?
I hope. Would you stick around?
Hopefully. You're going to stick around?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I'm sticking around?

Task.Q1: I'm a lifer. I guess this is where I belong.
Task.Q2: I'm a life-long employee. This is perhaps where I belong.
Task.Q3: I will stay. I belong there.
Task.Guide: 그것은 좋은 직장 환경이다라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[It's a nice work environment]}.
It's a pleasant working environment.
The work environment is very nice.
The working environment is so pleasant.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say it's a nice work environment?

Task.Q1: Well, uh, keep up the good work wherever you are. Maybe someday our paths will cross again.
Task.Q2: Well keep up the good work there as well. Someday our paths will cross again.
Task.Q3: Keep up the good work there. Our paths will cross again one day.
Task.Guide: 물론이라고 말하면서 또 보자고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Sure. We'll see again]}.
Sure. We'll see again soon.
I certainly will. I'm sure we'll see each other again.
I certainly will. I'm certain we will meet again.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we'll see again?

Complete.Reaction: Sure. Take care.

Mission.Title: It's Time 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 만남 일정을 정하기 위한 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on scheduling a meeting.

Task.Q1: My four o’clock was pushed back an hour, so I really need to move our meeting later in the evening.
Task.Q2: My four pm was delayed an hour, so I need to reschedule our night meeting at a later time.
Task.Q3: My four pm moved back an hour, so let's have our meeting later in the evening.
Task.Guide: 대신 수요일에 만날수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Would you rather} [meet up on Wednesday instead?]
Would you rather meet on Wednesday then?
Woud it be okay to meet up on Wednesday instead?
Would you like to meet on Wednesday then?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I would rather meet up on Wednesday instead?
Task.Key: {Would you rather} meet up on Wednesday instead?
Use_Key: Would you rather have some noodles?
Would you rather call me back later?
Would you rather go for a drive?
Use_Guide: 차라리 국수를 먹을 것인지 물어보세요.
차라리 나중에 나에게 전화를 다시 줄 것인지 물어보세요.
차라리 드라이브 하러 갈 것인지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: I’m having dinner with a college friend at 8:00 sharp.
Task.Q2: I will have dinner with a friend at 8 pm.
Task.Q3: I eat dinner at 8 pm.
Task.Guide: 언제 떠나야 8시까지 도착할 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What time} [would you need to leave] [to be there by 8:00?]
What time should you leave to get there by 8:00?
When would you leave to arrive at 8:00?
When should you leave to come exactly at 8:00?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what time I would need to leave to be there by 8:00?

Task.Q1: 10 to at the latest.
Task.Q2: 10 minutes before at most.
Task.Q3: 10 minutes in advance.
Task.Guide: 문제 없다고 말하면서 카페에 10시 5분에 도착해있을 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Not a problem]. {I’ll be at the café} [around ten O-five].
No problem. I'll be at the café at about ten O-five.
Alright. I'll arrive at the café by five past ten.
That will be fine. I'll be there at the café by five past ten.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you'll be at the café around ten O-five?

Task.Q1: I’ll leave at 5:00 on the dot.
Task.Q2: I'll take off at exactly 5:00.
Task.Q3: I'll leave at 5:00 then.
Task.Guide: 고맙다고 하면서 만나는 것을 기대한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Thanks. {I’m really looking forward to} [meeting with you].
Thanks. I look forward to meeting you.
Thanks so much. I'll look forward to our meet.
Thanks so much. I'll be looking forward to meeting you.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say you're really looking forward to meeting with me?

Complete.Reaction: You're welcome. I look forward to seeing you too.
