Mission.Title: Navigating Your Area 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 회의실이 어디인지 묻고 찾아가보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Ask where the meeting room is, and find your way there.

Task.Q1: Can I help you?
Task.Q2: How may I help you?
Task.Q3: Need anything?
Task.Guide: 여기서 회의가 있을 줄 알았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I thought} there was [supposed to be] [a meeting] here.
I thought there ought to be a meeting here.
I thought there was a meeting here.
There ought to be a meeting here.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you thought there was supposed to be a meeting here?
Task.Key: {I thought} there was supposed to be a meeting here.
Use_Key: I thought this was the right way.
I thought you were asleep.
I thought the book was on the table.
Use_Guide: 이것이 올바른 길이라고 생각했다고 말해 보세요.
네가 잠들어 있다고 생각했다고 말해 보세요.
그 책이 테이블 위에 있다고 생각했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: That got switched to the main conference room. I guess you didn't get the SMS.
Task.Q2: That actually got changed to the main conference room. It seems like you didn't get the SMS.
Task.Q3: The meeting is in the main conference room. You didn't get the SMS?
Task.Guide: 핸드폰을 차에 놔두고 왔다고 하면서 여기서 어떻게 회의실을 갈 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I [left my phone] in the car. So {how can I get to} [the conference room] from here?
My phone is in the car. How can I get to the conference room from here?
I left my phone in the car, so I didn't check the SMS yet. So how do I get to the conference room?
My phone is in the car, so I couldn't check the SMS. Do you know how I can get to the conference room?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking how you can get to the conference room?

Task.Q1: It's a little far. You might want to just catch them next time.
Task.Q2: It's a little far, so you might want to attend the next meeting.
Task.Q3: A bit far. You should attend the next meeting.
Task.Guide: 그것은 옵션이 아니라고 말하면서, 나는 거기에 가야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{That's not an option}. [I need to] [go there].
That's not optional. I must be there.
That's not acceptable. I need to be present.
That's not agreeable. I should be present.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you need to go there?

Task.Q1: You might just make it. Go to the second floor, take a right and walk down the hall. It's across the overpass.
Task.Q2: You may be able to make it. Reach the second floor, turn right and go down the hall. It's in front of the overpass.
Task.Q3: On the second floor, turn right and walk down the hall, until you reach the overpass. It's across from there.
Task.Guide: 빌딩 사이에 있는 통로를 말하는 것인지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{You mean} [that passageway] [between the buildings?]
Do you mean the passageway in between the buildings?
So the passageway between the buildings?
So the passageway in the middle of the two buildings?
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean the passageway between the buildings?

Complete.Reaction: That's the one.

Mission.Title: Sorry For That 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 이메일 내용을 여러 방법으로 수정하라고 지시해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Give instructions on how to revise email content.

Task.Q1: What's wrong with saying, “I'm sorry if this caused any trouble”?
Task.Q2: What's incorrect with the statement, "I'm sorry if this caused any trouble?"
Task.Q3: Should I say, "I'm sorry if this caused any trouble?"
Task.Guide: 일단, 당신은 막론하고 미안해 해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
First, {you should} [be sorry] [regardless].
First, you must be sorry nonetheless.
First, you should apologize definitely.
First, you must be apologetic for sure.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I should be sorry regardless?
Task.Key: First, you should be sorry regardless.
Use_Key: You should be apologetic about not being able to attend.
I should be more careful about what I say.
They should be concerned about the matter.
Use_Guide: 참석하지 못한 것에 대해 너는 미안해해야 한다고 말해보세요.
나는 내가 말하는 것에 대해 더 조심해야 한다고 말해보세요.
그 사항에 대해 그들은 걱정해야 한다고 말해보세요.
Use_Hint: [be apologetic about], [not being able to attend]

Task.Q1: So what should I say?
Task.Q2: So what do you suggest I say?
Task.Q3: So what should I say?
Task.Guide: 견적서에 오류가 있었다고 말하라고 조언 해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Tell them} [there was an error] [in the quote].
Informing that there was an error in the quote.
Let them know there was an error in the quote.
Just say there was an error in the quote.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say I should tell them there was an error in the quote?

Task.Q1: What happened afterwards?
Task.Q2: And what happened after?
Task.Q3: And then?
Task.Guide: 그 다음에는 네가 끼치는 손해를 인정해야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Next, {you need to} [acknowledge] [the damage it caused].
Next, you acknowledge the damage you caused.
Admit the damage you caused.
Admit to the damage you have caused.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I need to acknowledge the damage it caused?

Task.Q1: And should I say anything else?
Task.Q2: And is there anything else I should say?
Task.Q3: And anything else to add?
Task.Guide: 다시는 그것이 일어나지 않도록 하겠다고 말하라고 조언 해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Tell them you will make sure it won't happen again.
Say that you will make sure it won't happen again.
Tell them you won't do the same thing again.
Say that you won't do the same thing again.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean I should tell them I will make sure it won't happen again?

Complete.Reaction: Okay, thanks for your advice.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Where have you been?
Quiz.Guide: {"have been to"}를 이용하여 {"저는 런던에 다녀왔어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I have been to London.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Have you ever seen a giraffe?
Quiz.Guide: {"아니요. 기린은 본 적이 없어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: No, I have not seen a giraffe.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Have you read this book?
Quiz.Guide: {"아니요. 저는 그 책을 읽어보지 않았어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: No, I haven't read that book.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Have you ever played golf?
Quiz.Guide: {"네 골프 쳐 본 적 있어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, I have played golf.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Has he lived alone?
Quiz.Guide: {"네 그는 10년간 혼자 살아왔어요."}라고 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Yes, he has lived alone for ten years.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What did you do before we met?
Quiz.Guide: {"우리가 만나기 전에 저는 점심을 먹었어요."}를 과거완료 시제를 이용하여 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I had eaten lunch before we met.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What do you think of Tutoring?
Quiz.Guide: {"저는 Tutoring을 시작하기 전에는 영어를 배우는 것을 전혀 즐기지 않았어요."}를 과거완료 시제를 이용하여 답해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I had never enjoyed learning English until I started Tutoring.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 당신의 선생님이 오셨을 때 당신은 무얼 하고 있었나요?

Quiz.Answer_Set: I had finished my homework before my teacher started class.

Mission.Title: Trending Topics 2
Mission.Description_Ko: 주식의 지난해 퍼포먼스에 대해 얘기를 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about the stock's performance over the last year.

Task.Q0: I was going to ask you.
Task.Q1: How did the stock perform over the last year?
Task.Q2: How was the stock performance last year?
Task.Q3: How did stock perform last year?
Task.Guide: 이 그래프를 통해 우리는 1월에 힘차게 출발했지만, 서서히 감소했다는 것을 알 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{This graph shows us} that it [started out strong] in January, but [declined slowly].
This graph shows that it was strong in January, but declined gradually.
The graph here manifests strong performance in January, but such a trend decreased slowly.
The graph here manifests a strong starting point in January, but it started decreasing.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it started out strong in January but declined slowly?
Task.Key: {This graph shows us} that it started out strong in January, but declined slowly.
Use_Key: This graph shows us that we turned the corner last quarter.
This graph shows us that we were very busy this month.
This graph shows us that the sales increased rapidly last year.
Use_Guide: 이 그래프를 통하 우리는 지난 분기에 위기를 모면했다는 것을 알 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
이 그래프를 통해 우리가 지난 달에 굉장히 바빴다는 것을 알 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
이 그래프를 통해 작년 세일즈가 급격하게 증가했다는 것을 알 수 있다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: So when did it bounce back?
Task.Q2: So when was it that it bounced back?
Task.Q3: And it bounced back rapidly?
Task.Guide: 그 주식은 2분기에 바닥을 치고 평준화 되었다고 말하세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{It bottomed out} in the [second quarter] and [leveled off].
It fell out in the second quarter and evened out.
It bottomed out in the second quarter and stopped fluctuating.
In the second quarter, it fell out then evened out.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean it bottomed out in the second quarter and leveled off?

Task.Q1: How was the second half of the year?
Task.Q2: What was the second half of the year like?
Task.Q3: And the second half of the year?
Task.Guide: 3분기에는 변동이 있었지만, 주당 최고 $24를 달성했다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
It [fluctuated] in the [third quarter], but [hit a peak] of {around $24 per share}.
It fluctuated during the third quarter, but peaked at around $24 per share.
It was uneven in the third quarter, but reached a high point of around $24 per share.
It was uneven all throughout third quarter, but ultimately peaked at around $24 per share.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say it fluctuated in the third quarter but hit a peak of around $24 per share?

Task.Q1: And how has it been since then?
Task.Q2: How was it since then?
Task.Q3: Since then?
Task.Guide: 4분기 내내 큰 변동은 없었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Throughout the fourth quarter} there [hasn't been] [much fluctuation].
There hasn't been much fluctuation during the fourth quarter.
Not much fluctuation occurred during the fourth quarter.
The fluctation was not so severe during the fourth quarter.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying throughout the fourth quarter, there hasn't been much fluctuation?

Complete.Reaction: So should we invest?

Mission.Title: Getting Some Help 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 이메일을 보고 고별사를 수정하라고 권유해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Recommend revising the valediction after seeing the email.

Task.Q1: Would you mind helping me with something?
Task.Q2: Do you mind helping me with any of these?
Task.Q3: Help me with this please.
Task.Guide: 물론이라고 말하면서 무슨 일이냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Sure, what's up?]}
Sure, what can I do?
Of course. How can I help?
Of course. How may I help?
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you ask what's up?

Task.Q1: I need you to look at an e-mail for me. Does this look right to you?
Task.Q2: Can you look at this email for me? I want to know if this looks right.
Task.Q3: Look at this email. Does it look right?
Task.Guide: 알겠다고 하면서 하지만 너는 그 고별사를 바꾸고 싶을 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, but {you might want to} [change the valediction].
Yeah, but you may want to alter the valediction.
Pretty much. You might consider changing the valediction.
Pretty much. You should seek to change the valediction.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say I might want to change the valediction?
Task.Key: Yeah, but {you might want to} change the valediction.
Use_Key: You might want to write about something new.
She might want to invite you to her birthday party.
I might want to buy a warm coat for this winter.
Use_Guide: 너는 뭔가 새로운 것에 대해 쓰고 싶을 것이라고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 그녀의 생일파티에 너를 초대하고 싶을 것이라고 말해 보세요.
나는 이번 겨울을 위한 따뜻한 코트를 사고 싶을 것이라고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: The what?
Task.Q2: What do you mean?
Task.Q3: What?
Task.Guide: 고별사는 당신 이메일을 마무리 짓는 단어들을 말한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Valediction is} [the closing words] [in your e-mail].
Valediction. The words used for closing in the email.
The closing words of your email. It's called Valediction.
The closing words in the email. They're called Valediction.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say valediction is the closing words in my e-mail?

Task.Q1: What's wrong with my “valediction?”
Task.Q2: Is there anything wrong with it?
Task.Q3: Anything wrong?
Task.Guide: 답장을 기대하겠다고 말하는 것은 으스대는 것처럼 들린다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I expect your reply} [sounds bossy].
I expect your reply seems authoritarian.
You appear bossy when you say, I expect your reply.
If you say, I expect your reply, you may appear bossy.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I expect your reply sounds bossy.

Complete.Reaction: I couldn't come up with anything else.

Mission.Title: What Happened 1
Mission.Description_Ko: 소프트웨어 업데이트 도중 멈추어버린 화면에 대해 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk about a computer screen which froze while updating the software.

Task.Q1: What happened?
Task.Q2: What's wrong?
Task.Q3: A problem?
Task.Guide: 화면이 멈추었을 때 나는 내 소프트웨어를 업데이트 하고 있었다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I was updating} [my software] [when the screen froze].
I was updating software but the screen froze.
The software. The screen froze while being updated.
The software update stopped suddenly and the screen froze.
Task.Are_you_saying: Do you mean you were updating your software when the screen froze?
Task.Key: {I was updating} my software when the screen froze.
Use_Key: I was doing my homework when the bell rang.
She was listening to music when I got home.
Chris and Jeremy were drinking together when I saw them.
Use_Guide: 숙제를 하고 있는 동안 초인종이 울렸다고 말해 보세요.
그녀가 음악을 듣는 동안 나는 집에 도착했다고 말해 보세요.
Chris와 Jeremy가 함께 술을 마시는 동안 내가 그들을 봤다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: Did you try restarting it?
Task.Q2: Did you restart it?
Task.Q3: Try restarting.
Task.Guide: 다시 시작하는 것은 도움이 되지 않았다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yeah, {[restarting didn't help]}.
Yeah, it didn't help.
Yes, but it's no help.
Yes, but it's not helpful.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say restarting didn’t help?

Task.Q1: You're the second person today with that problem. I'll have a look.
Task.Q2: Another person had the same problem today. I'll take a look.
Task.Q3: You're not the first one with the problem. Let me look.
Task.Guide: 오늘까지 고칠 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you think} you can [fix it] [by the end of the day?]
Do you think you can get it fixed by the end of the day?
Can you fix it by the end of the day?
Can you get it fixed by the end of the day?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I can fix it by the end of the day?

Task.Q1: But I wouldn’t get my hopes up. That's actually what I was working on when you came in.
Task.Q2: But I wouldn't count on it. I was actually working on that when you arrived.
Task.Q3: But I can't be sure. I'm still working on the problem.
Task.Guide: 발표자료를 만들고 있었다고 말하면서 내 모든 파일을 담고 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I was [working on] [a presentation]. {[It has all my files]}.
I was preparing a presentation. It contains every file that I own.
I was working on a presentation. It has all my files.
I was preparing a presentation. It contains every file that I own.
Task.Are_you_saying: Did you say it has all your files?

Complete.Reaction: You didn't save to the cloud?

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_아이에게 버터 발음으로 영어 동요를! 1

Description.Description_Ko: {"아이에게 버터 발음으로 영어 동요를! 1"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Sing with your kid! 1"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 동요를 한 구절씩 다시 읽어봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's read the song with the pauses between phrases.

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the first part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"Twinkle twinkle, little star"}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Twinkle twinkle, little star

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the second part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"How I wonder what you are."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: How I wonder what you are.

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the third part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"Up above the world so high."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Up above the world so high

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the fourth part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"Like a diamond in the sky."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Like a diamond in the sky.

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the fifth part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"When the blazing sun is gone."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: When the blazing sun is gone.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Now let's begin with Itsy Bitsy Spider.
Quiz.Guide: {"The itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the water spout."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the water spout.

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the second part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"Down came the rain and washed the spider out."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Down came the rain and washed the spider out.

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the third part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"Out came the sun and dried up all the rain."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Out came the sun and dried up all the rain.

Quiz.Quiz_En: This is the fourth part of the lyric.
Quiz.Guide: {"And the itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the spout again."}를 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: And the itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the spout again.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: We should have..
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신과 당신의 아내, Suzie는 이번 여름 휴가를 떠나지 못한 것을 아쉬워 하고 있습니다. 그래도 애들은 집에서 즐거운 시간을 보냈다고 말해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You and your wife, Suzie, is talking about how unfortunate it was not to be able to leave for summer vacation. Tell her that the kids still had a good time at home.

Task.Q1: Staying home this summer was unfortunate.
Task.Q2: It was unfortunate to stay home this summer.
Task.Q3: Unfortunately I was home this summer.
Task.Guide: 우리가 티켓을 더 빨리 예매했어야 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
I know. We {should have} [booked tickets] [earlier].
I know. We shouldn’t have waited so late to book tickets.
Yes. I waited too long to book tickets.
Yes. I waited too long and now I cannot book tickets.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying we should have booked tickets earlier?
Task.Key: We {should have booked} tickets earlier.
Use_Key: I should have called you back earlier.
He should have come to my party.
She should have finished it already.
Use_Guide: 내가 너에게 더 일찍 전화 했어야 했다고 말해 보세요.
그는 내 파티에 왔어야 했다고 말해 보세요.
그녀는 이미 그것을 끝냈어야 했다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: It was my fault.
Task.Q1: I wish I hadn’t waited so long to take off work.
Task.Q2: I wish I had gotten off work earlier.
Task.Q3: I should have left work early.
Task.Guide: 그래도 애들은 집에서 잘 보낸 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [the kids still] [had a good time].
I think the kids still enjoyed their time.
The kids though enjoyed their time.
The kids, however, played well throughout.
Task.Are_you_saying: You think the kids still had a good time?

Task.Q0: I think so, too.
Task.Q1: They seemed to enjoy staying at home.
Task.Q2: It seemed as if they enjoyed staying home.
Task.Q3: They enjoyed being home.
Task.Guide: 그렇게 나쁜 휴가가 아니었을 수도 있다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Maybe] {it wasn’t} [such a bad vacation].
Maybe it wasn't a bad vacation after all.
Perhaps it was not a bad vacation at all.
I would think that it was rather a good vacation.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying maybe it wasn't such a bad vacation?

Complete.Reaction: Yeah, you're right.

Mission.Title: Leaving a Message
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 동료 Rick Remy에게 전화했는데, 그가 자리에 없습니다. 릭에게 메시지를 남겨 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You call to talk to Rick Remy, your colleague, but he's not at his desk. Engage in a phone  conversation leaving a message for Rick.

Task.Q1: What can I help you with?
Task.Q2: How may I assist you?
Task.Q3: How can I help you?
Task.Guide: Rick Remy를 연결해 달라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Hello. {Can you} [put me through to Rick Remy,] [please?]
Hello. Could you connect me to Rick Remy, please?
Hello. Can you please get me to Rick Remy?
Hello. Could you please let me talk to Rick Remy?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking to put you through to Rick Remy?

Task.Q1: He's not at his desk at the moment.
Task.Q2: He's not at his seat now.
Task.Q3: He is not in.
Task.Guide: 그가 언제 돌아오는지 아냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Do you} [know] [when he'll be back?]
Do you know when he will return?
Any ideas on when he'll be back?
When do you think he'll be back?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I know when he'll be back?
Task.Key: {Do you know when} he'll be back?
Use_Key: Do you know when you'll come back?
Do you know when they will return?
Do you know when the food will be done?
Use_Guide: 네가 언제 돌아올지 아냐고 물어보세요.
그들이 언제 돌아올지 아냐고 물어보세요.
음식이 언제 될지 아냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: He should be back by 1:00.
Task.Q1: Would you like to leave a message for him?
Task.Q2: Would you like to leave a message?
Task.Q3: Do you have a message for him?
Task.Guide: 명함을 수령할 수 있다고 전해 달라고 요청해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [tell him] [the business cards are ready for pick-up?]
Could you tell him he can come in to pick-up the business cards?
Could you let him know the business cards are ready to be picked-up?
Could you advise him that the business cards are ready for pick-up?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I could tell him the business cards are ready for pick-up?

Complete.Reaction: Certainly. I'll make sure he will get your message.

content_name: Have you upgraded your phone yet?

Mission.Title: Have you upgraded your phone yet?
Mission.Description_Ko: 핸드폰을 업그레이드 하는 것에 대해 대화를 나누어 보세요. 친구 Stacey에게 새로 구입한 스마트폰이 더 빠르다고 해보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Have a conversation on upgrading cell phones. Tell Stacey that the new smartphone is much faster.

Task.Q1: Have you upgraded your phone yet?
Task.Q2: Has your phone been upgraded yet?
Task.Q3: Upgrade your phone yet?
Task.Guide: 오늘 아침에 했다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, {[I did] [this morning]}.
Yes, this morning.
Yes, just this morning.
Yes, it was done this morning.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you did this morning?

Task.Q1: So, what do you think?
Task.Q2: So, how is it?
Task.Q3: So?
Task.Guide: 새 스마트폰이 훨씬 더 빠르다고 말해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[My new smartphone] is {so much} [faster].
My new smartphone is much faster as a result.
The smartphone is much faster now.
The smartphone works so much faster.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying your new smartphone is so much faster?
Task.Key: My new smartphone is {so much faster}.
Use_Key: Your house is so much bigger.
The tests are so much easier now.
Your smartphone has so many features that it is much better.
Use_Guide: 네 집이 훨씬 더 크다고 말해 보세요.
시험이 이제 훨씬 더 쉬워졌다고 말해 보세요.
네 스마트폰은 너무나도 많은 기능을 가지고 있어 훨씬 더 낫다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q1: How about the software?
Task.Q2: And the software?
Task.Q3: The software?
Task.Guide: 새로운 버전이 훨씬 빨라서 너무 좋다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[The new version is much quicker]}. [I really like it].
The new version is so much quicker. I like it very much.
The old version is much slower. I like the new version better.
The old version is very slow compared to the new one. I like the new one better.
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean the new version is much quicker?

Task.Q1: Was it expensive?
Task.Q2: Was it affordable?
Task.Q3: Expensive?
Task.Guide: 그렇게 안 비쌌고, 또 그 값어치를 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Not very]. {[It was worth the cost]}.
Not very much. It was worth every penny.
Not so much. It was cheap and worth the price.
Not really. It was affordable and worth it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you sayint it was worth the cost?

Complete.Reaction: Well, then maybe I should get one too.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_정글로 떠나요!

Description.Description_Ko: {"정글로 떠나요!"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"In the Wild, Wild Jungle"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 정글로 떠나요 이야기를 다시 한번 체크해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check the story, In the Wild, Wild Jungle once more.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Tell me about lions.
Quiz.Guide: {"brave"}를 이용하여 {"사자들은 용감합니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Lions are brave.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me about lions.
Quiz.Guide: {"사자들은 용감합니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Lions are brave.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Now, tell me about elephants.
Quiz.Guide: {"the largest brain"}을 이용하여 {"정글에서 코끼리들은 가장 큰 뇌를 가지고 있습니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Elephants have the largest brain in the jungle.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me about elephants.
Quiz.Guide: {"정글에서 코끼리들은 가장 큰 뇌를 가지고 있습니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Elephants have the largest brain in the jungle.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How about cheetahs? Tell me about them.
Quiz.Guide: {"the best hunters"}를 이용하여 {"이 정글에서 치타들은 가장 최고의 사냥꾼입니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Cheetahs are the best hunters in this jungle.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me about cheetahs.
Quiz.Guide: {"이 정글에서 치타들은 가장 최고의 사냥꾼입니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Cheetahs are the best hunters in this jungle.

Quiz.Quiz_En: How about giraffes? Tell me about them.
Quiz.Guide: {"long and beautiful necks"}를 이용하여 {"기린들은 길고 아름다운 목을 가졌습니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Giraffes have long and beautiful necks.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me about giraffes.
Quiz.Guide: {"기린들은 길고 아름다운 목을 가졌습니다."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Giraffes have long and beautiful necks.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 내가 누군지 맞춰보세요. 나는 정글의 왕입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Now, guess who am I. I am the king of the jungle.
Quiz.Guide: 나는 누구일까요? {"You are"}를 이용하여 답해보세요!
Quiz.Answer_Set: You are a lion.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 나는 정글에서 가장 빠른 동물입니다. 나는 누구일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: I am the fastest animal in the jungle. Who am I?
Quiz.Guide: {"You are"}를 이용하여 문장으로 답해보세요!
Quiz.Answer_Set: You are a cheetah.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_쥬라기 공원으로 떠나요!

Description.Description_Ko: {"쥬라기 공원으로 떠나요!"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Trip to Jurassic Park"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 쥬라기 공원으로 떠나요! 이야기를 다시 한번 체크해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's check the story, Trip to Jurassic Park again.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Tell me about T-Rex.
Quiz.Guide: {"the largest dinosaur"}를 이용하여 {"티-렉스는 가장 큰 공룡이에요."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The T-Rex is the largest dinosaur.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me about T-Rex.
Quiz.Guide: {"T-Rex는 가장 큰 공룡이에요."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The T-Rex is the largest dinosaur.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Tell me about Brachiosaurus.
Quiz.Guide: {"leaves"}를 이용하여 {"Brachiosaurus는 잎 먹는 것을 좋아해요."}를 영어로 말해보세요
Quiz.Answer_Set: The Brachiosaurus loves to eat leaves.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me about Brachiosaurus.
Quiz.Guide: {"Brachiosaurs는 잎 먹는 것을 좋아해요."}를 영어로 말해보세요
Quiz.Answer_Set: The Brachiosaurus loves to eat leaves.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: Pteranodon의 머리의 볏이 Pteranodons를 어떻게 도와주나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: How does the crest of the Pteranodon's head help the Pteranodons?
Quiz.Guide: {"keep balance"}를 이용하여 {"그 볏은 하늘을 나는 동안 그들이 균형을 잡고 방향을 찾도록 도와줘요."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The crest helps them keep balance and navigate while flying.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다시, Pteranodon의 머리의 볏이 Pteranodons를 어떻게 도와주나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me how the crest of the Pteranodon's head helps the Pteranodons.
Quiz.Guide: {"그 볏은 하늘을 나는 동안 그들이 균형을 잡고 방향을 찾도록 도와줘요."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The crest helps them keep balance and navigate while flying.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Tell me a story about the dinosaurs' extinction.
Quiz.Guide: {"ran out of"}를 이용하여 {"지구가 더 추워졌을 때, 공룡들은 먹을 음식이 떨어졌어요."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: When the Earth got colder, the dinosaurs ran out of food to eat.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다시 dinosaurs의 멸종에 대한 이야기를 해주세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Again, tell me a story about the dinosaurs' extinction.
Quiz.Guide: {"지구가 더 추워졌을 때, 공룡들은 먹을 음식이 떨어졌어요."}를 영어로 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: When the Earth got colder, the dinosaurs ran out of food to eat.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 내가 누구인지 맞혀 보세요. 내 이빨은 30cm입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Now, guess who I am. My teeth are about 30cm long.
Quiz.Guide: 나는 누구일까요? {"You are"}를 이용하여 답해보세요!
Quiz.Answer_Set: You are a Tyrannosaur.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 내가 누구인지 맞혀 보세요. 나는 세 개의 큰 뿔을 가지고 있어요. 한 개는 코에, 두 개는 이마에 있어요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I have three mighty horns. There is one on the nose, and two on the forehead. Who am I?
Quiz.Guide: 나는 누구일까요? {"You are"}를 이용하여 답해보세요!
Quiz.Answer_Set: You are a Triceratops.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_이건 뭘까요? : 마트편

Description.Description_Ko: {"이건 뭘까요? : 마트편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"What is this? : Mart"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 마트에 있는 물건들에 대해 이야기해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk about things in the mart.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"shopping cart"}를 이용해 {"이건 쇼핑 카트야."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: This is a shopping cart.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Then, what are those?
Quiz.Guide: {"frozen goods"}를 이용해 {"저것들은 냉동제품이야."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Those are frozen goods.

Quiz.Quiz_En: What are these?
Quiz.Guide: {"fresh produce"}를 이용해 {"이것들은 신선한 농산물이야."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: These are fresh produce.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 저는 저녁으로 무언가 멋진 것을 먹고 싶어요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: I want to eat something nice for dinner.
Quiz.Guide: {"How does BBQ sound"}를 이용해 {"저녁으로 BBQ 어때?"}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: How does BBQ sound for dinner?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 이 캔 섹션에서는 필요한 거 없어요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Don't you need anything in this canned goods section?
Quiz.Guide: {"I need"}를 이용해 {"나는 옥수수 캔 두 개가 필요해."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I need two cans of corn.

Quiz.Reaction: OK. I can see a bakery there.
Quiz.Quiz_En: What should we get in the bakery?
Quiz.Guide: {"pick a nice birthday cake"}를 이용해 {"아빠를 위해 멋진 생일 케이크를 고르자."}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Let's pick a nice birthday cake for dad.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 오, 이 섹션에는 많은 해산물이 있네요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Oh, there is a lot of seafood in this section.
Quiz.Guide: {"Look at"}을 이용해 {"저 큰 랍스터를 좀 봐!"}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Look at that huge lobster!

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 이제, 우리는 우리의 카트에 정말 많은 물건들이 있네요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Now, we've got so many things in our cart!
Quiz.Guide: {"place the items"}를 이용해 {"벨트 위에 물건들 놓는 것을 도와줄래?"}라고 말해보세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Can you help me place the items on the belt?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Quarterly Review
Mission.Description_Ko: 새로운 매니저를 긍정적으로 평가하는 Adelle과 대화를 나눠보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk with Adelle who thinks of her new manager positively.

Task.Q0: How are you?
Task.Q1: Were you informed that we got the quarterly review this week?
Task.Q2: Are you aware that we have the quarterly review this week?
Task.Q3: You know we got the quarterly review this week?
Task.Guide: 난 그저 본론으로 바로 들어갔으면 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I just hope we just cut to the chase]}.
I just hope we just get straight to the point.
I just hope we just don't beat around the bush.
I just want to get down to the business.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that you hope we can cut to the chase?

Task.Q1: Luckily, our new manager is forthright and exudes confidence.
Task.Q2: Luckily, our new manager is straight forward and shows confidence.
Task.Q3: Luckily, our new manager candid and has confidence.
Task.Guide: 그는 진정한 리더답게 보인다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
He {seems to be} [like] a [real leader].
He looks and acts like a leader.
He shows himself as a true leader.
It seems that he is a real leader.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that he looks and acts like a leader?
Task.Key: He {seems to be} like a real leader.
Use_Key: She seems to be quite smart.
They seem to be really tired.
Your boss seems to be a professional.
Use_Guide: 그녀는 상당히 똑똑해 보인다고 말해 보세요.
그들은 많이 피곤해 보인다고 말해 보세요.
너의 상사는 전문가처럼 보인다고 말해 보세요.

Task.Q0: He has gotten the entire department to invest in his idea.
Task.Q1: I haven't seen such influential person in the office.
Task.Q2: I've never seen such a person with so much influence in the office.
Task.Q3: There was never a person with such influence in the office.
Task.Guide: 최근 들어 사무실의 기운을 받아 힘이난다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I totally} [feed off the energy] [in the office] lately.
I get so much energy from the office recently.
I receive great energy from the office these days.
I get energized from the office these days.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying yu totally feed off the energy in the office lately?

Task.Q1: I don't mind tough love.
Task.Q2: I don't care about harsh treatment.
Task.Q3: I don't mind harsh treatment.
Task.Guide: 회의가 끝나면 모두가 활기를 되찾을 것이라고 확신한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I'm sure} everyone will [feel pumped up] [after the meeting].
I'm positive everyone will feel energized after the meeting.
I know everyone will feel revitalized after the meeting.
I'm certain everyone will be energized after the meeting.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that everyone will feel pumped up after the meeting?

Complete.Reaction: I'm looking forward to it.

Mission.Title: Cultural Intelligence
Mission.Description_Ko: Alex와 문화수용에 대한 대화를 나눠 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: Talk to Alex about cultural acceptance.

Task.Q0: Diverse workforce can be an asset to the company.
Task.Q1: For sure, but building a tie is rather hard.
Task.Q2: Definitely, although it's not easy to convey deep cultural insight.
Task.Q3: Of course, getting fully accepted by the company is difficult.
Task.Guide: 성공적으로 적응하려면 많은 노력이 필요할 것 같다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Much effort] {is needed} [to adapt successfully].
Taking a crash course would be a good idea.
You need to put in a lot of endeavor to soak in successfully.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying that much effort is needed to adapt successfully?

Task.Q1: The crash course would be for assimilation
Task.Q2: It's to know and to adapt to a new country.
Task.Q3: Training is needed to adapt to a new country.
Task.Guide: 문화를 이해하는 것이 말 자체를 이해하는 것 보다 중요할 때가 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Sometimes, [cultural cues are even more important] [than the message itself.]
Understanding the culture is even more essential than the message itself time to time.
Knowing the culture is sometimes considered more vital than the message itself.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying cultural cues are even more important than the message itself?

Task.Q1: Foreignness can be both attraction and repulsion.
Task.Q2: Products from different countries can be both likable and the opposite.
Task.Q3: Products from overseas can be favorable or the other way around.
Task.Guide: 사람들은 왜 이런 성향을 보이는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Why do you think} [human show[ this trait?]
Why do people show this kind of behavior?
How do people show such character?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking why I think human show this trait?
Task.Key: {Why do you think} human show this trait?
Use_Key: Why do you think he married her?
Why do you think she said that?
Why do you think they came back to Korea?
Use_Guide: 넌 왜 그가 그녀와 결혼했다고 생각하냐고 물어보세요.
그녀가 왜 그말을 했다고 생각하냐고 물어보세요.
왜 그들이 한국으로 돌아왔다고 생각하냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: People shouldn't be openly hostile to foreigners.
Task.Q2: People must not be  directly discrimminative.
Task.Q3: People shouldn’t be deliberately against foreigners.
Task.Guide: 맞다고 말하고, 특히 CEO들은 포용적이여야 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Right, {[cultural intelligence] is [a necessary aptitude in CEO]}.
True, cultural tolerance is a must have factor as  CEO.
Right, CEO should be able to embrace different culture aspects.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying cultural intelligence is a necessary aptitude in CEO?

Complete.Reaction: You can say that again.

Mission.Title: Telephoning & Note-Taking
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 동료 Jack에게 전화를 걸었는데, 그가 자리에 없습니다. 전화를 대신 받은 Brian에게 메시지를 남겨 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You called to Jack, your colleague, but he is not in the office. Leave a message to Brian who has answered instead.

Task.Q0: This is Brian, the assistant manager of S&G.
Task.Q1: Can I help you?
Task.Q2: May I help you?
Task.Q3: May I help you?
Task.Guide: 좋은 아침이라고 말하고, Jack이 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Oh, [good morning]. {[Is Jack in?]}
Good morning. Is Jack inside?
Greetings. How is Jack inside?
Greetings. How is Jack in there?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if Jack is in?

Task.Q0: I'm afraid he's out fo the office today.
Task.Guide: 메세지를 남길 수 있는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I wonder if I could} [leave a message?]
Do you know if I could leave a message?
Perhaps I could leave a message?
Could I leave a message?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you wonder if you could leave a message?
Task.Key: {I wonder if I could} leave a message.
Use_Key: I wonder if I could finish this next week.
I wonder if you could orgarnize the dinner party.
I wonder if they could come to help us to move.
Use_Guide: 내가 이것을 다음주에 끝내도 되는지 물어보세요.
네가 그 저녁 파티를 준비해 줄 수 있는지 궁금하다고 말해 보세요.
그들이 와서 우리 이사하는 것을 도와줄 수 있는지 궁금하다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [they could come], [to help us to move]

Task.Guide: 우리가 30일 수요일에 주선한 전화 회의와 관련하여 잭에게 전화해 달라고 부탁해 줄 수 있는지 물어보세요. 꽤 급하다고도 해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{Could you} [ask Jack to call me] [regarding the conference call we’ve arranged for Wednesday the 30th?] [It’s quite urgent].

Could you ask Jack to call me back, about the conference call on  Wednesday the 30th? It's very urgent.

Can you ask Jack to call back? I want him to tell me about the conference call on Wednesday the 30th. It's urgent, I'm afraid.

Would it be possible to ask Jack to call me back? I want to know about the conference call on the 30th urgently.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking if I could ask Jack to call me regarding the conference call you've arranged for Wednesday the 30th?

Task.Q1: I’ll let him know. Does he have your number?
Task.Q2: I'll tell him. Does he know your number?
Task.Q3: Sure. He has your number?
Task.Guide: 내 휴대폰 번호를 알려주겠다고 말하고, 0446 6565 7877 이라고 해보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Actually, {[I’ll give you my mobile number]}. It’s easier. [It’s 0446 6565 7877].

No, I am going to give you my mobile number instead. It's easier that way. Call me at 0446 6565 7877.

No, I will tell you my mobile number. It's easier to tell him that way. Call me at 0446 6565 7877.

No, I can give you my mobile number. You can tell him yourself. Reach me at 0446 6565 7877.

Complete.Reaction: That’s 0446 6565 7877. Right? Thanks.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_세 문장 게임 : 맞추기편 1

Description.Description_Ko: {"세 문장 게임 : 맞추기편 1"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Three sentences game :  Tutor Describes 1"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 토픽 카드에 등장한 사진들을 묘사하는 문장을 만들어봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's make sentences that describe the pictures on the topic card we used.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. Do you remember the picture taken at the crossroad?
Quiz.Guide: {"crossroad"}를 이용하여 {"몇몇 차들이 교차로에 있습니다."}를 말해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: There are some cars on the crossroad.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. Do you remember the picture of the baseball park?
Quiz.Guide: {"pitcher"} 그리고 {"batter"}를 이용하여 {"투수가 공을 던지고 타자가 공을 치고 있습니다."}를 말해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The pitcher is throwing a ball and the batter is hitting the ball.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 골대 앞에서 찍힌 사진을 기억하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. Do you remember the picture taken at the goal post?
Quiz.Guide: {"goalkeeper"} 그리고 {"lawn"}를 이용하여 {"골키퍼가 잔디밭에 누워있습니다."}를 말해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: The goalkeeper is lying on the lawn.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. Do you remember the picture of a big wheel?
Quiz.Guide: {"a big wheel"}을 이용하여 {"색색의 대관람차가 있습니다."}를 말해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: There is a colorful big wheel.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 엄마가 아기를 안고 있는 사진 기억하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. Do you remember the picture of the woman holding a baby?
Quiz.Guide: {"blond"}와 {"infant"}를 이용하여 {"금발의 여성이 유아를 안고 있습니다."}를 말해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: A blond woman is holding an infant.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 사무실의 한 책상 사진 기억하나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. Do you remember the picture of the desk in an office?
Quiz.Guide: {"turned off"}를 이용하여 {"책상 위의 모니터가 꺼져있습니다."}를 말해봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set:
The monitor on the desk is turned off.
There is a turned-off monitor on the desk.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_아이와 영어로 말해요 : 아침편

Description.Description_Ko: {"아이와 영어로 말해요 : 아침편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Talk to your kid : Morning"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 아이가 아침에 학교 가기 전, 간단히 이야기를 나눠 보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk with your kid in the morning.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Mom. Let me sleep five minutes more.
Quiz.Guide: {"get up"}을 이용해 {"이제 일어날 시간이야."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: It's time for you to get up.

Quiz.Quiz_En: I'm going to wash my face.
Quiz.Guide: {"wipe"}를 이용해 {"비누와 물로 세수한 뒤에 수건으로 네 얼굴을 닦으렴."}이라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Wipe your face with a towel after washing it with soap and water.

Quiz.Quiz_En: I'm going to wash my face.
Quiz.Guide: {"wipe"}를 이용해 {"비누와 물로 세수한 뒤에 수건으로 네 얼굴을 닦으렴."}이라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Wipe your face with a towel after washing it with soap and water.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 엄마, 저의 머리를 묶어주실 수 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Mom, can you tie my hair?
Quiz.Guide: {"how would you like me to"}를 이용해 {"내가 네 머리를 어떻게 묶어주면 좋겠어?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: How would you like me to tie your hair?

Quiz.Reaction: Just tie my hair back in a ponytail, please.
Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 그리고 제가 아끼는 청바지 어디 있어요? 어젯밤에 엄마가 다림질하시는 거 봤어요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: And, where is my favorite pair of jeans? I saw you iron them last night.
Quiz.Guide: {"they are still on"}을 이용해 {"그것들은 아직 다리미 위에 있어."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: They are still on the ironing board.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 제가 아끼는 청바지 어디 있어요? 어젯밤에 엄마가 다림질하시는 거 봤어요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Where is my favorite pair of jeans? I saw you iron them last night.
Quiz.Guide: {"they are still on"}을 이용해 {"그것들은 아직 다리미 위에 있어."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: They are still on the ironing board.

Quiz.Quiz_En: I am walking to school with my friend today.
Quiz.Guide: {"be careful when"}을 이용해 {"길을 건널 때 조심하렴."}이라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Be careful when you cross the street.

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Mission.Title: Communication & Culture
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 인도에 출장을 가봤습니다. 인도 출장을 가는 동료 Mr.Bulter에게 인도 문화와 예절에 대해 얘기해 주세요.
Mission.Description_En: You have had a business trip to India before. Talk about Indian etiquette and culture to Mr.Bulter, your colleague going on a business trip to India soon.

Task.Q1: How are you doing today?
Task.Q2: How is it going today?
Task.Q3: Doing well today?
Task.Guide: 좋다고 말하고, 인도 출장 준비는 되었는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m fine]. How about you? {Are you ready for} [your business trip to India?]

I'm great. How are you? Are you ready to go India for your business trip?

I'm doing well. What about you? Ready to go on a business trip to India?

I'm swell. What about you?  Ready for a business trip to India?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying if I am ready for my business trip to India?

Task.Q1: More or less. I was just wondering if I could ask your advice on a few things. What I mean is, I want to prepare myself for cultural differences I might encounter in India. Do you have any advice?
Task.Q2: Almost. Perhaps I could ask your advice on a few things. More specifically, I want to prepare for cultural differences I might encounter in India. Any advice?
Task.Q3: Pretty much. I wanted to ask for your advice on something. I want to prepare for cultural differences I may encouter in India.
Task.Guide: 당연하다 말하고, 내가 더 일찍 돕겠다고 하지 않아서 미안하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
Yes, [of course]. {I’m sorry} [I didn’t offer to help sooner].
Yes, I do. I'm sorry I couldn't help you sooner.
Yes. I do in fact. So sorry I couldn't help you earlier.
Yes. Sorry to have not helped you earlier.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're sorry that you didn't offer to help sooner?

Task.Guide: 무엇을 알고 싶으신지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[What would you like to know?]}
What do you want to know?
What is it that you wanted to know?
Did you want to know something?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what would I like to know?
Task.Key: {What would you like to} know?
Use_Key: What would you like to say?
What would you like to see?
What would you like to ask?
Use_Guide: 무슨 말을  하고 싶은 건지 물어보세요.
무엇을 보고 싶은 건지 물어보세요.
무엇을 묻고 싶은 건지 물어보세요.

Task.Q1: How should I greet people?
Task.Q2: How should I greet people there?
Task.Q3: How do I greet people?
Task.Guide: 간단히 악수를 하거나, 손을 맞잡으면서 '나마스테'라고 말할 수도 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[You could simply shake hands], [or you could say “Namaste”] {while} [putting your hands together].
It's simple. You can shake hands, or say "Namaste" while putting your hands together.
You may just shake people's hands, or say "Namaste", when you put your hands together.
You can always shake people's hands, or say "Namaste", at the same  time you put your hands together.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying I could simply shake hands or I could say "Namaste" while putting my hands together?

Task.Guide: 그렇게 하는 것은 네가 인도 문화를 이해하려고 노력하고 있다는 것을 보여줄 것이라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Doing that would show] {that} [you are trying to understand the culture].
Doing so shows your effort in comprehending the culture.
These actions show that you understand the culture.
Such actions reveal that you  comprehend the culture.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying doing that would show that I am trying to understand the culture?

Task.Q1: Is there any body language I should be aware of?
Task.Q2: Any body language I should know?
Task.Q3: What about body language?
Task.Guide: 손을 흔들며 인사할 때 조심하라고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Be careful] {when} [waving hello].
Be careful when waving to say hello.
Try to be careful when saying hello.
Try being careful when saying hello.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying be careful when waving hello?

Task.Guide: 어떤 인디언들은 서양식으로 손을 좌우로 흔드는 제스처를 "싫다" 또는 "가라"의 의미로 오해한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Some Indians might confuse] [the Western side-to-side hand wave]
{as} [“no” or “go away.”]
Some Indians mistake this Western side-to-side hand wave as "no" or "go away".
Indians often confuse this Western side-to-side hand wave as "no" or "go away".
Indians, however, confuse this Western side-to-side hand wave as "no" or "go away".
Task.Are_you_saying: You mean some Indians might confuse the Western side-to-side hand wave as "no" or "go away"?

Complete.Reaction: I never knew that. This has really been helpful.

Mission.Title: Presentation Know-how
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 발표를 앞두고 있습니다. 상사 Ms.Elliot에게 당신이 만든 파워포인트를 봐달라고 하고, 조언을 구해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are about to give a presentation. Ask your boss, Ms.Elliot to have a look at your PowerPoint and ask her for advice.

Task.Q1: How is your presentation coming?
Task.Q2: How is the presentation?
Task.Q3: Presentation going?
Task.Guide: 파워포인트는 다 된 것 같은데 좀 긴장된다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{I think} [I’m finished with the PowerPoint], [but I’m a little nervous].
I believe I'm finished with the PowerPoint, but I'm a bit nervous.
I am finished with the PowerPoint, but nervous about it.
I completed the Powerpoint, but am nervous about it.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you think you're finished with the PowerPoint but you're a little nervous?

Task.Guide: 한번 훑어봐 주면 정말 고맙겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{If} [you could look it over], [I’d be very grateful].
If you could review it, I'd be so thankful.
If you can take a look now, I'd be very grateful.
If you can look at it now, I'd be very thankful.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd be very grateful if I could look it over?

Task.Q0: Being nervous is only natural.
Task.Q1: Let me see what you’ve got done so far. We can begin by looking at the data you’re going to use.
Task.Q2: Let me check your progress so far. We can start by looking at the data you plan on using.
Task.Q3: I'll look at it, starting with the data you will use.
Task.Guide: 파워포인트를 봐 달라고 건네 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Here you go}].
Here it is.
Here you have it. Take a look.
Here you are. Have a look.

Task.Q1: Everything looks good, but I’m not sure if I understand this slide. It’s a little cluttered.
Task.Q2: Everything's good, but this slide here is incomprehensible. It's a little packed.
Task.Q3: Looks good in general. This slide though cannot be understood. It's packed.
Task.Guide: 간략하게 만들어야 한다는 말이냐고 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What you’re asking is} [for me] [to simplify it?]
What you're asking me is to make it simple?
So are you asking me to simplify it?
So would you have it simplified?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I'm asking is for you to simplify it?
Task.Key: {What you're asking is} for me to simplify it?
Use_Key: What you're asking is for me to attend the meeting on behalf of our team?
What she's asking is for me to bring all the cups we need?
What they're asking is for us to sign the paper as soon as possible?
Use_Guide: 우리 팀을 대표해서 그 회의에 참석하라는 말인지 물어보세요.
그녀는 나에게 우리가 필요한 컵을 다 가져오라고 요청하는 건지 물어보세요.
그들은 우리에게 가능한 빨리 계약서에 서명하라고 요청하는 건지 물어보세요.
Use_Hint: [attend the meeting], [on behalf of our team]

Task.Q1: I think if you just changed the formatting a little bit it would be a lot easier to follow. How were you planning on closing the presentation?
Task.Q2: If you change the formatting a bit, it would be much easier to follow. How did you want to close the presentation?
Task.Q3:
f the format was changed a bit, it would be easy to follow.
How did you want to close the presentation?
Task.Guide: 마지막에는 발표의 키 포인트들을 간단히 리뷰해 보고자 한다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{As a final point}, [I’d like to] [briefly review the key points of my presentation].
As a last point, I'd like to review the key points of the presentation.
I would like to go over the final key points of my presentation.
I want to take a look at the key points of the presentation for the last time.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you'd like to briefly review the key points of your presentation as a final point?

Complete.Reaction: That sounds perfect. I can’t wait to see it in action.

Mission.Title: Situational Communication
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 회사에서 질병과 스트레스 등으로 인한 어려운 한 주를 보냈습니다. 밀린 업무에 대해 상사 Mr.Thompson과 대화를 나누어 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You had a hard week facing a difficult situation at work, due to illness and stress. Have a conversation with your boss Mr.Thompson about a project which you have fallen behind.

Task.Q1: How are things going?
Task.Q2: How are things going with you?
Task.Q3: How is it going?
Task.Guide: 좋지 않다고 말하고, 스트레스를 많이 받는 한 주였다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[Not so good]. {[It’s been a stressful week]}.
Not so well. It's been pretty stressful all week.
Unwell. I have been stressful this week.
Bad. I had been stressed all week.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying it's been a stressful week?

Task.Q0: I'm sorry to hear about your situation.
Task.Q1: I know it must be difficult to come into work feeling sick
Task.Q2: It must be hard coming to work feeling sick.
Task.Q3: It's hard coming to work sick, isn't it?
Task.Guide: 오늘은 기분이 훨씬 좋아졌다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[I’m feeling much better today]}.
I'm feeling a lot better today.
It is, but I'm better today.
It is, but I am more refreshed today.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're feeling much better today?

Task.Q0: You look a little overwhelmed today.
Task.Q1: How are you doing on the project that you are doing with Jefferson?
Task.Q2: How are you on the project doing with Jefferson?
Task.Q3: How is the project doing with Jefferson?
Task.Guide: 몇 가지 문제가 있었지만, 곧 따라잡을 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’ve had some problems], but {I’m optimistic that} [I can catch up soon].
I've had many problems, but I'm pretty sure that I can catch up in the near future.
There were some problems, but I'm sure I can catch up soon.
There were problems, all right, but it's no big deal. I can catch up soon.
Are you saying you're optimistic that you can catch up soon?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you're optimistic that you can catch up soon?
Task.Key: {I'm optimistic that} I can catch up soon.
Use_Key: I'm optimistic that we can do this.
I'm optimistic that the weather will be just fine tomorrow.
I'm optimistic that he is an excellent candidate for the position.
Use_Guide: 나는 우리가 이것을 해낼 수 있다고 본다고 말해 보세요.
나는 내일 날씨가 좋을 거라고 본다고 말해 보세요.
나는 그가 그 직책에 적임자라고 본다고 말해 보세요.
Use_Hint: [he is an excellent candidate], [for the position]

Task.Q0: Actually, I wanted to talk to you about that.
Task.Q1: While you were out sick, I had to take a look at your records, and I was surprised to see how far behind you have fallen. I think that it might be better if we let someone else work on that account.
Task.Q2: When you were sick, I took a look at your records, and was surprised to see how behind you were. It might have been better if we let someone else work on your account.
Task.Q3: I was surprised to find that you fell behind while you were sick. Maybe someone else should work on the account.
Task.Guide: 그 말을 들어서 유감이지만, 혼자서도 해결할 수 있다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[I’m very sorry to hear that], but {I think} [I can fix things by myself].
I'm so sorry to hear that. I thought I may be able to fix things myself.
Very sorry for that. Maybe I can fix things myself.
So sorry for that. Perhaps I can fix things on my own.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you think you can fix things by yourself?

Complete.Reaction: I know and I just want to let you know that everyone thinks that you are doing a great job.

Mission.Title: Invitations
Mission.Description_Ko: 당신은 출장을 가서 만난 Ms.Adams와 이야기하고 있습니다. Ms.Adams의 저녁 초대에 응해 보세요.
Mission.Description_En: You are on your business trip and talking to Ms.Adams whom you met there. Respond to her dinner invitation.

Task.Q0: It’s been a pleasure getting to know you today.
Task.Q1: If you have some time, would you like to join my team for dinner tonight?
Task.Q2: If you have time, join my team for dinner tonight?
Task.Q3: Join my team for dinner tonight?
Task.Guide: 좋다고 말하고, 나는 이곳에 아는 사람이 없기 때문에 초대해줘서  감사하다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
[That would be great]. [I don’t really know anyone here], {so} [I really appreciate the invitation].

That would be so great. Don't really know anyone here, so I really  appreciate your inviting me.

Sure, that would be great. I am not acquainted with anyone here, so I would appreciate the invatation.

Sure, that would be awsome. Am not acquainted with anyone here, so I really appreciate your inviting me.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying you appreciate the invitation as you don't really know anyone here?

Task.Q0: What would you like to eat?
Task.Q1: There are a lot of good restaurants that we could go to.
Task.Q2: We have restaurants we could go to.
Task.Q3: There are restaurants to go to.
Task.Guide: 채식주의자에게 무엇을 추천하겠는지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{What would you recommend} [for a vegetarian?]
What would a vegetarian eat?
What can you recommend for a vegetarian?
What can vegetarians eat?
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you asking what I would recommend for a vegetarian?
Task.Key: {What would you recommend} for a vegetarian?
Use_Key: What would you recommend for a 13-year-old girl?
What would you recommend for a person who has just moved here?
What would you recommend for a person who is allegic to nuts?
Use_Guide: 13살 소녀에게는 무엇을 추천하겠는지 물어보세요.
이곳에 막 이사 온 사람에게는 무엇을 추천하겠냐고 물어보세요.
견과류 알러지가 있는 사람에게는 무엇을 추천하겠냐고 물어보세요.

Task.Q0: I know a couple of places.
Task.Q1: Do you prefer Indian or French?
Task.Q2: What do you prefer? Indian or French?
Task.Q3: Do you want Indian or French?
Task.Guide: 인도 음식이 좋겠다고 말해 보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[Indian would be nice]}.
Indian would be ideal.
Indian may be nice.
Indian might be ideal.
Task.Are_you_saying: Are you saying Indian would be nice?

Task.Q0: I’ll let the team know.
Task.Q1: I can pick you up at your hotel. When’s a good time to stop by?
Task.Q2: I can give you a ride from your hotel. When would be a good time to drop by?
Task.Q3: When would be a good time to pick you up fro your hotel?
Task.Guide: 7시쯤 어떤지 물어보세요.
Task.Answer_Set:
{[How about around 7:00?]}
How about at 7:00 or so?
Around 7:00?
At 7:00 or so?

Complete.Reaction: Perfect. I'll see you then.

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_아이와 영어로 말해요 : 점심편

Description.Description_Ko: {"아이와 영어로 말해요 : 점심편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Talk to your kid : Afternoon"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 아이가 학교에 갔다 온 후, 간단히 이야기를 나눠 보겠습니다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's talk with your kid in the afternoon.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Mom, I'm home.
Quiz.Guide: {"what did you have"}를 이용해 {"오늘 점심 뭐 먹었어?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: What did you have for lunch today?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Let me just wash my hands.
Quiz.Guide: {"make sure you wash"}를 이용해 {"반드시 비누로 네 손을 꼼꼼히 씻도록 해라."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Make sure you wash your hands thoroughly with soap.

Quiz.Quiz_En: Let me just wash my hands.
Quiz.Guide: {"make sure you wash"}를 이용해 {"반드시 비누로 네 손을 꼼꼼히 씻도록 해라."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Make sure you wash your hands thoroughly with soap.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 엄마, 저 조금 배고파요. 먹을 거 있나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Mom, I'm a little hungry. Do we have something to eat?
Quiz.Guide: {"I bought you some"}을 이용해 {"너 주려고 제과점에서 간식을 좀 샀어."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: I bought you some snacks at the bakery.

Quiz.Reaction: Really? You're the best! Thanks, mom.
Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 엄마 저 밖에 나가서 놀아도 되나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Mom, can I go and play outside?
Quiz.Guide: {"you need to tell me"}를 이용해 {"네가 집을 나서기 전에 어디 가는지 내게 말해줘야 해."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: You need to tell me where you are going before you leave the house.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 엄마 저 밖에 나가서 놀아도 되나요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Mom, can I go and play outside?
Quiz.Guide: {"you need to tell me"}를 이용해 {"네가 집을 나서기 전에 어디 가는지 내게 말해줘야 해."}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: You need to tell me where you are going before you leave the house.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 벌써 여섯 시다. 우리 저녁을 먼저 먹자.
Quiz.Quiz_En: It's already six p.m.! Let's have dinner first.
Quiz.Guide: {"go and get"}을 이용해 {"가서 네 언니를 불러올래?"}라고 말해주세요.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Can you go and get your sister?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 복습을 아주 완벽하게 마치셨습니다. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?

description: 18.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_초급 부모표 영어_열 고개 게임 : 대답편

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 게임 : 대답편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten Questions : Answer"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이것들은 동그란 야채이며 표면은 갈색이고 안쪽은 흰색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. These are round vegetables with brown skin and white insides.
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they…?"}를 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they potatoes?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 이것은 매우 차갑고 달콤한 음식입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. It is a very cold sweet food.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it ice cream?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이것은 손과 손목을 덮습니다. 이것은 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. This covers your hand and wrist. What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they gloves?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. People use umbrellas on this day.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a rainy day?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 우주선을 타고 여행하는 것을 훈련받습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. The person who has this job is trained to travel in a spacecraft.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it an astronaut?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이 동물은 긴 귀를 가졌습니다. 이 동물은 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number Six. This animal has long ears. What is this animal?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a rabbit?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This is essential for the latte.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it milk?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Last question. This day falls on the twenty-fifth of December.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Christmas?

Description.Description_Ko: AI 튜터와 마지막으로 동기부여 문구들을 점검해볼게요! 준비 됐나요?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 첫 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice One. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {'Good, better, best. Never let it rest until your good becomes better and your better is best.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Good, better, best. Never let it rest until your good becomes better and your better is best.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 두 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Two. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 세 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Three. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 네 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Four. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 다섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Five. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 여섯 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Six. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 일곱 번째, 다음 제시되는 문장을 읽어보세요.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Practice Seven. Read the following sentence.
Quiz.Guide: {The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.}
Quiz.Answer_Set: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_열 고개 게임 : 학용품편

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 게임 : 학용품편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten questions : School Supplies"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 당신은 이것을 무언가를 지우기를 원할 때 씁니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. You use this when you want to erase something.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it an eraser?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 당신은 연필이나 펜을 넣을 때 이것을 사용하십니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. You use this to put your pencils and pens in.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a pencil case?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 당신은 당신의 연필을 깎고 싶을 때 이것을 사용합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. You use this when you want to sharpen your pencil.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a pencil sharpener?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 당신은 무언가를 측정하거나 곧은 선을 그릴 때 이것을 사용합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. You use this to measure things or to draw straight lines.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a ruler?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 당신은 무언가를 자르고 싶을 때 이것을 사용합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. You use this when you want to cut something.
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they scissors?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 당신은 종이 묶음을 고정하기를 원할 때 이것을 사용합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. You use this when you want to staple several sheets of paper.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a stapler?

Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten questions : Job"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이 사람은 학생들을 가르치는 직업을 가진 사람입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. The person who has this job teaches students.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it ...?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a teacher?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 식당에서 요리를 하는 사람입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. The person who has this job is a cook in a restaurant.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a chef?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 아픈 사람을 치료합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. The person who has this job treats people who are ill.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a doctor?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 바이올린을 전문적으로 연주합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. The person who has this job plays the violin professionally.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a violinist?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 우주선을 타고 여행하는 것을 훈련받습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. The person who has this job is trained to travel in a spacecraft.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it an astronaut?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이 직업을 가진 사람은 농장을 소유하고 그것을 관리합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. The person who has this job owns a farm and manages it.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a farmer?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이 사람은 축구를 전문적으로 하는 사람입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This is a person who plays soccer professionally.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is he …?"}를 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is he a soccer player?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 이것들은 발과 발목을 덮는 옷의 일종입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. These are pieces of clothing that cover people's foot and ankle.

Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it a belt?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이것은 손과 손목을 덮습니다. 이것은 무엇일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This covers your hand and wrist. What is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they gloves?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이것은 부드럽고 납작한 모자입니다. 이것은 무엇일까요?

Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.

Quiz.Guide: {"Are they …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they the eyes?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이것은 당신의 얼굴의 일부로 냄새를 맡거나 숨을 쉴 때 씁니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. This is a part of your face that is used to smell and breathe.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it the nose?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이것은 당신의 다리를 구부리는 곳입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. This is the place where your legs bend.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it the knee?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이것들은 사람들의 얼굴에 있고, 사람들은 이것들로 소리를 듣습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. They are on people's faces, and people can hear sounds with these.
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they the ears?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이것은 사람 몸의 긴 부분으로 사람들은 이것을 일어설 때 사용합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. These are the longest part of people's bodies and we use them to stand on.
Quiz.Guide: {"Are they …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Are they the legs?

description: 11.[AI-Tutor] 튜터링-복습_입문 기초 문장 마스터_열 고개 게임 : 나라편

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 게임 : 나라편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten questions : Country"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Reaction: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.
Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 아마 당신은 이 나라에 살고 있을 겁니다. 이 나라는 어디인가요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. Maybe you live in this country. What country is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Korea?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 2번 문제. 이 나라에는 빅벤이 정말 유명합니다. 이 나라는 어디일까요?
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. Big Ben is very famous in this country. What country is this?
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it the United Kingdom?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 3번 문제. 한국과 매우 가깝습니다. 이 나라의 수도는 도쿄입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. It is very close to Korea. The capital city of this country is Tokyo.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Japan?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이 나라는 길고 추운 겨울로 잘 알려져 있고, 이 나라는 정말 큽니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. This country is known for having a long cold winter and it is a very big country.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Russia?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 5번 문제. 이 나라에서 당신은 피라미드를 보실 수 있습니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. You can find Pyramids in this country.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Egypt?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이 나라는 매우 유명한 공연장이 있는데, 이름이 오페라 하우스입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This country has a very famous concert hall, and the name is Opera House.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Australia?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 7번 문제. 이 나라는 피자나 파스타 같은 음식으로 유명합니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This country is famous for its food, such as pizza and pasta.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it Italy?

Description.Description_Ko: 아주 잘하셨어요! 문제를 아주 잘 맞혀주셨네요. 다음 토픽 카드도 열심히 해주실 거죠?
Description.Description_En: You did a great job! You've done your review task perfectly. Keep up your work on the next topic cards.

Description.Description_Ko: {"열 고개 게임 : 색깔편"} 토픽으로 유익한 학습 되셨나요? AI 튜터와 마무리해 봅시다.
Description.Description_En: How was the topic, {"Ten questions :  Color"}? Let's do a review of the topic.

BG_Description.BG_Description_Ko: 열 고개 게임을 시작해봅시다.
BG_Description.BG_Description_En: Let's do the Ten Questions Game.

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 1번 문제. 이것은 피 또는 불의 색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number one. This is the color of blood or fire.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it red?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number two. This is the color of the sky or the sea.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it blue?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number three. This is the color of grass or leaves.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it green?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 4번 문제. 이것은 비 오는 날의 구름의 색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number four. This is the color of the clouds on a rainy day.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it gray?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number five. This is the darkest color.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it black?

Quiz.Quiz_Ko: 6번 문제. 이것은 빨간색과 흰색의 사이의 색입니다.
Quiz.Quiz_En: Number six. This is the color between red and white.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it pink?

Quiz.Quiz_En: Number seven. This is the color of wood or soil.
Quiz.Guide: {"Is it …?"}을 이용하여 답을 맞혀봅시다.
Quiz.Answer_Set: Is it brown?
